Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of wheat
Description: Commercial cultivation of wheat crops, which involves activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This business activity includes the production of wheat for various purposes, including food production, flour milling, and other wheat-based products. It may also involve the sale of wheat grain directly or after basic processing.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of jowar, bajra and millets
Description: Commercial cultivation of jowar, bajra, and millets, which involves the entire farming process from sowing to harvesting. This business activity includes preparing the land, planting the seeds, nurturing the growth of the plants, protecting them from pests and diseases, and finally harvesting the mature crops. Post-harvest activities such as initial processing and packaging of these crops for sale or further use may also be part of this operation.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of other cereals
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of cereals, excluding rice. This involves all stages of crop production, from soil preparation and planting to crop maintenance and harvesting. The business may also engage in the initial processing of harvested cereals, such as cleaning, drying, and packaging. This category does not include the cultivation of leguminous crops or oil seeds.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of pulses (dal) and other leguminous crops such as peas and beans, not used as oilseeds
Description: Commercial cultivation of pulses (dal) and other leguminous crops like peas and beans, excluding those used as oilseeds. This involves the entire farming process from planting and nurturing the crops to harvesting and preliminary processing, with the primary purpose being food production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of mustard oil seed
Description: Commercial cultivation of mustard oil seeds, which involves activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of the seeds for oil production. This business operation may also include managing the growth conditions of the crops, pest control, and post-harvest care to ensure the quality and yield of the mustard oil seeds.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of groundnut oil seed
Description: Commercial cultivation of groundnut oil seeds, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing for oil extraction. This business activity primarily focuses on the production of groundnuts for oil production, which may include seed selection, soil preparation, crop rotation strategies, and pest management.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of sunflower oil seed
Description: Commercial cultivation of sunflower oil seeds, involving activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This work typically includes the preparation of land, sowing sunflower seeds, monitoring their growth, protecting them from pests and diseases, and eventually harvesting the matured sunflowers. The harvested sunflowers are then processed to extract the oil seeds, which are used in the production of sunflower oil and other related products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of soya bean oil seed
Description: Commercial cultivation of soya bean oil seeds is the main activity in this category. This involves the entire process of growing soya bean crops, from planting and tending to harvesting. The harvested soya beans are primarily used for oil extraction. Other activities may include initial processing of the harvested crops and managing the overall health and growth of the soya bean plants.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds
Sub-class Name: Growing of other oil seeds
Description: Commercial cultivation of various oil seeds not mentioned elsewhere in the classification. This includes the complete process from planting and nurturing the seeds to harvesting the mature crops. The business may also involve initial processing of the harvested seeds to separate oil and other by-products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of rice
Sub-class Name: Organic farming of basmati rice
Description: Cultivation of organic basmati rice, involving all stages from seed selection and planting to crop growth and harvesting. This business activity also includes the application of organic farming techniques such as natural pest management and the use of organic fertilizers. It may also encompass initial processing of the harvested rice for market readiness.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of rice
Sub-class Name: Organic farming of non-basmati rice
Description: Cultivation of non-basmati rice using organic farming methods, which involves planting, nurturing, and harvesting the crop without the use of synthetic pesticides, fertilizers, or genetically modified organisms. The process also includes activities like soil management, crop rotation, and natural pest control to maintain soil health and productivity. The harvested organic non-basmati rice might also undergo initial processing before being prepared for market or distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of rice
Sub-class Name: Inorganic farming of basmati rice
Description: Cultivating basmati rice using inorganic methods, which involves the application of synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, and other non-natural substances. The process includes preparing the land, sowing the seeds, managing the growth of the crop with the use of chemical inputs, harvesting the mature rice, and initial processing such as drying, milling, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of rice
Sub-class Name: Inorganic farming of non-basmati rice
Description: Cultivation of non-basmati rice using inorganic farming methods, which may involve the use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other synthetic substances. This includes all stages of the production process from preparation of the land, sowing, irrigating, applying fertilizers and pesticides, to harvesting. Post-harvest activities such as drying, milling and packaging of the rice may also be included.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of asparagus, cabbages, cauliflower, broccoli, lettuce, chicory, spinach and other leafy or stem vegetables
Description: Commercial cultivation of asparagus, cabbages, cauliflower, broccoli, lettuce, chicory, spinach and other leafy or stem vegetables. This involves all stages of production from planting and tending to harvesting and initial processing. The business may also include services such as crop rotation planning, pest management, and post-harvest handling and storage.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of cucumbers, gherkins, aubergines, tomatoes, watermelons, cantaloupes , melons and other fruit-bearing vegetables
Description: Commercial cultivation of cucumbers, gherkins, aubergines, tomatoes, watermelons, cantaloupes, melons, and other fruit-bearing vegetables. This involves all stages of production from planting and tending to the crops, through to harvesting. The business may also involve initial processing of these vegetables for sale or distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of onion
Description: Commercial cultivation of onions, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging of onions for sale. This may also include the preparation of land, use of specialized machinery for large scale onion farming, pest control measures, and initial processing such as cleaning and sorting.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of carrots, beets,turnips, garlic, leeks and other root, bulb vegetables(onion excluded)
Description: The business activity involves the cultivation of various root and bulb vegetables such as carrots, beets, turnips, garlic, and leeks, excluding onions. Core operations typically include soil preparation, seeding, watering, and crop protection measures, followed by harvesting, cleaning, and sorting of the produce. The business may also provide initial processing services such as packaging and storage.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of potatoes and other tubers such as sweet potatoes, cassava, yams"
Description: Commercial cultivation of potatoes and other tubers such as sweet potatoes, cassava, and yams. This involves all stages of production from planting and tending to harvesting and initial processing. The business operation may also include soil preparation, crop maintenance, and pest management services.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of mushrooms and truffles
Description: Commercial cultivation of mushrooms and truffles, involving processes such as preparing the growing mediums, planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This sub-class also includes businesses that grow these fungi for sale to food retailers, restaurants, and manufacturers.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of vegetable seeds (except beet seed)
Description: Commercial cultivation of vegetable seeds, excluding beet seeds, primarily involves the planting, nurturing, and harvesting of a variety of vegetable seeds. This includes the preparation of land, sowing of seeds, use of fertilizers and pesticides, irrigation, and the eventual collection of mature seeds. The business activity may also encompass initial processing such as cleaning, drying, and packaging of harvested seeds for sale or further cultivation.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers
Sub-class Name: Growing of vegetables, n.e.c."
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of vegetables not elsewhere classified, which involves activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This may include the production of vegetables like bell peppers, squashes, eggplants, and other similar crops that are not specifically mentioned in other categories. The process typically includes preparing the land, sowing seeds, applying fertilizers and pesticides, irrigating crops, and eventually harvesting and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of sugar cane
Sub-class Name: Growing of sugar cane
Description: Commercial cultivation of sugar cane, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting of the crop. This business activity also includes initial processing like crushing the cane to extract juice for sugar production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tobacco
Sub-class Name: Growing of tobacco
Description: Commercial cultivation of tobacco plants, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of tobacco leaves. This business operation may also include the management of tobacco plantations and the preparation of tobacco leaves for the production of various tobacco products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of fibre crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of cotton
Description: Commercial cultivation of cotton crops, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of the cotton for further use in textile industries or for sale. It may also involve the use of various farming techniques to ensure the growth and quality of the cotton crop.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of fibre crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of jute
Description: Commercial cultivation of jute crops, which involves activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This business activity may also include the production of jute seeds and other related jute products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of fibre crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of other fibre crops
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of fibre crops not mentioned elsewhere. This includes the entire farming process from planting and nurturing to harvesting and initial processing of crops. The crops grown may be used for a variety of purposes, including the production of textiles, cordage, or other industrial materials.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other non-perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of rose
Description: Commercial cultivation of rose plants, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting. This business typically involves the production of roses for various purposes including ornamental use, oil extraction, and other rose-derived products. It may also include services such as the sale of roses, rose plants, and related products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other non-perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of gladiolus
Description: Commercial cultivation of gladiolus flowers, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging. This business activity may also include the sale of harvested gladiolus directly to customers or through various distribution channels.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other non-perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of other flowers, including production of cut flowers, flower buds and flower seeds
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of flowers, encompassing the entire process from planting to harvesting. This includes the production of cut flowers, flower buds, and flower seeds. The business operations typically involve soil preparation, sowing, nurturing, and finally harvesting the flowers. The harvested flowers may be sold as fresh cut flowers, while flower buds and seeds are packaged and sold for personal or commercial gardening.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other non-perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of other non-perennial crops including beet seed and padding materials, n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the cultivation of non-perennial crops such as beet seed and padding materials, among others not elsewhere classified. Typical operations include planting, nurturing, and harvesting these crops. It may also involve the initial processing of these crops, such as cleaning, sorting, packaging, and preparing for market or further use.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of grapes
Sub-class Name: Growing of grapes
Description: Commercial cultivation of grapevines, encompassing planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of grapes. This can include activities for both table grapes and wine grapes, and may also involve the production of grape seed oil or raisins.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of mangoes
Description: Commercial cultivation of mangoes, involving activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging of the fruit. The process may also include the maintenance of mango orchards, disease control, and pest management to ensure the healthy growth of the trees.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of bananas
Description: Commercial cultivation of bananas in tropical and subtropical climates, involving planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of the fruit. This business activity may also include pest and disease management, irrigation, and fertilization to ensure a healthy and productive crop.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of pineapples
Description: Commercial cultivation of tropical and subtropical fruits, specifically pineapples, is the core activity in this classification. This involves the entire process of growing pineapples, from planting and tending to the crops, to harvesting and preparing them for sale or further processing. The business may also provide related services such as pest management, irrigation, and crop rotation planning.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of lichchis
Description: Commercial cultivation of lichchis, a tropical and subtropical fruit, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting and packaging for market distribution. This business activity may also include pest control, irrigation, and fertilization to ensure healthy and high-quality fruit yield.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of guava
Description: Commercial cultivation of guava fruits, encompassing the entire process from planting and nurturing the trees, to harvesting the mature fruits. This business activity may also include initial processing such as sorting, cleaning, and packaging of the harvested guavas for sale or distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of other tropical and sub tropical fruits
Description: Commercial cultivation of various tropical and subtropical fruits, beyond the commonly grown varieties. This involves the entire agricultural process from planting and growing to harvesting and initial processing. The activities may include cultivation of fruits such as guava, mango, papaya, pineapple, banana, and other less common tropical fruits. These businesses might also provide related services such as pest control, fertilization, and irrigation support for these specific fruit crops.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of citrus fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of oranges
Description: Commercial cultivation of oranges, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging of oranges. This may also include the maintenance of orange orchards, pest control, and initial processing or preparation of oranges for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of citrus fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of mousambi (grape fruit)
Description: Commercial cultivation of mousambi, also known as grapefruit, which involves processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging for market sale. This business activity may also include the management of grapefruit orchards, pest control, and fertilization to ensure healthy crop growth.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of citrus fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of lemons and lime
Description: Commercial cultivation of lemons and lime, encompassing all stages of production from planting and nurturing the trees, to harvesting the fruit. This also includes pest management, irrigation, and initial processing such as cleaning, sorting, and packaging of the harvested citrus fruits.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of citrus fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of other citrus fruits
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of citrus fruits, other than the commonly grown ones like oranges, lemons, grapefruits, and limes. This includes all stages of production from planting and nurturing the trees, to harvesting the fruits. It also encompasses the initial processing of these fruits for distribution to markets or for use in food and beverage production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of apples
Description: Commercial cultivation of apple trees, which includes planting, nurturing, and harvesting apples. This business activity also encompasses the management of apple orchards, pest control, pruning, and the initial processing of apples for direct sale or further manufacturing.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of appricots, peaches and nectarines
Description: Commercial cultivation of apricots, peaches, and nectarines, including planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This business activity also encompasses the management of orchards, pest control, and fertilization to ensure healthy growth and high-quality fruit production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of cherries and sour cherries
Description: Commercial cultivation of cherries and sour cherries, encompassing the entire process from planting and nurturing the trees to harvesting the ripe fruits. This business activity may also include initial processing of the fruits such as washing, sorting, and packaging for sale or further processing.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of other pome fruits and stone fruits
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of pome fruits and stone fruits, such as apples, pears, peaches, and cherries. This involves all stages of the farming process from planting and nurturing the trees to harvesting the ripe fruits. It may also include initial processing activities like cleaning, sorting and packaging of the fruits for sale or further processing.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts
Sub-class Name: Growing of strawberries and other berries
Description: Commercial cultivation of strawberries, other berries, tree fruits, and nuts, encompassing all stages from planting and nurturing to harvesting. This business activity also involves the initial processing of these fruits and nuts, such as cleaning, sorting, and packaging, for their subsequent sale in the market.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts
Sub-class Name: Growing of edible nuts (almonds, cashew nuts, chestnuts, hazelnuts pistachios, walnuts and other nuts)
Description: Cultivation and harvesting of edible nuts such as almonds, cashew nuts, chestnuts, hazelnuts, pistachios, walnuts, and other nut varieties. This involves all stages of nut production from planting and nurturing the trees, to harvesting the mature nuts. Additional processes may include initial cleaning, sorting, and packaging of the harvested nuts for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts
Sub-class Name: Growing of other tree and bush fruits, n.e.c
Description: Commercial cultivation of various tree and bush fruits and nuts not elsewhere classified, including planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This involves the growth and production of fruits such as berries, cherries, plums, and a variety of nuts from trees and bushes, as well as the provision of related services like pest management, pruning, and fertilization.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of oleaginous fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of coconut
Description: Commercial cultivation of coconut trees, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting of coconuts. This business operation may also include primary processing of harvested coconuts for the production of coconut-based products like oil, milk, and cream.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of oleaginous fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of olives and oil palms
Description: Cultivation of oleaginous fruits such as olives and oil palms, involving activities from planting and nurturing to harvesting. This includes the management of olive groves and oil palm plantations, as well as the initial processing of harvested fruits to extract oil. The business may also provide related services such as pest control, irrigation, and pruning to ensure healthy growth and high yield.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of oleaginous fruits
Sub-class Name: Growing of other oleaginous fruits
Description: Commercial cultivation of various types of oleaginous (oil-producing) fruits, such as olives, avocados, and coconuts. This involves all stages of production, from planting and nurturing the trees to harvesting the mature fruits. The business may also include initial processing steps such as cleaning, sorting, and oil extraction from the harvested fruits.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of beverage crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of tea
Description: Commercial cultivation of tea plants, encompassing planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of tea leaves. This includes activities such as soil preparation, seedling care, pest management, and the picking of tea leaves. It may also involve the initial processing steps such as withering, rolling, and drying to produce raw tea products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of beverage crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of coffee
Description: Commercial cultivation of coffee plants, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of coffee beans. This business activity may also include the management of coffee plantations and the sale of harvested coffee beans.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of beverage crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of cocoa
Description: Commercial cultivation of cocoa crops, encompassing processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing of cocoa beans. This activity may also involve the management of cocoa plantations and the sale of harvested cocoa beans for use in food and beverage production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of beverage crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of other beverage crops
Description: Cultivation of various beverage crops not classified elsewhere, such as tea, coffee, cocoa, and mate. This involves the entire agricultural process from planting and nurturing the crops to harvesting and preparing them for beverage production. It may also include the production of seeds for these crops and the provision of related support services such as crop maintenance and pest control.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of ginger
Description: Commercial cultivation of ginger, involving processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing for uses in food, medicine, and cosmetics. This business activity also includes necessary tasks like soil preparation, crop maintenance, and disease management specific to ginger plants.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of chili
Description: Commercial cultivation of chili crops, which involves processes such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This activity may also include the production of chili seeds for sale or the extraction of chili oil. The crops may be grown for use in food, pharmaceutical products, or other industries requiring chili.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of cardamoms
Description: Cultivation of cardamom crops, which involves activities such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting the plants. This business may also include the initial processing of harvested cardamom for use in various industries such as food, pharmaceuticals, and cosmetics.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of perennial and non-perennial spices and aromatic crops (pepper, capsicum, nutmeg, mace, anise, badian and fennel, cinnamon (canella), cloves, vanilla and other spices and aromatic crops)
Description: Cultivation of perennial and non-perennial spices and aromatic crops such as pepper, capsicum, nutmeg, mace, anise, badian, fennel, cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, and others. This business activity involves the entire agricultural process from planting and nurturing these crops to harvesting and preparing them for market or further processing. It may also include the extraction of essential oils or other valuable compounds from these plants.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of drug and narcotic crops
Description: Cultivation of drug and narcotic crops, involving the planting, nurturing, and harvesting of plants used for medicinal or controlled substances. This may also include initial processing of the crops, such as drying or extracting essential components, to prepare them for pharmaceutical use.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of plants used primarily in perfumery, in pharmacy or for insecticidal, fungicidal or similar purposes
Description: Cultivation and growth of plants used primarily for perfumery, pharmacy, or for insecticidal, fungicidal or similar purposes. This involves the planting, nurturing, and harvesting of these specific plants. The business may also include initial processing of these plants to extract essential oils, active pharmaceutical ingredients, or substances with insecticidal or fungicidal properties.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of heena leaves (mehendi)
Description: Cultivation of heena leaves, commonly known as mehendi, as part of the spice, aromatic, drug, and pharmaceutical crops industry. This involves the planting, nurturing, harvesting, and packaging of heena leaves, which are widely used for cosmetic and medicinal purposes. The operations may also include initial processing or drying of the leaves for further use in various industries such as cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and traditional medicine.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of rubber trees
Description: Commercial cultivation of rubber trees, encompassing activities such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting of rubber trees. This also includes extraction and initial processing of latex from the trees. The business operations may also involve selling of raw rubber and other by-products obtained from the rubber trees.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of trees for extraction of sap
Description: Cultivation of trees specifically for sap extraction, which involves processes such as planting, nurturing, and harvesting the sap from the trees. This activity may also include initial processing of the sap for various uses, such as syrup production, medicinal uses, or other industrial applications.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of bamboo and cane
Description: Commercial cultivation of bamboo and cane crops, involving activities such as planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This may also include the management of bamboo and cane plantations, as well as the sale of harvested bamboo and cane products.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Growing of other perennial crops
Sub-class Name: Growing of other perennial crops, n.e.c.
Description: Commercial cultivation of various perennial crops not elsewhere classified, including processes like planting, nurturing, harvesting, and initial processing. This may encompass a diverse range of crops that grow and yield over several years, such as berries, fruits, nuts, or ornamental trees and shrubs.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Plant propagation
Sub-class Name: Growing of plants for planting
Description: The business activity involves the cultivation and growth of plants specifically intended for planting. Core operations include the germination of seeds, nurturing of seedlings, and the growth of plants to a stage where they are ready for transplantation. Services may also extend to providing advice on optimal planting conditions and care for the plants. The aim is to supply other businesses, such as farms or gardening centers, with healthy plants for further growth or sale.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Plant propagation
Sub-class Name: Operation of tree nurseries (except forest tree nurseries)
Description: The business activity involves running tree nurseries, where young trees are propagated and grown until they reach a suitable size for planting. The process typically includes seed sowing, grafting, and cutting, as well as providing optimal growing conditions through irrigation, fertilizing, and pest management. This sub-class does not cover the operation of forest tree nurseries.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Plant propagation
Sub-class Name: Growing of plants, n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the cultivation and growth of a variety of plants not elsewhere classified. This includes the propagation of plants from seeds, cuttings, or grafts, as well as the maintenance of plant nurseries. Services may encompass the care and cultivation of indoor and outdoor plants, exotic plants, and other plant types not specifically mentioned in other classifications. The processes typically involve planting, watering, pruning, fertilizing, and monitoring plants for diseases and pests.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of cattle and buffaloes
Sub-class Name: Raising and breeding of cattle and buffaloes
Description: Commercial farming and breeding of cattle and buffaloes, encompassing activities such as feeding, milking, and breeding. This includes the management of livestock for the production of milk, meat, and other dairy products, as well as the provision of breeding services like artificial insemination. It also involves maintaining and improving herd health and productivity.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of cattle and buffaloes
Sub-class Name: Production of milk from cows or buffaloes
Description: Raising of cattle and buffaloes primarily involves the breeding, rearing, and care of these animals for various purposes. A significant part of this business activity is the production of milk from cows or buffaloes. This includes maintaining the health of the dairy herd, ensuring optimal feeding for milk production, milking the animals, and the initial processing of the milk. The milk may be sold as a raw product or undergo further processing for the production of dairy products such as cheese, butter, and yogurt.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of cattle and buffaloes
Sub-class Name: Production of bovine semen
Description: The business activity involves the breeding of cattle and buffaloes, specifically focusing on the production of bovine semen. Core operations include the collection, processing, storage, and distribution of bovine semen. This may also involve the use of advanced reproductive technologies, such as artificial insemination, to improve the genetic quality of herds. Other services may include semen analysis for fertility assessment, and training or consultation services related to bovine reproduction.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of horses and other equines
Sub-class Name: Raising of horses and other equines
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the breeding, raising, and caring for horses and other equine species such as donkeys and mules. Core operations typically include maintaining and managing horse farms or stables, breeding and raising horses for racing, riding, or other purposes, and providing related services such as training, shoeing, and grooming. The care and feeding of these animals, as well as ensuring their health and well-being, are also integral parts of this business.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of camels and camelids
Sub-class Name: Raising and breeding of camels and camelids
Description: Commercial rearing and breeding of camels and camelids, such as alpacas and llamas. This involves all aspects of their life cycle, from birth to maturity, including their feeding, care, and health management. Services may also include breeding programs for genetic improvement, sale of live animals, and possibly production of camelid-related products like milk, wool, and meat.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of sheep and goats
Sub-class Name: Raising and breeding of sheep and goats
Description: Business operations in this category involve the rearing, breeding, and overall husbandry of sheep and goats. This includes processes such as feeding, milking, shearing wool from sheep, and managing the health and wellbeing of the animals. The business may also involve the sale of live sheep and goats, as well as the production and sale of products derived from these animals, like milk, cheese, wool, and meat.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of sheep and goats
Sub-class Name: Production of milk from sheep or goat
Description: Breeding and raising of sheep and goats primarily for milk production. This involves the entire lifecycle management of these animals, from birth to maturity, ensuring their health and well-being to optimize milk yield. Services may also include milking operations, pasteurization, and packaging of sheep or goat milk for commercial distribution.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of sheep and goats
Sub-class Name: Production of raw wool
Description: Breeding and raising of sheep and goats primarily for wool production. This includes tending to the animals, ensuring their health and welfare, shearing the wool, and preparing it for further use in textile manufacturing. The business may also involve selling the animals for meat or dairy production, but the primary focus is on wool production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of swine/pigs
Sub-class Name: Raising of swine/pigs (including breeding of swine/pigs)
Description: The business activity involves the raising and breeding of swine or pigs. Core operations include the rearing of pigs from birth, ensuring their health and wellbeing, and managing their breeding processes. Additionally, the business may provide services such as selling piglets to other farms or businesses, as well as supplying mature pigs for meat production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of poultry
Sub-class Name: Raising and breeding of chickens and capons, ducks, geese, turkeys and guinea fowls chickens and capons, ducks, geese, turkeys and guinea fowls
Description: Raising and breeding of a variety of poultry such as chickens and capons, ducks, geese, turkeys, and guinea fowls. This involves all aspects of poultry farming, including hatching and rearing young birds, ensuring their health and well-being, and managing their breeding processes. It may also include the production and sale of eggs, meat, and feathers from these birds. This business activity can also encompass the provision of consulting services related to poultry farming.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of poultry
Sub-class Name: Production of eggs
Description: Breeding and rearing of various types of poultry such as chickens, ducks, and quails primarily for egg production. This involves feeding and caring for the poultry, collecting eggs, and packaging them for sale. It may also include the vaccination of poultry to prevent diseases and maintain egg production rates.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of poultry
Sub-class Name: Operation of poultry hatcheries
Description: Breeding and raising of various types of poultry such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys, primarily for meat and egg production. This also involves operating poultry hatcheries, which includes incubating poultry eggs and hatching chicks. Other services may include providing care for the chicks until they are ready to be sold or raised for meat or egg production.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of other animals
Sub-class Name: Raising and breeding of pet animals (cats, dogs, birds, hamsters etc.
Description: Breeding and raising a variety of pet animals such as cats, dogs, birds, hamsters, and more. This involves activities like animal care, feeding, and sheltering, as well as overseeing the breeding process to ensure healthy offspring. Services may also include selling these pets to pet stores, individuals, or other businesses.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of other animals
Sub-class Name: Bee-keeping and production of honey and beeswax
Description: Beekeeping and production of honey and beeswax involve the breeding and care of bees, primarily for honey production. Key activities include maintaining bee colonies in hives, harvesting honey, and processing beeswax. The business may also involve the sale of other bee products like royal jelly and propolis, as well as offering pollination services to other agricultural enterprises.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of other animals
Sub-class Name: Raising of silk worms, production of silk worm cocoons
Description: The business activity involves the breeding and rearing of silk worms, including the provision of suitable environments and nutrition for their growth. It also includes the production of silk worm cocoons, a critical process in the silk production industry. Key operations may involve maintaining silk worm farms, ensuring optimal conditions for silk worm development, and collecting the produced cocoons for further processing into silk.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Raising of other animals
Sub-class Name: Raising of other animals, n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the breeding and raising of non-traditional or uncommon animals. This can include activities such as rearing of insects (like silkworms, butterflies), amphibians, reptiles, or other rare or exotic animals. The primary operations can range from feeding and nurturing these animals, ensuring their health and well-being, to breeding and selling them. This sub-class does not cover traditional livestock farming or poultry raising.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Class Name: Mixed farming
Sub-class Name: Mixed farming
Description: Mixed farming involves the simultaneous cultivation of crops and rearing of livestock on the same farm. This business activity includes activities such as planting and harvesting crops, feeding and taking care of livestock, and managing the rotation of crops and livestock to maintain soil fertility. It may also involve the initial processing of crops for food production and the production of dairy and meat products from the livestock.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Support activities for crop production
Sub-class Name: Agricultural activities on a fee or contract basis (preparation of fields, establishing a crop, treatment of crops, crop spraying, trimming of fruit trees and vines, transplanting of rice, thinning of
Description: Business activities in this category involve providing support services for crop production on a fee or contract basis. These services include preparing fields for planting, establishing a crop, treating crops to ensure their health and productivity, and crop spraying for pest control. Other tasks may involve the trimming of fruit trees and vines to promote growth and productivity, transplanting of rice to optimize field utilization, and thinning of crops to ensure proper growth and development. These activities are generally performed by specialized agricultural service providers.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Support activities for crop production
Sub-class Name: Operation of agricultural irrigation equipment
Description: Business operations under this classification involve the management and operation of agricultural irrigation equipment, which is crucial for crop production. Typical services include the installation, monitoring, maintenance, and repair of irrigation systems. These systems may range from simple sprinkler systems to more complex drip or subsurface irrigation setups. The goal is to ensure efficient water usage and optimal growing conditions for crops.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Support activities for crop production
Sub-class Name: Other supporting activities including agricultural gardening (excluding parks and gardening activities), n.e.c.
Description: Businesses under this classification provide a variety of support services for crop production, excluding parks and gardening activities. These services may include soil preparation, planting, crop care, and harvesting assistance. In addition, they may also offer agricultural gardening support, which involves the cultivation, maintenance, and care of plants used in agriculture. Other services could be related to crop disease prevention, pest control, and irrigation management. The goal of these businesses is to aid in the enhancement of crop yield and quality.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Support activities for animal production
Sub-class Name: Support activities for animal production
Description: Business activities in this category involve providing support services for animal production. This includes a range of services such as herd testing, livestock breeding and pedigree record services, boarding and care of pets, and service activities incidental to animal production. Other operations may involve the provision of animal health care services, artificial insemination, and other animal husbandry support activities.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Post-harvest crop activities
Sub-class Name: Preparation of crops for primary markets, i.e. cleaning, trimming, grading, disinfecting
Description: Businesses under this classification are involved in post-harvest crop activities, specifically preparing crops for primary markets. This entails operations such as cleaning, trimming, grading, and disinfecting of the harvested crops. The aim is to ensure the crops are in the best condition for sale, meeting the standards set by primary markets. These activities are crucial in maintaining the quality of the crops after harvest and before they reach the end consumer.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Post-harvest crop activities
Sub-class Name: Cotton ginning, cleaning and bailing
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the processing of harvested cotton. This includes ginning, which is the process of separating cotton fibers from their seeds, cleaning to remove any dirt or debris, and bailing to compress the cotton into compact, transportable bales. These processes prepare the raw cotton for further use in textile manufacturing or for sale to other industries.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Post-harvest crop activities
Sub-class Name: Preparation of tobacco leaves
Description: Processing and preparation of harvested tobacco leaves for further use is the main activity in this sub-class. This involves services such as curing, fermenting, drying, and packaging of tobacco leaves. These processes are essential in preparing the leaves for their eventual use in the production of tobacco products such as cigarettes, cigars, and snuff.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Post-harvest crop activities
Sub-class Name: Other post harvest crop activities, n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in various activities related to crops after they have been harvested that are not classified elsewhere. This may encompass tasks such as cleaning, drying, sorting, grading, and packaging of harvested crops. It could also include services like crop storage and preservation, as well as the preparation of crops for primary markets or further processing. Services related to the promotion of crop growth post-harvest, such as seed conditioning, are also part of this business activity.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities
Class Name: Seed processing for propagation
Sub-class Name: Seed processing for propagation
Description: Commercial processing of seeds intended for propagation, encompassing activities such as cleaning, drying, sorting, grading, and packaging. This business operation also includes treating seeds to improve their germination and vitality, ensuring the production of high-quality seeds for the purpose of planting and cultivating crops.

Division Name: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Group Name: Hunting, trapping and related service activities
Class Name: Hunting, trapping and related service activities
Sub-class Name: Hunting, trapping and related service activities
Description: Engaging in hunting and trapping of wild animals, this business activity involves the provision of related services such as the tracking, stalking, and capturing of various game species. It also includes the use of traps, snares, or other similar contraptions to capture animals for fur, meat, or sport. Services might also extend to guided hunting trips and wildlife control services.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Silviculture and other forestry activities
Sub-class Name: Growing of standing timber (planting, replanting, transplanting, thinning and conserving of forests and timber tracts
Description: The business activity involves the cultivation and maintenance of standing timber, which includes processes such as planting, replanting, transplanting, and thinning of forests and timber tracts. It also encompasses conserving these areas to ensure sustainable growth and health of the forests. This operation is a part of silviculture and other forestry activities, under the broader section of agriculture, forestry and fishing.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Silviculture and other forestry activities
Sub-class Name: Operation of forest tree nurseries
Description: Maintaining and operating forest tree nurseries, which involves the cultivation and management of tree seedlings for forestry purposes. Key activities include preparing the soil, sowing seeds, nurturing the seedlings, and ensuring their healthy growth until they are ready for transplantation into a forest setting. This may also encompass the provision of technical guidance and services related to forestry practices.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Silviculture and other forestry activities
Sub-class Name: Other forestry activities including growing of pulpwood, firewood etc
Description: Engaging in a range of forestry activities such as the cultivation and management of pulpwood and firewood. This involves the entire process from seedling selection and plantation to the harvesting and preparation of the timber for various uses. It may also include forest conservation efforts, disease management, and other forestry services aimed at maintaining and improving the health and productivity of forests.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Logging
Sub-class Name: Gathering and preparation of fire wood
Description: The business activity involves the collection and preparation of firewood, primarily sourced from logging activities. Key operations include identifying suitable trees, cutting them down, chopping the logs into smaller, manageable pieces suitable for burning, and preparing them for sale or use. Services may also include delivery of firewood to customers.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Logging
Sub-class Name: Logging camps and loggers primarily engaged in felling timber and producing wood in the rough such as pitprops, split poles, pickets, hewn railway ties
Description: The business activity involves the operation of logging camps and the work of loggers who are primarily responsible for felling timber and producing rough wood products. These products may include pitprops, split poles, pickets, and hewn railway ties. The typical processes involved in this activity range from cutting down trees to processing the timber into the aforementioned wood products.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Logging
Sub-class Name: Production of charcoal in the forest (using traditional methods
Description: Traditional charcoal production in the forest involves the process of converting wood into charcoal in an outdoor setting. This includes selecting the right types of wood, arranging the wood in a specific manner, setting the wood on fire, and then covering it with soil to control the burn. The business activity also involves monitoring the burn process, extinguishing the fire, and finally, collecting and packaging the charcoal for sale.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Logging
Sub-class Name: Other logging activities, n.e.c.
Description: Engagement in various logging activities not elsewhere classified, such as felling of trees, cutting them into logs, or transporting logs to the mill. This may also include the provision of services like bucking and debarking of logs, fire prevention services, and conservation activities related to logging.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Gathering of non-wood forest products
Sub-class Name: Gathering of tendu leaves
Description: Commercial collection of tendu leaves from non-wood forests, including identifying and gathering suitable leaves, typically used in the production of beedis (Indian cigarettes). This activity may also involve initial processing such as drying or packaging of the leaves.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Gathering of non-wood forest products
Sub-class Name: Gathering of lac, resins and rubber-like gums
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are primarily involved in the collection of non-timber forest products such as lac, resins, and rubber-like gums. Typical activities include identifying suitable trees or plants, extracting the raw materials, and preliminary processing for further use. These resources are often used in industries like manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, and cosmetics. The process is sustainable and does not involve the cutting down of trees, making it an essential part of forest conservation efforts.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Gathering of non-wood forest products
Sub-class Name: Gathering of wild growing mushrooms, truffles, berries, nuts, cork, balsams, vegetable hair, eelgrass, mosses, lichens
Description: Collection and harvesting of naturally occurring non-wood forest products such as mushrooms, truffles, berries, nuts, cork, balsams, vegetable hair, eelgrass, mosses, and lichens. This business activity involves the identification, gathering, and initial processing of these products from the wild. These items are then prepared for sale or further use, contributing to various industries including food, cosmetics, medicinal, and craft industries.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Gathering of non-wood forest products
Sub-class Name: Gathering of non-wood forest products, n.e.c.
Description: Collecting non-timber forest products not elsewhere classified, such as wild fruits, nuts, seeds, medicinal plants, and other naturally occurring resources. This involves identifying, harvesting and gathering these products from forests in a sustainable manner. It may also include initial processing or packaging of the collected materials for sale or distribution.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Support services to forestry
Sub-class Name: Forestry service activities (forest management consulting services, forestry inventories, timber evaluation, forest pest control
Description: Support services to forestry encompass a range of activities aimed at managing and preserving forests. These services typically include forest management consulting, where experts provide advice on best practices for maintaining forest health and productivity. Other operations involve conducting forestry inventories, which involve assessing and documenting the types and quantities of trees in a particular forest area. Timber evaluation is another key service, where the quality and value of timber is assessed for commercial use. Additionally, these businesses may also offer forest pest control services to mitigate the impact of harmful insects, diseases or invasive species on forest ecosystems.

Division Name: Forestry and logging
Class Name: Support services to forestry
Sub-class Name: Logging service activities such as transport of logs within the forest
Description: Support services to forestry primarily involve logging service activities, including the transportation of logs within the forest. This encompasses the cutting down of trees, preparing them into logs, and moving these logs from the felling site to a collection point within the same forest. These services are critical to the forestry industry, providing the necessary support for efficient and safe timber extraction.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine fishing
Sub-class Name: Fishing on a commercial basis including taking of marine crustaceans and molluscs in ocean and coastal waters
Description: Commercial marine fishing involves the capture of marine crustaceans and molluscs in ocean and coastal waters. This business activity includes locating, catching, and selling a variety of marine species for commercial purposes. Typical processes involved may include operating fishing vessels, deploying nets or traps, and sorting, preserving, and packaging the catch for sale or further processing.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine fishing
Sub-class Name: Gathering of other marine organisms and materials such as natural pearls, sponges, coral and algae
Description: Harvesting of natural pearls, sponges, coral, and algae from marine environments. This business activity involves the collection of these marine organisms and materials, often through diving or dredging operations. It may also include initial processing, such as cleaning and sorting, before selling to various markets like jewelry, cosmetics, and health industries.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine fishing
Sub-class Name: Activities of vessels engaged in fishing and in processing and preserving of fish
Description: Marine fishing operations that involve the use of vessels for catching fish and other seafood. This also includes the onboard processing and preservation of the catch, ensuring it remains fresh for distribution and sale. Typical processes might involve netting or trapping, sorting, cleaning, freezing or canning the catch, and maintaining the fishing equipment and vessel.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater fishing
Sub-class Name: Fishing and taking of freshwater crustaceans and molluscs on a commercial basis in inland waters
Description: Commercial fishing of freshwater crustaceans and molluscs in inland waters, which involves processes such as catching, trapping, and harvesting these species. The business operations may also include sorting, cleaning, and packaging of the catch for sale or further processing. It is a commercial activity primarily focused on supplying seafood markets, restaurants, and other food service providers.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater fishing
Sub-class Name: Taking and gathering of freshwater aquatic animals
Description: Engaging in freshwater fishing activities, which primarily involve the capture and collection of aquatic animals from freshwater sources such as rivers, lakes, and ponds. Typical operations include the use of various fishing techniques and equipment to catch species such as fish, shellfish, and other aquatic life. This can also encompass services related to the sorting, cleaning, and initial processing of the catch for sale or further production.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Fish farming in sea water including farming of marine ornamental fish
Description: Business activity under this classification involves the cultivation and harvesting of fish in sea water, including the farming of marine ornamental fish. Core operations include the breeding, rearing, and harvesting of marine species in controlled sea water environments. Services may also extend to the sale and distribution of the harvested fish, as well as the maintenance and monitoring of marine habitats for optimal growth conditions.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Culture of crustaceans, bivalves, other mollusks and other aquatic animals in sea water
Description: Marine aquaculture involves the farming and cultivation of crustaceans, bivalves, other mollusks, and various aquatic animals in sea water. Core operations include breeding, hatching, and rearing these marine species in a controlled sea water environment. Services may also encompass feeding, maintaining the health of the organisms, managing the aquatic environment, and harvesting mature organisms for sale or further processing.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Growing of edible seaweeds
Description: Cultivating and harvesting edible seaweeds in marine environments, including the setup and maintenance of seaweed farms, monitoring the growth of the seaweeds, and gathering them for food production. This involves the application of aquaculture techniques specific to marine ecosystems and may also include the processing of harvested seaweeds for direct consumption or use in various food products.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Aquaculture activities in brackish waters and in salt water filled tanks or reservoirs
Description: Marine aquaculture in brackish waters and salt water filled tanks or reservoirs involves the cultivation and harvesting of aquatic organisms such as fish, shellfish, and seaweed. Typical processes include stocking, feeding, and protecting these organisms from predators and diseases. Services may also include the purification and packaging of the harvested organisms for distribution and sale. This activity might also involve the maintenance and monitoring of the water quality in the tanks or reservoirs to ensure optimal conditions for the aquatic organisms.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Operation of fish hatcheries (marine)
Description: Marine fish hatchery operations involve the breeding, hatching, and rearing of fish in a controlled marine (saltwater) environment. Typical processes include the selection and spawning of broodstock, incubation of eggs, and nurturing of fish larvae until they reach a suitable size for commercial sale or release into the wild. Services may also include providing fish for restocking programs, research institutions, or commercial aquaculture operations.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Marine aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Other marine aquaculture, n.e.c
Description: Engaging in marine aquaculture activities not elsewhere classified, such as cultivating and harvesting marine organisms like shellfish, seaweed, and other sea flora and fauna. This can involve processes like seeding, raising, and gathering these marine organisms, often in controlled marine or ocean environments. Services may also include the initial processing, packaging, and sale of harvested marine products.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Fish farming in freshwater including farming of freshwater ornamental fish
Description: Commercial farming of fish in freshwater environments, including the cultivation of ornamental fish species. This involves processes such as breeding and rearing of fish, maintaining optimal conditions in ponds or tanks, monitoring fish health, and harvesting. It also includes the sale of harvested fish for consumption or ornamental purposes.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Culture of freshwater crustaceans, bivalves, other mollusks and other aquatic animals
Description: Cultivation and farming of freshwater crustaceans, bivalves, other mollusks, and aquatic animals in controlled environments. This involves the breeding, rearing, and harvesting of species such as crayfish, clams, snails, and other freshwater creatures. Services may also encompass the provision of feed, maintaining water quality, and ensuring the overall health and growth of the aquatic animals. The harvested products are typically prepared for sale to food markets, restaurants, or processed for other uses.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Operation of fish hatcheries (fresh-water)
Description: The business activity of operating freshwater fish hatcheries involves the breeding, hatching, and rearing of fish in controlled environments. Core operations typically include the production and supply of fish eggs, fry, and fingerlings, as well as providing services such as fish health management and quality control. This may also involve the development of new breeds or species and the provision of consultation services to fish farms and other related businesses.

Division Name: Fishing and aquaculture
Class Name: Freshwater aquaculture
Sub-class Name: Other freshwater aquaculture activities, n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the cultivation and harvesting of aquatic organisms in freshwater environments. This can include raising fish, crustaceans, mollusks, aquatic plants, and other aquatic organisms not classified elsewhere. Typical processes may involve breeding, rearing, and feeding these organisms, as well as monitoring their health and growth. Services may also include the sale of harvested aquatic organisms for various markets such as food, aquarium trade, bait, and research.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of hard coal
Sub-class Name: Opencast mining of hard coal
Description: Extraction of hard coal from open-pit or strip mines, involving processes such as removal of topsoil and rock layers, drilling, blasting, and coal recovery. This business activity may also include coal cleaning or washing, and the restoration of mined areas.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of hard coal
Sub-class Name: Belowground mining of hard coal
Description: Extraction and production of hard coal from below the earth's surface. This involves processes such as digging tunnels and shafts into the earth, removing coal from subterranean deposits, and initial processing such as cleaning and sorting. This activity may also include the construction of underground mine sites.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of hard coal
Sub-class Name: Cleaning, sizing, grading, pulverizing, compressing etc. of coal
Description: Business activities in this category involve the mining of hard coal and subsequent processing. This includes cleaning the coal to remove impurities, sizing it into uniform pieces for better combustion and handling, grading it based on its energy content, and pulverizing it into a fine powder for use in power plants. It also involves compressing the coal into briquettes for easier storage and transport. These operations ensure the coal is ready for sale and use in various industries.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of hard coal
Sub-class Name: Other operations relating to mining and agglomeration of hard coal
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in various operations related to the mining and agglomeration of hard coal. These activities may include the extraction of coal from underground or open-pit mines, preparation of coal by sizing and washing, and the agglomeration of hard coal, which involves processing coal into briquettes or other forms suitable for use in industry. Services may also encompass the removal of impurities, coal cutting, and tunneling support activities.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of lignite
Sub-class Name: Opencast mining of lignite (brown coal)
Description: Extraction of lignite, also known as brown coal, through opencast mining methods. This involves activities such as removing overburden, drilling and blasting the coal seam, and recovering and transporting the lignite. It may also include basic processing to prepare the coal for sale.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of lignite
Sub-class Name: Belowground mining of lignite (brown coal)
Description: Engaging in the extraction of lignite, also known as brown coal, from underground mines. This involves the processes of digging or drilling deep into the earth's crust to access and remove lignite deposits. Other activities may include the initial processing of the mined lignite, such as cleaning, sizing, and sorting.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of lignite
Sub-class Name: Washing, dehydrating, pulverizing, compressing of lignite
Description: The business activity involves the mining of lignite, a type of coal, and its subsequent processing. The mined lignite undergoes various procedures such as washing to remove impurities, dehydrating to reduce moisture content, pulverizing to turn it into a fine powder, and compressing for easier transportation and storage. These operations are essential for preparing lignite for its various industrial uses, including as a fuel in power generation.

Division Name: Mining of coal and lignite
Class Name: Mining of lignite
Sub-class Name: Other operations relating to mining and agglomeration of lignite
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the extraction and processing of lignite, a type of coal often used in electricity generation. This includes mining operations to extract lignite from the ground, as well as the agglomeration of lignite, a process that involves treating the coal to increase its size and improve its quality. Other related operations may encompass the cleaning, sorting, sizing, and blending of lignite.

Division Name: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Class Name: Extraction of crude petroleum
Sub-class Name: Off shore extraction of crude petroleum
Description: Offshore extraction of crude petroleum involves drilling and extracting petroleum from beneath the seabed. Typical processes include the use of drilling platforms or vessels to reach oil reserves under the ocean floor, and the subsequent extraction, storage, and transportation of the crude oil. This activity may also encompass the maintenance of offshore drilling equipment and infrastructure.

Division Name: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Class Name: Extraction of crude petroleum
Sub-class Name: On shore extraction of crude petroleum
Description: Businesses involved in the onshore extraction of crude petroleum are primarily engaged in the exploration and drilling of oil wells on land. These operations typically involve surveying and mapping potential oil field locations, drilling and operating the wells, and extracting the crude petroleum. The extracted crude oil may then be processed or sold to refineries for further processing.

Division Name: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Class Name: Extraction of natural gas
Sub-class Name: Offshore Extraction of natural gas
Description: Offshore extraction of natural gas involves the process of identifying and drilling natural gas reserves located beneath the ocean floor. This operation includes exploration activities, drilling of wells, and extraction of natural gas from these offshore reserves. The extracted gas is then processed and transported to the mainland for further use. Services typically provided may include maintenance of drilling equipment, safety inspections, and environmental impact assessments.

Division Name: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Class Name: Extraction of natural gas
Sub-class Name: On shore Extraction of natural gas
Description: The business activity involves the onshore extraction of natural gas, typically from wells drilled into the earth's surface. Core operations include exploration and drilling processes, gas extraction, and initial processing to remove impurities. Services may also involve maintenance of extraction equipment, monitoring of gas flow, and ensuring adherence to safety and environmental regulations.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of iron ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of iron ores
Description: Extraction and beneficiation of iron ores from underground or open-cut mining operations. This includes activities like drilling, blasting, loading and hauling, as well as the processing of ore to remove impurities and improve iron content. Services may also encompass the development of mine sites and the restoration of the environment after mining operations.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of uranium and thorium ores
