Sub-class Name: Mining of uranium and thorium ores
Description: Extraction and processing of uranium and thorium ores from the earth's crust, involving activities such as prospecting, exploration, development of mining sites, and ore extraction. This also includes the processing of extracted ores to yield concentrates of uranium and thorium for use in nuclear energy production and other applications.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of copper ore
Description: Extraction and processing of copper ore from underground or open-pit mines. This involves drilling, blasting, loading, and hauling the ore to crushing plants. The business activity may also include beneficiation processes such as grinding, concentration, and purification to increase the copper content. Services can extend to the marketing and sale of the extracted copper ore.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of aluminium ore (bauxite)
Description: Extraction and processing of aluminium ore, commonly known as bauxite, from the earth's crust. This involves activities such as prospecting to find ore deposits, drilling and blasting to access the ore, and transporting the ore to processing facilities. It also includes the initial processing of aluminium ore to extract alumina, which is used in the production of aluminium products.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of manganese ore
Description: The business activity involves the extraction of manganese ore from the earth. Core operations include the exploration and identification of manganese ore deposits, drilling and blasting to break up the ground, and the removal and transport of the ore for further processing. Services provided may also encompass ore grading, crushing, and screening to separate the mineral from waste materials.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of chromium ore
Description: Extraction and processing of chromium ore from mines and quarries. This business activity involves the exploration of land to locate chromium deposits, the use of heavy machinery to extract the ore from the earth, and the initial processing of the ore to prepare it for further use in manufacturing industries. Services may also include the evaluation of mining sites and the reclamation of mined land.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of precious metal ore (gold, silver)
Description: Extraction and processing of precious metal ores such as gold and silver from the earth. This business activity involves the exploration and evaluation of metal ore deposits, followed by the mining and beneficiation processes to separate the precious metals from the ore. It may also include basic smelting services to produce semi-finished goods.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of lead and znic ore
Description: Extraction and processing of lead and zinc ores from the earth's crust. This involves activities such as surveying potential mining sites, drilling and blasting to extract ores, crushing and grinding the ores for further processing, and removing impurities to obtain pure lead and zinc. Services may also include the exploration and development of lead and zinc ore mines.

Division Name: Mining of metal ores
Class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Sub-class Name: Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores, n.e.c. [titanium ( ilmenite and rutile) ,niobium, tantalum,vanadium or zirconium ores; tin bearing ores; and, nickel, cobalt, tungsten, molybdenum, antimony and
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the mining and extraction of various non-ferrous metal ores not classified elsewhere. These include titanium (both ilmenite and rutile), niobium, tantalum, vanadium, zirconium, tin-bearing ores, and others such as nickel, cobalt, tungsten, molybdenum, and antimony. The operations typically include the exploration and development of mining sites, extraction of ores, and the initial processing such as crushing, grinding, washing, and grading. These metals are then used in a range of industries, from manufacturing to electronics and aerospace.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Quarrying of marble
Description: Extraction and processing of marble from quarries, involving activities such as blasting, cutting, shaping, and finishing. This business may also provide related services such as transportation and sale of quarried marble.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Quarrying of granite
Description: Extraction and processing of granite from quarries, involving activities such as drilling, blasting, cutting, shaping, and finishing. This business may also provide related services such as transportation and distribution of quarried granite.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Quarrying of slate and building and monumental stone other than marble and granite
Description: Extraction and processing of slate and various types of building and monumental stones, excluding marble and granite. This involves operations like mining or quarrying, crushing, and sizing of these stones for construction and other purposes. Other activities may include shaping and finishing of the quarried stones to meet specific requirements.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Mining of dolomite
Description: Extraction and processing of dolomite from the earth, typically through quarrying methods. This business activity involves the removal of overburden, drilling and blasting of mineral deposits, and the subsequent transportation of dolomite for various industrial uses. Services may also include the crushing and grinding of mined dolomite, and the restoration of the mining area.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Mining of gypsum including selenite
Description: Extraction and processing of gypsum and selenite minerals from quarries or mines. This includes the operations of drilling, blasting, cutting, crushing, and grinding the mined materials. The business activity may also involve the purification and packaging of these minerals for use in various industries such as construction, agriculture, and manufacturing.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Operation of sand or gravel pits, basalt / porphyry, clay (ordinary), crushing and breaking of stone for use as a flux or raw material in lime or cement, manufacture or as building material, road meta
Description: The business activity involves the operation of sand or gravel pits, extraction and processing of basalt and porphyry, and ordinary clay mining. It also includes the crushing and breaking of stone to be used as a flux or raw material in the production of lime or cement. Additionally, these processed materials may serve as a building material or road meta. Processes typically include extraction, crushing, breaking, and basic manufacturing.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Mining/quarrying of limestone, limeshell, ?kankar? and other calcareous minerals including calcite, chalk and shale
Description: The business activity involves the extraction and processing of limestone, limeshell, 'kankar', and other calcareous minerals such as calcite, chalk, and shale. Typical operations include the identification and exploration of mineral-rich sites, the removal of minerals from the earth using various mining or quarrying techniques, and the processing of these minerals for use in a variety of industries. Services may also include the transportation and distribution of these minerals to customers.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Mining of clays (kaolin, ball clay, wollastonite, bentonite, fuller?s earth, fire clay etc. )
Description: Extraction and processing of various types of clays such as kaolin, ball clay, wollastonite, bentonite, fuller's earth, and fire clay. This business activity involves the identification of clay deposits, extraction from the earth using various mining techniques, and processing the raw material for use in a variety of industries. Services may also include the sale and distribution of the mined and processed clay products.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Group Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Class Name: Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Sub-class Name: Mining of refractory non-clay minerals (andalusite, kyanite, sillimanite, dunite, diaspore magnesite, diaspore, magnesite)
Description: Extraction and processing of refractory non-clay minerals such as andalusite, kyanite, sillimanite, dunite, diaspore magnesite, and magnesite. This involves the exploration and mining of these minerals, followed by their processing to make them suitable for use in various industries. Services may also include the marketing and sale of the mined and processed minerals.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of native sulphur or pyrites and pyrrhotites valued chiefly for sulphur
Description: Extraction and mining of native sulphur, pyrites, and pyrrhotites, primarily for their sulphur content. This involves processes such as exploration, extraction, and primary processing of these minerals. The business may also include services related to the mining operation like the purification and refining of sulphur.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of natural phosphates including apatite minerals
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the extraction and processing of natural phosphates and apatite minerals. Typical operations include the exploration, drilling, and mining of these minerals, followed by the processing and refining stages to prepare them for use in various industries. The end products are typically used in the manufacture of fertilizers and chemicals. Services may also include the evaluation of phosphate and apatite mineral deposits and the provision of consultation on mining strategies.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of earth colours (ochre including red oxide).
Description: Extraction and mining of earth colours, specifically ochre and red oxide, which are often used in the production of pigments for paints, ceramics, and other industrial applications. This business activity involves the exploration and extraction of these minerals from the earth, followed by their processing and preparation for sale and distribution.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of fluorspar
Description: Extraction and processing of fluorspar, a mineral primarily used in the manufacture of chemicals and fertilizers. This involves activities such as exploration of fluorspar deposits, mining of the mineral, and preliminary processing to prepare it for industrial use.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of barytes
Description: Extraction and processing of barytes, a mineral primarily used in the oil and gas industry. This business activity involves the exploration, mining, and milling of barytes, transforming raw ore into useful products. Services may also include the sale and distribution of the processed barytes to various industries.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
Sub-class Name: Mining of potash bearing salts/minerals; borate minerals and other fertiliser and chemical minerals n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the extraction and processing of potash bearing salts and minerals, borate minerals, and other fertiliser and chemical minerals not elsewhere classified. This includes the exploration and mining of these minerals, the processing of raw materials into usable forms, and the distribution of these products to various industries for use in agricultural and chemical applications. Typical processes may involve drilling, blasting, crushing, grinding, and other methods of mineral extraction and processing.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Extraction of peat
Sub-class Name: Extraction and agglomeration of peat
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the extraction of peat from peatlands or bogs, followed by its agglomeration into a usable form. Typical operations include the removal of surface vegetation, drainage of peatlands, digging out peat, and processing it into compact forms such as briquettes or pellets. Services may also include the restoration of extracted sites for environmental conservation.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Extraction of salt
Sub-class Name: Salt mining, quarrying, screening etc.
Description: Commercial extraction of salt from mines or quarries, encompassing activities such as digging, drilling, and blasting to extract salt deposits. It also includes processes like crushing, screening, washing and grading of extracted salt. Services may also extend to the production of brine by evaporation of salt in solution.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Extraction of salt
Sub-class Name: Salt production by evaporation of sea water or other saline waters
Description: Commercial production of salt through the evaporation of sea water or other saline waters. This involves the collection of sea water or other saline sources, evaporation processes to extract salt, and the packaging and distribution of the final product. The business may also provide related services such as salt refining and quality control.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of gemstones (agate, diamond, emerald, garnet (gem), jasper, rubby/saphire etc
Description: Extraction and processing of gemstones such as agate, diamond, emerald, garnet, jasper, ruby, sapphire, and others. This involves the exploration and mining of gemstone deposits, the sorting and grading of mined gemstones, and the initial cutting and polishing processes. Services may also include the sale of raw or partially processed gemstones to jewelers and other businesses.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining and quarrying of abrasive materials (pumice stone, emery, corundum, garnet and other natural abrasives)
Description: Extraction and processing of abrasive materials such as pumice stone, emery, corundum, garnet, and other natural abrasives. The business operations typically involve exploring and extracting these materials from quarries or mines, followed by processing to refine and prepare them for various industrial uses. Services may also include the sale and distribution of these abrasive materials to manufacturers or other end users.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of mica
Description: Extraction and processing of mica, a group of sheet silicate minerals, from the earth's crust. This involves activities such as exploration, drilling, blasting, and hauling the mineral from mining and quarrying sites. The extracted mica may then be processed for use in various industries such as cosmetics, electronics, and construction.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of natural graphite
Description: Extraction and processing of natural graphite from mines and quarries. This involves the exploration, drilling, and blasting of graphite deposits, as well as the subsequent processing, which may include crushing, grinding, and refining of the mined graphite. Services may also extend to the sale of extracted graphite.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of asbestos
Description: Extraction and processing of asbestos minerals from a mine or quarry. This involves the exploration and drilling for asbestos, removal of asbestos ore from the ground, and the initial processing of the ore to extract the mineral. This may also include services related to the maintenance and operation of the asbestos mine or quarry.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of vermiculite, perlite and chlorites
Description: Extraction and processing of vermiculite, perlite, and chlorites from mines and quarries. This involves the exploration and extraction of these minerals, followed by the initial processing such as crushing, grinding, washing, and sizing. Other operations may include removing impurities and refining the minerals for further use in various industries.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of felspar and silica minerals including quartz, quartzite and fuch.Quartzite
Description: The business activity involves mining and quarrying of felspar and silica minerals, notably quartz, quartzite, and fuch.Quartzite. Core operations include the extraction of these minerals from the earth, their processing, and preparation for distribution. Services provided may encompass mineral exploration, mine development, mineral extraction, and initial processing before supplying to various industries.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of talc/ steatite
Description: Extraction and processing of talc or steatite from mines and quarries. This involves the identification of suitable sites, drilling, blasting, and removal of the mineral. After extraction, the mineral undergoes processes such as crushing, grinding, and milling to prepare it for various industrial uses.

Division Name: Other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Other mining and quarrying n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Mining of laterite, diatomite and silicious fossil meals (e.g. diatomite); and other natural fluxes;natural asphalt or bitumen and other mining n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the mining and quarrying of laterite, diatomite, and silicious fossil meals such as diatomite. It also includes the extraction of other natural fluxes and materials like natural asphalt or bitumen. Typical processes include the exploration, extraction, and primary processing of these materials. Additionally, this sub-class covers other mining activities not classified elsewhere.

Division Name: Mining support service activities
Group Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Class Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Sub-class Name: Services incidental to off shore oil extraction
Description: Providing support services for petroleum and natural gas extraction, particularly in offshore locations. This involves a range of activities such as drilling, extraction, and exploration support, as well as maintenance and repair of equipment and infrastructure used in offshore oil extraction. Other services may include logistical support, safety services, and environmental impact assessment and management.

Division Name: Mining support service activities
Group Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Class Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Sub-class Name: Services incidental to on shore oil extraction
Description: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction, specifically services incidental to on shore oil extraction, encompass a range of operations. These include drilling, completing, and equipping wells, operation of separators, emulsion breakers, desilting equipment, and field gathering lines for crude petroleum and natural gas. It also involves all other activities necessary to make oil and gas marketable. In addition, it includes the removal of oil from the field, and other activities aimed at preparing oil and gas up to the point of shipment from the producing property.

Division Name: Mining support service activities
Group Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Class Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Sub-class Name: Services incidental to off shore gas extraction
Description: Providing support services for petroleum and natural gas extraction, particularly in off-shore environments. This involves a range of activities including drilling, cementing, casing, perforating, chemical treatment, and cleaning of wells. It may also encompass maintenance and repair of equipment, and other specialized services necessary for the extraction and production of off-shore gas.

Division Name: Mining support service activities
Group Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Class Name: Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction
Sub-class Name: Services incidental to on shore gas extraction
Description: Providing support services for petroleum and natural gas extraction on land, which may encompass a range of activities such as drilling, cementing, casing, perforating, and cleaning of wells. It also includes the provision of specialized services like removing obstructions, operation and maintenance of oil and gas field production, and performing completion and shutdown of wells.

Division Name: Mining support service activities
Group Name: Support activities for other mining and quarrying
Class Name: Support activities for other mining and quarrying
Sub-class Name: Support activities for other mining and quarrying
Description: Providing specialized services that support mining and quarrying operations, such as drilling, blasting, and mine construction. These activities also include exploration services that assist in locating and extracting mineral resources, mine tunneling, and the removal of overburden. Other services may involve mine drainage and pumping, on-site processing and preparation of extracted materials, and other support tasks necessary for efficient mining and quarrying operations.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Mutton-slaughtering, preparation
Description: The business activity involves the slaughtering of sheep for mutton and the subsequent preparation of the meat. Core operations include the humane killing of the animals, skinning, evisceration, and cutting the carcass into manageable pieces. The prepared meat may then be packaged, frozen, or otherwise preserved for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Beef-slaughtering, preparation
Description: Business operations in this category involve the slaughtering of cattle and the subsequent preparation of beef products. Typical processes include the humane killing of animals, skinning, eviscerating, and cutting carcasses into manageable pieces. Further activities may involve the packaging and preservation of beef for sale or distribution, ensuring the meat is kept in optimal conditions to maintain freshness and quality.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Pork-slaughtering, preparation
Description: Business activities in this category involve the slaughtering of pigs and the subsequent processing and preservation of pork. The operations typically include the humane killing of pigs, followed by the preparation of the meat through processes such as cutting, deboning, and packaging. The meat may also be preserved through methods like smoking, curing, or freezing to extend its shelf life and enhance its flavor. This category may also encompass the production of pork products such as sausages, ham, and bacon.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Poultry and other slaughtering, preparation
Description: The business activity involves slaughtering poultry and other livestock, followed by the processing and preserving of the meat. This includes operations such as cleaning, cutting, and packaging the meat, as well as utilizing various preservation techniques to extend its shelf life. Services may also include the preparation of meat products for distribution to retailers or direct to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Preservation, Processing and canning of meat
Description: Commercial processing and preservation of meat, encompassing activities such as curing, smoking, salting, and canning. This business involves transforming raw meat into products ready for consumption or further cooking, ensuring their longevity and safety through various preservation methods. It may also include packaging and labeling of the processed meat products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Production of hides and skins originating from slaughterhouses
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preservation of meat, specifically focusing on the production of hides and skins derived from slaughterhouses. Core operations include the collection of animal hides and skins after slaughter, cleaning and treating these materials to prevent decay, and preparing them for further use in industries such as fashion, upholstery, and leather goods manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Rendering of lard and other edible fats of animal origin
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preservation of meat, specifically through the rendering of lard and other edible fats of animal origin. Core operations include the collection and treatment of animal fat, the boiling or heating of fat to separate it from other components, and the processing of this fat into usable products like lard. This may also encompass the preservation and packaging of these products for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Production and processing of animal offal
Description: Commercial production and processing of animal offal, involving activities such as slaughtering, butchering, and preserving. This includes the handling and treatment of by-products from meat processing, such as organs and other internal parts of animals, for use in food production or other industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Processing and preserving of meat
Sub-class Name: Production, processing and preserving of other meat and meat products n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve the production, processing, and preservation of various types of meat and meat products not specified elsewhere. Typical operations include slaughtering of animals, cutting and packing of meat, and production of meat-based products such as sausages, cured meats, and other processed meat items. Preservation methods might involve smoking, curing, freezing, or canning to extend the shelf life of the products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Sun-drying of fish
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preservation of fish, crustaceans, and molluscs, specifically through sun-drying methods. Core operations include catching or sourcing seafood, preparing it for drying, and then exposing it to sunlight until it's adequately dehydrated. The sun-dried seafood is then packaged and stored for later distribution or sale. This process naturally preserves the seafood, extending its shelf life and enhancing its flavor for culinary uses.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Artificial dehydration of fish and sea food
Description: Businesses under this classification are involved in the artificial dehydration of fish and other seafood. This process typically includes cleaning, preparing, and dehydrating fish, crustaceans, and molluscs to preserve them for extended periods. Services may also include packaging and distributing the dehydrated seafood products for commercial sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Radiation preservation of fish and similar food
Description: The business activity involves the use of radiation techniques to preserve fish, crustaceans, and molluscs. Core operations include treating these seafood products with ionizing radiation to eliminate bacteria and other pathogens, extending shelf life and ensuring food safety. Services may also comprise packaging and storing the preserved seafood for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Processing and preserving of fish crustacean and similar foods
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans, and similar seafood products. Core operations include cleaning, filleting, freezing, smoking, salting, and packing of these seafood items. They may also engage in canning or other methods of preservation to extend shelf life. Other activities may involve the production of fishmeal for human consumption or animal feed.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Processing and canning of fish
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the processing and canning of fish. This includes the cleaning, filleting, and packaging of various fish species, as well as their preservation through canning. The operations may also encompass the production of fish-based products such as canned tuna, salmon, sardines, and more. The process typically involves procurement of raw fish, their preparation, and the use of preservation techniques to extend shelf life and maintain quality.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Processing and canning of frog legs
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preserving of frog legs, including cleaning, cutting, and packaging. It also includes the canning of these products for longer shelf life and easier distribution. The operations may involve boiling or blanching the frog legs, followed by canning them in a suitable preservative solution. The business may also provide services such as quality control, packaging, and distribution of the canned frog legs.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Production of fishmeal for human consumption or animal feed
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans, and molluscs to produce fishmeal. This includes catching or sourcing these sea creatures, cleaning, and processing them into a powdered product. This fishmeal is then packaged and distributed for human consumption or as a component in animal feed. Operations may also include quality control measures to ensure the nutritional value and safety of the produced fishmeal.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs
Sub-class Name: Production, processing and preservation of other fish products n.e.c
Description: Business operations under this classification involve the production, processing, and preservation of various types of fish products not elsewhere classified. Typical processes may include fishing, cleaning, freezing, canning, smoking, or drying fish and other seafood. Services may also include the production of fish oil, fish meal, or other by-products of fish processing. The aim is to extend the shelf life of fish products and make them suitable for future consumption or use in other industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Sun-drying of fruit and vegetables
Description: Commercial processing and preserving of fruits and vegetables through sun-drying methods. This involves activities such as washing, cutting, and laying out fruits and vegetables to dry in the sun, and then packaging and storing the dried produce for sale or further processing.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Artificial dehydration of fruit and vegetables
Description: The business activity involves the artificial dehydration of fruits and vegetables, a key process in food preservation. Core operations include sourcing fresh produce, cleaning, slicing, and artificially drying them to remove moisture. This process extends the shelf life of fruits and vegetables, making them suitable for long-term storage and use in various food products. Services may also encompass packaging and distribution of these dehydrated products to retailers or other businesses.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Radiation preservation of fruit and vegetables
Description: The business activity involves the use of radiation technology to preserve fruits and vegetables. This includes processes such as irradiation, which kills bacteria, insects and other pests, thereby extending the shelf life of these products. Other operations could include packaging and labeling of the radiated fruits and vegetables. This method of preservation ensures food safety and quality, making the fruits and vegetables suitable for longer storage and transportation.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fruit or vegetable juices and their concentrates, squashes and powder
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the production of fruit or vegetable juices, their concentrates, squashes, and powders. Core operations typically include the selection, washing, and processing of raw fruits and vegetables, followed by extraction, concentration, or dehydration to produce juices, concentrates, or powders. The final products are then packaged and prepared for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sauces, jams, jellies and marmalades
Description: Production of sauces, jams, jellies, and marmalades from fruits and vegetables, which involves processes such as cleaning, sorting, and preparing the raw materials, cooking, and preserving them. This also includes packaging and distribution of these finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pickles, chutney etc.
Description: Engaged in the production and preservation of fruits and vegetables, this business activity involves the creation of pickles, chutneys, and similar preserved foods. Key operations include sourcing fresh produce, processing it through methods such as cutting and peeling, and then preserving it using techniques like fermentation or canning. The end products are typically used for direct consumption or as ingredients in other food items.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Canning of fruits and vegetables
Description: The business activity involves the processing and preservation of fruits and vegetables, primarily through canning methods. This includes washing, peeling, cutting, and cooking the produce before sealing it in sterilized cans to ensure long-term storage. The process also involves quality control checks, packaging, and distribution of the canned fruits and vegetables.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of potato flour & meals and prepared meals of vegetables
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the processing and preservation of fruits and vegetables, with a specific focus on the manufacture of potato flour, meals, and prepared vegetable meals. Typical processes include washing, peeling, cutting, and cooking vegetables, as well as grinding potatoes into flour or meal. The business may also package and distribute these products for retail or wholesale. Additional operations might include the development and production of ready-to-eat vegetable meals.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Class Name: Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables
Sub-class Name: Preservation of fruit and vegetables n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve the processing and preservation of various fruits and vegetables not otherwise specified. Typical operations include cleaning, sorting, and grading of produce, followed by processes such as canning, freezing, dehydrating, pickling, or making jams and jellies to extend their shelf life. These businesses may also produce fruit and vegetable juices, purees, and concentrates. The goal of these activities is to maintain or enhance the nutritional value, flavor, and texture of the fruits and vegetables, while ensuring their availability all year round.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hydrogenated oil and vanaspati ghee
Description: Production and processing of hydrogenated oils and vanaspati ghee, derived from both plant and animal sources. This involves the extraction and refining of oils, the hydrogenation process to turn them into solid or semi-solid fats, and the manufacture of vanaspati ghee, a vegetable-based substitute for traditional dairy ghee. Services may also include packaging and distribution of the final products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of vegetable oils and fats excluding corn oil
Description: The business activity involves the production of vegetable oils and fats, excluding corn oil. This typically includes processes such as extraction, refining, and packaging of oils and fats derived from a variety of vegetable sources like olives, sunflowers, coconuts, and more. The operations may also encompass the production of by-products such as oilseed cake. Services provided may include wholesale distribution of these manufactured oils and fats to food production companies or retail outlets.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of edible animal oils and fats
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the production of edible animal oils and fats. This includes processes such as extraction, refining, and packaging of these products. Typical operations may involve sourcing raw animal materials, processing these materials to extract oils and fats, purifying the extracted products, and preparing them for sale in the market. These oils and fats are primarily used for culinary purposes.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fish oil
Description: Processing and production of fish oil, which involves the extraction of oil from fish or fish parts. This includes activities such as obtaining raw fish, processing it to separate the oil, refining the oil, and packaging it for sale. The fish oil produced can be used for various purposes including dietary supplements, animal feed, and industrial uses.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of non-edible animal oil and fats
Description: Production and processing of non-edible animal oils and fats. This involves extracting oils and fats from various animal sources, refining them, and preparing them for use in industrial applications such as lubricants, biofuels, and other non-food products. It may also include the manufacture of by-products like animal feed from the leftover materials.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of oil cakes & meals incl. residual products, e.g. Oleostearin, Palmstearin
Description: The business activity involves the production of oil cakes and meals, which are by-products derived from the processing of vegetable and animal oils and fats. Typical processes include the extraction and refinement of oils from raw materials like seeds, nuts, or animal fats, and the subsequent manufacturing of residual products such as Oleostearin and Palmstearin. Services may also include packaging and distribution of these products for use in various industries, including food, cosmetics, and biofuel.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of non-defatted flour or meals of oilseeds, oilnuts or kernels
Description: The business activity involves the production of non-defatted flour or meals from oilseeds, oilnuts, or kernels. Core operations include processing and grinding oilseeds, oilnuts, or kernels to create flour or meals, ensuring the natural oil content is retained. Services may also encompass packaging and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Class Name: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other vegetable oil, animal oil and fats n.e.c
Description: Business operations in this category involve the production of various types of vegetable and animal oils and fats that are not elsewhere classified. This includes processing raw materials, extracting oils and fats, refining, and packaging for distribution. Typical processes may involve cold pressing, solvent extraction, refining, and hydrogenation. The end products can range from cooking oils to industrial-grade oils and fats.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pasteurised milk whether or not in bottles/ polythene packs etc. (plain or flavoured)
Description: Production and packaging of pasteurized milk, which can be either plain or flavored. This involves processes such as milk collection, pasteurization to eliminate bacteria, and packaging into bottles or polythene packs.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of milk-powder, ice-cream powder and condensed milk except baby milk food
Description: Production and processing of dairy-based products such as milk powder, ice cream powder, and condensed milk, excluding baby milk food. This involves activities such as sourcing raw milk, pasteurization, dehydration or condensation processes, packaging, and distribution of the final products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of baby milk foods
Description: Production and processing of baby milk foods, typically involving the sourcing of dairy ingredients, pasteurization, formulation of nutritionally balanced baby food products, and packaging for distribution. This business activity may also include the development of specialized baby milk foods to cater to specific dietary needs or restrictions.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cream, butter, cheese, curd, ghee, khoya etc.
Description: Production and processing of dairy products such as cream, butter, cheese, curd, ghee, and khoya. This involves activities like pasteurizing and homogenizing milk, churning to produce butter, fermenting milk to create cheese and curd, and heating milk to produce ghee and khoya. The business may also provide related services such as packaging and distribution of these dairy products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ice-cream, kulfi etc.
Description: Production and processing of ice-cream, kulfi, and similar dairy-based frozen desserts, which involves sourcing of dairy ingredients, mixing, freezing, packaging, and distribution. This business activity may also include the development of new flavors and quality control for ensuring product safety and consistency.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of dairy products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other dairy products n.e.c.
Description: Production and processing of various dairy products not elsewhere classified, such as cheese, butter, yogurt, and ice cream. This involves activities like pasteurization, fermentation, and packaging of dairy products. It may also include the creation of dairy-based specialty items or innovative dairy products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Flour milling
Description: Business activities in this category involve the processing of grains such as wheat, corn, and rice into flour. This includes cleaning, grinding, and milling grains, as well as packaging and distributing the resulting flour products. Other operations may involve producing specialty flours and other grain mill products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Rice milling
Description: Business operations in this category involve the processing of rice, which includes the removal of husks and bran to produce white rice. Additional activities may include the milling of paddy rice, production of rice flour, and other related grain mill processes. Services may also encompass the packaging and distribution of the milled rice products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Dal (pulses) milling
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the processing and milling of pulses, commonly known as dal, to produce various food products. This includes activities such as cleaning, sorting, de-husking, splitting, and packaging of different types of pulses. The final products may be sold to wholesalers, retailers, or directly to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Grain milling other than wheat, rice and dal
Description: Processing and milling of grains other than wheat, rice, and dal, including activities such as cleaning, hulling, milling, sieving and packaging. This business operation may involve producing flour, groats, meal or pellets from grains like corn, barley, oats, rye, and others. The final products are typically used for human consumption, animal feed, or other industrial uses.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Vegetable milling (production of flour or meal of dried leguminous vegetables(except dal), of roots or tubers, or of edible nuts)
Description: The business activity involves the milling of vegetables, specifically focusing on the production of flour or meal derived from dried leguminous vegetables (excluding dal), roots, tubers, or edible nuts. Core operations include sourcing these raw materials, processing them through milling equipment to create flour or meal, and then packaging the final product for distribution. This might also involve quality control measures to ensure the product meets food safety standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cereal breakfast foods obtained by roasting or swelling cereal grains
Description: The production of cereal breakfast foods by roasting or swelling cereal grains is the main activity. This involves processes such as sourcing various cereal grains, roasting or swelling them to create different textures and flavors, and then packaging the final products for distribution. The products may include a variety of breakfast cereals, granola, muesli, and similar grain-based foods. The business may also be involved in developing new cereal-based products and ensuring the quality of the products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of flour mixes and prepared blended flour and dough for bread, cakes, biscuits
Description: The business activity involves the production of grain mill products, specifically focusing on the creation of flour mixes and prepared blended flour and dough. These mixes are typically designed for use in baking bread, cakes, and biscuits. Key operations include sourcing and milling grains, blending different types of flour for specific baking needs, and preparing ready-to-use dough mixes. The company may also provide related services such as product development for specific baking requirements or private labeling for retail businesses.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other readymade mixed powders like idli, gulabjamun etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of ready-to-use mixed powders for various food items such as idli, gulabjamun, and others. The process typically includes sourcing quality grains, milling them into fine powder, and then combining them with other necessary ingredients to create a ready-to-cook mix. The final product is usually packaged and marketed for consumer use, providing a convenient option for quick and easy meal preparation.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of grain mill products
Sub-class Name: Other grain milling and processing n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve the milling and processing of various grains not specified elsewhere. Typical operations include grinding grains into flour, grits, or meal and may also involve the production of grain-based foods such as breakfast cereals. Other processes could include the removal of chaff, bran, or germ from the grain and the packaging of the final product for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of starches from rice, potatoes, maize etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of starches from various sources such as rice, potatoes, maize, and other similar crops. Core operations include the extraction, processing, and refining of starch from these raw materials. The processed starch may then be sold directly or used in the manufacture of other starch-based products. Services provided may include custom processing and packaging of starch products according to client specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sago and sago products
Description: Production and processing of sago and sago-based products, which involves sourcing raw sago, refining it into usable forms, and creating various products such as sago pearls, flour, and other derivatives. This may also include packaging and distribution of these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of glucose, glucose syrup, maltose etc.
Description: Production and processing of starch derivatives such as glucose, glucose syrup, and maltose. This involves the extraction of starch from various sources, its conversion into different forms, and the manufacture of starch-based products. Services may include custom processing and production of these starch derivatives for use in industries like food and beverage, pharmaceuticals, and more.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gluten
Description: Production and processing of gluten, a protein found in certain grains, is the primary activity of this business. This involves extracting gluten from grains, purifying it, and converting it into various products. It may also include the manufacturing of gluten-based products such as vital wheat gluten, seitan, or other food additives.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tapioca and tapioca substitutes prepared from starch
Description: The business activity involves the production of tapioca and its substitutes using starch as the primary raw material. Typical operations include processing and refining starch to create tapioca, a starchy carbohydrate used in various food products. The process may also involve developing substitutes for tapioca, again using starch. These products are then packaged and prepared for distribution to various food industries or direct consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of corn oil
Description: The business activity involves the production of corn oil, a type of vegetable oil derived from corn. This includes processes such as corn kernel extraction, oil pressing, refining, and bottling. The operations may also involve the production of by-products like corn gluten and corn meal. The final product, corn oil, is commonly used in cooking and baking, as well as in the production of margarine and other food products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Group Name: Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products
Class Name: Manufacture of starches and starch products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other starch products n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the manufacturing of a variety of starch products not classified elsewhere. This involves processing raw materials, such as corn, wheat, or potatoes, to extract starch and further refine it into various products. These products may include modified starches, dextrins, or other starch derivatives used in various industries like food, paper, textile, and pharmaceuticals. The operations typically include raw material procurement, starch extraction, product formulation, and distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of bakery products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bread
Description: Production and sale of various types of bread, including whole grain, white, and specialty breads. This involves processes such as mixing ingredients, kneading dough, baking, and packaging. It may also include the development of new bread recipes and the provision of custom bread-making services.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of bakery products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of biscuits, cakes, pastries, rusks etc.
Description: Commercial production of biscuits, cakes, pastries, rusks, and similar bakery products. This involves the process of sourcing raw materials, baking, packaging, and distribution of these goods. It may also include the development of new recipes and the quality control of finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of bakery products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other bakery products n.e.c.
Description: Production and sale of a variety of bakery items not otherwise classified, such as specialty breads, pastries, cakes, cookies, and other confectioneries. This involves processes like baking, decorating, packaging, and direct or wholesale distribution of these bakery products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture or refining of sugar (sucrose) from sugercane
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the production and refinement of sugar, specifically sucrose, from sugarcane. The core operations include the extraction of juice from sugarcane, the purification and crystallization of this juice to produce raw sugar, and the further refining of this raw sugar to create a finished product. This may also involve the production of by-products such as molasses. The end product is typically sold to food manufacturers, retailers, or directly to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `gur' from sugarcane
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the production of 'gur', also known as jaggery, from sugarcane. Typical processes include the extraction of juice from sugarcane, its boiling and concentration, and the final formation of 'gur'. The services provided may also encompass packaging and distribution of the manufactured 'gur'.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `gur' from other than sugarcane
Description: The business activity involves the production of 'gur', a type of unrefined sugar, from sources other than sugarcane. Typical processes include sourcing the raw materials, such as date palm or coconut palm sap, and then boiling, cooling, and solidifying the sap to create 'gur'. The operations may also encompass packaging and distribution of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `khandsari' sugar from sugarcane
Description: The production of 'khandsari' sugar from sugarcane involves the extraction of juice from sugarcane, followed by boiling, crystallizing, and drying to create a coarse, unrefined sugar. This business activity typically includes the procurement of sugarcane, the operation of machinery for juice extraction, and the use of traditional methods for sugar crystallization and drying. Services may also include packaging and distribution of the finished 'khandsari' sugar.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `khandsari' suger from other than sugarcane
Description: The business activity involves the production of 'khandsari' sugar from sources other than sugarcane. It typically includes processes such as sourcing and processing of alternative raw materials like sweet sorghum, sugar beet, or palm sap. The core operations involve extraction of juice from these materials, its clarification, concentration, and crystallization to produce 'khandsari' sugar. This type of sugar manufacturing may also provide related services such as packaging and distribution of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `boora' and candy from sugarcane
Description: The business activity involves the production of 'boora' and candy using sugarcane as the primary ingredient. Core operations include sourcing and processing of sugarcane, extraction of sugar, and the subsequent manufacturing of 'boora' and candy. This may also involve flavoring, shaping, and packaging these confectionery items for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `boora' and candy from other than sugarcane
Description: Production and processing of 'boora' and candy using sources other than sugarcane. This involves sourcing alternative sweeteners, creating the candy mixture, shaping and cooling the candies, and finally packaging for distribution. It may also include the development of new candy recipes and flavors.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of molasses
Description: Production and processing of molasses, a by-product of sugar manufacturing. This involves extraction of juice from sugarcane or sugar beet, boiling it down to form sugar and then further processing the residual liquid to create molasses. The operations may also include packaging and distribution of molasses for various industries such as food, alcohol, and animal feed.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of sugar
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sugar from other sources (juice of palm, suger beet etc.)
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of sugar from various non-traditional sources such as palm juice, sugar beet, and others. The core operations include sourcing raw materials, extraction of juice from these materials, and processing it into sugar. This may also encompass refining, crystallization, packaging, and distribution of the produced sugar.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cocoa products
Description: Business activity involves the production of cocoa-based products, including the processing of raw cocoa beans into various forms such as cocoa powder, cocoa butter, and cocoa liquor. Typical operations include the cleaning, roasting, grinding, and pressing of cocoa beans, as well as the blending and refining of cocoa mass into different cocoa products. This can also encompass the production of cocoa-based food items and beverages.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of chocolate and chocolate confectionery
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the production of chocolate and chocolate confectionery. Core operations include the processing of cacao beans into cocoa solids and cocoa butter, blending these ingredients with others like sugar and milk to produce different types of chocolate, and shaping the resulting chocolate into various forms such as bars, truffles, or pralines. These companies may also produce filled chocolates, where the fillings can range from fruits and nuts to liqueurs. This category also covers the manufacture of chocolate-covered confectionery such as chocolate-coated nuts or fruits.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sugar confectionery (except sweetmeats)
Description: Production and processing of sugar-based confectionery items, excluding sweetmeats. This involves activities such as the creation of candies, lollipops, gum, and other non-chocolate sweets. The process typically includes the selection and preparation of ingredients, cooking and molding of the confectionery, and packaging for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture sweetmeats including dairy based sweetmeats
Description: The activity involves the production of cocoa, chocolate, and sugar-based confections, with a specific focus on sweetmeats, which can include dairy-based treats. Core operations include sourcing and processing raw ingredients like cocoa beans and sugar, creating chocolate or sugar confectionery recipes, and manufacturing these into final products. This could also involve the production of traditional sweetmeats using dairy products. Services may include the packaging and distribution of these confections.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of chewing gum
Description: Production of chewing gum, involving processes such as mixing, heating, and molding of gum base and other ingredients. This may also include the addition of flavors, colors, and sweeteners, as well as packaging and distribution of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Preserving in sugar of fruit, nuts, fruit peels and other parts of plants
Description: The business activity involves the preservation of fruits, nuts, fruit peels, and other plant parts by using sugar. This typically includes processes such as candying, crystallizing, glazing, or coating these items with sugar to extend their shelf life and enhance their taste. The preserved products are often used in the manufacture of confectionery items like candies, chocolates, cakes, and pastries. The operations may also involve packaging and selling these sugar-preserved products to retailers or directly to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other cocoa, chocolate, sugar confectionery products n.e.c.
Description: The manufacturing of a variety of cocoa, chocolate, and sugar confectionery products not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.) involves a range of activities. These include the processing of cocoa beans into cocoa powder, cocoa butter, and cocoa blocks, as well as the creation of different types of chocolate such as dark, milk, and white chocolate. The production of sugar confectionery items such as candies, sweets, lollipops, and similar treats also falls under this business activity. Services may encompass the entire production process, from the initial preparation and processing of raw ingredients to the final packaging and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of macaroni, noodles, couscous and similar farinaceous products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of macaroni, noodles, couscous and similar farinaceous products
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of pasta and grain-based products such as macaroni, noodles, and couscous. This includes the entire manufacturing process, from the initial mixing and kneading of dough to the shaping, drying, and packaging of the final products. It also encompasses the production of other similar farinaceous (starch-based) products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of prepared meals and dishes
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of prepared meals and dishes
Description: Production and supply of ready-to-eat meals and dishes, encompassing a variety of cuisines. This involves the processes of sourcing ingredients, cooking, packaging, and distribution. The operations may also include the creation of frozen, chilled, or shelf-stable meals that are typically reheated before consumption. Services may also extend to custom meal production for specific dietary requirements or preferences.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Processing and blending of tea including manufacture of instant tea
Description: The business activity involves the processing and blending of different types of tea leaves to create a variety of tea flavors. This operation also includes the manufacture of instant tea, a product that is designed for quick preparation. Typical processes in this business may involve sourcing and selection of tea leaves, drying, cutting, sieving, blending, and packaging. The production of instant tea requires additional steps such as extraction, concentration, and drying to create a soluble powder or granules.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Coffee curing, roasting, grinding blending etc. and manufacturing of coffee products
Description: The business activity involves the comprehensive processing of coffee, starting from curing raw coffee beans to roasting them for flavor enhancement. This also includes grinding the roasted beans into a fine or coarse powder as per customer preferences, blending different types of coffee for unique flavor profiles, and the production of various coffee-based products. The operations may also involve packaging and labeling the final product for retail or wholesale distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Processing of edible nuts
Description: The business activity involves the manufacture of edible nuts, which includes processes like shelling, roasting, salting, and packaging. It may also encompass the production of nut-based products such as nut butters or flavored nuts. Services provided can include the sourcing and quality control of raw nuts, as well as the distribution and sale of the final processed nut products.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of malted foods including foods for infants and handicapped
Description: The business activity involves the production of malted foods, which includes specialized food items for infants and handicapped individuals. Core operations include sourcing of raw materials, processing them to produce malted food products, and packaging for distribution. The process may involve malting grains, formulating nutritional blends suitable for infants or those with special dietary needs, and maintaining stringent quality controls to ensure product safety and compliance with health regulations.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Grinding and processing of spices
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the grinding and processing of various spices. Typical operations include the cleaning, drying, grinding, and packaging of spices such as pepper, cinnamon, cardamom, and others. These businesses may also engage in the extraction and distillation of essential oils from spices, as well as the production of spice blends or mixes.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of papads, appalam and similar food products
Description: Production and manufacturing of food items such as papads, appalam, and other similar products. This involves the entire process from sourcing raw materials, preparing the dough, shaping and drying the papads or appalam, to packaging and distribution. The business may also include the development of new recipes and flavors, quality control, and ensuring compliance with food safety standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of vitaminised high protein flour, frying of dal and other cereals
Description: The business activity involves the production of vitamin-enriched high protein flour, which includes sourcing raw materials, processing, and packaging. It also includes the frying of dal and other cereals, a process that involves cleaning, sorting, frying, and packaging the products. These operations may provide products for both individual consumers and commercial entities, such as bakeries or food service companies.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Processing of salt into food-grade salt, e.g. iodized salt
Description: The business activity involves the transformation of raw salt into food-grade salt, such as iodized salt. This includes processes like purification, iodization, and packaging of salt to make it suitable and safe for human consumption. This operation may also encompass additional enrichment or flavoring of the salt, as well as the manufacturing of specialty or gourmet salts.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other semi-processed, processed or instant foods n.e.c. except farinaceous products and malted foods and manufacturing activities like manufacture of egg powder, sambar powder etc. (this excludes the
Description: Manufacturing of various semi-processed, processed or instant foods not elsewhere classified, excluding farinaceous products and malted foods. This involves the production of items such as egg powder, sambar powder, and similar products. The process typically includes sourcing raw materials, processing these ingredients into semi-finished or fully processed foods, packaging, and distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of prepared animal feeds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cattle feed
Description: Production and supply of prepared feeds specifically designed for cattle, encompassing the process of sourcing raw materials, formulating balanced diet mixes, and packaging for sale. Activities may also include research and development to enhance nutritional value and improve cattle health.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of prepared animal feeds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of poultry feed
Description: Production and supply of prepared feeds specifically designed for poultry. This involves the formulation, blending, and packaging of feeds that are nutritionally balanced to meet the dietary needs of various types of poultry, including chickens, turkeys, ducks, and other fowl. Services may also include research and development of new feed formulations to improve poultry health and productivity.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of prepared animal feeds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of prepared feeds for pets, including dogs, cats, birds, fish etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of prepared feeds specifically designed for pets such as dogs, cats, birds, fish, and more. This includes the formulation and mixing of feed ingredients, processing, and packaging of pet food products. The operations may also involve research and development to create nutritionally balanced and health-promoting feeds for various types of pets.

Division Name: Manufacture of food products
Class Name: Manufacture of prepared animal feeds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other animal feeds n.e.c.
Description: Production and distribution of various animal feeds not elsewhere classified, such as pet food, bird food, and specialty animal nutrition products. This involves sourcing raw materials, processing them into suitable food for different animal species, and packaging for distribution. Services may also include custom feed formulation and nutritional advice.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of distilled, potable, alcoholic beverages such as whisky, brandy, gin, ""mixed drinks"" etc.
Description: The production and blending of distilled, potable, alcoholic beverages such as whisky, brandy, gin, and mixed drinks. This involves the process of distilling and rectifying spirits, followed by blending to achieve a specific taste and character. It may also include the creation of unique beverage mixes or cocktails for commercial distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
