Class Name: Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of country liquor
Description: Production and processing of country liquor, involving the distillation, rectification, and blending of spirits. This encompasses the entire manufacturing process from fermentation to bottling, ensuring the liquor adheres to quality standards. Services may also include the development of unique blends and flavors of country liquor.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits
Sub-class Name: Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits
Description: Business operations in this category involve the production of distilled alcoholic beverages. This includes the process of distillation, which involves heating a liquid to create vapor and then cooling that vapor to create a liquid. The rectification process, which is a method of refining and purifying spirits, is also a key operation. Additionally, the blending of spirits to create different flavors and types of alcoholic beverages is part of this business activity. This can involve mixing different types of distilled spirits or adding flavorings and other ingredients.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of wines
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wines
Description: The business activity involves the production of wines, which includes the process of fermenting fruits, primarily grapes, to create various types of wines. This can encompass the entire winemaking process, from grape cultivation and harvesting to fermentation, aging, and bottling. The businesses may also provide related services such as wine blending and flavoring.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors and malt
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of beer
Description: Production and processing of malt liquors and beer, involving the brewing of beer from malted barley and other ingredients, fermentation, aging, and packaging for commercial distribution. This can also include the production of non-alcoholic beer, craft beer, and other specialty beer products.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors and malt
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors other than beer
Description: Production and processing of malt liquors, excluding beer, is the main business activity in this category. This involves processes such as malting grains, typically barley, fermenting the malted grains, and distilling the fermented malt to produce malt liquors. The final product could range from spirits like whisky to non-alcoholic beverages. This sub-class does not include the manufacture of beer.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors and malt
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of malt
Description: The business activity involves the production of malt from barley or other grains through a process known as malting. This typically includes steeping, germinating, and drying the grains to convert them into malt. The malt produced can be used in brewing, distilling, or in the production of foods like malt vinegar, malt extract, and malted milk.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors and malt
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of malt liquors and malt n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this classification are involved in the production of malt liquors and malt. The process typically includes brewing, fermenting, and packaging of malt liquors such as beer. It also covers the production of malt, which involves soaking, germinating, and drying cereal grains. This malt is often used as a key ingredient in brewing and distillation processes. Additionally, this sub-class includes manufacturing of other related malt products not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.).

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of aerated drinks
Description: The business activity involves the production of aerated drinks, commonly known as carbonated or fizzy drinks. Core operations include the process of carbonation, where carbon dioxide is dissolved under high pressure into water to create bubbles, and the addition of various ingredients such as sweeteners, flavors, and colors. The final product is then bottled or canned for distribution and sale. This category also includes the manufacture of soft drinks with reduced sugar content or alternative sweeteners.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic flavoured concentrates and syrups
Description: The business activity involves the production of synthetic flavoured concentrates and syrups, typically used in the manufacture of soft drinks and other beverages. The process usually includes sourcing raw materials, creating unique flavor combinations, and processing these into concentrated forms or syrups. This also involves quality control measures to ensure product safety and consistency. Additionally, the business may also involve the packaging and distribution of these concentrates and syrups to beverage manufacturers or retailers.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mineral water
Description: Business activity involves the production of mineral water, which includes sourcing, purifying, and bottling of natural spring or well water. Typical processes include filtration, carbonation, and addition of minerals for taste enhancement or health benefits. The final product is then packaged in bottles or other containers for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ice
Description: Production and distribution of soft drinks, mineral waters, and other types of bottled waters, along with the manufacturing of ice. This involves processes such as water purification, carbonation, flavoring and bottling for soft drinks and water products. For ice manufacturing, it includes freezing water into various sizes and shapes, typically for consumption or cooling purposes.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks
Description: Production and distribution of a variety of soft drinks, which may involve processes such as the creation of unique beverage formulas, carbonation, sweetening, and bottling. This business activity also includes quality control measures to ensure the safety and consistency of the final product, as well as packaging and labeling for retail sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of beverages
Class Name: Manufacture of soft drinks; production of mineral waters and other bottled waters
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other non-alcoholic beverages n.e.c.
Description: Production and manufacturing of a variety of non-alcoholic beverages not elsewhere classified, such as fruit drinks, energy drinks, coffee, tea, and other specialty beverages. This involves processes like selection and sourcing of ingredients, beverage formulation, bottling, packaging, and distribution. It also includes the production of mineral waters and other types of bottled waters.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Stemming and redrying of tobacco
Description: Business operations under this classification involve the processing of tobacco leaves, specifically through stemming and redrying procedures. Stemming refers to the removal of the main vein or stem from the tobacco leaf, while redrying is a process used to reduce the moisture content in the tobacco. These processes are essential in preparing tobacco for further manufacturing into various tobacco products.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bidi
Description: The business activity involves the production of bidi, a traditional Indian cigarette filled with tobacco. The core operations include sourcing and processing tobacco, rolling it into tendu or temburni leaf wrappers, and packaging the finished products for distribution. This also covers quality control measures to ensure the bidi meets standard regulations.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cigarettes, cigarette tobacco
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of cigarettes and cigarette tobacco. Core operations include sourcing and processing raw tobacco, creating blends, and rolling cigarettes. It may also encompass the production of different types of cigarettes, including filter and non-filter variants, and the packaging of finished products for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cigars and cheroots
Description: The business activity involves the production of cigars and cheroots, which includes sourcing and processing tobacco leaves, rolling them into desired shapes, and packaging for distribution. Core operations may include quality control of raw materials, blending of different tobacco types for flavor, and ensuring the cigars and cheroots meet industry standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of snuff
Description: Business activity involves the production of snuff, a type of tobacco product. This includes the processing of raw tobacco into powdered or granulated form, which is then typically inhaled or 'snuffed' into the nose. The process may also involve flavoring, packaging, and distribution of the finished snuff products.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of zarda
Description: The business activity involves the production of zarda, a type of chewing tobacco popular in South Asia. This includes sourcing raw tobacco, processing it into a flavored mixture with spices and other ingredients, and packaging the final product for distribution and sale. Typical operations may also involve quality control, product development, and adherence to tobacco industry regulations.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of catechu(katha) and chewing lime
Description: The business activity involves the production of catechu (also known as katha) and chewing lime, typically used in various types of chewing tobacco products. Core operations include sourcing raw materials, processing them into the desired product, and packaging for distribution. The production of catechu involves boiling acacia wood in water and evaporating the mixture to yield a concentrated extract. Chewing lime manufacture involves heating limestone or seashells to create calcium oxide, which is then hydrated to produce calcium hydroxide. Both products are then prepared and packaged for use in the tobacco industry.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pan masala and related products.
Description: The business activity involves the production of pan masala and related tobacco products. Core operations include sourcing and processing of raw materials such as betel nuts, tobacco, lime, and various spices, blending them to create the final product, and packaging for sale. Services may also include product development and research to create new flavors or improve existing ones.

Division Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Class Name: Manufacture of tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other tobacco products including chewing tobacco n.e.c.
Description: Production and processing of various tobacco products not classified elsewhere, such as chewing tobacco. This involves sourcing raw tobacco, processing it into chewable form, and packaging for distribution and sale. The business operations may also include the development of new tobacco products and quality control of the production process.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Sub-class Name: Preparation and spinning of cotton fiber including blended* cotton
Description: The business activity involves the processing and spinning of cotton fibers, including those that are blended with other materials. Core operations include the cleaning, carding, combing, and drawing of raw cotton to prepare it for spinning. The spinning process involves twisting the prepared cotton fibers into yarn or thread. These threads or yarns are then used in the production of various cotton-based textile products.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Sub-class Name: Preparation and spinning of silk fiber including blended* silk
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the processing and spinning of silk fibers, including those blended with other materials. Key operations include the preparation of raw silk, transforming it into usable fibers, and spinning these fibers into threads or yarns. The final products are typically used in the textile industry for weaving or knitting.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Sub-class Name: Preparation and spinning of wool, including other animal hair and blended*wool including other animal hair
Description: The business activity involves the processing and spinning of wool and other animal hair. This includes the initial stage of preparing the raw wool and animal hair, cleaning it and aligning the fibres to make them suitable for spinning. The spinning process transforms these prepared fibres into yarn or thread. This category also covers the blending of wool with other animal hair, creating mixed fibre products for various textile applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Sub-class Name: Preparation and spinning of man-made fiber including blended* man-made fiber
Description: Business operations in this category involve processing and spinning of synthetic or man-made textile fibers, including those that are blended. Typical processes include the transformation of raw synthetic materials into fibers, followed by the spinning of these fibers to create yarn or thread. Services may also encompass blending different types of man-made fibers to produce a variety of textile products.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Sub-class Name: Preparation and spinning of jute, mesta and other natural fibers including blended natural fibers n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve the preparation and spinning of jute, mesta, and other natural fibers, including blended natural fibers not elsewhere classified. Typical operations include the cleaning, carding, combing, and spinning of these fibers to create yarn. The yarn can then be used in various textile manufacturing processes. The blending of different natural fibers to create unique properties in the yarn is also included in this classification.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Weaving of textiles
Sub-class Name: Weaving, manufacture of cotton and cotton mixture fabrics.
Description: The business activity involves the weaving and production of cotton and cotton mixture fabrics. Core operations include sourcing raw cotton, spinning it into yarn, and then weaving this yarn into fabrics. The manufacturing process may also involve blending cotton with other materials to create mixed fabrics. The final products are typically sold to clothing manufacturers, home goods producers, or directly to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Weaving of textiles
Sub-class Name: Weaving, manufacture of silk and silk mixture fabrics.
Description: The business activity involves the weaving and production of silk and silk blend fabrics. Core operations include sourcing raw silk materials, processing these materials into threads or yarns, and then weaving these threads into various types of silk and silk mixture fabrics. The finished products may be used in fashion, home decor, or other industries that require silk fabrics. Services may also include custom weaving for specific design requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Weaving of textiles
Sub-class Name: Weaving, manufacture of wool and wool mixture fabrics.
Description: The business activity involves the weaving and production of textiles, specifically focusing on wool and wool mixture fabrics. Core operations include sourcing raw wool, processing it into usable form, and then weaving it into various textiles. The manufacturing process may also involve blending wool with other materials to create mixed fabrics. Products typically range from clothing materials to home furnishings. The services provided may also include custom weaving for specific design requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Weaving of textiles
Sub-class Name: Weaving, manufacturing of man-made fiber and man-made mixture fabrics.
Description: The business activity involves the weaving and manufacturing of fabrics made from synthetic or man-made fibers, and those made from a blend of synthetic and natural materials. Key operations include the production of yarn from synthetic materials, weaving this yarn into fabric, and further processing the fabric for use in various industries. This could also involve designing and producing a wide variety of textiles with different patterns, colors, and textures using man-made fibers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Weaving of textiles
Sub-class Name: Weaving of jute, mesta and other natural fibers including blended natural fibers n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the weaving of textiles specifically made from jute, mesta, and other natural fibers, including those that are blended. The core operations typically include sourcing raw materials, processing these fibers, and weaving them into textiles. These textiles are then further used in various industries for making products like bags, carpets, clothing, and more. The business might also provide services related to the design, development, and customization of these woven textiles according to customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Finishing of cotton and blended cotton textiles.
Description: The business activity involves the final processing of cotton and blended cotton textiles. Core operations include bleaching, dyeing, printing, dressing, and finishing of these textiles to enhance their appearance and durability. Services may also encompass the treatment of textiles with water, heat, or chemicals, and other processes to achieve desired characteristics such as colorfastness, shrink resistance, and wrinkle-free properties.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Finishing of silk and blended silk textiles.
Description: Business operations in this category involve the final stages of processing silk and blended silk textiles. Typical processes include bleaching, dyeing, printing, dressing, and other finishing techniques applied to silk and blended silk textiles. Services may also encompass shrink-proofing, moth-proofing, waterproofing, and the application of other protective substances to enhance the durability and aesthetic appeal of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Finishing of wool and blended wool textiles.
Description: The business activity involves the final processing of wool and blended wool textiles. Core operations include bleaching, dyeing, printing, dressing, and other finishing techniques applied to wool and wool blend fabrics. Services provided may also encompass the application of water, stain, or wrinkle-resistant treatments, as well as the shrink-proofing of woolen textiles.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Finishing of man-made and blended man-made textiles.
Description: The business activity involves the final processing and finishing of man-made and blended man-made textiles. Core operations include processes such as bleaching, dyeing, printing, dressing, and other treatments to improve the appearance, texture, or performance of textiles. Services may also include water and stain resistance treatments, fireproofing, mothproofing, mildew proofing, and shrinkage control treatments. The objective is to enhance the utility and aesthetic appeal of the man-made and blended textiles.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Finishing of jute, mesta and other vegetable textiles fabrics
Description: The business activity involves the finishing processes of jute, mesta, and other vegetable textile fabrics. Core operations typically include bleaching, dyeing, printing, dressing, and other treatments aimed at improving the appearance, texture, or durability of these textiles. Services may also entail the application of water repellents, flame retardants, or other protective substances to enhance the functional properties of the fabrics.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Activity related to screen printing
Description: Screen printing on textiles, often as the final step in the textile manufacturing process, is the primary focus of this business activity. This includes applying colorants and designs onto fabric surfaces using a mesh screen, a squeegee, and ink. Services may also encompass pre-press processes such as design creation and screen preparation, as well as post-press tasks like ink curing and quality checking. This business activity might cater to various industries, including fashion, home decor, and promotional merchandise.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Group Name: Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Class Name: Finishing of textiles
Sub-class Name: Other activities relating to finishing of textile n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the final processes in textile manufacturing such as bleaching, dyeing, printing, shrinking, calendaring, and other finishing techniques not explicitly classified elsewhere. Services may include treating textiles to enhance their durability, appearance, or feel, as well as applying decorative or functional finishes. This may also involve the application of water, stain, fire, or wrinkle-resistant finishes, as well as the preparation of textiles for market distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted cotton fabrics
Description: Creating knitted and crocheted fabrics made of cotton, encompassing all stages from sourcing the raw cotton material to the final knitting and crocheting processes. This could include the production of a wide range of products such as clothing, home textiles, and other fabric-based items. Services may also involve custom design and production based on specific client requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted woolen fabrics
Description: Production of knitted and crocheted woolen fabrics, involving processes such as spinning, knitting or crocheting, and finishing. This business activity may also encompass designing and creating patterns for woolen fabrics, as well as dyeing and bleaching these materials.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted synthetic fabrics
Description: Production of knitted and crocheted synthetic fabrics, involving processes such as knitting or crocheting synthetic yarn into fabric. This may include creating a variety of textile products such as clothing, home furnishings, and industrial textiles. Services provided may range from custom design and production to bulk manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other knitted and crocheted fabrics
Description: Production and supply of various types of knitted and crocheted fabrics, beyond the conventional range. This involves the knitting or crocheting of materials, potentially using a variety of techniques, to create distinct fabrics. These fabrics may then be sold to other businesses for use in their products, such as clothing, home furnishings, or other textile goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of curtains, bed covers and furnishings
Description: Production of made-up textile items such as curtains, bed covers, and furnishings, excluding clothing. This involves processes such as sourcing and preparing textiles, designing patterns, cutting and sewing fabrics, and finishing products for sale. Services may also include custom design or sizing, and the creation of matching sets or collections of home furnishings.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of crocheted made up textile goods except apparel
Description: The business activity involves the production of crocheted textile goods that are not clothing. This typically includes items such as crocheted blankets, tablecloths, doilies, and decorative items. The core operations include sourcing and processing of textile materials, creating design patterns, crocheting the items, and finalizing the products for sale. This may also encompass custom orders for specific designs or sizes.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mosquito nets
Description: Production and supply of mosquito nets, which involves the processing of textile materials, weaving or knitting them into net structures, and applying chemical treatments for mosquito repellency. This may also include the design and customization of mosquito nets to cater to specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bedding, quilts pillows, sleeping bags etc.
Description: Production of various made-up textile articles such as bedding, quilts, pillows, and sleeping bags. This involves processes like designing, cutting, sewing, and finishing of textile materials. The business operations may also include customization of products based on customer requirements and providing repair or alteration services for the manufactured items.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tarpaulin
Description: The business activity involves the production of tarpaulin, a heavy-duty waterproof cloth often used as a protective cover. This typically includes processes such as sourcing and preparing the textile materials, applying treatments to make the fabric waterproof, and cutting and stitching the fabric into the desired sizes and shapes. Services may also include customization of tarpaulin products to meet specific client requirements, such as adding eyelets, reinforcements, or other modifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of blankets
Description: The production and sale of blankets made from various textiles is the main business activity. This typically involves processes such as sourcing and purchasing textile materials, designing patterns, cutting and sewing textiles into blankets, and finally, quality checking, packaging, and distributing the finished products. This category does not include the manufacture of clothing or apparel.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of made-up textile articles, except apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other made-up textile articles, except apparel n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the production of various non-apparel textile items. This includes the manufacturing of items such as bedding, table linens, towels, curtains, cushions, and other similar products. It typically involves processes like weaving, dyeing, printing, and finishing of textiles. The final products are then marketed to retailers or directly to consumers. This category also includes other made-up textile articles not elsewhere classified, meaning it encompasses a wide range of textile products beyond those explicitly listed.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carpets and other floor coverings made of cotton
Description: Production and creation of carpets and other floor coverings primarily made of cotton. This involves the process of selecting and sourcing cotton, designing, weaving or knitting, dyeing, and finishing of cotton floor coverings. It may also include the provision of customized carpet designs and sizes based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carpets and other floor coverings made of wool
Description: Production and supply of carpets and other floor coverings made from wool. This involves sourcing and processing wool, designing and crafting carpets and rugs, and selling the finished products to retailers or directly to customers. Services may also include custom rug design, carpet repair and restoration, and consultation on carpet care and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carpets and other floor coverings made of silk
Description: The production of carpets and other floor coverings made of silk involves the creation, design, and manufacturing of silk-based floor coverings. This includes the sourcing of silk materials, weaving or tufting processes to produce carpets and rugs, and the application of various treatments to enhance durability and appearance. This business activity also involves quality control, packaging, and distribution of finished silk carpets and rugs to retailers or direct consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carpets made of synthetic materials
Description: Production and sale of carpets and rugs made from synthetic materials, such as nylon, polyester, or polypropylene. This involves sourcing and processing raw materials, designing and weaving or tufting carpets, and performing quality checks. The business may also provide services like carpet customization, installation, and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carpets, and other floor coverings made of jute, mesta and coir
Description: Production and manufacturing of carpets and rugs made from natural fibers such as jute, mesta, and coir. This involves sourcing the raw materials, processing them into usable fibers, weaving or otherwise creating the floor coverings, and potentially treating or finishing the products for sale. Services may also include custom design and manufacturing of these types of floor coverings.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of carpets and rugs
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other floor coverings n.e.c.
Description: Production of various types of floor coverings not classified elsewhere, such as linoleum, cork flooring, and vinyl tiles. This involves sourcing raw materials, designing, cutting, and assembling the floor coverings. It may also include customizing floor coverings as per customer specifications and providing installation services.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of thread, including thread ball making
Description: The business activity involves the production of cordage, rope, twine, and netting, which includes the manufacturing of thread and the process of making thread balls. Typical operations may encompass spinning, twisting, and braiding fibers into ropes or twines, creating netting for various uses, and forming thread balls. This may also include manufacturing threads of different materials like cotton, silk, wool, or synthetic fibers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cordage or rope made of jute
Description: The business activity involves the production of cordage or rope using jute as the primary material. This typically includes processes such as sourcing and preparing raw jute, spinning and twisting it into yarn or threads, and then further twisting or braiding these into cordage or ropes. The final products may be used in various industries such as construction, shipping, or arts and crafts.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cordage or rope made of coir
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of cordage and rope made from coir, a natural fiber extracted from the husk of coconut. Typical processes include sourcing and processing of raw coir, followed by twisting or braiding the fibers into cordage or rope. This may also encompass the design and production of a variety of coir rope types, sizes, and strengths to meet diverse customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rope and cordage made of synthetic material
Description: Production and supply of synthetic ropes and cordage, involving processes such as extruding synthetic materials, twisting and braiding to form ropes, and finishing for various uses. This activity may also include the customization of these products to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of knotted netting of twine, cordage or rope (other than mosquito net)
Description: The production of knotted netting from twine, cordage, or rope, excluding mosquito nets, is the primary business activity. This process involves the weaving or knotting of these materials to create various types of netting used in industries such as fishing, sports, agriculture, and safety. Services may include custom netting design and production, as well as repair and maintenance of existing netting products.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tapes, newar and wicks
Description: Production of cordage, rope, twine, and netting involves the creation of strong, durable materials used in various industries. This includes the manufacturing of tapes, newar, and wicks, which involves the process of twisting, braiding, and weaving fibers into flat or tubular forms. These products are used in a variety of applications, such as packaging, clothing, or candle production. The business may also provide services such as custom manufacturing to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of cordage, rope, twine and netting
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other cordage or rope n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of cordage or rope not elsewhere classified. This includes processes like spinning, twisting, and braiding of natural or synthetic fibers to create ropes or cordages. The operation may also involve the manufacturing of specialty ropes, cords or twines as per custom requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Embroidery work and making of laces and fringes
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of textiles, with a specific focus on embroidery work and the creation of laces and fringes. Core operations include designing and implementing intricate embroidery patterns on different textile materials, as well as crafting laces and fringes. Services may also encompass custom-made designs for specific client needs, and the supply of these specialized textile products to retailers or directly to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Zari work and other ornamental trimmings
Description: The production of Zari work and other ornamental trimmings involves creating decorative elements often used in clothing, home decor, and other textile products. These businesses engage in processes such as weaving, embroidering, or otherwise crafting intricate designs, typically using metallic threads. Services may include custom design, production, and supply of these trimmings to fashion houses, interior designers, or direct consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of linoleum and similar products
Description: The business activity involves the production of linoleum and similar products, which are commonly used for flooring purposes. Key operations include sourcing of raw materials such as solidified linseed oil, pine rosin, ground cork dust, wood flour, and mineral fillers. These materials are then processed and combined to produce linoleum, which is then cut into sheets or tiles. The business may also provide related services such as customization of designs and patterns on the linoleum products.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gas mantles
Description: The business activity involves the production of gas mantles, a key component used in gas lighting. This typically includes processes such as weaving or knitting of fabric, impregnating the fabric with a solution to make it incandescent, and shaping the fabric into mantles. The final product is used in various lighting applications, particularly in outdoor and camping equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of made-up canvas goods such tents, sails etc.
Description: Production and assembly of canvas goods such as tents, sails, and other related products. This involves processes like cutting and stitching of canvas material, waterproofing, and finishing. Services may also include custom design and manufacture of canvas items to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wadding of textile materials and articles of wadding such as sanitary napkins and tampons
Description: The production of wadding from textile materials and the creation of wadding-based items such as sanitary napkins and tampons. This involves processes such as sourcing and processing textile materials, designing and manufacturing wadding, and converting these into finished products like sanitary napkins and tampons. The operation may also include quality control, packaging, and distribution of these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metallised yarn or gimped yarn, rubber thread or cord covered with textile material, textile yarn or strip impregnated, covered or sheathed with rubber or plastic
Description: The production of specialized textile products such as metallised or gimped yarn, rubber thread or cord covered with textile material, and textile yarn or strip impregnated, covered, or sheathed with rubber or plastic. This involves processes such as impregnation, coating, covering, and sheathing of textile yarn or strips with rubber or plastic, and the manufacture of metallised or gimped yarn. These products are typically used in a variety of industries including fashion, automotive, and home furnishings.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of waterproof textile excluding tarpaulin
Description: The production of waterproof textiles, excluding tarpaulin, involves the design, creation, and distribution of various water-resistant textile products. This could range from outdoor clothing materials to furnishing fabrics. The typical processes include selecting suitable raw materials, treating the textiles to enhance their water resistance, quality testing for durability and water repellency, and then packaging and distributing the final product to retailers or directly to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of textiles
Class Name: Manufacture of other textiles n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other textiles/textile products n.e.c.
Description: Production and processing of various textiles and textile products not elsewhere classified. This involves the creation of unique textiles, including the spinning, weaving, and finishing of diverse fabrics. It may also include the manufacturing of specialty textile products such as flags, banners, and other similar items. Services provided can range from custom textile design to textile product manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of all types of textile garments and clothing accessories
Description: Production of various textile garments and clothing accessories, excluding fur apparel. This involves the design, cutting, sewing, and finishing of a wide range of clothing items such as shirts, trousers, dresses, and coats. The business activity also includes the manufacture of clothing accessories like scarves, ties, gloves, and hats. The operations typically encompass both mass production for retail and custom tailoring services.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rain coats of waterproof textile fabrics or plastic sheetings
Description: The business activity involves the production of rain coats made from waterproof textile fabrics or plastic sheetings. This includes the entire manufacturing process, from sourcing the materials, designing the coats, cutting and sewing the fabric, to the final finishing and packaging of the product. It does not include the manufacture of fur apparel.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hats, caps and other clothing accessories such as gloves,belts, ties, cravats, hairnets etc.
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various clothing accessories such as hats, caps, gloves, belts, ties, cravats, and hairnets. Core operations include the design, cutting, and sewing of these items, often from textiles, leather, or other materials. Services provided may include customization of these accessories to meet specific customer requirements. The process typically involves pattern-making, material selection, cutting, sewing, and quality control checks to ensure the finished product meets specified standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel made of leather and substitutes of leather
Description: Production and supply of clothing items made from leather and its substitutes. This involves sourcing and processing of leather materials, designing and crafting of various apparel such as jackets, pants, gloves, and accessories. It may also include the treatment and dyeing of leather, quality control, packaging and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Custom tailoring
Description: Creating custom-made clothing items, excluding fur products, is the primary business activity in this category. This involves taking individual measurements, designing unique patterns, and sewing garments according to customer preferences. Additional services may include alterations, repairs, and garment fitting consultations. All operations are conducted within the manufacturing sector.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel, except fur apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various types of non-fur clothing items fall under this category. This includes the design, cutting, and sewing of textiles and fabrics to create a wide range of clothing products such as shirts, pants, dresses, and more. The business operations may also cover the manufacture of specialized clothing items not elsewhere classified, like costumes, raincoats, and other weather-specific apparel. The creation of these garments may involve processes like pattern making, stitching, and quality control.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of fur
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel and clothing accessories made of fur
Description: Production and creation of clothing items and accessories using fur materials. This business activity encompasses the entire process from sourcing and treating the fur, to designing and manufacturing items such as coats, hats, gloves, and other accessories. It may also include custom tailoring services, repairs, and alterations of fur garments.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of fur
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fur and skin rugs and other similar articles
Description: Production and creation of fur and skin rugs, as well as other similar articles. This involves sourcing and processing of fur and skins, designing and crafting rugs and various other items, and potentially offering customization services to customers. The process may also include the treatment and preservation of fur and skins to ensure product quality and longevity.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of fur
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other fur products n.e.c.
Description: The production and supply of various fur products not elsewhere classified, encompassing a range of operations such as sourcing, processing, and crafting of fur into a variety of items. This could include the creation of fur clothing, accessories, or decorative items. Services may also include customization of fur products or repair and restoration of fur items.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of knitted or crocheted wearing apparel and other made-up articles directly into shape (pullovers, cardigans, jerseys, waistcoats and similar articles)
Description: The production of knitted or crocheted apparel such as pullovers, cardigans, jerseys, waistcoats, and similar items. This involves the process of knitting or crocheting materials directly into the shape of the final product, without the need for cutting or sewing. The business operations may also include the design and development of new styles, quality control, packaging, and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of wearing apparel
Group Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel
Class Name: Manufacture of knitted and crocheted apparel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other knitted and crocheted apparel including hosiery
Description: Production of various types of knitted and crocheted apparel, such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, or hosiery items. This involves activities from sourcing and preparation of yarn to knitting or crocheting, and then finishing the products. The process may also include designing patterns, dyeing, and packaging for sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Flaying and curing of raw hides and skins
Description: Business activities in this category involve the processing of raw hides and skins, including flaying (removing the skin from an animal) and curing (preserving the skin to prevent decay). This process is typically used in the leather manufacturing industry. The curing process can involve salting, drying, pickling, or smoking the hides and skins. These operations are often part of the larger process of tanning and dressing leather and the dressing and dyeing of fur.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Tanning and finishing of sole leather
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the tanning and finishing of sole leather. This includes processes such as soaking, liming, and bating to transform raw hides into durable leather, specifically for the soles of shoes. Additional services may involve dyeing, coating, or otherwise finishing the leather to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Tanning and finishing of industrial leather
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the tanning and finishing of industrial leather. This includes processes such as soaking, liming, pickling, and dyeing of raw hides to transform them into durable, finished leather. This leather is typically used for manufacturing goods like furniture, automobile interiors, clothing, and accessories. The services provided may also involve quality control, customization of leather finishes, and the development of new tanning techniques or formulations.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Scraping, currying, tanning, bleaching, shearing and plucking and dyeing of fur skins and hides with the hair on
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the processing of fur skins and hides with the hair on. Typical activities include scraping off any remaining flesh and fat, currying to smooth and soften the hide, and tanning to transform the raw hide into usable leather. The fur may also be bleached to lighten its color, sheared to a desired length, plucked for removal of unwanted hair, and dyed for aesthetic purposes. These processes are essential in preparing fur and leather for use in various consumer products such as clothing, accessories, and upholstery.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Finishing of upper leather, lining leather and garment leather etc.
Description: The business activity involves the final processing of upper leather, lining leather, and garment leather. This typically includes processes such as surface treatment, dyeing, and finishing to enhance the quality, appearance, and durability of the leather. It also encompasses the conditioning of leather to make it ready for use in various products like footwear, clothing, and accessories. The operations may also include the dressing and dyeing of fur to prepare it for use in the manufacturing of fur products.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Embroidering and embossing of leather articles
Description: The business activity involves the tanning and dressing of leather, as well as the dressing and dyeing of fur. Key processes include the conversion of raw hides into finished leather through tanning, and preparing and dyeing fur for use in various products. Additionally, this business specializes in the embroidering and embossing of leather articles, adding decorative stitching or raised designs to enhance the aesthetic appeal and value of leather goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; dressing and dyeing of fur
Sub-class Name: Other tanning, curing, finishing, embossing etc. of leather
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve various processes related to the treatment of leather, beyond just tanning and dressing. These may include curing, which is the process of preserving the leather to prevent decay; finishing, which involves various techniques to improve the durability, appearance, and feel of the leather; and embossing, which is the process of creating raised or sunken designs or patterns on the leather surface. The operations may also include other similar or related processes not specifically mentioned.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Manufacture of luggage, handbags and the like, saddlery and harness
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of travel goods like suitcase, bags, hold alls etc.
Description: Production and assembly of travel goods such as suitcases, bags, and hold alls. This involves sourcing raw materials, designing and cutting patterns, sewing or otherwise assembling the pieces, and adding necessary hardware or accessories. The process may also include quality checks and packaging for retail or direct customer sales.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Manufacture of luggage, handbags and the like, saddlery and harness
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of purse, ladies' handbags, artistic leather presented articles and novelties
Description: The production of purses, ladies' handbags, and various artistic leather articles and novelties is the primary focus. The business operations typically involve the sourcing and processing of leather, design and manufacturing of the products, and their subsequent distribution and sale. The products range from everyday items like purses and handbags to more specialized artistic leather pieces and novelty items.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Manufacture of luggage, handbags and the like, saddlery and harness
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of saddlery and harness
Description: Production of saddlery and harness involves the creation of equipment used for riding, driving, and controlling horses. This includes the design, cutting, sewing, and assembly of various leather or synthetic materials to produce items such as saddles, bridles, halters, reins, and other horse tack. The business may also offer repair services for these items and custom-made products tailored to specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Group Name: Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery and harness; dressing and dyeing of fur
Class Name: Manufacture of luggage, handbags and the like, saddlery and harness
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other consumer goods of leather and substitutes of leather n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various consumer goods made from leather and its substitutes that are not elsewhere classified (n.e.c). This includes the manufacturing process from raw materials to finished products. Typical operations may encompass the design, cutting, shaping, and stitching of leather or synthetic materials to create a wide array of consumer goods such as wallets, belts, keychains, and other leather accessories. Services provided may also include customization of products and repair of leather goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Class Name: Manufacture of footwear
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of leather footwear such as shoes, sandals, chappals, leather-cum-rubber/plastic cloth sandles and chappals
Description: The business activity involves the production of leather footwear such as shoes, sandals, and chappals. It includes the design, cutting, stitching, and finishing of leather materials to create various types of footwear. The process may also incorporate other materials like rubber or plastic in the production of combined leather footwear. Services provided may include customization of designs, repair or refurbishment of leather footwear, and manufacturing footwear to meet specific industrial safety standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Class Name: Manufacture of footwear
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of footwear made primarily of vulcanized or moulded rubber and plastic.
Description: Production and assembly of footwear primarily made from vulcanized or moulded rubber and plastic materials. This involves processes such as designing, cutting, and shaping of rubber and plastic materials, vulcanization or moulding techniques to form the footwear, and final assembly. The business may also provide related services such as customization and repair of such footwear.

Division Name: Manufacture of leather and related products
Class Name: Manufacture of footwear
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other footwear n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various types of footwear not elsewhere classified, such as boots, shoes, sandals, and slippers. This involves sourcing and preparing materials, designing and cutting patterns, stitching or gluing parts together, and adding final touches like laces or buckles. It may also include custom footwear manufacturing and repair services.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Sawmilling and planing of wood
Sub-class Name: Sawing and planing of wood
Description: Processing raw timber into cut and planed lumber. This involves operations such as cutting logs into boards, beams, and other wood products, as well as planing wood to achieve a smooth, uniform surface. Services may also include drying lumber and treating it with preservatives.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Sawmilling and planing of wood
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of unassembled wooden flooring including parquet flooring
Description: Business operations involve the production of unassembled wooden flooring, including parquet flooring. This typically includes sawmilling and planing of wood to create flooring materials, followed by further processes such as sanding, finishing, and packaging. The flooring products are then sold unassembled, ready for installation at the customer's location.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Sawmilling and planing of wood
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wooden railway sleepers
Description: The business activity involves the sawmilling and planing of wood specifically for the production of wooden railway sleepers. This includes the processes of cutting, shaping, and finishing wood to create durable sleepers used in railway track construction. Services provided may also encompass the treatment of these wooden sleepers to enhance their resistance to weather conditions and pests.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Sawmilling and planing of wood
Sub-class Name: Activities related to saw milling and planing of wood n.e.c.
Description: The sawmilling and planing of wood involves the processing of logs into lumber and timber products. This includes operations such as cutting, shaping, and finishing wood to create products like planks, boards, beams, and moldings. The activities related to sawmilling and planing of wood n.e.c. (not elsewhere classified) could encompass additional services such as treating the wood to prevent decay, custom cutting and planing to meet specific customer requirements, and the production of wood chips and sawdust.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ply wood and veneer sheets
Description: Production of plywood and veneer sheets, involving processes such as peeling, slicing, or sawing of wood logs, pressing the sheets together with adhesive to form plywood, and finishing the products for use in construction, furniture, and other industries. This business may also provide cutting and shaping services to create customized wood-based panels.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of particle board and fibreboard including densified wood
Description: The business activity involves the production of veneer sheets, wood-based panels, particle board, and fibreboard, including densified wood. Core operations include sourcing raw materials, processing wood into various forms, and manufacturing these products. Typical processes may involve slicing large blocks of wood into thin sheets for veneer production, compressing wood chips or shavings under high pressure to create particle board and fibreboard, and densifying wood to make it stronger and more durable. Services may also include customization of these products based on customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of flush doors and other boards or panels
Description: The business activity involves the production of veneer sheets and wood-based panels, including the manufacturing of flush doors and other types of boards or panels. Core operations include sourcing and processing raw wood materials, creating veneer sheets and panels through various techniques such as slicing, peeling, or cutting. The business also specializes in the manufacture of flush doors, which involves the assembly of door frames, filling them with a core material, and attaching veneer sheets on both sides. Other types of boards or panels are also produced, potentially using different manufacturing techniques depending on the product specifications. Services may include custom manufacturing for specific client requirements and the sale of these products to construction companies, furniture manufacturers, and other relevant industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other plywood products n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various plywood products not elsewhere classified, such as laminated wood, blockboard, and other composite wood panels. Core operations typically include sourcing and processing raw wood materials, applying heat and pressure to bond layers of wood veneer into plywood, and finishing and quality control processes. Services may also encompass custom plywood product design and manufacturing to meet specific client requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of builders' carpentry and joinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of structural wooden goods [intended to be used primarily in the construction industry such as beams, rafters, roof struts, glue-laminated and metal connected, prefabricated wooden roof tr
Description: Production of structural wooden goods primarily for the construction industry, such as beams, rafters, roof struts, and prefabricated wooden roof trusses. This involves processes like glue-laminating and metal connecting to ensure the strength and durability of the products. The operations typically include sourcing raw materials, processing the wood, assembling the structural elements, and delivering the finished products to construction sites.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of builders' carpentry and joinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of prefabricated buildings, or elements thereof, predominantly of wood
Description: Producing prefabricated buildings or their components primarily made of wood, such as modular homes, sheds, or garages. This involves the assembly of pre-made parts, including walls, floors, and roofs, in a factory setting before they are shipped to the construction site for final assembly. Services may also include customization of these elements according to customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of builders' carpentry and joinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of builders' carpentry and joinery
Description: Production of builders' carpentry and joinery items, including the creation of doors, windows, stairs, and other wooden structures used in construction. This involves processes such as cutting, shaping, and assembling wooden parts, and may also include the installation of these items in buildings. Services may extend to the customization of these products as per specific architectural designs or customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of wooden containers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wooden boxes, barrels, vats, tubs, packing cases etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of wooden containers such as boxes, barrels, vats, tubs, and packing cases. Core operations include sourcing and processing of wood, designing and manufacturing containers of different shapes and sizes, and quality control to ensure durability and functionality. Services may also include customization of containers based on client requirements, treatment of wood to enhance longevity, and packaging for transportation.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of wooden containers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of plywood chests
Description: The business activity involves the production of wooden containers, specifically focusing on the manufacture of plywood chests. The core operations include sourcing and processing of wood, primarily plywood, designing and crafting it into chests. This might involve processes such as cutting, shaping, assembling, and finishing the product. The end products could be used in a variety of sectors, including storage, transportation, and furniture.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of wooden containers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of market basketry, grain storage bins and similar products made of bamboo or reed
Description: Business activities in this category involve the production of wooden containers and similar products made from bamboo or reed. This includes the crafting of market baskets, grain storage bins, and other related items. Typical processes involved may include sourcing the raw materials, designing the containers, and manufacturing the final product. Services provided may also include customization of products to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of wooden containers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other wooden containers and products entirely or mainly of cane, rattan,bamboo, willow, fibre, leaves and grass n.e.c.
Description: Business activities involve the production of wooden containers and other products made primarily from natural materials such as cane, rattan, bamboo, willow, fibre, leaves, and grass. This includes sourcing and preparing the raw materials, designing and creating the containers or products, and finishing and packaging for sale. The business may also provide custom design services and produce a variety of products not elsewhere classified, based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wooden industrial goods
Description: Production and processing of various wooden industrial goods, such as pallets, crates, barrels, and other wooden containers. This involves tasks like cutting, shaping, and finishing wood to create the desired products. Additionally, this class also includes the manufacture of articles from cork, straw, and plaiting materials. This could involve crafting items such as baskets, mats, or other woven goods from these materials.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cork and cork products
Description: The business activity involves the production of cork and cork-based products. This includes sourcing and processing raw cork, shaping and refining it into various products like cork flooring, wine stoppers, bulletin boards, and other cork-based items. Services may also include custom design and manufacturing of cork products based on client specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wooden agricultural implements
Description: Production and assembly of wooden agricultural tools such as plows, harrows, and shovels. This involves sourcing and processing wood, designing and crafting the implements, and potentially distributing them to agricultural businesses or retail outlets.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of various articles made of bamboo, cane and grass
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the production of various items made from bamboo, cane, and grass. The manufacturing process typically involves sourcing raw materials, crafting these into different products, and then distributing them for sale. Products may include furniture, decorative items, utensils, baskets, and other similar goods. Services may also include custom design and production of bamboo, cane, and grass articles to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of broomsticks
Description: Production and supply of broomsticks, involving sourcing and processing of wood and other materials like straw and cork. The business operations typically include cutting and shaping wood into handles, attaching bristles or other sweeping materials, and finishing the product for commercial sale. This can also involve designing and manufacturing custom broomsticks.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of articles made of palm leaf, dhak leaf, screw-pine leaf and khajoor leaf;articles of vegetables fibre etc,.
Description: The business activity involves the production of items using natural materials like palm leaf, dhak leaf, screw-pine leaf, and khajoor leaf, along with other vegetable fibres. The core operations include sourcing these raw materials, processing them into a usable form, and crafting them into finished products. These products may range from decorative items to practical goods for household or commercial use. The manufacturing process may involve traditional crafting techniques or modern machinery, depending on the nature of the product. Services provided may also include customization of products based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of products of pith and shalapith
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the manufacturing of products from pith and shalapith, which are types of plant-based materials. Typical operations include sourcing raw materials, processing them into usable forms, and crafting various products. These can range from decorative items to functional goods. The production process may involve traditional handcrafting techniques or modern machinery, depending on the specific product being made. Services may also include custom design and production based on customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials
