Group Name: Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials
Class Name: Manufacture of other products of wood; manufacture of articles of cork, straw and plaiting materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other wood products n.e.c.
Description: Business operations in this category involve the manufacturing of various wood products not elsewhere classified, such as wooden tools, handles, brooms, frames, and ornaments. This also includes the creation of items from cork, straw, and plaiting materials. Typical processes may involve cutting, shaping, assembling, and finishing wood, as well as weaving or braiding straw and other plaiting materials to produce a range of goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pulp
Description: Production of pulp from wood and other materials, involving processes such as wood chipping, chemical treatment, and mechanical or heat-based pulping. This business activity also includes the recovery and reuse of chemicals used in the pulping process.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of news print
Description: Production of newsprint, a type of paper primarily used for printing newspapers. This involves the process of converting wood pulp into paper, including activities such as pulping wood chips, bleaching the pulp, and then spreading it into large thin sheets to create newsprint. The business may also provide related services such as recycling old newspapers into fresh newsprint.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paper and paper rolls not further processed
Description: The production of raw paper and paper rolls that are not subject to further processing forms the core of this business activity. This involves processes such as pulping wood chips, bleaching pulp, and then forming it into large sheets or rolls of paper. These products may then be sold as is to other businesses for further processing and use in a range of paper goods, from office supplies to packaging materials.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of packing paper
Description: Production of packing paper, a type of paper specifically designed for wrapping and protecting goods for shipment or storage. This involves the processes of converting raw materials such as wood pulp into paper, then further processing to create a durable and flexible material suitable for packaging applications. Services may also include customizing packing paper to meet specific customer requirements in terms of size, thickness, and other physical properties.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other special purpose paper (excluding computer stationary)
Description: The business activity involves the production of specialized paper products, excluding computer stationery. This typically includes the manufacturing of a wide range of unique paper items such as filter paper, absorbent paper, tracing paper, and other specially treated paper. The core operations involve sourcing raw materials, processing them into pulp, and then transforming this pulp into various types of special purpose paper. Additional processes may include treating the paper to give it specific properties, cutting it into desired shapes and sizes, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paper board, straw board
Description: Production of paper board and straw board, involving processes such as pulping raw materials, refining pulp into paper, and further converting paper into paperboard or straw board. This business activity may also encompass the treatment of waste and by-products from these manufacturing processes.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hard board including false board and chip board
Description: Production and processing of hard board materials, including false board and chip board, typically used in construction and furniture industries. This involves processes such as wood chipping, pulping, pressing, and drying to create the final product. The business may also provide related services such as customization of board sizes and finishes.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other primary paper materials including composite paper and paper board n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the production of various primary paper materials, beyond just pulp, paper, and paperboard. This includes the manufacture of composite paper and paperboard not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.). The process typically involves combining different types of paper materials to create a composite product, which can offer enhanced durability, flexibility, or other desirable properties. This could also involve the production of specialized paper products for various industrial applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard
Description: Production of corrugated paper and paperboard, which involves processing raw materials into finished products. This includes activities such as pulping wood chips, bleaching the pulp, pressing it into sheets, and corrugating these sheets to add rigidity. The final products are typically used for packaging and shipping goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper board containers
Description: Production of corrugated paper board containers involves the manufacturing and shaping of corrugated paper and paperboard into various types of containers. This process typically includes designing, cutting, folding, and gluing corrugated paper and paperboard to create boxes, cartons, cases, and other types of packaging materials. The end products are typically used for packaging and shipping goods across various industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of card board boxes
Description: The production of corrugated paper and paperboard involves processing raw materials into a wavy, grooved form that provides enhanced strength and durability. This business activity also extends to the manufacture of containers made from these materials, such as boxes, cartons, and packaging materials. The sub-class of manufacturing cardboard boxes includes the design and production processes of creating boxes of various sizes and shapes for different uses, such as packaging, shipping, and storage. This may involve cutting and shaping the cardboard, assembling the boxes, and possibly customizing them as per client requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sacks and bags of paper
Description: The business activity involves the production of corrugated paper and paperboard, as well as containers made from these materials. This specifically includes the manufacture of paper sacks and bags. Typical processes might include sourcing raw materials, processing these into corrugated paper and paperboard, and then shaping and finishing these materials into sacks, bags, and other types of containers. Services could also encompass custom design and production of specific types of paper containers according to customer needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other containers of paper and paperboard n.e.c.
Description: The production of various types of paper and paperboard containers not otherwise classified falls under this business activity. This involves processes such as sourcing raw materials, manufacturing corrugated paper and paperboard, and transforming these materials into different containers. The containers can be used for a wide range of purposes, such as packaging for food, beverages, and other goods. Services may also include custom design and production of paperboard containers to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of computer paper
Description: Production and manufacturing of computer paper, which involves processes such as sourcing raw materials, pulp processing, papermaking, and finishing. This can also include the creation of specialized computer paper types, such as continuous form paper or thermal paper, and may involve additional steps like coating or perforating the paper.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paper cups, saucers, plates, hoops, cones and other similar products
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various articles from paper and paperboard such as cups, saucers, plates, hoops, cones, and other similar products. Core operations include sourcing raw materials, designing and cutting paper and paperboard into various shapes, assembling and finishing the products. Services may also include customization of designs and packaging for clients.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of printing, writing and photocopying paper ready for use
Description: The business activity involves the production of various articles of paper and paperboard, with a specific focus on the manufacture of printing, writing, and photocopying paper ready for use. Core operations involve sourcing raw materials, processing these materials into paper or paperboard, and then further refining them into specific products such as printing paper, writing paper, and photocopying paper. This may include processes such as pulping, bleaching, and coating. The end products are then packaged and prepared for distribution to various commercial and retail clients.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paper pulp articles other than containers (such as egg trays)
Description: The production of various paper pulp articles excluding containers, like egg trays, is the main activity. This involves processes such as sourcing raw materials, pulping the paper, molding it into the desired shape, and drying the final product. The business may also provide services like designing custom paper pulp articles and delivering the finished goods to the client.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of file cover/file boards, and similar articles
Description: The production process in this business activity involves creating various items from paper and paperboard, such as file covers and file boards. The typical operations may include sourcing and preparation of raw materials, designing, cutting, and shaping the paper or paperboard into the desired product. It also encompasses finishing processes like coating or laminating for durability and aesthetics. The end products are then packaged and prepared for distribution to various customers such as offices, schools, or stationery stores.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wall paper
Description: Production and supply of wallpaper, involving processes such as design, printing, and finishing of paper and paperboard specifically for wall coverings. This may also include the creation of custom or bespoke wallpapers according to client specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of carbon paper & stationary items
Description: Production of various articles made from paper and paperboard, such as carbon paper and stationary items. This involves processes like creating, shaping, and finishing these products. The business may also provide services such as customizing stationery items to meet specific client needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Group Name: Manufacture of paper and paper products
Class Name: Manufacture of other articles of paper and paperboard
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other paper products n.e.c.
Description: Production of various paper and paperboard articles not classified elsewhere, including the creation of specialty paper items. This may involve processes such as papermaking, cutting, folding, and finishing. Services may also include the customization of paper products to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Printing of newspapers
Description: Production and distribution of printed newspapers, involving activities such as typesetting, printing, and binding. This may also encompass printing of specialized newspapers, including advertising or informative newspapers.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Printing of magazines and other periodicals, books and brochures, maps, atlases, posters etc.
Description: The business activity involves the printing of various types of publications such as magazines, periodicals, books, and brochures. It also includes the printing of maps, atlases, and posters. The core operations typically involve the process of transferring images or text onto paper or other materials, using various printing methods. Services may also include graphic design, layout, and binding services to create a finished product.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Printing of postage stamps, taxation stamps, cheques and other security papers
Description: The business activity involves the production of secure printed materials such as postage stamps, taxation stamps, cheques, and other security papers. Key operations include designing, engraving, and printing these items using specialized processes to ensure their authenticity and prevent forgery. Services may also encompass custom printing orders for government entities or financial institutions.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Printing of bank notes, currency notes
Description: The business activity involves the production of bank notes and currency notes. This includes the design, printing, and quality control of physical money. The process typically involves engraving plates with the design, printing on special paper or polymer substrates, applying security features, and rigorous inspection to ensure authenticity and compliance with national standards.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Printing directly onto textiles, flexographic plastic, glass, metal, wood and ceramics
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve direct printing onto various materials such as textiles, flexographic plastic, glass, metal, wood, and ceramics. The core operations include the design and production of prints on these different surfaces. This may involve processes like digital printing, screen printing, flexographic printing, or other printing techniques suitable for each specific material. Services provided might range from custom print design to mass production of printed items.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Printing
Sub-class Name: Other printing activities like screen printing other than textile n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in various types of non-textile printing activities such as screen printing. This can involve creating designs, transferring them to screens, and applying ink through these screens onto different materials. It may also include related services such as design consultation, pre-press services, and finishing processes like cutting, folding, or binding.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Service activities related to printing
Sub-class Name: Book and other similar sheet binding on account of others
Description: Book and other similar sheet binding on account of others involves the provision of binding services for various types of printed materials. This includes tasks such as compiling pages, applying adhesive to bind pages together, and attaching covers. The service is typically provided to publishers, authors, businesses, and individuals who require professional binding for their printed works such as books, reports, manuals, and brochures.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Service activities related to printing
Sub-class Name: Engraving, etching and block making etc.
Description: Businesses in this sub-class conduct service activities related to printing, with a focus on engraving, etching, and block making. These operations typically involve creating designs on hard surfaces by cutting into the material's surface. The process may include traditional manual engraving, laser engraving, or photogravure, which uses photography and chemical etching. Block making refers to the creation of printing blocks, which are used to print images or text. Services may also include the production of plates and dies, embossing, and other related activities.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Group Name: Printing and service activities related to printing
Class Name: Service activities related to printing
Sub-class Name: Other service activities related to printing n.e.c.
Description: Providing a range of specialized services related to the printing industry, not elsewhere classified. These activities may involve print consultation, graphic design, prepress services, binding, and finishing. Typical processes include assisting clients in preparing for print production, creating print-ready files, and executing post-printing tasks like cutting, folding, and assembling printed materials.

Division Name: Printing and reproduction of recorded media
Class Name: Reproduction of recorded media
Sub-class Name: Reproduction of recorded media
Description: The business activity involves the reproduction of recorded media, which includes the duplication of audio, video, software, and data from original copies onto various formats such as CDs, DVDs, Blu-rays, or digital files. Typical processes involved may include digital remastering, format conversion, and mass copying. Services may also encompass packaging and distribution of the reproduced media.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of coke oven products
Sub-class Name: Production of coke and semi-coke products
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of coke oven products, primarily focusing on the production of coke and semi-coke. Core operations include the conversion of coal into coke by heating it in the absence of air, a process known as carbonization. This typically involves the use of coke ovens and related equipment. The resulting products, coke and semi-coke, are used in various industrial applications such as in the production of steel and as fuel in various industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of coke oven products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other coke oven products such as gas, crude coal and lignite tars etc.
Description: The production of various coke oven products such as gas, crude coal, and lignite tars is the main activity. This involves the operation of coke ovens, processing of raw materials, and the manufacturing of by-products. Services may include the extraction of gas from coke ovens, refining of crude coal, and production of lignite tars.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of refined petroleum products
Sub-class Name: Production of liquid and gaseous fuels, illuminating oils, lubricating oils or greases or other products from crude petroleum or bituminous minerals
Description: Processing crude petroleum or bituminous minerals to produce a range of products such as liquid and gaseous fuels, illuminating oils, lubricating oils or greases. This involves various stages of refining and treatment to transform raw materials into usable products. The core operations include extraction, distillation, cracking, reforming, and treatment to ensure the final products meet specific standards and requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of refined petroleum products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paraffin wax
Description: Production and processing of paraffin wax, typically derived from refined petroleum products. This involves the purification, solidification, and packaging of paraffin wax for use in various industries such as candle making, packaging, cosmetics, and crayon production.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of refined petroleum products
Sub-class Name: Bottling of LPG/CNG
Description: The business activity involves the production of refined petroleum products, specifically the bottling of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) and Compressed Natural Gas (CNG). Core operations include the processing and refining of petroleum to produce LPG and CNG, the safe storage of these gases, and their bottling in appropriate containers for distribution and sale. Services may also involve the delivery of bottled LPG and CNG to commercial and residential customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of refined petroleum products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hard-coal and lignite fuel briquettes
Description: The production of hard-coal and lignite fuel briquettes involves processing and refining these raw materials into compact, energy-dense forms. Typical operations may include the mining of hard coal and lignite, followed by their compression into briquettes, which are then marketed as fuel sources. This process may also involve the removal of impurities, testing for quality and compliance, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Class Name: Manufacture of refined petroleum products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other petroleum n.e.c. (includes manufacture of petroleum jelly, micro-crystalline petroleum wax, slack wax, ozokerite, lignite wax, petroleum coke, petroleum bitumen and other residues
Description: The business activity involves the production of various petroleum-based products not categorized elsewhere. This includes the manufacture of petroleum jelly, a versatile product used in a variety of industries from cosmetics to pharmaceuticals. It also involves the creation of micro-crystalline petroleum wax and slack wax, commonly used in packaging, candles, and other wax-based products. The production of ozokerite, lignite wax, petroleum coke, and petroleum bitumen is also part of this business operation. These products are typically used in industries such as energy production, road construction, and metallurgy. Additionally, the manufacture of other petroleum residues is included, which might be used in a variety of industrial applications. The manufacturing processes typically involve refining crude oil and its by-products into these specific, marketable items.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of liquefied or compressed inorganic industrial or medical gases (elemental gases,liquid or compressed air, refrigerant gases, mixed industrial gases etc.)
Description: The production and processing of inorganic industrial or medical gases in liquefied or compressed forms, such as elemental gases, liquid or compressed air, and refrigerant gases. This also includes the manufacture of mixed industrial gases. The core operations involve the purification, compression, and liquefaction of these gases for use in various industrial or medical applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of inorganic acids except nitric acid
Description: Production and supply of basic inorganic acids, excluding nitric acid, fall under this business activity. Typical operations involve chemical synthesis or extraction processes to produce acids such as sulfuric, hydrochloric, or phosphoric acid. These acids are often used in various industries, including pharmaceuticals, agriculture, and manufacturing. Services may also include packaging and delivery of these acids to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tanning or dying extracts; tannings and their derivatives and colouring matter (including manufacture of indigo)
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the production of tanning or dying extracts, tannins and their derivatives, and colouring matter, including the manufacture of indigo. The operations typically encompass the chemical processing and refinement of raw materials into these specific products. This may include the extraction and concentration of tanning agents from plant materials, the synthesis of dye substances, and the manufacture of indigo used in textile industry.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of dyes and pigments from any source in basic form or as concentrate
Description: Production of dyes and pigments in their basic form or as concentrates, derived from any source. This business activity involves the chemical processing of raw materials to create colorants used in a variety of industries, such as textiles, paints, and printing. Processes typically include the synthesis of organic or inorganic compounds, formulation of concentrates, and quality control testing.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of turpentine and resins of vegetable origin
Description: Production and processing of turpentine and vegetable-based resins, typically involving extraction, distillation, and refining processes. This business activity may also include the packaging and distribution of these products for use in various industries such as pharmaceuticals, paints, and adhesives.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of basic chemical elements
Description: Production of basic chemical elements, involving processes such as chemical reactions, purifications, and distillations. This includes manufacturing of elements like hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen, as well as the production of inorganic acids such as sulfuric, nitric, and phosphoric acid. Services may also include quality control testing, packing, and distribution of these basic chemical elements.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of distilled water
Description: Production and supply of distilled water, a process which involves the purification of water through distillation to remove impurities and contaminants. This typically includes the boiling of water to create steam, condensing the steam back into liquid form, and collecting the resultant purified water. This business activity may also involve packaging and distribution of the distilled water for various uses such as laboratory testing, automotive cooling systems, and medical applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic aromatic products
Description: Production of synthetic aromatic products, which involves chemical processes to create substances such as perfumes, flavorings, and essential oils. This manufacturing practice typically includes the selection and synthesis of raw materials, chemical reactions to produce aromatic compounds, and quality control measures to ensure the final product meets necessary standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of organic and inorganic chemical compounds n.e.c.
Description: Production of organic and inorganic chemical compounds not elsewhere classified, involving processes such as combining, compounding, and conversion of raw materials through chemical reactions. This includes the manufacture of a broad range of chemical substances for use in various industries like pharmaceuticals, agriculture, cosmetics, and more. Services may also include custom synthesis of specific chemical compounds based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of urea and other organic fertilizers
Description: Production of urea and other organic fertilizers, involving processes such as synthesis of raw materials, chemical reactions to produce the fertilizers, and packaging for distribution. This may also include research and development for new fertilizer formulations, testing for quality assurance, and providing related consultation services.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of straight mixed, compound or complex inorganic fertilizers
Description: The business activity involves the production of straight mixed, compound, or complex inorganic fertilizers. This typically includes processes such as combining different inorganic elements to create a range of fertilizers suitable for various soil types and plant needs. It may also involve the manufacture of nitrogen compounds and other essential nutrients to promote plant growth. Services may include customizing fertilizer mixes to meet specific agricultural requirements, and packaging and distributing the finished products to retailers or directly to farmers.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of associated nitrogen products (nitric and sulphonitric acids, ammonia, ammonium chloride, ammonium carbonate, nitrites and nitrates of potassium)
Description: The business activity involves the production of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, specifically associated nitrogen products. This includes the manufacturing processes for nitric and sulphonitric acids, ammonia, ammonium chloride, ammonium carbonate, as well as nitrites and nitrates of potassium. Typical operations may involve chemical synthesis, quality control, packaging, and distribution of these nitrogen-based products, which are commonly used in agriculture and other industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other fertilizers n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various types of fertilizers not otherwise classified, including the creation of nitrogen compounds. This typically involves chemical processes to produce the fertilizers, quality control measures to ensure product safety and effectiveness, and distribution services to deliver the products to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of plastic in primary forms (includes amino-resins, polyurethanes etc.)
Description: Production of plastics in their primary forms, which includes the manufacturing of various types of plastics such as amino-resins, polyurethanes, and others. The core operations involve chemical processing and synthesis to create these materials. These plastics are typically produced in forms such as pellets, liquid resins, or sheets, which are then used by other industries for further manufacturing and production processes.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic rubber in primary forms
Description: Production of synthetic rubber in its primary forms, encompassing processes such as polymerization, coagulation, and drying. This includes the creation of various types of synthetic rubber like styrene-butadiene, nitrile, and neoprene. The business operations may involve the provision of raw synthetic rubber materials to industries for further processing or manufacturing of products.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Group Name: Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mixture of synthetic and natural or rubber like gums
Description: Production of plastics and synthetic rubber in their primary forms, including the creation of mixtures using synthetic and natural or rubber-like gums. This process typically involves the chemical synthesis of raw materials to produce plastic and rubber materials, which can be further processed into final products. The business activity also includes the manufacture and sale of various synthetic and natural gum mixtures.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of insecticides, rodenticides, fungicides, herbicides
Description: Production and processing of pesticides and other agrochemical products such as insecticides, rodenticides, fungicides, and herbicides. This involves activities such as chemical formulation, mixing, compounding, and packaging of these substances that are used for controlling pests, fungi, and unwanted plants in agriculture and other sectors.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of disinfectants (for agricultural and other use)
Description: Production of disinfectants for agricultural and other uses, involving processes such as chemical formulation, mixing, and packaging. This includes the creation of substances used to kill microorganisms or inhibit their growth, specifically designed for agricultural applications such as crop protection, but also suitable for other uses. Services may also involve research and development of new disinfectant products.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other agrochemical products n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various agrochemical products not elsewhere classified, such as fertilizers, plant growth regulators, soil amendments, or other chemical agents used in agriculture. Typical processes include the formulation, compounding, and packaging of these chemical products. Services may also encompass research and development of new agrochemical solutions, quality testing, and regulatory compliance for safe and effective use in farming and other agricultural applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of paints and varnishes, enamels or lacquers
Description: Production of paints, varnishes, enamels, and lacquers, encompassing a range of processes such as formulation, blending, and compounding. This involves the preparation of a variety of coatings used for decorative, protective, and industrial purposes. Services may also include the customization of these products to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of prepared pigments, prepared opacifiers and prepared colours, vitrifiable enamels and glazes engobes and similar preparations of a kind used in the ceramic, enamelling or glass industry
Description: The business activity involves the production of prepared pigments, opacifiers, and colours. It also includes the manufacture of vitrifiable enamels and glazes, engobes, and other similar preparations used predominantly in the ceramic, enamelling, or glass industry. Typical processes in this operation might encompass the formulation of pigments and colours, the creation of enamel and glaze mixtures, and the preparation of materials used to enhance or alter the properties of ceramics and glass products.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of printing ink
Description: Production and supply of printing ink, which involves the process of creating ink for various printing applications. This includes formulating and blending pigments, solvents, resins, and other materials to produce different types of printing ink such as offset, flexographic, gravure, and digital printing inks.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of prepared pigments and other colouring matter of a kind used in the manufacture of paints or by artists or other painters
Description: The production of prepared pigments and other coloring matter used in the creation of paints or by artists and other painters. This involves processes such as sourcing raw materials, processing these materials into pigments, and packaging and distributing the final product. It includes the creation of a variety of colors and shades for use in different types of paints, from house paint to artist's paint.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mastics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of caulking compounds and similar non-refractory filling or surfacing preparations,mastics, prepared paint or varnish removers, organic composite solvents and thinners and other related pr
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of caulking compounds and similar non-refractory filling or surfacing preparations. It includes the production of mastics, prepared paint or varnish removers, and organic composite solvents and thinners. The core operations can involve chemical processing, mixing, and packaging of these products. The business may also provide related services such as product development and supply of these materials to various industries like construction, painting, and automotive.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of soap all forms
Description: The business activity involves the production of soap in various forms such as bars, liquid, powder, and gel. This includes processes like the selection and preparation of raw materials, mixing of ingredients, molding, cutting, stamping, packaging, and distribution. The business may also provide customized soap formulations based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cleaning and polishing products (preparations for perfuming or deodorizing rooms; artificial waxes and prepared waxes; polishes and creams for leather, wood, glass, metal etc.; scouring
Description: The business activity involves the production of cleaning and polishing products. This includes creating preparations for perfuming or deodorizing rooms, manufacturing artificial and prepared waxes, and developing polishes and creams for various materials such as leather, wood, glass, and metal. It also encompasses the production of scouring products. Typical processes in this business may include sourcing raw materials, product formulation, manufacturing, packaging, and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of detergent and similar washing agents excluding soap
Description: Production of detergents and similar washing agents, excluding soap, is the main business activity. This involves processes such as formulation, blending, compounding, and packaging of various cleaning agents. The products manufactured can range from laundry detergents, dishwashing liquids, fabric softeners, to other specialized cleaning solutions. The operations do not include the manufacture of soap.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of perfumes and cologne de-eau
Description: Production of perfumes and cologne de-eau, encompassing the creation of unique scent compositions, blending of essential oils and aroma compounds, and packaging of the final product. This business activity may also involve quality control testing, marketing, and distribution of the manufactured perfumes and cologne de-eau.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of preparations for oral or dental hygiene (includes manufacture of toothpastes, toothpowder, mouthwash, oral, perfumes, dental fixative pastes and powders etc.)
Description: Production and supply of oral and dental hygiene products, such as toothpastes, toothpowder, mouthwash, and dental fixative pastes and powders. This involves the process of creating, testing, packaging, and distributing these products to consumers, retailers, or other businesses. It may also include the development of new products or formulations for oral care.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hair oil, shampoo, hair dye etc. (includes manufacture of shampoos, hair sprays, hair fixers, hair oils, hair creams, hair dyes and bleaches and preparations for permanent waving or str
Description: The production of hair care products such as hair oil, shampoo, hair dye, and other related items. This involves the formulation, mixing, and packaging of various hair care goods like shampoos, hair sprays, hair fixers, hair oils, hair creams, hair dyes and bleaches, as well as products for permanent waving or straightening. The process may also include the development and testing of new hair care formulas.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cosmetics and toileteries (includes manufacture of pre-shave, shaving or after shave preparations; personal deodorants and anti-respirants; perfumed bath bath salts and other bath prepa
Description: The production of cosmetics and toiletries involves creating a variety of personal care products. This includes the manufacturing of pre-shave, shaving, or after-shave preparations, personal deodorants and anti-respirants, as well as perfumed bath salts and other bath preparations. The process typically involves sourcing and combining raw materials, formulating and testing products, and packaging the finished goods.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ""agarbatti"" and other preparations which operate by burning
Description: Production and manufacturing of "agarbatti" or incense sticks, along with other products that function through burning. This involves the process of blending raw materials, molding them into the desired shape, drying, and packaging. In addition, this business activity could also include the manufacturing of items such as scented candles, mosquito coils, and other similar products that release their properties when burned.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, perfumes and toilet preparations
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other perfumes and toilet preparations n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various perfumes and toilet preparations that are not elsewhere classified. This includes the creation of unique fragrances, the formulation of toiletry items such as bath salts, bath oils, and other related products. The core operations include sourcing raw ingredients, formulating and testing product recipes, manufacturing the final product, and packaging for distribution. Services may also include custom fragrance development and private label production.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of matches
Description: The manufacturing of matches involves the production of safety and strike-anywhere matches. This includes the processes of cutting and shaping the matchsticks, applying the chemical ignition coating, and packaging the finished products. The business may also provide related services such as custom branding or packaging design for the matches.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of explosives, ammunition and fire works
Description: Production and supply of explosives, ammunition, and fireworks, involving processes such as formulation, mixing, assembling, and packaging. This also includes the creation of products for both commercial and recreational use, such as dynamite for construction and demolition, ammunition for military and security purposes, and fireworks for entertainment.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of essential oils; modification by chemical processes of oils and fats (e.g. by oxidation, polymerization etc.)
Description: The production of essential oils through various extraction methods such as distillation, cold pressing, or solvent extraction. This also involves the modification of oils and fats through chemical processes like oxidation and polymerization. These processes can be used to alter the physical and chemical properties of the oils and fats for use in a variety of industries, including cosmetics, food and beverage, and pharmaceuticals.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of photographic plates, films, sensitized paper and other sensitized unexposed materials, chemical preparations for photographic uses
Description: The business activity involves the production of photographic materials such as plates, films, and sensitized paper, as well as other sensitized unexposed materials. It also includes the manufacture of chemical preparations used in photography. Typical operations may involve chemical processing, coating materials with light-sensitive substances, and producing specialized chemical solutions for photographic development and printing.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gelatin and its derivatives, resinoids, glues, prepared adhesives, including rubber-based glues and adhesives
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing and processing of various chemical products, specifically focusing on gelatin and its derivatives, resinoids, glues, and prepared adhesives, including those that are rubber-based. Core operations include the production of gelatin from animal by-products, creation of resinoids from plant resins, and the formulation of different types of glues and adhesives. This may also encompass the development of rubber-based adhesives. The processes typically involve chemical reactions, mixing, heating, and packaging of the finished products.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of chemical elements and compounds doped for use in electronics
Description: Business activity revolves around the production of chemical elements and compounds that are specifically doped for use in the electronics industry. This typically involves processes such as the synthesis or extraction of raw chemical elements, the doping of these elements with impurities to alter their properties, and the manufacture of compounds using these doped elements. The end products are typically used in the creation of electronic devices or components.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of chemical products or preparations of a kind used in the textiles, paper, leather and like industries
Description: The production of chemical products or preparations specifically designed for use in the textiles, paper, leather, and similar industries. This involves the creation and processing of various chemical substances, which might include dyes, treatments, or finishes, tailored to enhance the performance or appearance of products in these industries. Services may also include research and development of new chemical formulations, quality control, and customization of chemical products based on client specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of various other chemical products n.e.c.(antiknock preparations, anti-freeze preparations, liquids for hydraulic transmission, composite diagnostic or laboratory reagents, writing or draw
Description: The manufacturing of a diverse range of chemical products not classified elsewhere, such as antiknock preparations, anti-freeze solutions, and hydraulic transmission fluids. This also includes the production of composite diagnostic or laboratory reagents, and materials for writing or drawing. The core business operations involve chemical processing and synthesis, quality control testing, packaging, and distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of man-made fibres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic or artificial filament tow
Description: Production of synthetic or artificial filament tow, a type of man-made fiber. This involves processes such as polymerization, spinning, drawing, and texturing to create fibers that are commonly used in textiles, carpets, and other industrial applications. Services may also include customization of fiber properties according to customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of man-made fibres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic or artificial filament staple fibre not textured
Description: The production of synthetic or artificial filament staple fibres that are not textured forms the core of this business activity. This typically involves processes such as the polymerization of raw materials, spinning them into fibres, and subsequent cooling. The fibres produced are not textured, meaning they do not undergo any additional treatments to alter their surface properties or appearance. These non-textured synthetic or artificial fibres are then packaged and distributed for use in various industries like textile, automotive, and home furnishings.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of man-made fibres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic or artificial filament yarn, whether or not textured including high tenacity yarn
Description: The business activity involves the production of synthetic or artificial filament yarn, which can be textured or non-textured. It includes the processing and transformation of raw materials into high tenacity yarn, a strong and durable type of thread. The core operations include the synthesis of polymers, spinning these into fibers, and further processing to create the final yarn product. This may also encompass the provision of related services such as dyeing, texturing, or treatment of the yarn to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of man-made fibres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of synthetic or artificial mono-filament or strip
Description: Production of synthetic or artificial mono-filament or strip involves the transformation of raw materials into synthetic fibers. This process typically includes the creation of man-made fibers such as nylon, polyester, and acrylic, among others. The business operations may involve the extrusion of these materials into thin strands or strips, which are then processed and refined for use in various industries such as textiles, fishing, and 3D printing.

Division Name: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Class Name: Manufacture of man-made fibres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of anti-sprouting products, plant growth regulators
Description: The business activity involves the production of man-made fibres specifically designed for the manufacture of anti-sprouting products and plant growth regulators. Core operations include the synthesis of fibres, formulation of growth regulating substances, and the production of agricultural aids. This may involve chemical processes to create fibres with specific properties, blending of growth regulators, and packaging of the final product for commercial distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of medicinal substances used in the manufacture of pharmaceuticals: antibiotics,endocrine products, basic vitamins; opium derivatives; sulpha drugs; serums and plasmas; salicylic acid, its
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of medicinal substances used in the production of pharmaceuticals. This includes the creation of antibiotics, endocrine products, basic vitamins, opium derivatives, sulpha drugs, serums, plasmas, and salicylic acid. Typical processes may involve chemical synthesis, extraction, purification, and packaging of these medicinal substances. These products are then used as raw materials in the production of various pharmaceutical and medicinal products.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of allopathic pharmaceutical preparations
Description: Production of allopathic pharmaceutical preparations involves the creation of medicines based on the principles of allopathy. This includes the formulation, processing, and packaging of pharmaceutical products such as tablets, capsules, injections, and syrups. These products are typically created using chemical compounds and substances, and are designed to alleviate or cure various diseases and health conditions. The process may also involve rigorous testing and quality control to ensure the safety and effectiveness of the medicines.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of `ayurvedic' or `unani' pharmaceutical preparation
Description: Production and processing of pharmaceutical preparations based on Ayurvedic or Unani medicinal systems. This involves sourcing and processing of medicinal herbs, plants, and other natural ingredients, following traditional Ayurvedic or Unani recipes to create various medicinal products. Services may include formulation, compounding, packaging, and distribution of these medicines.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of homoeopathic or biochemic pharmaceutical preparations
Description: Business activity involves the production of homoeopathic or biochemic pharmaceutical preparations. This includes sourcing and processing natural ingredients, formulating remedies according to homoeopathic or biochemic principles, and packaging these products for distribution and sale. The operations may also encompass research and development to create new treatments, quality testing to ensure product safety and efficacy, and regulatory compliance to meet health and safety standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of veterinary preparations
Description: Production and processing of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemicals, and botanical products specifically designed for veterinary use. This involves the creation of medications, vaccines, and other health-related products intended for animals. Typical operations may include research and development, formulation, compounding, testing, and packaging of these veterinary preparations.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of medical impregnated wadding, gauze, bandages, dressings, surgical gut string etc.
Description: Production and supply of medical impregnated wadding, gauze, bandages, dressings, and surgical gut string. This involves the process of infusing or saturating these products with pharmaceutical substances to enhance their medicinal properties. The operations typically include sourcing raw materials, manufacturing the products, ensuring quality control, and distributing the finished goods to healthcare facilities.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
Group Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Class Name: Manufacture of pharmaceuticals, medicinal chemical and botanical products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other pharmaceutical and botanical products n.e.c. like hina powder etc.
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of a variety of pharmaceutical and botanical products not elsewhere classified, such as hina powder. The core operations typically include sourcing raw materials, processing these materials into finished products, quality control testing, and packaging. Services provided may include custom formulation and production of botanical products, as well as the development of new pharmaceutical products.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes; retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes for motor vehicles, motorcycles, scooters, three-wheelers, tractors and aircraft
Description: Manufacturing rubber tyres and tubes specifically designed for motor vehicles, motorcycles, scooters, three-wheelers, tractors, and aircraft. This involves processes such as raw material procurement, design, production, and quality control. Additionally, it includes the retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres, which involves removing worn-out treads and replacing them with new, durable layers to extend the lifespan of the tyre.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes; retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes for cycles and cycle-rickshaws
Description: Production and supply of rubber tyres and tubes specifically designed for cycles and cycle-rickshaws. This involves the entire process from raw material procurement to the manufacturing of the finished product. It may also include services related to the quality testing, marketing, and distribution of these tyres and tubes.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes; retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres
Sub-class Name: Retreading of tyres; replacing or rebuilding of tread on used pneumatic tyres
Description: The business activity involves the retreading of tyres, which is the process of replacing or rebuilding the tread on used pneumatic tyres. This operation extends the life of used tyres by removing the worn-out tread and applying a new layer of tread rubber. The process typically includes inspection of used tyres, buffing off old tread, applying new rubber, curing the tyre, and final inspection for quality and safety. This service is a cost-effective and environmentally friendly alternative to buying new tyres.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes; retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber tyres and tubes n.e.c.
Description: The production of rubber tyres and tubes not elsewhere classified involves the creation of various types of tyres and tubes from rubber materials. This can include tyres for vehicles, bicycles, aircraft, and other equipment. The process typically involves shaping, curing, and finishing the rubber to create the final product. Additionally, this business activity may also include the retreading and rebuilding of rubber tyres, which involves replacing the worn-out tread on used tyres to extend their life and improve safety.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber plates, sheets, strips, rods, tubes, pipes, hoses and profile -shapes etc.
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various rubber products, specifically focusing on the production of rubber plates, sheets, strips, rods, tubes, pipes, hoses, and profile-shapes. Core processes typically include the selection and preparation of raw rubber materials, molding or extruding these materials into desired shapes, and finishing processes to ensure product quality. The products are typically used in a wide range of industries, from automotive to construction and medical sectors.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber conveyor or transmission belts or belting
Description: Production and supply of rubber conveyor or transmission belts and belting, which involves processes such as mixing and molding of rubber, vulcanization, and quality control. These products are commonly used in various industries for material handling, power transmission, and other applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber contraceptives
Description: Production and supply of rubber contraceptives, which involves processes such as the creation of latex rubber, shaping and curing it into products like condoms. This may also include quality testing, packaging, and distribution of these rubber contraceptive products.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of rubber balloons
Description: Production and supply of rubber balloons, encompassing all stages from raw material processing to final product creation. This involves activities such as sourcing and processing of rubber, designing and shaping of balloons, quality control, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other rubber products n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various rubber products not classified elsewhere, including the creation of rubber mats, gloves, gaskets, and more. This involves the processes of sourcing raw rubber, molding or shaping it into the desired product, quality testing, and finally packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of semi-finished of plastic products (plastic plates, sheets, blocks, film, foil, strip etc.)
Description: Production of semi-finished plastic products such as plastic plates, sheets, blocks, film, foil, and strips. This involves processes like molding, extrusion, and lamination to convert raw plastic materials into semi-finished goods, which are then used in various industries for further manufacturing or packaging purposes.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tableware, kitchenware and other household articles and toilet articles of plastic, including manufacture of vacuum flasks and other vacuum vessels
Description: The business activity involves the production of plastic products, specifically focusing on tableware, kitchenware, and other household and toilet articles. This includes the manufacturing process of vacuum flasks and other vacuum vessels. Typical operations include the design, molding, and assembly of these plastic items, ensuring they meet safety and quality standards. The process may also involve customization based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of plastic articles for the packing of goods (plastic bags, sacks, containers, boxes, cases, carboys, bottles etc.)
Description: Production of plastic packaging materials such as bags, sacks, containers, boxes, cases, carboys, and bottles. This involves processes like molding, extrusion, and injection to shape plastic into desired forms, and it may also include design and customization services to meet specific packaging needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bathing tubs, wash-basins, lavatory pans and covers, flushing cisterns and similar sanitary-ware of plastics
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of plastic sanitary-ware products such as bathing tubs, wash-basins, lavatory pans and covers, and flushing cisterns. The core operations include designing, molding, and finishing these plastic items. Services provided may also encompass the installation and maintenance of these plastic sanitary-ware products.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of travel goods of plastics (suitcase, vanity bags, holdalls and similar articles)
Description: Production and manufacturing of travel goods made from plastics, such as suitcases, vanity bags, holdalls, and similar items. This involves processes such as design, molding, assembly, and finishing of plastic travel items. Services may also include customization of products, quality control, and distribution to retailers or direct to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of spectacle frames of plastic
Description: The business activity involves the production of spectacle frames made from plastic materials. This includes the process of sourcing raw plastic materials, molding and shaping them into spectacle frames. The operations may also involve quality checking, packaging, and distribution of the finished plastic spectacle frames to retailers or directly to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of moulded industrial accessories of plastics [including electrical insulating fittings of plastics]
Description: Production of moulded plastic items specifically designed for industrial use, including the manufacture of electrical insulating fittings. This involves processes such as injection moulding, blow moulding, rotational moulding, and compression moulding to create a variety of plastic products used in various industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of polymer/ synthetic / PVC water storage tanks
Description: Production of water storage tanks made from polymer, synthetic materials, or PVC. This involves processes such as designing, molding, and assembling tanks that are primarily used for storing water. Services may also include customization of tanks as per customer requirements and maintenance or repair of these storage tanks.

Division Name: Manufacture of rubber and plastics products
Class Name: Manufacture of plastics products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other plastics products n.e.c.
Description: Production and fabrication of various plastic products not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.), such as plastic kitchenware, bathroom accessories, furniture, and other miscellaneous items. This involves processes like plastic injection molding, extrusion, blow molding, and thermoforming. The services may also include design, prototyping, assembly, and packaging of plastic products.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of glass in primary or semi-manufactured forms (such as sheets & plate glass) including mirror sheets and wired, coloured, tinted, toughened or laminated glass
Description: Production of primary or semi-manufactured glass forms, such as sheets and plate glass, inclusive of mirror sheets and wired, coloured, tinted, toughened, or laminated glass. This involves processes such as melting raw materials, refining, forming, and cooling to produce various types of glass. The business may also provide services related to the customization and modification of these glass products.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of glass fibre (including glass-wool) and yarn of glass fibre; nonwoven glass fabrics,mats, boards and similar non-woven products
Description: This business activity involves the production of glass fibre, which includes glass-wool, and the creation of yarn from glass fibre. It also includes the manufacturing of nonwoven glass fabrics, mats, boards, and similar non-woven products. Core operations typically involve the melting and drawing of glass into fibres, spinning fibres into yarn, and the production of non-woven materials through bonding or interlocking fibres mechanically, thermally, or chemically.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hollow glassware (bottles, jars etc.) for the conveyance or packing of goods
Description: Production and supply of hollow glassware items such as bottles, jars, and similar products primarily used for transportation or packaging of goods. This involves the process of melting raw materials, forming the molten glass into desired shapes, and cooling the products for finishing and packaging.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of laboratory or pharmaceutical glassware
Description: Production and supply of glassware specifically designed for laboratory or pharmaceutical use. This involves the processes of melting, shaping, and finishing various types of glass to create products such as test tubes, beakers, flasks, pipettes, petri dishes, and other specialized glass containers used in scientific and medical research, testing, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of table or kitchen glassware
Description: Production and supply of glassware items for table or kitchen use, such as plates, bowls, jars, jugs, and cups. This involves the process of melting raw materials to form glass, shaping it into desired products, cooling and finishing them for use in domestic or commercial kitchens.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of glass bangles
