Description: Production and supply of glass bangles, encompassing the process of melting raw materials to form glass, shaping and cooling it into bangles, and potentially decorating or finishing the products for retail or wholesale distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of glass decoration pieces and glassware used in imitation jewellery
Description: The business activity involves the production of decorative glass items and glassware used in imitation jewellery. Core operations include designing, moulding, and finishing various glass pieces, such as vases, figurines, beads, or pendants. The process can also involve the application of color, texture, or other decorative elements to the glass. The final products are typically used in costume jewellery or as decorative items.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Class Name: Manufacture of glass and glass products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other glassware/glass products: articles of glass used in construction such as glass blocks; clock or watch glasses, optical glass and optical glass elements not optically worked; and o
Description: The business activity involves the production of various glass and glass products, specifically those used in construction such as glass blocks. It also includes the manufacturing of clock or watch glasses, optical glass, and optical glass elements that have not been optically worked on. Typical processes involve sourcing raw materials, melting and molding glass into desired shapes, and quality checking for finished products. Services may also include customization based on client specifications and delivering finished products to customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of refractory products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of refractory mortars, concretes etc.
Description: Production of refractory materials such as mortars and concretes, typically used in high-temperature environments like kilns, furnaces, reactors, and fireplaces. This involves processes such as mixing, molding, and curing of heat-resistant substances. Services may also include custom formulation of refractory products to meet specific industrial requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of refractory products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of refractory bricks, blocks tiles and similar refractory ceramic constructional goods
Description: Production and supply of refractory products such as bricks, blocks, tiles, and similar ceramic construction goods. These products are typically used in industries that require materials capable of withstanding high temperatures. The core operations involve sourcing raw materials, manufacturing the refractory products through high-temperature heating processes, quality control checks, and distributing the final products to various industries such as steel, glass, and cement manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of refractory products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of refractory ceramic products
Description: Production of refractory ceramic products, which are materials that can withstand high temperatures without losing their strength or shape. This includes the creation of items such as bricks, blocks, tiles, and other ceramic goods used in industries that require heat-resistant materials, such as steel and glass manufacturing. The process typically involves mixing raw materials, forming the product, and firing it in a kiln.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of refractory products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other refractory articles n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various refractory products not elsewhere classified, such as special shapes, crucibles, stoppers, and nozzles. This involves processes like molding, firing, and finishing of refractory products, which are materials capable of withstanding high temperatures and are used in industries such as steel, glass, and ceramics.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of clay building materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bricks
Description: Production and supply of bricks made from clay, including processes such as clay extraction, shaping, drying, and firing. This business activity may also involve the design and customization of bricks according to customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of clay building materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of non-refractory ceramic sanitary wares: sinks, baths, water-closet pans, flushing cistern etc.
Description: Production and supply of non-refractory ceramic sanitary wares made from clay, such as sinks, baths, water-closet pans, and flushing cisterns. This involves processes like clay preparation, molding, drying, and firing to create durable sanitary products. The business may also provide related services such as product customization and installation support.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of clay building materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of non-refractory ceramic pipes, conduits, guttering and pipe fittings
Description: The production of non-refractory ceramic pipes, conduits, guttering, and pipe fittings, typically involves the shaping, drying, and firing of clay materials. These products are commonly used in construction and infrastructure for purposes such as drainage, sewage systems, and water supply. The process may include the design and creation of custom fittings and components, as well as the provision of related installation support services.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of clay building materials
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other clay building materials
Description: Production and supply of various clay building materials, beyond the standard bricks and tiles. This can involve the extraction and preparation of clay, shaping and firing of the material, and the final production of diverse clay products such as building blocks, chimney pots, and architectural terracotta. The business may also provide related services such as product consultation, custom design, and delivery.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of articles of porcelain or china, earthenware, imitation porcelain or common pottery, including earthen statues
Description: Production and supply of various porcelain and ceramic products, including articles made from porcelain, china, earthenware, imitation porcelain, or common pottery. This can encompass a wide range of items, such as earthen statues. The core operations involve the design, molding, baking, glazing, and finishing of these products, followed by their distribution to retailers or direct customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ceramic tableware and other domestic or toilet articles
Description: The production and sale of ceramic tableware and other domestic or toilet articles, which involves processes such as molding, firing, glazing, and decorating. This includes items like ceramic plates, bowls, cups, saucers, and other tableware, as well as ceramic bathroom fixtures like sinks, toilet bowls, and bidets.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of statuettes and other ornamental ceramic articles
Description: Production of porcelain and ceramic items such as statuettes and other decorative articles. This involves processes like molding, firing, glazing, and painting to create ornamental ceramic pieces. Services may also include custom design and creation of unique ceramic artworks.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electrical insulators and insulating fittings of ceramics
Description: Production and supply of electrical insulators and insulating fittings made from ceramics. This involves the processes of shaping, firing, and finishing ceramic materials to create products that are used to prevent the transfer of electricity. These ceramic products are typically used in electrical systems and equipment to provide insulation.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ceramic laboratory, chemical and industrial products
Description: Production and supply of ceramic products specifically designed for laboratory, chemical, and industrial uses. This involves the creation of items such as ceramic lab equipment, chemical processing components, and industrial ceramics. Typical processes include the molding, firing, and glazing of ceramic materials to meet specific functional requirements in laboratory and industrial settings.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ceramic products n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various porcelain and ceramic products not classified elsewhere, such as pottery, figurines, or decorative items. This involves processes like molding, firing, glazing, and decorating. It may also include the provision of specialized services such as custom design and creation of ceramic pieces.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of clinkers and cement
Description: Production and processing of clinkers, a key ingredient in many types of cement, and the subsequent manufacturing of various types of cement. This involves processes such as the heating and grinding of raw materials, blending of ground materials to produce clinkers, and grinding of clinkers with other additives to produce cement. It may also include the manufacture of lime and plaster products.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of portland cement, aluminous cement, slag cement and similar hydraulic cement
Description: Production and processing of various types of cement such as portland cement, aluminous cement, slag cement, and other similar hydraulic cements. This involves activities such as the blending of raw materials, heating to high temperatures to produce clinker, grinding of clinker with other materials to produce cement, and quality control testing.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of asbestos cement
Description: The production of asbestos cement involves the mixing of asbestos fibers with cement to create a durable and fire-resistant material. This process typically includes sourcing raw materials, blending asbestos and cement in appropriate ratios, molding the mixture into desired shapes, and curing the products. The resulting asbestos cement products may be used in construction for items like pipes, sheets, and tiles.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of quicklime, slaked lime and hydraulic lime (excluding chewing lime)
Description: The business activity involves the production of quicklime, slaked lime, and hydraulic lime. Typical processes include mining or quarrying limestone, and then subjecting it to high temperatures to produce quicklime. This quicklime can then be chemically treated to create slaked lime or hydraulic lime. These products are used in a variety of industries, such as construction, water treatment, and soil stabilization. Note that the manufacture of chewing lime is not included in this classification.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of plasters of calcined gypsum or calcined sulphate
Description: Business activity involves the manufacturing of plasters made from calcined gypsum or calcined sulphate. The core operations typically include the process of heating these materials to a high temperature to remove any water content, forming what is known as calcined gypsum or sulphate. This is then used to produce plasters, which are often used in construction for coating walls and ceilings. Services may also include the customization of these plasters to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other cement and plaster n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various types of cement and plaster not elsewhere classified, involving processes such as raw material preparation, clinker production, and cement grinding. This also includes the creation of specialty cements and plasters tailored to specific construction needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of plaster statues and other plaster products
Description: Production and supply of plaster statues and other plaster products, involving processes such as mixing, molding, drying, and finishing. This could include the creation of decorative items, building materials, or custom pieces for a variety of industries and applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement or artificial stone (tiles, bricks etc.)
Description: Production and supply of articles made from concrete, cement, or artificial stone such as tiles, bricks, and similar products. This involves processes like mixing raw materials, molding or shaping, curing, and finishing products for construction and other uses.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of asbestos sheets
Description: Production and supply of asbestos sheets, involving the process of combining asbestos with cement or plaster to form sheets. This may also include the customization of these sheets based on specific customer requirements. Activities typically involve sourcing raw materials, processing and manufacturing, quality control, and distribution of the finished product.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of R.C.C. bricks and blocks
Description: Production and supply of Reinforced Cement Concrete (R.C.C.) bricks and blocks, which involves processes such as mixing cement and concrete, molding them into bricks or blocks, and curing them for strength and durability. This activity may also include the sale of these products to construction companies, contractors, or individual customers.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hume pipes and other pre-fabricated structural components of cement and/or concrete for building or civil engineering
Description: The production of hume pipes and other prefabricated structural components made of cement and/or concrete for use in building or civil engineering projects. This involves processes such as mixing materials, molding components, curing, and quality checking. The finished products are typically used in construction for purposes like drainage, sewage systems, or as foundational and structural elements in buildings and infrastructure.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of insulation boards of vegetable fibre, straw or wood waste, agglomerated with cement & other mineral binders.
Description: The business activity involves the production of insulation boards using vegetable fibre, straw, or wood waste, which are then agglomerated with cement and other mineral binders. The core operations include sourcing raw materials, processing these materials into insulation boards, and binding them with cement and other minerals. This process also entails quality checking for durability and insulation properties, packaging, and distributing the finished products. The business may also provide after-sales services such as installation guidance or customer support.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other cement and asbestos cement products n.e.c.
Description: Production and supply of various cement and asbestos cement products not elsewhere classified, such as precast concrete products, asbestos sheets, and pipes. This involves processes like mixing raw materials, molding, curing, and finishing to create durable and versatile products used in construction and other industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone
Sub-class Name: Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the processing of stone, which includes cutting, shaping, and finishing processes. These operations typically involve using specialized machinery to cut and shape various types of stone into desired forms, such as slabs, tiles, or architectural elements. The finishing process often includes polishing or applying other treatments to enhance the stone's appearance and durability. These services are commonly provided to construction, interior design, and landscaping sectors.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of worked mica and mica products
Description: Business activity involves the manufacturing of worked mica and mica products. This includes the extraction and processing of mica, a non-metallic mineral, into various forms for industrial and commercial use. Typical processes might involve mining mica, refining and treating it to create different grades, and shaping or molding it into products such as electrical insulators, heat-resistant materials, and decorative items. This also includes the manufacture of mica powder, flakes, and waste.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gypsum boards
Description: Production and processing of gypsum boards, which involves the extraction of gypsum, its conversion into a powdered form, and the subsequent manufacturing of gypsum boards commonly used in construction. Services may also include the design and customization of gypsum boards according to customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of millstones, sharpening or polishing stones and natural or artificial abrasive products, including abrasive powder or grain on a base of textile material, paper, paper board or other mat
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of millstones, sharpening or polishing stones, and both natural and artificial abrasive products. This includes the production of abrasive powder or grain affixed to a base of textile material, paper, paper board or other materials. Typical processes include sourcing raw materials, shaping and finishing stones, producing abrasive products, and attaching abrasive materials to various bases.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of graphite products other than electrical articles
Description: Production and supply of non-electrical graphite products fall under this business activity. It typically involves processes such as mining of graphite, purification, and processing into various forms like graphite powder, graphite rods, and other non-metallic graphite products. This can also include the manufacture of graphite-based composite materials or other specialized graphite products, excluding those used for electrical purposes.

Division Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Group Name: Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c. (includes asbestos yarn and fabric, and articles of asbestos yarn and fabric such as clothing, headgear, footwear, cord, string, paper o felt;
Description: The production of non-metallic mineral products not elsewhere classified involves manufacturing items such as asbestos yarn, fabric, and articles made from these materials. This includes the production of clothing, headgear, footwear, cord, string, paper, and felt made from asbestos. The core operations involve sourcing raw asbestos, processing it into yarn or fabric, and then creating various products from these materials. Services may also include customization of these products based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pig iron and spiegeleisen in pigs, blocks or other primary forms
Description: Production of pig iron and spiegeleisen in primary forms such as pigs, blocks, or other shapes. This involves processes like smelting or refining iron ore and other ferrous materials, and casting the molten metal into specific forms for use in further manufacturing or metallurgical processes.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of direct reduction of iron (sponge iron) and other spongy ferrous products
Description: Production of direct reduced iron, also known as sponge iron, and other similar ferrous products forms the primary business activity. This typically involves processes such as the reduction of iron ore in a solid state at a high temperature below the melting point, resulting in a more metallurgically consistent product. The produced sponge iron is then used in the manufacture of steel and other iron-based products.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of steel in ingots or other primary forms, and other semi-finished products of steel
Description: The business activity involves the production of basic iron and steel, specifically in the form of steel ingots or other primary forms, and semi-finished steel products. Core operations include the transformation of raw iron into steel through processes such as smelting, refining, and alloying. This also encompasses the production of semi-finished goods like steel slabs, billets, and blooms, which are typically used in further manufacturing processes.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ferro-alloys
Description: Production and processing of ferro-alloys, which are iron alloys with a high proportion of one or more other elements such as manganese, chromium, or nickel. This involves activities like smelting and refining of ferro-alloys, and may also include the manufacture of sintered ferro-alloys.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hot-rolled and cold-rolled products of steel
Description: The business activity involves the production of basic iron and steel materials, with a particular focus on the manufacture of hot-rolled and cold-rolled steel products. Core operations include the processes of heating and rolling steel to alter its properties, producing materials with varying degrees of strength, hardness, and ductility. The business typically provides steel products in different shapes and sizes, such as sheets, plates, bars, and strips, which are used in a wide range of industries, including construction, automotive, and machinery manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tube and tube fittings of basic iron and steel
Description: The business activity involves the production of tubes and tube fittings made from basic iron and steel. Core operations include the melting and refining of iron and steel, the shaping and molding of these materials into tubes and tube fittings, and the finishing processes such as coating or galvanizing. Services provided may also encompass the customization of these products to meet specific client requirements or industry standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of railway track materials (unassembled rails) of steel
Description: The production of railway track materials, specifically unassembled steel rails, falls under this business activity. It involves the processes of smelting and refining iron ore to create basic iron and steel, which is then shaped into rails for railway tracks. Services may also include custom fabrication of steel rails to meet specific railway infrastructure needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wire of steel by cold drawing or stretching
Description: Business activity involves the production of steel wire through methods such as cold drawing or stretching. This process typically starts with raw steel, which is then shaped into wire by pulling it through a series of dies to reduce its diameter and increase its length. The cold drawing process enhances the physical properties of the steel, improving its surface finish and dimensional accuracy. The manufactured steel wire can then be used in a variety of applications, including the production of cables, springs, and fasteners.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Class Name: Manufacture of basic iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other basic iron and steel n.e.c
Description: Production and processing of various types of basic iron and steel not elsewhere classified. This involves the operations of smelting, refining, and alloying iron and steel, as well as rolling and finishing these metals into products such as plates, sheets, strips, bars, rods, and other basic forms. Services may also include the treatment and coating of iron and steel products to improve their durability and performance.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of Copper from ore, and other copper products and alloys
Description: Processing and refining of copper from ore, along with the production of various copper products and alloys. This involves activities such as mining and extraction of copper ore, purification processes to obtain pure copper, and manufacturing of copper-based products like wires, sheets, tubes, and alloys. This may also include recycling of copper scrap to produce copper products.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of Aluminium from alumina and by other methods and products of aluminium and alloys
Description: The production of aluminium from alumina or other methods, and the creation of aluminium products and alloys. This involves activities such as the extraction of aluminium from raw materials, the refining and processing of aluminium into usable forms, and the manufacture of various aluminium-based products and alloys for use in a wide range of industries. Services may also include custom alloy creation, product design, and material testing.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Manufacturing of lead, zinc and tin products and alloys
Description: Production of lead, zinc, and tin products and alloys, typically involving processes such as smelting, refining, and casting. This manufacturing activity also includes the fabrication of products like sheets, bars, rods, and wires from these metals. The business might also provide services related to the recycling and recovery of lead, zinc, and tin from scrap and waste.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Manufacturing of chrome, manganese and nickel products alloys
Description: Production and processing of basic precious and non-ferrous metals such as chrome, manganese, and nickel. This involves the extraction of these metals, refining them into a pure state, and creating various alloys for use in a variety of industries. The services provided may include custom alloy creation, metal purification, and the manufacture of products made from these specific metals.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Production and refining of precious metals (such as gold, silver platinum etc.) and alloys
Description: Business activity in this sub-class involves the production and refining of precious metals such as gold, silver, and platinum, as well as their alloys. Core operations typically include the extraction of these metals from ores, their purification through various refining processes, and the creation of different alloys by combining them with other elements. This can also entail the production of semi-finished or finished products from these metals and alloys.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Group Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Class Name: Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other non-ferrous metals n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve the production of non-ferrous metals not classified elsewhere, such as aluminum, copper, lead, zinc, and tin. This includes the mining and refining of these metals, as well as the production of alloys. Typical processes may involve smelting, casting, rolling, and finishing. Services provided might include custom alloy creation, metal purification, and the manufacture of basic metal products.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Class Name: Casting of iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tubes, pipes and hollow profiles and of tube or pipe fittings of cast-iron/cast-steel
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of tubes, pipes, and hollow profiles from cast iron or cast steel. This also includes the production of tube or pipe fittings made from the same materials. The typical processes involved may include melting, casting, and finishing of the iron and steel to form the desired products. These products are often used in various industries such as construction, oil and gas, and water supply.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Class Name: Casting of iron and steel
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other iron and steel casting and products thereof
Description: The business activity involves the production of iron and steel castings, which are typically created through processes such as melting, molding, and cooling. This category also covers the manufacture of various products from these iron and steel castings. The operations could include the design and production of specific casting molds, the smelting and pouring of molten iron or steel into these molds, and the finishing processes such as grinding, polishing, and coating of the cast products.

Division Name: Manufacture of basic metals
Class Name: Casting of non-ferrous metals
Sub-class Name: Casting of non-ferrous metals
Description: Manufacturing processes that involve the casting of non-ferrous metals, such as aluminum, copper, lead, nickel, tin, and zinc. This includes melting and shaping these metals into desired forms using molds. Typical operations may also involve the production of non-ferrous metal parts for various industries, including automotive, aerospace, and electronics. Services provided may include custom casting, finishing, and quality control testing.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of structural metal products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of doors, windows and their frames, shutters and rolling shutters, gates and similar articles used on buildings
Description: Production and assembly of doors, windows, frames, shutters, rolling shutters, gates, and similar construction-related products. This involves processes such as designing, cutting, shaping, and joining metal parts, as well as the installation of these products on buildings.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of structural metal products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal frameworks or skeletons for construction and parts thereof ((towers, masts, trusses, bridges etc.)
Description: The business activity revolves around the production of metal frameworks or skeletons used in construction. This includes the manufacturing of various structural metal products such as towers, masts, trusses, and bridges. Typical processes involved in this business might include design, fabrication, and assembly of these metal structures. Services provided could also encompass custom manufacturing to meet specific construction requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of structural metal products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of industrial frameworks in metal (frameworks for blast furnaces, lifting and handling equipment etc.)
Description: The business activity involves the production of industrial metal frameworks used in various applications such as blast furnaces, lifting and handling equipment. The operations typically include designing, cutting, shaping, and assembling metal parts to create durable, high-strength structures that can withstand heavy loads and high temperatures. Services provided may also include customization of metal frameworks based on specific industrial requirements and installation support for the manufactured products.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of structural metal products
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other structural metal products
Description: Production and assembly of various structural metal products not classified elsewhere, including metal frameworks or skeletons for construction and parts thereof, such as towers, masts, trusses and bridges. This involves processes like cutting, bending, and assembling metal structures, as well as providing related services such as installation and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal containers for compressed or liquefied gas
Description: Production and assembly of metal containers designed for storing compressed or liquefied gas. This involves processes such as cutting, shaping, and joining metal parts, as well as testing for leaks and pressure resistance. The containers may be used in various industries, including industrial, medical, and household applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal reservoirs, tanks and similar containers
Description: Production and assembly of metal reservoirs, tanks, and similar containers. This involves processes such as cutting, shaping, and joining metal pieces to create storage solutions for a variety of industries. It may also include the addition of features such as valves, gauges, or other fittings to the containers. The end products are typically used for storing or transporting liquids or gases under pressure.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of central heating boilers and radiators and parts and accessories thereof
Description: Business activity involves the manufacturing of metal tanks, reservoirs, containers, central heating boilers, and radiators. This includes the production of parts and accessories for these products. Typical processes may involve metal fabrication, welding, and assembly. Services may also include the design and customization of these items according to customer specifications, as well as their maintenance and repair.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of tanks, reservoirs and containers of metal
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other containers n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various types of metal containers not classified elsewhere. This could include the production of specialized metal containers for industrial, commercial, or residential use. The operations typically involve the design, fabrication, and assembly of metal tanks, reservoirs, and containers. Services may also include customization of containers based on specific client requirements and the provision of maintenance and repair services for the manufactured products.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of steam generators, except central heating hot water boilers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of steam or other vapour generating boilers and hot water boilers other than central heating boilers
Description: The production of steam generators, excluding those used for central heating hot water boilers, is the primary activity in this category. This involves the manufacturing of steam or other vapour generating boilers and hot water boilers, aside from those used in central heating systems. Typical processes include design, assembly, testing, and quality control of these boilers. The services provided may also encompass installation, maintenance, and repair services for these boiler systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of steam generators, except central heating hot water boilers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of nuclear reactors, except isotope separators
Description: The production of steam generators, barring those used for central heating hot water boilers, is the key activity in this class. It involves designing, assembling, and testing steam generators for various industrial applications. The sub-class focuses on the manufacturing of nuclear reactors, with the exclusion of isotope separators. This entails the creation of devices used to initiate and control a sustained nuclear chain reaction, which includes processes such as design, assembly, installation, and maintenance of nuclear reactors.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of steam generators, except central heating hot water boilers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of auxiliary plant for use with steam generators (condensers, economizers, superheaters, steam collectors and accumulators)
Description: The business activity involves the production of steam generators, excluding those used for central heating hot water boilers. This includes the manufacturing of auxiliary plants designed to work with steam generators such as condensers, economizers, superheaters, steam collectors, and accumulators. Typical processes in this operation may involve design, assembly, and testing of these products, ensuring they function efficiently with steam generators. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these auxiliary plants.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of structural metal products, tanks, reservoirs and steam generators
Class Name: Manufacture of steam generators, except central heating hot water boilers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other steam generators (except central heating hot water boilers), n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of steam generators, excluding those used for central heating hot water boilers. Typical operations include the design, assembly, and testing of steam generators used in different sectors such as power plants, industrial facilities, and marine applications. This also covers the manufacture of parts and components for these steam generators, as well as providing after-sales services like maintenance and repair. The term 'n.e.c.' indicates that this category includes all other related activities not classified elsewhere.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of weapons and ammunition
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of weapons and ammunition
Description: Production and assembly of various types of weapons and ammunition, including firearms, artillery, and naval armament. This involves processes such as casting, forging, machining, and assembling of guns, pistols, rifles, bullets, shells, bombs, torpedoes, and other military weapons. Services may also include the repair and maintenance of these weapons and ammunition.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Forging, pressing, stamping and roll-forming of metal; powder metallurgy
Sub-class Name: Forging, pressing, stamping and roll-forming of metal; powder metallurgy
Description: Business activities in this classification involve shaping metal through forging, pressing, stamping, and roll-forming processes. Forging is the process of heating and hammering metal into a desired shape. Pressing involves applying pressure to metal to alter its shape or remove unwanted material. Stamping is a process where metal is placed in a press and a die is used to cut or shape the material. Roll-forming is a continuous bending operation in which a long strip of metal is passed through consecutive sets of rolls, or stands, each performing only an incremental part of the bend, until the desired cross-section profile is obtained. Additionally, this class includes powder metallurgy, which is the process of creating metal parts from small metal particles that are heated and pressed together. These processes are typically used in the manufacturing of a wide range of metal products.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Treatment and coating of metals; machining
Sub-class Name: Machining; treatment and coating of metals
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the treatment, coating, and machining of metals. Typical operations include altering the surface of metals to improve their durability, resistance, and aesthetic appeal. This may involve processes such as heat treatment, galvanizing, electroplating, and powder coating. Additionally, these businesses carry out machining activities, which include cutting, drilling, turning, and milling metals to create specific shapes or components. These services are often provided to industries like automotive, construction, aerospace, and manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cutlery such as knives, forks, spoons, cleavers, choppers, razors, razor blades,scissors, hair clippers etc.
Description: Production and manufacturing of cutlery items such as knives, forks, spoons, along with other tools like cleavers, choppers, razors, and razor blades. This also involves the manufacturing of grooming tools like scissors and hair clippers. The process typically includes designing, forging, shaping, polishing, and packaging these items for distribution and sale.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hand tools (non-power-driven) for agricultural/horticulture/forestry
Description: The business activity involves the production of non-power-driven hand tools specifically designed for agricultural, horticultural, and forestry uses. Core operations include the design, manufacturing, and distribution of tools such as spades, hoes, shears, and rakes. Processes may involve metalworking, forging, or casting to create durable, efficient tools for various farming and gardening tasks. Services could also include custom tool creation and tool repair or maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hand tools such as pliers, screwdrivers, press tools, blacksmiths' tools, drills,punches, milling cutters etc.
Description: Production and manufacturing of various hand tools including but not limited to pliers, screwdrivers, press tools, blacksmiths' tools, drills, punches, and milling cutters. This involves processes such as design, forging, assembly, and quality control to ensure the production of high-quality, durable tools for various industries and individual use.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of padlocks, locks, keys, hinges and the like, hardware for buildings, furniture, vehicles etc.
Description: Production and manufacturing of padlocks, locks, keys, hinges, and other related hardware items for various applications such as buildings, furniture, and vehicles. This includes the process of designing, casting, forging, and finishing these hardware products to meet specific security and functional requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of cutlery, hand tools and general hardware
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of general hardware (saws and saw-blades, including circular saw-blades and chainsaw blades, moulding boxes, vices, clamps etc.)
Description: Production and supply of general hardware items such as saws and saw-blades, including circular saw-blades and chainsaw blades, moulding boxes, vices, and clamps. This involves the processes of designing, manufacturing, and distributing these hardware tools for various industrial and domestic uses.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal fasteners (nails, rivets, tacks, pins, staples, washers and similar non-threaded products and nuts, bolts, screws and other threaded products)
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of metal fasteners, including nails, rivets, tacks, pins, staples, washers, and similar non-threaded products. It also includes the manufacturing of nuts, bolts, screws, and other threaded products. Typical processes involve sourcing raw materials, metal shaping and forming, heat treating for hardness and durability, and quality control checks to ensure product integrity.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of containers such as tins and cans for food products and boxes
Description: Production of various fabricated metal products not classified elsewhere, with a specific focus on creating containers like tins, cans, and boxes for food products. This involves processes such as metal shaping, welding, and finishing to produce durable and safe containers for food storage and transportation. Services may also include custom container design and production for specific food product requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal cable and other articles made of wire (except for electric transmission)
Description: Fabrication of various metal products not classified elsewhere, with a specific focus on the production of metal cables and articles made from wire, excluding those used for electrical transmission. The core operations typically involve processes such as metal extrusion, drawing, and twisting to create cables and other wire-based items. This may also include the manufacture of wire ropes, wire gauze, wire fencing, and other similar products.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal household articles (plates, saucers, pots, kettles, saucepans, frying pans and other non-electrical utensils, small hand-operated kitchen appliances and accessories)
Description: Fabrication of metal household items such as plates, saucers, pots, kettles, saucepans, frying pans, and other non-electrical utensils. This also includes the manufacture of small hand-operated kitchen appliances and accessories. The core business operations involve metalworking processes such as casting, forging, bending, cutting, and assembling to create a range of kitchenware and accessories.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal sanitary ware such as baths, sinks, washbasins and similar articles
Description: Manufacturing of metal sanitary ware involves the production of various bathroom fixtures made of metal, such as baths, sinks, and washbasins. The typical processes include designing, casting, welding, polishing, and assembling these products. Services may also include customization of products based on client specifications and after-sales maintenance or repair services.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of reinforced safes, vaults, strong room doors, gates and metal goods for office use (other than office furniture) and other purposes
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of reinforced safes, vaults, strong room doors, and gates. It also includes the production of various metal goods intended for office use, excluding office furniture, and for other general purposes. The core operations typically include designing, fabricating, and assembling these metal products. Additional services may encompass customization based on client requirements, quality testing, and maintenance support for the manufactured items.

Division Name: Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activities
Class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.
Description: Production and fabrication of various metal products not classified elsewhere, including metal tools, hardware, cutlery, and general metal goods. This involves processes such as forging, pressing, stamping, roll forming, and powder metallurgy. Services may also include the treatment and coating of metals, engraving, chasing and etching.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electronic capacitors, resistors, chokes, coils, transformers (electronic) and similar components
Description: Production of electronic components such as capacitors, resistors, chokes, coils, and electronic transformers. This involves processes like designing, building, and testing these components, which are essential parts of various electronic devices and systems. The business may also provide related services such as component customization and repair.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electron tubes, diodes, transistors and related discrete devices
Description: Production of electron tubes, diodes, transistors, and related discrete devices, which are integral components of electronic devices. This involves processes such as design, assembly, testing, and packaging of these electronic components. Services may also include custom manufacturing and provision of after-sales support.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of integrated circuits (analog, digital or hybrid)
Description: Production of integrated circuits, which can be analog, digital, or hybrid. This involves designing and manufacturing miniaturized electronic circuits and components, commonly known as chips. The process typically includes photolithography, etching, doping, and testing for quality control. These integrated circuits are fundamental components in various electronic devices such as computers, mobile phones, and other digital appliances.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bare printed circuit boards, loading of components onto printed circuit boards; manufacture of interface cards (e.g. sound, video, controllers, network, modems)
Description: The production of bare printed circuit boards and the loading of components onto these boards are key activities in this business. The manufacturing process also includes the creation of interface cards such as sound, video, controllers, network, and modems. Typical processes involve designing, testing, and assembling electronic components and boards for a variety of applications.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of display components (plasma, polymer, LCD, LED)
Description: Production and assembly of display components such as plasma, polymer, LCD, and LED screens. This involves processes like designing, manufacturing, and testing of these components. Services may also include customization of display components based on customer specifications and providing maintenance or repair services for these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of printer cables, monitor cables, USB cables, connectors etc.
Description: Production and assembly of various electronic components such as printer cables, monitor cables, USB cables, and connectors. This involves sourcing raw materials, designing and manufacturing components, quality testing, and packaging for distribution. It may also include providing after-sales services for these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of microprocessors
Description: Designing, producing, and selling microprocessors, which are the integral components of any computing device. This involves activities such as circuit design, silicon wafer processing, assembly, testing, and packaging. The business may also provide related services such as customization of microprocessors to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Class Name: Manufacture of electronic components and boards
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other electronic components n.e.c
Description: Production and assembly of various electronic components and boards not explicitly classified elsewhere. This involves designing and manufacturing a wide range of electronic parts such as resistors, capacitors, inductors, diodes, transistors, and other semiconductor devices. It also includes the fabrication of printed circuit boards (PCBs) and integrated circuits (ICs). Services may also encompass testing, quality control, and packaging of the finished components.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of desktop computers, laptop computers, hand-held computers (e.g. PDA),mainframe computers and computer servers
Description: Production and assembly of various types of computers such as desktops, laptops, hand-held devices like PDAs, mainframe systems, and computer servers. This involves designing, manufacturing, and testing of these computer systems. It includes both hardware and software integration to ensure the computer systems function effectively. Services may also encompass after-sales support and maintenance for these computer products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of magnetic and optical storage devices such as magnetic disk drives, flash drives, CD, DVD and other storage devices
Description: The manufacturing of magnetic and optical storage devices involves the production of various data storage equipment such as magnetic disk drives, flash drives, CD, DVD and other storage devices. This process typically includes the design, assembly, testing, and packaging of these devices. These businesses may also provide after-sales services such as repair and maintenance for the manufactured products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of monitors, keyboards, all types of mice, joysticks, and trackball accessories, dedicated computer terminals etc.
Description: Production and assembly of computer peripheral equipment such as monitors, keyboards, various types of mice, joysticks, and trackball accessories, as well as dedicated computer terminals. This involves processes such as design, manufacturing, testing, and distribution of these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of printers, scanners, including bar code scanners, smart card readers, virtual reality helmets, computer projectors (video beamers)
Description: The production of printers, scanners, bar code scanners, smart card readers, virtual reality helmets, and computer projectors (video beamers). This business activity involves the design, assembly, and testing of these computer peripheral devices. Services may also include product customization, troubleshooting, and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of computer terminals, like automatic teller machines (ATM's), point-of-sale (POS) terminals not mechanically operated
Description: The production of computer terminals such as automatic teller machines (ATMs) and point-of-sale (POS) terminals that are not mechanically operated. This involves the design, assembly, and testing of these devices. It may also include providing maintenance and repair services for these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of computers and peripheral equipment that are not elsewhere classified. This involves the design and manufacture of various computer hardware components, such as motherboards, processors, memory devices, and storage systems. It also includes the production of peripheral devices like monitors, keyboards, mice, printers, and scanners. Services may also encompass customization of hardware components based on customer specifications and post-manufacturing support.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of radio and television studio and broadcasting equipment, including television cameras
Description: Production and assembly of radio and television studio and broadcasting equipment, including television cameras. This involves designing, manufacturing, and testing of various broadcasting devices and systems. Key operations include the creation of transmission equipment, studio recording devices, and live broadcasting tools. It also includes the manufacture of related components and parts.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of telephone and facsimile equipment, including telephone answering machines, PBX
Description: Production of telephone and facsimile equipment, along with telephone answering machines and private branch exchange (PBX) systems. This involves designing, assembling, and testing of these communication devices. The business may also provide after-sales services such as maintenance and repair.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of data communications equipment, such as bridges, routers, and gateways
Description: Business operations in this category involve the production of data communication equipment, such as bridges, routers, and gateways. This includes designing, assembling, and testing these devices. These businesses typically provide services such as product development, manufacturing, quality control, and after-sales support for data communication equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of cable television equipment, transmitting and receiving antenna including dish, VSAT
Description: The business activity involves the production of cable television equipment, transmitting and receiving antennas, including dishes and VSAT (Very Small Aperture Terminal). Core operations include the design, assembly, and quality testing of these communication devices. Services can also encompass maintenance and repair of the manufactured equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pagers, cellular phones and other mobile communication equipment
Description: Production and assembly of pagers, cellular phones, and other mobile communication devices. This involves the design, manufacturing, and testing of these devices. It may also include the provision of related services such as repair and maintenance of mobile communication equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other communication equipments n.e.c.
Description: Production of various communication devices not elsewhere classified, such as satellite communication equipment, broadcasting equipment, and other specialized devices. This involves processes like design, assembly, and testing of the equipment, as well as providing related services like installation, maintenance, and repair.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of televisions, television monitors and displays
Description: Production and assembly of televisions, television monitors, and displays, encompassing all stages from design and parts procurement to final product testing and packaging. This business activity also includes the development and manufacturing of components such as screens, casings, and circuit boards for these devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture video cassette recorders and duplicating equipment
Description: Production and assembly of video cassette recorders and duplicating equipment, including design, testing, and quality control processes. This may also involve the repair or refurbishment of existing equipment, as well as the provision of related after-sales services.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of audio recording and duplicating systems
Description: Production and assembly of audio recording and duplicating systems, such as tape recorders, CD burners, and digital audio workstations. This involves designing and building these systems, as well as testing their functionality. It may also include providing repair and maintenance services for these devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of radio receivers
Description: Production and assembly of radio receivers, encompassing the design, testing, and manufacturing of various components such as antennas, tuners, amplifiers, and speakers. This also involves quality control processes to ensure the functionality and safety of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of stereo equipment, speaker systems, amplifiers for musical instruments and public address systems, microphones, karaoke machines, headphones (e.g. radio, stereo, computer)
Description: Production and assembly of consumer electronics such as stereo equipment, speaker systems, and amplifiers for musical instruments and public address systems. This also involves the manufacture of microphones, karaoke machines, and various types of headphones including those for radios, stereos, and computers. Typical processes may include designing, prototyping, testing, and mass producing these electronic devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of CD and DVD players
Description: Production and assembly of CD and DVD players, involving processes such as designing, prototyping, testing, and quality control. This business activity also includes the provision of related services such as repair and maintenance of these devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Class Name: Manufacture of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other electronic consumer goods n.e.c. (this includes non-television video camera)
Description: Production and assembly of various electronic consumer goods not elsewhere classified, such as non-television video cameras. This involves designing, developing, and manufacturing a wide range of electronic devices for consumer use. Typical processes include sourcing materials, assembling components, testing product functionality, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of physical properties testing and inspection equipment
Description: The business activity involves the production of equipment used for testing and inspecting physical properties. This includes the creation of devices that can measure attributes such as hardness, tensile strength, elasticity, and thermal properties. Typical processes include the design, assembly, and calibration of these testing and inspection instruments. Services may also encompass maintenance, repair, and upgrading of such equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of automotive emissions testing equipment
Description: Production and assembly of equipment used for testing emissions from automobiles. This involves the creation of devices that measure the quantity and type of pollutants being released by vehicles to ensure they meet environmental standards. Services may include the design, manufacturing, and maintenance of these testing devices, as well as providing technical support and training for their use.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of consumption meters for electricity, water or gas, flow meters and counting meters
Description: The business activity involves the production of consumption meters for utilities such as electricity, water, or gas, as well as flow meters and counting meters. Core operations include the designing, manufacturing, and testing of these devices to ensure accurate measurements of utility usage. Services may also include maintenance, repair, and calibration of these measuring instruments.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of meteorological instruments
Description: Business activities in this category involve the production of meteorological instruments such as weather stations, barometers, thermometers, hygrometers, anemometers, rain gauges, and other devices used for weather forecasting and climate study. The processes typically involve design, assembly, testing, and calibration of these instruments. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these devices, as well as providing related consulting and technical support.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of radar equipment, GPS devices, search, detection, navigation, aeronautical and nautical equipment
Description: Production and assembly of radar systems, GPS devices, and other equipment used for search, detection, and navigation purposes. This also involves the manufacture of specialized aeronautical and nautical equipment. The business operations typically include design, testing, calibration, and maintenance of said devices and systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of laboratory analytical instruments and miscellaneous laboratory apparatus for measuring and testing such as scales, balances, incubators etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of laboratory analytical instruments and various laboratory apparatus used for measuring and testing. This includes manufacturing instruments such as scales and balances for precise measurements, as well as incubators for controlled growth or reactions.
