The core operations involve design, production, testing, and distribution of these specialized instruments and apparatus. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of industrial process control equipment
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the production of industrial process control equipment, which are devices used to monitor and regulate industrial processes. This includes the manufacturing of various control systems, sensors, and instruments that help manage, direct, or regulate the behavior of machines or systems in an industrial setting. Typical processes may involve the design, assembly, testing, and maintenance of such equipment. These businesses may also provide related services such as installation, repair, and technical support for the process control equipment they manufacture.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other measuring n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various types of measuring equipment not elsewhere classified, such as meters, gauges, and other precision instruments. This involves designing, manufacturing, and calibrating devices used for measuring, testing, navigating, and controlling. Services may also include the repair and maintenance of these devices, as well as providing related consulting services.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of watches and clocks
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of watches and clocks, including instrument panel clocks (except time-recording equipment)
Description: The business activity involves the production of watches and clocks, encompassing everything from the assembly of various components to the final product. This includes the manufacturing of all types of watches, from wristwatches to pocket watches, as well as different kinds of clocks, such as wall clocks, alarm clocks, and instrument panel clocks. However, it does not include the manufacture of time-recording equipment. The typical processes may include designing, prototyping, assembling, testing, and packaging of the final product.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of watches and clocks
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of components for clocks and watches (springs, jewels, dials, hands, plates, bridges and other parts); watch and clock cases, including cases of precious metals
Description: The business activity involves the production of various components for clocks and watches, such as springs, jewels, dials, hands, plates, bridges, and other parts. It also includes the manufacturing of watch and clock cases, even those made from precious metals. This typically involves processes such as design, assembly, finishing, and quality control of these parts and cases.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of watches and clocks
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of time-recording equipments such as time-clock, parking meters etc.
Description: The production of time-recording devices such as time-clocks and parking meters falls under this business activity. Processes typically involve the design, assembly, and testing of these devices. The business may also offer after-sales services such as repair and maintenance of the manufactured equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment; watches and clocks
Class Name: Manufacture of watches and clocks
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other watches and clocks n.e.c.
Description: The production and assembly of various types of watches and clocks not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.) is the primary focus. This involves the creation of wristwatches, pocket watches, wall clocks, alarm clocks, and other timekeeping devices. The process typically includes designing, manufacturing, and assembling watch and clock parts, as well as the final assembly and quality control of the finished products. Services may also include repair and maintenance of these timekeeping devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of irradiation, electromedical and electrotherapeutic equipment
Description: The business activity involves the production of irradiation, electromedical, and electrotherapeutic equipment. Core operations include the design, assembly, and testing of devices such as radiation therapy machines, MRI scanners, pacemakers, defibrillators, and other medical equipment that utilize electromagnetic fields or radiation. This also covers the manufacture of therapeutic appliances and apparatus, such as electrocardiographs, ultrasonic medical equipment, and ultraviolet or infrared ray apparatus. The process may also involve providing after-sales services, including equipment maintenance and repair.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of optical instruments and photographic equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of optical instruments and photographic equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of optical instruments and equipment
Description: Production and assembly of optical instruments and equipment, such as microscopes, telescopes, binoculars, and other precision instruments used in scientific research, medical examinations, and navigational activities. This also encompasses the manufacture of parts and accessories associated with these optical instruments.

Division Name: Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products
Group Name: Manufacture of magnetic and optical media
Class Name: Manufacture of magnetic and optical media
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of magnetic and optical media
Description: Production and assembly of magnetic and optical media, such as hard drives, CDs, DVDs, and Blu-Ray discs. This involves processes like encoding data onto these media, quality control checks, and packaging for distribution. It may also include the manufacture of rewritable and pre-recorded media.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Class Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of power generators (except battery charging alternators for internal combustion engines), motor generator sets (except turbine generator set units)
Description: The business activity involves the production of power generators, excluding battery charging alternators for internal combustion engines, and motor generator sets, excluding turbine generator set units. Core operations typically include the design, assembly, and testing of these electrical devices. Services may also encompass installation, maintenance, and repair of the manufactured equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Class Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric power distribution transformers, arc-welding transformers, fluorescent ballasts, transmission and distribution voltage regulators
Description: The business activity involves the production of electric power distribution transformers, arc-welding transformers, fluorescent ballasts, and transmission and distribution voltage regulators. Core operations include designing, assembling, and testing of these devices. Services may also encompass maintenance and repair, as well as the provision of related consulting services.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Class Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric motors (except internal combustion engine starting motors)
Description: Producing electric motors, excluding those used for starting internal combustion engines. This involves processes such as designing, assembling, and testing of electric motors. It also includes the provision of related services such as maintenance and repair of manufactured motors.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Class Name: Manufacture of electric motors, generators, transformers and electricity distribution and control apparatus
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electricity distribution and control apparatus (electrical apparatus for switching or protecting electrical circuits (e.g. switches, fuses, voltage limiters, surge suppressors, junction
Description: The business activity involves the production of electricity distribution and control apparatus. This includes the manufacture of electrical devices for switching or protecting electrical circuits such as switches, fuses, voltage limiters, surge suppressors, and junction boxes. The core operations typically involve designing, assembling, testing, and selling these electrical apparatus. The process may also include the maintenance and repair of these devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of batteries and accumulators
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of primary cells and primary batteries and rechargeable batteries, cells containing manganese oxide, mercuric oxide silver oxide or other material
Description: The activity involves the production of primary cells and batteries, both rechargeable and non-rechargeable, using materials such as manganese oxide, mercuric oxide, silver oxide, among others. The core operations include designing, assembling, and testing of these batteries and cells. This may also encompass the development of new battery technologies and the provision of related services such as battery maintenance and recycling.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of batteries and accumulators
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric accumulator including parts thereof (separators, containers, covers)
Description: The business activity involves the production of electric accumulators and their components such as separators, containers, and covers. Core operations include the assembly and manufacturing of different types of batteries and accumulators, such as lead-acid, nickel-cadmium, and lithium-ion. This also encompasses the fabrication of parts integral to these products, ensuring they function effectively. Services may include custom design and production of batteries and accumulators to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices
Class Name: Manufacture of fibre optic cables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fibre optic cables for data transmission or live transmission of images
Description: Production and assembly of fibre optic cables specifically designed for data transmission or live image broadcasting. This involves processes such as the creation of optical fibres, coating and buffering, colour coding, and cabling. Services may also include testing the cables for quality assurance, and packaging for distribution.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices
Class Name: Manufacture of other electronic and electric wires and cables
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other electronic and electric wires and cables (insulated wire and cable made of steel, copper, aluminium)
Description: Production and manufacturing of a variety of insulated electronic and electric wires and cables made from materials such as steel, copper, and aluminium. This process typically involves the design, creation, testing, and distribution of these products, which are essential components in various electronic devices and electrical systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices
Class Name: Manufacture of wiring devices
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of switch, switch box, lamp holders, lugs etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of wiring devices such as switches, switch boxes, lamp holders, and lugs. Core operations include the design, assembly, and testing of these electrical components. Services provided may also encompass customization of these devices according to specific client requirements, as well as the repair and maintenance of these products. The manufacturing process typically involves the use of metal, plastic, and other materials to create durable and reliable wiring devices for use in electrical circuits.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of wiring and wiring devices
Class Name: Manufacture of wiring devices
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other wiring devices and fittings n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various wiring devices and fittings not elsewhere classified, involving processes such as molding, casting, or other manufacturing techniques. This may include fabrication of items like electrical connectors, terminal blocks, fuse boxes, or other wiring accessories. Services can also encompass custom manufacturing based on client specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of electric lighting equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric lighting equipment
Description: Production and assembly of electric lighting equipment, including but not limited to, light bulbs, fluorescent tubes, and LED lights. This also encompasses the manufacture of parts and components like filaments and casings. The business operations may involve design, assembly, testing, and packaging of lighting products for commercial and residential use.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of domestic appliances
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of domestic electric appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, vacuum cleaners, mixers, grinders etc.
Description: Production of household electrical appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, vacuum cleaners, mixers, and grinders. This involves the design, assembly, testing, and sales of these appliances. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these appliances.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of domestic appliances
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of domestic electrothermic appliances such as electric water heaters, space heaters, irons, ovens, toasters, microwave ovens etc
Description: The manufacturing of domestic electrothermic appliances involves the production of devices that use electricity to generate heat for household use. This includes the creation of products such as electric water heaters, space heaters, irons, ovens, toasters, and microwave ovens. The process typically includes design, assembly, testing, and packaging of these appliances. Services may also encompass after-sales support, including repair and maintenance of these appliances.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of domestic appliances
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric fans (except exhaust fans)
Description: Production and assembly of electric fans for household use, excluding exhaust fans. This involves sourcing components, assembling the fans, and conducting quality checks. The business may also provide after-sales services such as repair and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of domestic appliances
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of domestic non-electric cooking and heating equipment such as non-electric space heaters, cooking ranges, grates, stoves, water heaters, cooking appliances, plate warmers
Description: Manufacturing of non-electric domestic cooking and heating appliances such as space heaters, cooking ranges, grates, stoves, water heaters, and plate warmers. This involves the design, production, and distribution of these appliances that are used for heating spaces and cooking food without the use of electricity. The process typically includes sourcing materials, fabrication, assembly, quality control, and delivery to retail outlets or direct to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of domestic appliances
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other domestic appliances n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of a variety of domestic appliances not classified elsewhere, such as vacuum cleaners, electric fans, or heaters. This involves processes like designing, testing, and manufacturing these appliances, ensuring they meet safety standards, and providing after-sales services like repair and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of electrical equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of other electrical equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other electrical equipment
Description: Producing a variety of electrical equipment not classified elsewhere, such as batteries, wires, switches, and electrical insulators. This involves the entire production process, from design and assembly to testing and distribution. In addition, it may include the provision of maintenance and repair services for these electrical products.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle engines
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle engines
Description: The business activity involves the production of engines and turbines, excluding those designed for aircraft, vehicles, and cycles. This manufacturing process typically includes the design, assembly, and testing of various engine and turbine types. Services may also encompass maintenance, repair, and overhaul of these engines and turbines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of fluid power equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fluid power equipment
Description: Businesses in this category focus on the production of fluid power equipment, which is machinery or devices that use fluid (either liquid or gas) to transmit power from one location to another. This includes the manufacture of hydraulic and pneumatic equipment such as hydraulic pumps, valves, cylinders, actuators, and pneumatic devices. These operations involve the design, assembly, and testing of the equipment, as well as the provision of maintenance and repair services. The production process may also include the fabrication of components and the integration of these parts into complete systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of hand pumps
Description: Production and assembly of hand pumps, encompassing the creation of various types of manual pumps used for water, air, or other fluids. This business activity typically involves designing, fabricating, and testing hand pumps to ensure functionality and safety. Services may also include the repair and maintenance of these products.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves etc.
Description: The manufacturing of other pumps, compressors, taps and valves involves the production of various mechanical devices used to move fluids or gas by mechanical action. This includes the design and assembly of different types of pumps (like centrifugal, reciprocating, rotary, and diaphragm pumps), compressors (such as reciprocating, rotary screw, and centrifugal compressors), and various types of taps and valves. The business operations may also encompass the maintenance and repair services of these products. The manufacturing process typically includes casting, machining, assembly, testing, and packaging.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of bearings, gears, gearing and driving elements
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bearings, gears, gearing and driving elements
Description: Production and assembly of components such as bearings, gears, gearing, and driving elements used in various machinery and equipment. This involves processes such as casting, machining, heat treating, and assembling parts that facilitate motion in machines. Services may also include custom manufacturing of these components based on specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners
Description: Production and assembly of ovens, furnaces, and furnace burners for various applications such as cooking, heating, and industrial processes. This involves designing and fabricating these appliances, installing and testing their heating elements, and ensuring they meet safety standards. Services may also include repair and maintenance of these heating devices.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of lifts, escalators and moving walkways
Description: The production and assembly of lifting and handling equipment such as lifts, escalators, and moving walkways. This involves designing, manufacturing, and installing these systems in various buildings and structures. Services can also include maintenance and repair of these systems to ensure safe and efficient operation.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other lifting and handling equipment and parts thereof
Description: Production and assembly of various lifting and handling equipment such as cranes, forklifts, conveyors, and escalators, as well as their parts and components. The business operations typically involve design, fabrication, quality control, and maintenance services for these types of machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of office machinery and equipment (except computers and peripheral equipment)
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of office machinery and equipment
Description: Production and assembly of various office machinery and equipment, excluding computers and peripheral devices. This involves activities such as the manufacturing of photocopying machines, fax machines, paper shredding machines, typewriters, calculators, and other similar office equipment. The process typically includes design, fabrication, assembly, testing, and distribution of these machines and equipment. Services may also involve repair and maintenance of the manufactured office machinery and equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of power-driven hand tools
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of power-driven hand tools
Description: Production and assembly of power-driven hand tools such as drills, saws, grinders, and sanders. This involves sourcing and processing raw materials, designing and creating tool parts, assembling the final products, and conducting quality checks. It may also include providing repair and maintenance services for these tools.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of refrigerating or freezing equipment f industrial use, including assemblies of major components
Description: The business activity involves the production of refrigerating or freezing equipment for industrial use. This includes the assembly of major components required for these machines. Typical processes may include the design, assembly, testing, and maintenance of a variety of industrial cooling and freezing systems. Services could also involve customizing these machines to meet specific industry needs.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of air-conditioning machines, including motor vehicles air-conditioners
Description: Production and assembly of air-conditioning machines for various applications, including those designed for motor vehicles. This involves designing, manufacturing, and testing of air-conditioners to ensure optimal performance. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of fire extinguishers and other equipment for projecting, dispersing or spraying liquids or powders whether or not hand-operated, including sand blasting machines, stream cleaning machines
Description: The business activity involves the production of fire extinguishers and various equipment designed to project, disperse, or spray liquids or powders. This includes not only hand-operated devices but also machines such as sand blasting and steam cleaning machines. The core operations include designing, manufacturing, and testing these devices to ensure they function effectively for their intended purposes. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of weighing machinery (other than sensitive laboratory balances)
Description: Production and assembly of various types of weighing machinery, excluding sensitive laboratory balances. This involves designing and manufacturing scales and other weighing equipment for general purposes, such as industrial scales, retail scales, and medical scales. Services may also include the maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of filtering and purifying machinery or apparatus for liquids and gases
Description: Production and assembly of machinery or apparatus designed for filtering and purifying liquids and gases. This involves the construction of various types of filters and purifiers, such as water filters, air purifiers, oil filters, and gas purifiers. The business operations typically include designing, manufacturing, testing, and selling these devices. Services may also include maintenance and repair of the filtering and purifying machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other general-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other general purpose machinery n.e.c. ( fans intended for industrial applications,exhaust hoods for commercial, laboratory or industrial use; calendering or other rolling machines othe
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various general-purpose machinery not specified elsewhere. This includes the production of fans designed for industrial applications, exhaust hoods for commercial, laboratory, or industrial use, and calendering or other rolling machines. Typical processes may include designing, assembling, testing, and selling these types of machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tractors used in agriculture and forestry																										and accessories for general purpose machinery and equipment.)
Description: The production and assembly of tractors specifically designed for agricultural and forestry purposes fall under this business activity. It also includes the manufacturing of accessories for these tractors and other general purpose machinery and equipment. Typical operations involve designing, developing, and producing various types of tractors and their components, as well as providing after-sales services such as repair and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ploughs, manure spreaders, seeders, harrows and similar agricultural machinery for soil preparation, planting or fertilizing, harvesting or threshing machinery
Description: The manufacturing of agricultural and forestry machinery, specifically focusing on the production of ploughs, manure spreaders, seeders, harrows, and similar machinery used for soil preparation, planting, fertilizing, harvesting or threshing. This involves the design, assembly, testing, and sales of such machinery, which aids in various agricultural processes from soil preparation to crop harvesting.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of spraying machinery for agricultural use
Description: The business activity involves the production of machinery specifically designed for agricultural spraying purposes. This includes the creation of various types of equipment such as pesticide sprayers, herbicide sprayers, and other crop spraying machines. The operations typically involve designing, assembling, testing, and selling these agricultural spraying machines, ensuring they meet industry standards and customer requirements. Services may also include maintenance and repair of the manufactured machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of agricultural and forestry machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other agricultural and forestry machinery n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of agricultural and forestry machinery not classified elsewhere. This includes manufacturing processes such as design, assembly, testing, and quality control of specialized machinery used in farming and forestry operations. The machinery produced may include irrigation equipment, harvesters, tractors, or forestry equipment like loggers and skidders. The business may also provide after-sales services like machinery repair and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of metal-forming machinery and machine tools
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machine tools for turning, drilling, milling, shaping, planning, boring, grinding etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of machine tools designed for various metalworking processes such as turning, drilling, milling, shaping, planning, boring, and grinding. This includes the design, manufacturing, and assembly of machinery used in forming and shaping metals. The operations may also encompass providing maintenance services and spare parts for these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of metal-forming machinery and machine tools
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electroplating machinery
Description: The business activity involves the production of electroplating machinery, a key component in the metal-forming industry. Core operations include designing, assembling, and testing these machines, which are used to coat various metal objects with a thin layer of a different metal. The process typically involves creating machinery that uses an electric current to reduce dissolved metal cations, allowing a thin, coherent metal coating to be deposited on an object. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines, as well as providing necessary training for their operation.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of metal-forming machinery and machine tools
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for the machine tools listed above
Description: Production and assembly of parts and accessories specifically designed for metal-forming machinery and machine tools. This involves processes such as precision machining, casting, forging, and finishing of components like gears, clamps, dies, and fixtures. The business may also offer services such as maintenance and repair of these machine tool parts and accessories.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of metal-forming machinery and machine tools
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of metal-forming machinery and machine tools n.e.c
Description: The manufacturing of metal-forming machinery and machine tools not elsewhere classified (n.e.c) involves the production of a wide variety of equipment used for shaping, cutting, and processing metal. This includes the creation of lathes, drilling machines, milling machines, grinding machines, and other machinery not specifically categorized elsewhere. The core business operations include designing and assembling machinery parts, quality checking of the final product, and providing maintenance and repair services for these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for metallurgy
Description: Production and assembly of machinery designed for metallurgical processes, including machines for casting, rolling, forging, and other metalworking activities. This can involve the creation of furnaces, ladles, rolling mills, extrusion presses, and other equipment used in the conversion of raw metals into finished products. Services may also include the repair, maintenance, and upgrading of such machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of continuous-action elevators and conveyors for underground use
Description: The production of machinery specifically designed for mining, quarrying, and construction operations, with a particular focus on continuous-action elevators and conveyors for underground use. This involves the complete manufacturing process, from design and assembly to the testing of machinery. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines, as well as providing necessary training for their operation.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of boring, cutting, sinking and tunnelling machinery (whether or not for underground use)
Description: The business activity involves the production of machinery used in mining, quarrying, and construction processes. This specifically includes the manufacturing of equipment for boring, cutting, sinking, and tunnelling, which may be used either above ground or underground. Typical operations in this business may involve the design and assembly of these machines, quality testing, and providing maintenance services.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of earth-moving machinery (bulldozers, angle-dozers, graders, scrapers, levellers,mechanical shovels, shovel loaders, off-road dumping trucks etc.)
Description: The production of earth-moving machinery involves the creation of heavy equipment designed for tasks such as mining, quarrying, and construction. This includes the manufacture of bulldozers, angle-dozers, graders, scrapers, levellers, mechanical shovels, shovel loaders, and off-road dumping trucks. The process typically includes designing, assembling, and testing these machines to ensure they meet industry standards and can effectively perform tasks such as digging, grading, and moving large amounts of earth or other materials. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of tracklaying tractors and tractors used in construction or mining
Description: The production of tracklaying tractors and tractors specifically designed for use in construction or mining operations. This involves the entire manufacturing process, from the design and assembly of these specialized vehicles to the testing and distribution. Services may also include maintenance and repair, as well as the production of related parts and accessories.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of concrete and mortar mixers, piledrivers and pile-extractors, mortar spreaders,bitumen spreaders, concrete surfacing machinery
Description: Businesses in this category are engaged in the manufacturing of machinery used for mining, quarrying, and construction. This includes the production of concrete and mortar mixers, piledrivers and pile-extractors, mortar spreaders, bitumen spreaders, and concrete surfacing machinery. The operations typically involve designing, assembling, and testing these machines to ensure they meet industry standards and customer requirements. Services may also include maintenance and repair of the manufactured machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for machinery/equipment used by construction and mining industries
Description: Production of parts and accessories specifically designed for machinery and equipment used in the construction and mining industries. This involves processes such as designing, manufacturing, and assembling components for machinery like excavators, bulldozers, drilling rigs, and other mining and construction equipment. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these parts and accessories.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other machinery for mining, quarrying and construction n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various machinery specifically designed for mining, quarrying, and construction activities not classified elsewhere. This involves processes such as the design, fabrication, assembly, and maintenance of heavy machinery like excavators, bulldozers, drilling machines, and other specialized equipment used in mining and construction industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for the dairy industry
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for use in the dairy industry. This includes the manufacture of equipment for milk processing, cheese making, butter churning, yogurt production, and other dairy-related operations. Services may also encompass the provision of spare parts, maintenance, and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for the grain milling industry
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for processing food, beverages, and tobacco in the grain milling industry. This involves designing, manufacturing, and installing a variety of machines such as grain huskers, separators, cleaners, and grinders. The business may also offer maintenance and repair services for these machines to ensure their optimal performance.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of presses, crushers etc. used to make wine, cider, fruit juices etc.
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for processing food, beverages, and tobacco. This includes the manufacture of equipment such as presses and crushers used in the production of wine, cider, and fruit juices. Services may also involve the maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for the bakery industry or for making macaroni, noodles, pasta etc.
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for the bakery industry or for making macaroni, noodles, pasta, and similar food items. This includes the creation of machines used for mixing, baking, and packaging these products. Services may also encompass the maintenance and repair of this specialized equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for the extraction or preparation of animal or vegetable fats or oils
Description: Production and assembly of machinery designed for extracting or preparing animal or vegetable fats or oils. This includes the creation of equipment used in food, beverage, and tobacco processing industries, particularly those machines that aid in the extraction or preparation of oils and fats from animal or vegetable sources. Services may also involve maintenance and repair of such machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for the preparation of tobacco and for the making of cigarettes or cigars, or for pipe or chewing tobacco or snuff
Description: The activity involves the manufacturing of machinery specifically designed for the preparation of tobacco and the production of cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, chewing tobacco, or snuff. Core operations include the designing, assembling, and testing of these machines. Services may also encompass maintenance and repair of the machinery, as well as providing relevant parts and accessories.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for food, beverage and tobacco processing
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other machinery for the industrial preparation or manufacture of food or drink n.e.c. (including tea or coffee making machines)
Description: Production and assembly of various machines used in the industrial preparation or manufacture of food and drinks not elsewhere classified. This includes the creation of tea or coffee making machines. The core operations involve designing, building, and testing these machines to ensure they meet industry standards and are efficient in processing food and beverages. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for preparation of textile fibers, spinning machines, machines for preparing textile yarns, weaving machines (looms), including hand looms, knitting machines
Description: The production of machinery specifically designed for the textile, apparel, and leather industries. This includes the manufacturing of machines for preparation of textile fibers, spinning machines for converting fibers into yarn or thread, and weaving machines or looms to interlace two distinct sets of yarns or threads. The process also encompasses the creation of knitting machines for the production of textiles and fabrics. Hand looms are also part of the manufacturing process. All these machines are integral to the textile production process, aiding in the transformation of raw fibers into finished fabric or clothing products.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of textile printing machinery
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for textile printing, such as screen printing machines, heat press machines, and direct-to-garment printers. This involves the design, manufacturing, and testing of these machines, ensuring they are fit for use in the textile, apparel, and leather industries. Services may also include maintenance and repair of textile printing machinery.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for washing, bleaching, dyeing, dressing, finishing coating or impregnating textile fabrics, machines for reeling, unreeling, folding, cutting or pinking textile fabrics, and
Description: Manufacturing machinery specifically designed for textile, apparel, and leather production. This includes creating machines for washing, bleaching, dyeing, dressing, finishing, coating, or impregnating textile fabrics. The business activity also encompasses the production of machines for reeling, unreeling, folding, cutting, or pinking textile fabrics. Typical operations involve design, assembly, and testing of these machines, ensuring they meet industry standards and customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ironing machines, commercial washing and drying machines, dry-cleaning machines and other laundry machinery
Description: Production and assembly of machinery specifically designed for textile, apparel, and leather industries, such as ironing machines, commercial washing and drying machines, and dry-cleaning machines. This business activity also encompasses the manufacture of other laundry machinery. The core operations typically involve designing, constructing, testing, and selling these machines to businesses within the textile, apparel, and leather industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sewing machines, sewing machine heads and sewing machine needles (whether or not for household use)
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the production of sewing machines, sewing machine heads, and sewing machine needles. These products may be designed for either industrial or household use. The manufacturing process typically involves the design, assembly, and testing of these machines and components. These companies may also provide related services such as maintenance and repair of the manufactured items.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for preparing, tanning or working hides, skins or leather, machinery for making or repairing footwear or other articles of hides, skins, leather or fur skins
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of machinery specifically designed for preparing, tanning, or working with hides, skins, or leather. It also includes the production of machinery for making or repairing footwear or other articles made from hides, skins, leather, or fur skins. The core operations include designing and assembling these machines, testing their functionality, and providing maintenance and repair services. This may also involve customizing machinery to meet specific requirements in the textile, apparel, and leather production industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other machinery for textiles, apparel and leather production n.e.c.
Description: The production of specialized machinery used in the textile, apparel, and leather industries, not elsewhere classified. This involves the design, manufacture, and sale of a range of equipment such as weaving machines, knitting machines, sewing machines, and leather processing machines. Services may also include the installation, maintenance, and repair of these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for making paper pulp, paper, paperboard and articles of paper board
Description: Production of machinery specifically designed for creating paper pulp, paper, paperboard, and articles of paper board. This involves the design, assembly, and maintenance of specialized equipment used in the paper production process, such as pulp making machines, paper mills, and paperboard manufacturing units. Services may also include providing spare parts and technical support for these machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of machinery for working soft rubber or plastics or for the manufacture of products of these materials
Description: Production of machinery specifically designed for processing soft rubber or plastics, and for the fabrication of products made from these materials. This involves the design, assembly, and maintenance of such machinery. Typical processes may include molding, extrusion, and other forms of plastic or rubber shaping. Services may also encompass troubleshooting and repairs, as well as providing technical support and training for machine operation.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of printing and bookbinding machines and machines for activities supporting printing on a variety of materials (other than textiles)
Description: Production of printing and bookbinding machines designed for various materials excluding textiles. This involves the creation of machinery that supports various printing activities, such as offset, digital, and flexographic printing. The business may also manufacture machines for bookbinding, including those used for binding styles like saddle stitching, perfect binding, and coil binding. The process typically includes design, assembly, testing, and distribution of these specialized machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c.
Class Name: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other special-purpose machinery n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of special-purpose machinery that does not fall under any other specific category. This includes creating custom machinery designed for specific industrial tasks or unique applications. Processes involved may range from conceptualization and design, to manufacturing, assembly, and maintenance services for these specialized machines.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of passenger cars
Description: Production of passenger cars, encompassing the design, assembly, and testing of vehicles designed for personal use. Typical processes involved in this business activity include sourcing and fabrication of parts, assembly line production, quality control, and safety testing. This also includes the manufacture of electric and hybrid passenger cars.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of commercial vehicles such as vans, lorries, over-the-road tractors for semi-trailers etc.
Description: Production of commercial vehicles like vans, lorries, and over-the-road tractors for semi-trailers. This involves designing, assembling, and testing of these vehicles. Services may also include customization of vehicles based on specific client requirements and providing after-sales support such as repair and maintenance.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of chassis fitted with engines for the motor vehicles included in this class
Description: The manufacturing of motor vehicle chassis fitted with engines involves the production and assembly of vehicle frames equipped with engines. This process includes designing and constructing the structural base of a motor vehicle, integrating the engine into the chassis, and ensuring proper fitting and functionality. The finished product is intended for inclusion in the manufacture of complete motor vehicles.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicle engines
Description: The business activity involves the production of motor vehicle engines. Core operations include the design, assembly, and testing of engines specifically designed for use in motor vehicles. This may encompass a variety of engine types, such as petrol, diesel, or hybrid engines. Services provided could also involve customization of engines to meet specific vehicle requirements, quality assurance testing, and post-production maintenance or repair services.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles n.e.c.
Description: Production of various types of motor vehicles not elsewhere classified, such as automobiles, trucks, and buses. This involves processes like assembling of vehicle parts, testing for quality control, and finalizing the product for market release. It may also include customization of vehicles based on customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bodies, including cabs for motor vehicles
Description: The manufacturing of bodies, including cabs for motor vehicles, involves the production and assembly of the main parts of motor vehicles, such as the body and cab. This includes the fabrication of car frames, truck cabs, and other vehicle bodies, often from metal or fiberglass. The process may also involve the installation of interior fittings, such as seating and safety features. These products are typically intended for use in the automotive industry, either for new vehicle production or for repairs and replacements in existing vehicles.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers for transport of goods or passengers
Description: The manufacturing of trailers and semi-trailers designed for the transportation of goods or passengers. This involves the production processes such as design, assembly, and finishing of trailers and semi-trailers. These vehicles are typically attached to motor vehicles for additional cargo or passenger capacity. The business operations may also include the provision of repair and maintenance services for the manufactured trailers and semi-trailers.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Class Name: Manufacture of bodies (coachwork) for motor vehicles; manufacture of trailers and semi-trailers
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other attachments to motor vehicles n.e.c.
Description: The business activity involves the production of bodies, also known as coachwork, for motor vehicles. This includes the design and construction of trailers and semi-trailers. Additionally, the operation includes the manufacturing of various other attachments for motor vehicles not elsewhere classified. The typical processes involved are design, assembly, and installation of these components, ensuring they meet industry standards and customer specifications. Services may also include the repair or modification of these vehicle bodies and attachments.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of diverse parts and accessories for motor vehicles such as brakes, gearboxes, axles,road wheels, suspension shock absorbers, radiators, silencers, exhaust pipes, catalysers, clutches, ste
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various parts and accessories for motor vehicles. This includes the production of essential components like brakes, gearboxes, axles, road wheels, suspension shock absorbers, radiators, silencers, exhaust pipes, catalysers, and clutches. Operations typically involve sourcing raw materials, processing these materials into finished parts, and conducting quality checks to ensure they meet necessary standards for vehicle assembly and safety. Services may also include custom manufacturing for specific vehicle models or designs.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles

Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories of bodies for motor vehicles such as safety belts, airbags,doors, bumpers
Description: The business activity involves the production of parts and accessories specifically designed for motor vehicle bodies. This includes the manufacture of safety components such as safety belts and airbags, as well as structural elements like doors and bumpers. The operations typically include design, fabrication, assembly, and testing of these parts to ensure they meet safety and quality standards. The end products are then supplied to automobile manufacturers or aftermarket suppliers for vehicle assembly or replacement parts.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of car seats
Description: Production of car seats and related components for motor vehicles, encompassing design, assembly, and finishing processes. This business activity typically involves fabricating frames, padding, and covers, as well as integrating features such as seat belts, headrests, and adjustable mechanisms. Services may also include customization and retrofitting of car seats to meet specific customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers
Group Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of motor vehicle electrical equipment, such as generators, alternators, spark plugs,ignition wiring harnesses, power window and door systems, assembly of purchased gauges into instrument p
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of electrical equipment for motor vehicles. This includes the production of generators, alternators, spark plugs, ignition wiring harnesses, and power window and door systems. It also involves the assembly of purchased gauges into instrument panels. These processes are integral to the functioning of various vehicle systems and contribute to the overall performance and safety of motor vehicles.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment

Description: The construction of commercial vessels such as passenger ships, ferry-boats, cargo ships, tankers, tugs, and hovercraft (excluding recreation-type hovercraft). This involves designing, building, and assembling various types of marine vessels intended for commercial use. Services may include the fabrication of ship parts, hull assembly, outfitting, and final ship testing.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment

Sub-class Name: Building of warships and scientific investigation ships etc.
Description: Construction and assembly of warships and scientific investigation ships, which involves design, fabrication of ship parts, assembly, testing, and launching. This also includes the installation of ship systems such as navigation, propulsion, and weaponry for warships, or specialized equipment for scientific investigation ships.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Building of ships and floating structures
Sub-class Name: Building of fishing boats and fish-processing factory vessels
Description: Construction and assembly of fishing boats and fish-processing factory vessels, encompassing design, fabrication, and outfitting processes. This business activity also includes the installation of machinery and equipment necessary for catching and processing fish on board.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Building of ships and floating structures
Sub-class Name: Construction of floating or submersible drilling platforms
Description: Building ships and floating structures, specifically the construction of floating or submersible drilling platforms, involves designing, assembling, and testing these structures. Typical processes may include drafting blueprints, sourcing materials, welding and assembling parts, and conducting quality assurance tests. Services provided may also encompass maintenance and repair of these drilling platforms. This business activity is crucial for offshore oil and gas exploration and extraction industries.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Building of ships and floating structures
Sub-class Name: Construction of floating structures ( floating docks, pontoons, coffer-dams, floating landing stages, buoys, floating tanks, barges, lighters, floating cranes, non-recreational inflatable rafts etc.)
Description: Building of ships and floating structures involves the construction and assembly of various marine vessels and floating structures such as floating docks, pontoons, coffer-dams, floating landing stages, buoys, floating tanks, barges, lighters, floating cranes, and non-recreational inflatable rafts. The core business operations can include design, fabrication, assembly, maintenance, and repair of these structures. This may also involve the installation of machinery and equipment necessary for the functioning and operation of these structures.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Building of pleasure and sporting boats
Sub-class Name: Building of pleasure and sporting boats
Description: The construction and assembly of pleasure and sporting boats, including yachts, sailboats, motorboats, and other recreational watercraft. This business activity involves designing and building boats tailored to leisure activities such as fishing, water sports, or cruising. Services may also include repair, maintenance, and customization of these boats as per customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electric, diesel, steam and other rail locomotives
Description: The business activity entails the production of various types of rail locomotives such as electric, diesel, and steam locomotives. Core operations involve designing and assembling locomotives, installing and testing locomotive engines and parts, and providing maintenance and repair services for the produced locomotives. This may also include the manufacture of locomotive frames and parts, as well as the conversion and refurbishment of old locomotives.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of self-propelled railway or tramway coaches, vans and trucks, maintenance or service vehicles
Description: The business activity involves the production of self-propelled railway or tramway coaches, vans, and trucks, as well as maintenance or service vehicles. This includes designing, assembling, and testing these vehicles for functionality and safety. Additionally, it encompasses the provision of repair and maintenance services to ensure the vehicles' optimal performance and longevity.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of railway or tramway rolling stock, not self-propelled (passenger coaches, goods vans tank wagons, self-discharging vans and wagons, workshop vans, crane vans, tenders etc.
Description: The production of non-self-propelled railway or tramway rolling stock forms the core of this business activity. This includes the manufacture of various types of rolling stock such as passenger coaches, goods vans, tank wagons, self-discharging vans and wagons, workshop vans, crane vans, and tenders. These operations typically involve design, assembly, and production processes, as well as quality control and testing to ensure the safety and efficiency of the final products.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of specialized parts of railway or tramway locomotives or of rolling stock (bogies, axles and wheels, brakes and parts of brakes; hooks and coupling devices, buffers and buffer parts; shoc
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of specialized parts for railway or tramway locomotives and rolling stock. Key operations include the production of bogies, axles and wheels, brakes and parts of brakes, hooks and coupling devices, buffers and buffer parts, shock absorbers, and other specialized components. These processes require advanced engineering and precision manufacturing techniques to ensure the safety and efficiency of the railway and tramway systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mechanical and electro-mechanical signalling safety and traffic control equipment for railways, tramways, inland waterways, roads, parking facilities, airfields etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of mechanical and electro-mechanical signalling safety and traffic control equipment. This includes the design, manufacture, and installation of these systems for various modes of transportation such as railways, tramways, and inland waterways, as well as for roads, parking facilities, and airfields. The process typically includes the creation of traffic lights, railway signals, road signs, parking meters, and similar devices that help control traffic and ensure safety. This may also involve providing maintenance and repair services for these systems.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Class Name: Manufacture of railway locomotives and rolling stock
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mining locomotives and mining rail cars
Description: The business activity involves the production of railway locomotives and rolling stock specifically designed for mining operations. This includes the manufacturing process of mining locomotives and mining rail cars, which are used to transport mined materials. The operations typically include designing, assembling, testing, and maintenance of these specialized railway vehicles. Services may also encompass custom manufacturing based on specific mining requirements and conditions, and providing after-sales services such as repairs and parts replacement.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Class Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of airplanes
Description: Production and assembly of various types of airplanes, including commercial, military, and private aircraft. This involves designing and manufacturing airplane parts, assembling them into a complete aircraft, and conducting necessary tests for safety and performance. Services may also include maintenance and repair of airplanes.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Class Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of helicopters
Description: Business activity in this sub-class involves the production of helicopters, which includes designing, assembling, and testing of these aircrafts. Typical processes include the construction of airframes, rotors and other key components, as well as integrating avionic systems. Post-production services such as maintenance, repair, and overhaul of helicopters may also be provided.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Class Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gliders, hang-gliders, dirigibles and hot air balloons and other non-powered aircraft
Description: Production and assembly of gliders, hang-gliders, dirigibles, hot air balloons, and other non-powered aircraft. This involves designing and manufacturing lightweight frames and structures, integrating control systems, and testing for safety and performance. It may also include the provision of maintenance services and parts for these types of aircraft.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Class Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of spacecraft and launch vehicles, satellites, planetary probes,orbital stations, shuttles, intercontinental ballistic (ICBM) and similar missiles
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of spacecraft and launch vehicles, satellites, planetary probes, orbital stations, shuttles, and intercontinental ballistic (ICBM) missiles. Core operations include design, assembly, testing, and maintenance of these aerospace products. Services may also encompass the development of related machinery and technologies, as well as the provision of technical consulting in aerospace manufacturing.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Group Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Class Name: Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories of the aircraft and spacecraft of this class (major assemblies such as fuselages, wings, doors, control surfaces, landing gear, fuel tanks, nacelles, airscrews, he
Description: The business activity involves the manufacturing of various parts and accessories for aircraft and spacecraft. This includes the production of major assemblies such as fuselages, wings, doors, control surfaces, landing gear, fuel tanks, nacelles, and airscrews. The operations typically involve various processes such as design, fabrication, assembly, and testing of these components to ensure they meet the necessary aviation standards.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of military fighting vehicles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of weapons and ammunition
Description: Production of military combat vehicles, including tanks and armored vehicles, designed for warfare. This also involves the manufacturing of various types of weapons and ammunition such as guns, bombs, missiles, and other military grade weaponry. Typical processes include design, assembly, testing, and maintenance of these military products.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of motorcycles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of motorcycles, scooters, mopeds etc. and their engine
Description: Production and assembly of motorcycles, scooters, mopeds, and other similar vehicles along with their engines. This involves design, engineering, and manufacturing processes, including fabrication of parts, assembly, testing, and quality control. Services may also include customization of these vehicles as per customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of motorcycles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of three-wheelers and their engine
Description: Production and assembly of three-wheeler vehicles and their engines. This business activity involves the design, manufacture, and assembly of three-wheeled motorcycles, including the production of their engines. Typical processes include sourcing and processing raw materials, fabrication of motorcycle parts, engine assembly, product testing, and quality control. This may also involve customization of three-wheelers as per customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of motorcycles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories of three wheelers and motorcycles including side cars
Description: Production and assembly of parts and accessories specifically designed for three wheelers, motorcycles, and side cars. This involves processes such as designing, fabricating, testing and selling components such as engines, brakes, exhausts, seats, and other related parts. The business may also provide services like customization and repair of these motorcycle and three-wheeler parts.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of bicycles and invalid carriages
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of non-motorized bicycles and other cycles, including cycle-rickshaws, (delivery) tricycles, tandems, children's bicycles and tricycles, baby carriages
Description: The business activity involves the production of non-motorized bicycles and other cycles. This includes the manufacturing of various types of bicycles such as cycle-rickshaws, delivery tricycles, tandems, children's bicycles, and tricycles. The operation also extends to the production of baby carriages. The typical processes involved in this business include designing, assembling, and testing of these products to ensure they meet safety and quality standards. Services may also include customization of bicycles and carriages based on customer requirements.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of bicycles and invalid carriages
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of invalid carriages with or without motor
Description: Production and assembly of invalid carriages, which can be either motorized or non-motorized. This involves designing and manufacturing carriages specifically for individuals with disabilities or mobility impairments. Services may also include customization of carriages to meet specific needs, maintenance, repair, and potential upgrades.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of bicycles and invalid carriages
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of parts and accessories for bicycles, cycle -rickshaws and invalid carriages
Description: The business activity involves the production of parts and accessories for bicycles, cycle-rickshaws, and invalid carriages. Core operations include the design, manufacturing, and assembly of various components such as frames, wheels, pedals, seats, handlebars, and other related accessories. The process may also involve customization of parts to meet specific customer requirements, quality testing of produced parts, and supply of these components to bicycle, cycle-rickshaw, and invalid carriage manufacturers.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of vehicles drawn by animals
Description: The business activity involves the production of transport equipment specifically designed to be pulled by animals. This typically includes the design, assembly, and manufacture of items such as horse-drawn carriages, ox carts, and other similar vehicles. The process may involve both traditional craftsmanship and modern manufacturing techniques. Services may also include maintenance, repair, and customization of these animal-drawn vehicles.

Division Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment
Class Name: Manufacture of other transport equipment n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other transport equipments n.e.c. such as pushcarts, handcarts etc
Description: The business activity involves the production of various types of transport equipment not classified elsewhere, such as pushcarts and handcarts. Core operations include designing, assembling, and manufacturing these items, often customized to specific customer requirements. Services may also include maintenance and repair of the produced equipment.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of furniture made of wood
Description: Production and assembly of wooden furniture, including chairs, tables, beds and cabinets. This involves processes such as cutting, shaping and finishing wood, as well as assembling the final product.
