Services may also include custom design and crafting of wooden furniture according to customer specifications.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of furniture made of cane & reed
Description: Production and sale of furniture made from cane and reed materials, including chairs, tables, beds, and other related products. The business operations typically involve sourcing and processing of raw materials, designing furniture, assembling, and final finishing. Services may also include customization of furniture based on customer specifications and after-sales services such as delivery and installation.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of furniture primarily of metal
Description: Business activity encompasses the production of furniture primarily made of metal. This involves processes such as designing, cutting, bending, and assembling various types of metal to create furniture items. The product range can include chairs, tables, beds, cabinets, and other metal-based furnishings. Services may also extend to customizing metal furniture based on specific client requirements, including size, design, and finish.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of furniture primarily of plastic
Description: Production and assembly of furniture primarily made from plastic materials. This involves the process of designing, molding, and assembling various types of plastic furniture such as chairs, tables, cabinets, and other related products. Services may also include customization of furniture based on customer specifications and the sale of these products to retailers or directly to consumers.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of mattresses and pillows
Description: Production and assembly of mattresses and pillows, involving processes such as cutting, sewing, and stuffing materials. This includes manufacturing of various types of mattresses like foam, innerspring, waterbed, air, and other related products. It also covers the production of different types of pillows, such as bed pillows, travel pillows, orthopedic pillows, and decorative pillows.

Division Name: Manufacture of furniture
Class Name: Manufacture of furniture
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other furniture n.e.c.
Description: Production of various types of furniture not classified elsewhere, including the design, crafting, and assembly of unique or custom-made furniture pieces. This can involve working with a range of materials such as wood, metal, glass, and textiles, and may include services like furniture repair, restoration, and upholstery.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of jewellery of gold, silver and other precious or base metal metal clad with precious metals or precious or semi-precious stones, or of combinations of precious metal and precious or semi
Description: The business activity involves the production of jewellery made from gold, silver, and other precious or base metals that are clad with precious metals or adorned with precious or semi-precious stones. This also includes the manufacture of jewellery items that are a combination of precious metal and precious or semi-precious stones. Core operations typically include sourcing and processing of raw materials, designing, crafting, and polishing the final jewellery pieces, and possibly setting or inlaying stones.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Working of diamonds and other precious and semi-precious stones including the working of industrial quality stones and synthetic or reconstructed precious or semi-precious stones
Description: The business activity involves the processing and handling of diamonds, as well as other precious and semi-precious stones, including those of industrial quality and synthetic or reconstructed variants. Core operations include cutting, polishing, shaping, and setting these stones for use in jewellery and related articles. This may also encompass the creation of gemstone replicas using synthetic materials.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Production of worked pearls
Description: The business activity involves the production and processing of worked pearls, a key component in the manufacture of jewellery and related articles. Core operations typically include sourcing, shaping, polishing, and drilling pearls for use in various types of jewelry. This may also encompass the production of pearl inlays for decorative or artistic purposes.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of coins, including coins for use as legal tender, whether or not of precious metal
Description: The business activity involves the production of coins, which may be used as legal tender. This includes the design, minting, and distribution of coins, regardless of whether they are made from precious metals. The process typically involves engraving designs on metal blanks, pressing them into coins, and ensuring their quality and legality for circulation.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other articles of gold, silver and other precious and semi precious metal and stone
Description: Creating various articles from gold, silver, and other precious or semi-precious metals and stones. This involves processes such as designing, cutting, polishing, and setting stones, as well as casting, forging, and finishing metal pieces. The end products can range from jewelry items like rings, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings to other precious metal and stone articles.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of jewellery, bijouterie and related articles
Class Name: Manufacture of imitation jewellery and related articles
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of imitation jewellery and related articles
Description: Production and creation of imitation jewellery and related articles, involving the use of non-precious metals, plastic, and other materials to mimic the look of real jewellery. This includes the design, assembly, and finishing processes of rings, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and other types of jewellery. It also involves the manufacture of related articles such as costume jewellery, novelty jewellery, and other fashion accessories.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of stringed instruments (non-electronic)
Description: Production and assembly of non-electronic stringed instruments, such as violins, guitars, and cellos. This involves crafting the body and neck of the instrument, string fitting, and quality testing for sound. It may also include the creation of custom-made instruments as per customer specifications.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wind instruments, accordions, harmonium and similar instruments and mouth organs
Description: Production and assembly of wind instruments, accordions, harmoniums, mouth organs, and similar musical instruments. This involves processes such as the crafting of instrument parts, assembly, tuning, and quality control to ensure sound precision and quality. Services may also include repair and maintenance of these musical instruments.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of percussion musical instruments
Description: Production and assembly of percussion musical instruments such as drums, cymbals, and xylophones. This involves sourcing and processing raw materials, designing and crafting individual instrument components, assembling the final product, and conducting quality checks to ensure optimal sound and performance. Services may also include customization of instruments to meet specific client requirements.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments, the sound of which is produced electronically
Description: Production of musical instruments that generate sound electronically, including activities such as design, assembly, and testing. This typically involves the creation of synthesizers, electronic keyboards, digital pianos, and other electronic music devices. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these instruments.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of musical instruments
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other musical instruments n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various musical instruments not elsewhere classified, such as traditional, ethnic, or experimental instruments. This may involve crafting parts, assembling components, tuning instruments, and performing quality checks. It can also include providing repair services and custom modifications for these instruments.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of sports goods
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of sports goods
Description: Production and assembly of sports goods such as balls, bats, rackets, gloves, protective gear, and other sports equipment. This involves sourcing raw materials, designing and shaping the goods, and ensuring quality control for the finished products. It may also include customization of sports equipment and providing repair services for the same.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of dolls and toy animals
Description: Production of dolls and toy animals, encompassing the design, creation, and assembly of various types of dolls and stuffed or plastic toy animals. This may involve the fabrication of individual parts, painting, stuffing, sewing, and final assembly of the toys. The business activity also includes quality control, packaging, and distribution of the finished products.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of wheeled toys designed to be ridden, including plastic bicycles and tricycles
Description: Production of ride-on toys such as plastic bicycles and tricycles. This involves the design, manufacturing, and assembly of wheeled toys intended for riding. Services may include custom production, quality testing, and distribution of these toys.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of pin-tables, coin-operated games, billiards, special tables for casino games, etc.
Description: The production and assembly of pin-tables, coin-operated games, billiards, and special tables for casino games. This involves designing and manufacturing various types of gaming equipment, which may include sourcing materials, assembly, quality control, and distribution to retailers or direct to consumers. It could also involve the creation of custom or bespoke gaming tables for casinos or private customers.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of playing cards
Description: Production and distribution of playing cards, involving the design, printing, cutting, and packaging processes. This also includes the creation of customized or special edition playing cards.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of electronic games
Description: Production and assembly of electronic games, such as video games, handheld games, and console games. This involves designing game software, creating graphics and sound effects, coding, and testing for quality assurance. It also includes the manufacture of physical components like game cartridges or discs, consoles, controllers, and accessories.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Manufacture of games and toys
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other games and toys n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of a diverse range of games and toys not classified elsewhere. This involves designing, creating, and marketing various types of toys and games, including but not limited to board games, dolls, action figures, puzzles, and educational toys. Services may also include customization of toys and games based on customer demand.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of dental fillings and cements (except denture adhesive or cement), dental wax and other dental plaster preparations; manufacture of dental laboratory furnaces, dental instruments, artific
Description: The business activity involves the production of dental fillings and cements, excluding denture adhesives or cements, as well as dental wax and other dental plaster preparations. It also includes the manufacture of dental laboratory furnaces and dental instruments. The core operations typically involve processes such as product design, material sourcing, manufacturing, quality control, and distribution to dental clinics, hospitals, or dental supply companies.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of laboratory apparatus (laboratory ultrasonic cleaning machinery, laboratory sterilizers, laboratory type distilling apparatus, laboratory centrifuges etc.)
Description: Production and supply of laboratory apparatus such as ultrasonic cleaning machinery, sterilizers, distilling apparatus, and centrifuges. This involves designing, manufacturing, and maintaining these instruments, which are crucial for various laboratory procedures and tests. The business may also provide after-sales services like repair and calibration of these devices.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of medical, surgical, dental or veterinary furniture such as operating tables,examination tables, dentists' chairs etc.
Description: The production of medical, surgical, dental or veterinary furniture such as operating tables, examination tables, and dentists' chairs. This involves the design, manufacturing, and selling of specialized furniture used in healthcare settings. Typical processes may include sourcing of materials, fabrication, quality control, and distribution to healthcare facilities.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of bone plates and screws, syringes, needles, catheters, cannulae, etc.
Description: The business activity involves the production of various medical and dental instruments and supplies. The core operations include the manufacturing of bone plates and screws, which are typically used in surgical procedures to fix broken bones. It also involves the production of syringes and needles, essential tools for administering medications or drawing fluids. The manufacturing of catheters and cannulae, used for draining fluids or delivering treatments directly into veins or other body cavities, is also a key part of the operations. These processes may involve design, assembly, sterilization, and quality control testing to ensure the safety and effectiveness of the medical and dental instruments and supplies.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of measuring instruments such as thermometers etc.
Description: The manufacturing of medical and dental instruments and supplies involves the creation of various tools and equipment used in the healthcare industry. This includes the production of measuring instruments such as thermometers, which are essential for monitoring patients' health. The business operations may include design and development, production, quality control, and distribution of these instruments. Services provided could also involve the maintenance and repair of these instruments.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of orthopedic and prosthetic devices
Description: Production of orthopedic and prosthetic devices, including artificial limbs, braces, and supports designed to aid in mobility or correct physical function. This involves processes such as design, fabrication, fitting, and adjustment of these devices according to the specific needs of patients. Services may also include maintenance and repair of these devices.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of ophthalmic goods, eyeglasses, sunglasses, lenses ground to prescription, contact lenses, safety goggles etc.
Description: Production and supply of ophthalmic goods such as eyeglasses, sunglasses, and safety goggles. This involves grinding lenses to match prescriptions, manufacturing contact lenses, and other related optical products. The core operations include designing, creating, and distributing these optical items for medical, dental, and safety use.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Group Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Class Name: Manufacture of medical and dental instruments and supplies
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other medical and dental instruments n.e.c.
Description: Production and assembly of various medical and dental instruments not elsewhere classified, such as surgical tools, dental drills, and other specialized equipment. This involves processes like designing, prototyping, testing, and manufacturing. It also includes the provision of related services such as maintenance and repair of these instruments.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Other manufacturing n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of stationary articles such as pens and pencils of all kinds whether or not mechanical, pencil leads, date, sealing or numbering stamps, hand-operated devices for printing or embossing lab
Description: Production of various stationary items such as all types of pens and pencils, including mechanical ones, and pencil leads. This also involves the creation of date, sealing or numbering stamps, and hand-operated devices used for printing or embossing labels. The processes typically include designing, manufacturing, and distributing these stationary products.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Other manufacturing n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of protective safety equipment (fire-resistant and protective safety clothing, linemen's safety belts and other belts for occupational use, cork life preservers, plastics hard hats and oth
Description: The manufacturing of protective safety equipment involves the production of various safety items such as fire-resistant clothing, protective safety attire, linemen's safety belts and other belts for occupational use. It also includes the creation of cork life preservers and plastic hard hats. The core business operations involve the design, production, and distribution of these safety products to ensure the protection of individuals in various occupational fields.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Other manufacturing n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of umbrellas, sun-umbrellas, walking sticks, seat-stick
Description: Production of umbrellas and sun-umbrellas, including the assembly of various components like handles, shafts, and canopy. This also involves the manufacturing of walking sticks and seat-sticks, which may include carving, shaping, and finishing processes. The provision of related services such as repair or customization may also be part of the business operations.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Other manufacturing n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of articles of personal use such as cigarette lighters, smoking pipes, combs, hair slides, scent sprays, vacuum flasks and other vacuum vessels for personal or household use, wigs, false b
Description: The manufacturing of personal use items such as cigarette lighters, smoking pipes, combs, hair slides, scent sprays, and vacuum flasks. This also includes the production of other vacuum vessels for personal or household use, and items like wigs and false beards. The core operations involve the design, production, and distribution of these products, often involving processes such as molding, assembly, and packaging.

Division Name: Other manufacturing
Class Name: Other manufacturing n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of other articles n.e.c.
Description: Engaged in a variety of manufacturing activities not classified elsewhere, this business typically involves the production of diverse goods using various materials and techniques. The processes can range from designing and prototyping to assembly, inspection, and packaging. Services may also include customization of products based on client specifications, quality assurance, and after-sales support.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of fabricated metal products
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of structural products
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the repair and maintenance of structural metal products. These operations typically involve the restoration of metal structures such as buildings, bridges, and towers. Services may include welding, replacing damaged parts, corrosion control, strengthening or reinforcing structural elements, and general maintenance tasks to ensure the integrity and functionality of the metal products.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of fabricated metal products
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of pipes and pipelines
Description: Business operations in this category focus on the repair and maintenance of pipes and pipelines made from fabricated metal products. Typical services provided include diagnosing pipe or pipeline issues, performing repairs or replacements, and conducting regular maintenance checks to ensure optimal functionality. This may involve tasks such as fixing leaks, removing blockages, or replacing damaged sections of pipes or pipelines.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of fabricated metal products
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of metal tanks, reservoirs, containers, steel shipping drums etc.
Description: Business operations in this category primarily involve the repair and maintenance of various fabricated metal products, specifically metal tanks, reservoirs, containers, and steel shipping drums. Typical services provided include diagnosing and fixing damages, performing regular checks to ensure functionality, replacing worn-out parts, and conducting necessary modifications or improvements. These activities are essential to prolong the life and enhance the performance of these metal products.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of fabricated metal products
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of steam or other vapour generators and auxiliary plant for use with steam generators such as condensers, economizers, superheaters, steam collectors and accumulators
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the repair and maintenance of steam or other vapour generators and auxiliary plants. These auxiliary plants are typically used with steam generators and include components such as condensers, economizers, superheaters, steam collectors and accumulators. The typical services provided by these businesses include routine maintenance, fault diagnosis, repair or replacement of faulty parts, and overall system checks to ensure optimal functioning of the steam or vapour generators and their auxiliary plants.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of fabricated metal products
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of other fabricated metal products
Description: The business activity involves the repair and upkeep of various fabricated metal products that are not specifically classified elsewhere. Typical operations include diagnosing issues, performing repairs, and conducting regular maintenance to ensure the longevity and functionality of these metal products. Services may encompass welding, soldering, replacing parts, or applying protective coatings, among other repair techniques.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of engines and turbines excluding aircraft, vehicle and cycle engines
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the repair and maintenance of engines and turbines, except those used in aircraft, vehicles, and cycles. Typical operations include diagnosing faults, replacing damaged components, carrying out routine service checks, and ensuring the optimal performance of engines and turbines. This can involve a range of engines and turbines used in various industrial and manufacturing applications.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of pumps and related equipment, fluid power equipment, valves
Description: Business activities in this category involve the repair and maintenance of pumps and related equipment, as well as fluid power equipment and valves. Typical services provided include diagnosing and fixing issues with machinery, routine maintenance checks, replacing worn-out parts, and ensuring the optimal functioning of equipment. This could cover a variety of equipment types, from industrial pumps and hydraulic systems to various kinds of valves used in different industries.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of metal cutting and metal forming machine tools and accessories, power-driven hand-tools and other machine tools
Description: The business activity involves the repair and maintenance of a wide range of machine tools. This includes metal cutting and metal forming machine tools and accessories, power-driven hand-tools, and other machine tools. Typical services provided may encompass troubleshooting, repairing, and maintaining these tools to ensure their optimal performance and longevity. The operations could also involve replacing worn-out parts, fine-tuning the machinery for improved efficiency, and conducting regular checks to prevent breakdowns.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of agricultural machinery and forestry and logging machinery including agricultural tractors
Description: The business activity involves the repair and maintenance of agricultural machinery and forestry and logging machinery, including agricultural tractors. Core operations include diagnosing and fixing mechanical issues, performing routine checks and services, replacing worn-out parts, and ensuring machinery is in optimal working condition. Services might also include on-site repairs and emergency breakdown assistance for agricultural and forestry machinery.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of mining, construction, and oil and gas field machinery; metallurgy machinery
Description: Businesses in this category specialize in the repair and maintenance of machinery used in mining, construction, and oil and gas fields, as well as metallurgy machinery. Typical services include troubleshooting and fixing mechanical faults, conducting regular maintenance checks, replacing worn-out parts, and ensuring optimal operation of heavy-duty machinery. These activities are crucial for the smooth operation of industries that rely heavily on such machinery.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of food, beverage, and tobacco processing machinery
Description: Businesses in this category specialize in the repair and maintenance of machinery used in the processing of food, beverages, and tobacco. Typical activities include diagnosing issues, performing repairs, conducting routine maintenance checks, and replacing parts on a variety of processing equipment such as mixers, ovens, grinders, and packaging machines. Services may also involve providing technical advice or training to operators on machinery use and maintenance.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of textile apparel, leather production machinery and papermaking machinery
Description: The business activity involves the repair and maintenance of machinery used in the production of textile apparel, leather, and papermaking. Core operations include diagnosing mechanical issues, performing repairs, routine servicing, and preventive maintenance to ensure optimal functioning of these industrial machines. Services may also include the replacement of worn-out parts, calibration of machinery for precise operations, and providing technical support.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of machinery
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of other special purpose machinery of division 28 (weighing equipment,vending machines, cash registers, photocopy machines, calculators, typewriters etc.)
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are typically involved in the repair and maintenance of various special purpose machinery, including but not limited to weighing equipment, vending machines, cash registers, photocopy machines, calculators, typewriters and more. This could involve troubleshooting and diagnosing issues, replacing worn or damaged parts, performing routine servicing to ensure optimal operation, and restoring machinery to its original working condition. The service is often provided on a contractual basis or as and when required by customers.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of electronic and optical equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of measuring, testing, navigating and control equipment of group 265
Description: Business activity in this category involves the repair and maintenance of measuring, testing, navigating, and control equipment. This typically includes services like diagnosing and fixing faults in electronic and optical devices, replacing defective parts, and conducting routine maintenance checks. The equipment serviced can range from precision measuring tools to navigation systems and industrial control equipment.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of electronic and optical equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of irradiation, electromedical and electro theraputic equipmemts of class 2660
Description: Business operations under this classification involve the repair and maintenance of irradiation, electromedical, and electrotherapeutic equipment. Typical processes include diagnosing and fixing faults, replacing defective parts, and conducting regular maintenance checks to ensure equipment functionality. Services may also encompass on-site repairs, preventive maintenance, and providing guidance on the proper usage of these medical and therapeutic devices.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of electronic and optical equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of optical instruments and equipment of class 2670
Description: Business operations under this classification primarily involve the repair and maintenance of optical instruments and equipment, such as microscopes, binoculars, telescopes, and other precision optical devices. Typical services provided include diagnosing and fixing hardware issues, replacing damaged parts, performing routine maintenance checks, and ensuring the optimal functionality of these devices. This class is specifically related to the equipment categorized under class 2670.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of electrical equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair of electrical equipment
Description: Business activity involves the repair and maintenance of electrical equipment. This includes fixing malfunctioning or broken electrical devices, replacing worn out parts, and restoring equipment to optimal working condition. Services typically provided can range from small-scale repairs like fixing household appliances, to large-scale repairs of industrial machinery or power generation equipment. The operations may also involve troubleshooting to identify specific issues, providing routine maintenance services, and offering consultation on equipment usage and safety measures.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of transport equipment, except motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Repair of transport equipment, except motor vehicles
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the repair and maintenance of various types of transport equipment, excluding motor vehicles. This covers a wide range of equipment such as aircraft, rail vehicles, ships, and boats. Typical operations include diagnosing faults, repairing or replacing defective parts, and performing routine maintenance checks. Services may also extend to the restoration of transport equipment, improving their functionality and extending their lifespan.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment
Class Name: Repair of other equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair of other equipment
Description: The business activity involves the repair and maintenance of various types of equipment not specified elsewhere. This can include a wide range of machinery and devices used in different industries. Typical operations may involve diagnosing issues, replacing faulty parts, performing routine maintenance checks, and restoring the equipment to its optimal working condition. Services might also include providing consultation on equipment usage and maintenance, and offering emergency repair services.

Division Name: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
Group Name: Installation of industrial machinery and equipment
Class Name: Installation of industrial machinery and equipment
Sub-class Name: Installation of industrial machinery and equipment
Description: The business activity involves the installation of industrial machinery and equipment, including tasks such as setting up, aligning, and leveling machines. This process may also involve the assembly of machinery components, the connection of electrical wiring, and the testing and troubleshooting of installed equipment. Services provided can range from the initial installation of new machinery to the replacement or upgrade of existing industrial equipment.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation by hydroelectric power plants
Description: Generation of electric power using hydroelectric power plants, encompassing the processes of harnessing water flow to produce electricity, managing power generation systems, and monitoring hydroelectric production facilities. This also involves the transmission and distribution of the generated power to various consumer sectors.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation by coal based thermal power plants
Description: Generation of electric power through coal-based thermal power plants, involving processes such as coal handling, combustion for steam generation, and electricity production through steam turbines. This also includes the transmission and distribution of the produced electricity to various consumers.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation by non-coal based thermal (e.g. diesel, gas )
Description: Generating electric power using non-coal based thermal sources such as diesel and gas. This involves the entire process from production to transmission and distribution. Typical operations may include the setup and maintenance of power plants that use diesel or gas, the generation of electricity through thermal processes, and the transmission and distribution of this electricity to consumers.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation and transmission by nuclear power plants
Description: Generating and transmitting electric power using nuclear energy sources. This involves the operation of nuclear power plants, including the processes of nuclear fission, steam generation, and electricity production. Services may also include the maintenance and monitoring of nuclear reactors, waste management, and ensuring safety protocols.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation using solar energy
Description: Generating electric power using solar energy sources, this involves the installation and operation of solar power plants or solar farms. Typical processes include capturing sunlight with photovoltaic cells, converting it into electricity, and distributing this power to the grid. Services may also encompass maintenance of solar panels and systems, and monitoring of solar energy production.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Electric power generation using other non conventional sources
Description: Generation of electric power using non-traditional or unconventional sources such as solar, wind, geothermal, biomass, or tidal energy. This involves activities like setting up and maintaining power generation infrastructure, converting these energy sources into electricity, and transmitting and distributing the generated power to consumers. Services may also include system operation and control, power quality management, and infrastructure repair and upgrade.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Transmission of electric energy
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily involved in the transmission of electric energy. This includes the operation of power transmission systems that convey electricity from the generation source to the distribution system. Activities may involve managing transmission infrastructure, such as power lines and substations, and ensuring the efficient and reliable transfer of electricity over long distances. This process also includes the regulation of electricity power levels, maintaining grid stability, and handling any issues related to power transmission.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Class Name: Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
Sub-class Name: Collection and distribution of electric energy to households, industrial, commercial and other users n.e.c.
Description: Business activities involve the gathering and distribution of electric energy to various types of users including households, industrial and commercial entities, and other unspecified users. Core operations include the generation of electricity, its transmission across power grids, and the final distribution to end-users. Services may also encompass the maintenance of power supply networks, ensuring reliable and uninterrupted electricity delivery to all customer categories.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains
Class Name: Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains
Sub-class Name: Manufacture of gas
Description: Producing gas for various purposes such as heating, cooking, and power generation. The process typically involves extracting raw materials, refining and processing them into usable gas. This may also include the purification and odorization of gas to ensure its safe and effective use.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Group Name: Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains
Class Name: Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains
Sub-class Name: Distribution and sale of gaseous fuels through mains
Description: The activity involves the distribution and sale of gaseous fuels such as natural gas, propane, or butane via a network of pipelines, often referred to as mains. Core operations include maintaining the pipeline infrastructure, monitoring gas flow and pressure, ensuring safety standards, and delivering the gas to end consumers. This may also involve meter reading, billing, and customer service for residential, commercial, and industrial clients.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Class Name: Steam and air conditioning supply
Sub-class Name: Production, collection and distribution of steam and hot water for heating, power and other purposes
Description: Businesses in this category are involved in the production, collection, and distribution of steam and hot water for various uses such as heating, power generation, and other applications. Typical operations may include the generation of steam or hot water, the operation of steam distribution systems, and the provision of central air conditioning services. These companies may also be responsible for the maintenance and repair of the related distribution systems.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Class Name: Steam and air conditioning supply
Sub-class Name: Production and distribution of cooled air and chilled water for cooling purposes
Description: Generating and distributing cooled air and chilled water for cooling purposes, such as air conditioning systems. This involves the processes of cooling air or water, managing and maintaining the necessary equipment, and ensuring the efficient delivery of these resources to various facilities for temperature regulation.

Section Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Division Name: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Class Name: Steam and air conditioning supply
Sub-class Name: Production of ice, including ice for food and non-food (e.g. cooling) purposes
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily engaged in the production of ice, which can be used for both food and non-food applications such as cooling. Typical operations include the manufacturing of large ice blocks or smaller ice cubes, packaging, and distribution. These businesses may also provide services related to the supply of steam and air conditioning.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Water collection, treatment and supply
Class Name: Water collection, treatment and supply
Sub-class Name: Water collection, treatment and supply
Description: Collecting water from various sources such as rivers, lakes, and wells, treating it to meet safety and quality standards, and supplying it to residential, commercial, and industrial users. This involves processes like filtration, disinfection, and chemical treatment to ensure the water is safe for consumption or use. In addition, this business activity also includes the maintenance and operation of the infrastructure needed for water distribution like pipelines, water towers, and pumping stations.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Sewerage
Class Name: Sewerage
Sub-class Name: The operation and maintenance of sewer systems
Description: Managing and operating sewer systems, which involves the maintenance and repair of sewer lines, pumps and other related infrastructure. This also includes the monitoring and control of sewage flow, and the implementation of safety and sanitation standards to ensure proper waste disposal and prevent environmental contamination.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Sewerage
Class Name: Sewerage
Sub-class Name: Collecting and transporting of human or industrial waste water or rain water by means of sewerage networks, collectors, tanks and other means of transport (sewage vehicles etc.)
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the collection and transportation of human or industrial wastewater, or rainwater, using sewerage networks, collectors, tanks, and other transport methods such as sewage vehicles. Key activities include managing and maintaining sewerage infrastructure, operating sewage vehicles, and ensuring the safe and efficient transport of wastewater from its origin to treatment facilities or disposal sites.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Sewerage
Class Name: Sewerage
Sub-class Name: Treatment of waste water or sewer by means of physical, chemical or biological processes
Description: Businesses in this sub-class engage in the treatment of waste water or sewer through physical, chemical or biological processes. This involves the purification and cleansing of waste water from residential, industrial, or commercial sources. Typical operations may include the removal of contaminants, the reduction of biochemical oxygen demand (BOD), and the treatment of sludge. Services provided might encompass sewage treatment, effluent treatment, and the operation of waste water treatment plants.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Collection of non-hazardous waste
Sub-class Name: Collection of non-hazardous waste
Description: Gathering and transporting non-hazardous waste from residential, industrial, and commercial sectors. Typical operations involve the use of specialized vehicles and equipment to collect waste like paper, plastic, metal, and other non-hazardous materials. Services may also include sorting and preparing collected waste for recycling or disposal.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Collection of hazardous waste
Sub-class Name: Collection of hazardous waste
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily involved in the gathering and transportation of hazardous waste. Typical operations may include the collection of waste from commercial, industrial, or residential sources that could pose a risk to human health or the environment, such as chemical waste, radioactive waste, and medical waste. Services may also encompass the initial sorting, grouping, and temporary storage of this hazardous waste prior to its treatment or disposal.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste
Sub-class Name: Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste
Description: Businesses under this classification are involved in managing, treating, and disposing of non-hazardous waste. Typical operations include collecting and transporting non-hazardous waste from various sources, processing it through methods such as incineration, composting, recycling, or landfilling, and managing the final disposal of the waste. These businesses also ensure that all waste treatment and disposal activities comply with environmental regulations and standards.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste
Sub-class Name: Treatment and disposal of toxic live or dead animals and other, contaminated waste, disposal of used goods; incineration of hazardous waste
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the treatment and disposal of hazardous waste, including toxic live or dead animals and other contaminated waste. They also manage the disposal of used goods and oversee the incineration of hazardous waste. Typical processes include the collection, transportation, and treatment of hazardous waste, as well as the implementation of safety measures to prevent environmental contamination. Services may also involve waste remediation and clean-up of contaminated sites.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste
Sub-class Name: Treatment, disposal and storage of radioactive nuclear waste
Description: Handling and managing radioactive nuclear waste through a variety of processes such as treatment, disposal, and storage. This may involve activities like safe containment of radioactive materials, conversion of waste into less harmful forms, secure transportation to disposal sites, and long-term storage in designated facilities. The objective is to minimize the risk of radiation exposure and environmental contamination.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Class Name: Materials recovery
Sub-class Name: Materials recovery
Description: Business activities under this classification primarily involve the recovery and recycling of materials from waste. This includes processes such as sorting and collecting waste materials, and transforming them into new products or raw materials for reuse. Services may also include the extraction of valuable components from discarded appliances or electronic equipment, recovery of paper from paper waste, and recycling of metals, glass, and plastic. The aim is to minimize waste and conserve resources through efficient materials recovery operations.

Section Name: Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Division Name: Remediation activities and other waste management services
Group Name: Remediation activities and other waste management services
Class Name: Remediation activities and other waste management services
Sub-class Name: Remediation activities and other waste management services
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the cleanup, containment, removal and treatment of contaminated substances, including soil and water. This also includes waste management services such as collecting, handling, processing, recycling, and disposing of waste materials. Typical processes may involve environmental remediation, hazardous waste management, landfill operation, recycling services, and waste-to-energy conversion.

Division Name: Construction of buildings
Class Name: Construction of buildings
Sub-class Name: Construction of buildings carried out on own-account basis or on a fee or contract basis
Description: The construction of buildings involves planning, designing, and managing the construction process, whether it's done on an own-account basis or on a fee or contract basis. This business activity includes site preparation, laying foundations, and building structures for residential, commercial, and industrial purposes. It encompasses a wide range of tasks such as masonry work, carpentry, plumbing, electrical work, and installing heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems. The work may also involve coordinating with architects, engineers, and other construction professionals to ensure the building meets specific design and safety standards.

Division Name: Construction of buildings
Class Name: Construction of buildings
Sub-class Name: Activities relating to alteration, addition, repair, maintenance carried out on own-account basis or on a fee or contract basis
Description: The business activity encompasses the alteration, addition, repair, and maintenance of buildings. This could be performed on an own-account basis, where the company carries out the work on properties they own, or on a fee or contract basis, where services are provided to clients for a set price or under a specific contract. Typical operations might involve remodeling or extending existing structures, performing necessary repairs to ensure building safety and functionality, and conducting regular maintenance tasks such as painting, roofing, or plumbing work.

Division Name: Construction of buildings
Class Name: Construction of buildings
Sub-class Name: Assembly and erection of prefabricated constructions on the site
Description: The business activity revolves around the assembly and erection of prefabricated constructions on site. This involves the transportation of pre-manufactured building components to the construction site, where they are then assembled and erected to form a complete structure. Typical processes include site preparation, component installation, and finalizing construction. This can cover a range of building types, from residential homes to commercial structures.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of roads and railways
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of motorways, streets, roads, other vehicular and pedestrian ways, highways, bridges, tunnels and subways
Description: Building and maintaining motorways, streets, roads, and other pathways for vehicles and pedestrians, including the construction of highways, bridges, tunnels, and subways. Core operations involve the planning, design, and execution of construction projects, as well as regular maintenance and repair services to ensure safe and efficient transportation routes.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of roads and railways
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of railways and rail-bridges
Description: Building and maintaining railway systems and rail-bridges, encompassing tasks such as designing, constructing, repairing, and servicing railway tracks and bridges. The operations typically involve earthwork, laying of tracks, installation of signaling systems, and regular inspection and maintenance of the railway infrastructure to ensure safety and efficiency.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of roads and railways
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of airfield runways
Description: Building and maintaining airfield runways, which involves tasks such as laying, repairing, and resurfacing the runway surface. This also includes marking runways, installing lighting and signage, and conducting regular inspections for safety and regulatory compliance. Services may also extend to the construction of taxiways and aprons associated with the runway.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of power plants
Description: Building and maintaining power plants, including the construction of structures and infrastructures necessary for power generation. This involves processes such as site preparation, installation of machinery and equipment, and the ongoing maintenance and repair of power plant facilities. Services may also include upgrading existing power plants to improve efficiency or meet regulatory standards.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction/erection and maintenance of power, telecommunication and transmission lines
Description: Building and maintaining power, telecommunication, and transmission lines, which involves tasks such as erecting utility poles, stringing and repairing overhead lines, and installing transformers and other equipment. This business activity may also include the construction of utility projects such as power plants or telecommunication facilities.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction of long distance pipelines or urban pipelines
Description: Building long-distance pipelines or urban pipelines, typically for transporting water, gas, or oil. This involves designing and planning the pipeline routes, digging trenches, laying pipes, and performing maintenance and repairs. The construction process may also include installing associated infrastructure such as pumping stations or valve systems.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of water main and line connection, water reservoirs including irrigation system (canal)
Description: The business activity involves the construction and upkeep of water main and line connections and water reservoirs, including irrigation systems like canals. Core operations include designing, building, and maintaining infrastructure for water delivery and storage. This may encompass laying pipes for water mains, constructing reservoirs for water storage, and developing irrigation systems for agricultural use. Services could also include regular inspection and repair of these structures to ensure their functionality and longevity.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction and repair of sewer systems including sewage disposal plants and pumping stations
Description: Building and repairing sewer systems, including the establishment of sewage disposal plants and pumping stations. This involves the construction of infrastructure for wastewater management, including laying down sewer lines, installing sewer pipes, and maintaining sewer systems. Services also include the building of facilities for sewage treatment and the operation of pumping stations to control the flow of sewage.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Water well drilling
Description: Drilling water wells, including the necessary planning, site preparation, and construction. This business activity involves the use of specialized machinery and equipment to create boreholes for water extraction, typically for residential, commercial, or agricultural use. Services may also include well maintenance, repair, and decommissioning.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Class Name: Construction of utility projects
Sub-class Name: Construction of utility projects n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in the construction of various utility projects that are not otherwise classified. This involves building infrastructure for utilities such as water, sewage, electricity, gas, and telecommunications. Typical processes include planning and designing utility systems, excavation and installation of utility lines, and maintenance and repair of existing utility structures. This may also cover the construction of renewable energy infrastructure like wind and solar farms.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Group Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Class Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Sub-class Name: Construction and maintenance of industrial facilities such as refineries chemical plants etc.
Description: Building and maintaining industrial facilities such as refineries and chemical plants. This involves a range of construction activities, from initial site preparation and foundation work to the assembly and installation of complex industrial machinery. It also includes ongoing maintenance services to ensure the safe and efficient operation of these facilities.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Group Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Class Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Sub-class Name: Construction of waterways, harbours and river works, dredging of waterways
Description: Building waterways, harbours, and river works, along with dredging of waterways, are the primary activities in this business. It involves designing and constructing infrastructure like canals, docks, piers, and other marine structures. The dredging process, which includes excavation and removal of sediments from water bodies to maintain navigational depth or create new waterways, is also a significant part of this business. Services may also encompass maintenance and repair of such structures.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Group Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Class Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Sub-class Name: Construction of dams etc.
Description: Building and maintaining dams, dikes, levees, and other water control structures. This business activity involves the design, construction, and repair of such structures, often as part of larger civil engineering projects. Services may also include the implementation of safety measures, routine maintenance, and upgrades to existing structures.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Group Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Class Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Sub-class Name: Construction of outdoor sports facilities
Description: Building outdoor sports facilities, including but not limited to stadiums, tennis courts, golf courses, and swimming pools. This involves planning and designing the facility, sourcing and procuring required materials, overseeing the construction process, and ensuring the final structure is safe and meets all regulatory standards. Services may also include maintenance and renovation of existing sports facilities.

Division Name: Civil engineering
Group Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Class Name: Construction of other civil engineering projects
Sub-class Name: Other civil engineering projects n.e.c.
Description: Undertaking a variety of civil engineering projects not classified elsewhere, such as constructing highways, bridges, tunnels, ports, and waterways. This can also involve the construction of utility projects such as water and sewage systems. Typical processes include project planning, site preparation, construction, and project management. Services may also encompass maintenance and repair of these structures.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Demolition
Sub-class Name: Demolition
Description: The business activity involves tearing down and dismantling buildings and other structures, often to make way for new construction. This includes the safe and controlled use of heavy machinery, explosives, or manual labor to remove existing structures. Services may also include site clearance, waste removal and recycling, as well as salvaging and reselling reusable materials.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Site preparation
Sub-class Name: Site preparation for mining including overburden removal and other development and preparation of mineral properties and sites except oil and gas sites
Description: The business activity involves the preparation of mining sites, which includes tasks such as the removal of overburden and the development and preparation of mineral properties and sites. It does not include the preparation of oil and gas sites. Typical processes in this business may include land clearing, excavation, drilling, and blasting to make the sites ready for mining operations.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Site preparation
Sub-class Name: Site preparation including drilling, boring and core sampling for construction, geophysical, geological or similar purposes
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve preparing construction sites through methods such as drilling, boring, and core sampling. These processes are essential for both construction and geophysical or geological purposes, providing crucial information about the site's subsurface conditions. Services typically include the removal of previously existing structures, topsoil, and vegetation, leveling and grading the land, and conducting tests to assess the suitability of the ground for construction.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Site preparation
Sub-class Name: Clearing of building sites, earth moving: excavation, landfill, levelling and grading of construction sites, trench digging, rock removal, blasting etc.
Description: The business activity involves the preparation of construction sites by clearing them and performing earth moving tasks. This includes excavation, landfill, levelling and grading of construction sites, trench digging, and rock removal. The operations may also involve blasting for rock removal or other site preparation needs. These services are typically provided before any construction work begins to ensure the site is suitable and safe for the proposed development.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Site preparation
Sub-class Name: Other site preparation activities n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in a variety of site preparation activities not elsewhere classified, such as clearing and excavating land for construction projects. This includes removing topsoil, setting out, grading, and trenching, as well as other tasks necessary to prepare a site for construction. Services may also involve the removal of previously existing structures or hazardous materials from a site.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Electrical installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of electrical wiring and fittings
Description: Businesses in this category carry out the installation of electrical wiring and fittings in buildings and other construction projects. This includes tasks such as laying out and installing electrical wires, preparing and installing electrical fixtures, and setting up electrical control systems. The work may involve both new installations and repairs or upgrades to existing systems. Services could also include the installation of telecommunications wiring, computer network cabling, and wiring for security systems. The work is typically carried out by licensed electricians, following all relevant safety regulations and building codes.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Electrical installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of telecommunications wiring, computer network and cable television wiring, including fibre optic, satellite dishes
Description: Installation of telecommunications wiring, computer networks, and cable television wiring involves setting up and maintaining various types of communication lines. These include fibre optic cables and satellite dishes that enable high-speed internet, cable television, and other digital services. The core business operations typically include the design and layout of network infrastructure, installation of cables and wiring, troubleshooting network issues, and regular maintenance and upgrades of the system.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Electrical installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of street lighting and electrical signals
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the installation of street lighting and electrical signals. This involves setting up and maintaining outdoor lighting systems, including public street lights, traffic signals, and other outdoor electrical signage. Services may include design and planning of lighting systems, installation of poles and fixtures, wiring and electrical work, and ongoing maintenance and repairs.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Electrical installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of fire alarm system and burglar alarm system
Description: The business activity involves the installation of fire alarm systems and burglar alarm systems in various types of buildings. Core operations include assessing the building's layout to determine optimal system placement, installing the alarms, and connecting them to the necessary power sources. Services also typically include system testing to ensure functionality, as well as regular maintenance and repair services to keep the systems in optimal working condition.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Electrical installation
Sub-class Name: Other electrical installation n.e.c.
Description: Installation, maintenance, and repair of various electrical systems and equipment not classified elsewhere, such as power lines, lighting fixtures, and electrical control systems. This may involve tasks like wiring buildings for electrical power, installing electrical components, and troubleshooting electrical problems. Services could also include upgrading existing electrical systems, ensuring compliance with electrical codes, and providing consultations on electrical safety measures.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Plumbing, heat and air-conditioning installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of plumbing for water, gas and sanitation equipments
Description: The installation of plumbing for water, gas, and sanitation equipment involves setting up and maintaining systems that transport water, gas, and waste materials in residential, commercial, and industrial buildings. Typical services provided include installing pipes and fixtures for water and gas supply, fitting sanitation systems like toilets and sinks, and ensuring the proper functioning of heating and air conditioning systems. The business also involves diagnosing and repairing any issues with these installations, providing regular maintenance, and upgrading systems when necessary.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Plumbing, heat and air-conditioning installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of heating systems (electric, gas and oil), furnaces, cooling towers, non-electric solar energy collectors etc.
Description: Installing heating systems such as electric, gas, and oil-based systems, setting up furnaces and cooling towers, and mounting non-electric solar energy collectors. This business activity involves the planning, installation, and maintenance of these systems, ensuring that they function efficiently to provide heating and cooling solutions for residential and commercial buildings.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Plumbing, heat and air-conditioning installation
Sub-class Name: Other plumbing, heat and air conditioning activities n.e.c.
Description: Installation, maintenance, and repair of plumbing, heating, and air conditioning systems not classified elsewhere. This involves activities such as installing water heaters, radiators, and HVAC units, repairing leaks in pipes or ducts, and servicing heating or cooling systems to ensure efficient operation. It may also include specialized tasks like installing underfloor heating or solar thermal technology.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Other construction installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of elevators, escalators
Description: Installation, maintenance, and repair of elevators and escalators in both residential and commercial buildings. This involves the assembly and set up of these vertical transportation systems, ensuring their safe and efficient operation. Typical services may also include regular inspections, troubleshooting, and replacement of faulty parts.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Other construction installation
Sub-class Name: Installation of thermal, sound or vibration insulation system in buildings
Description: The business activity involves the installation of thermal, sound or vibration insulation systems in various types of buildings. Core operations include assessing a building's insulation needs, selecting the appropriate insulation materials, and installing these materials in a manner that improves the building's thermal efficiency, reduces noise transmission, or minimizes vibration. Services typically provided may also encompass maintenance and repair of existing insulation systems.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Group Name: Electrical, plumbing and other construction installation activities
Class Name: Other construction installation
Sub-class Name: Other construction projects n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in a variety of construction activities not elsewhere classified, such as the installation of doors, windows, staircases, and other building components. This can also include the construction of outdoor structures like carports, pergolas, or patios. Services may involve planning, assembling, and installing these components, as well as providing maintenance and repair services.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Building completion and finishing
Sub-class Name: Installation of doors, windows, door and window frames, fitted kitchens, of wood or other materials
Description: Businesses in this sub-class specialize in the installation of doors, windows, fitted kitchens, and door and window frames. This can involve working with a variety of materials, including wood. Typical operations include measuring and cutting materials to fit specific spaces, securing installations safely and securely, and finishing work to enhance aesthetics and durability. Services can range from new installations in buildings under construction to replacements or upgrades in existing structures.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Building completion and finishing
Sub-class Name: Interior completion such as ceilings, wooden wall coverings, movable partitions etc. ; Laying of parquet and other wood floor coverings, carpets and linoleum, wallpaper; tiling with ceramic, concrete
Description: Completing interior construction such as installing ceilings, wooden wall coverings, and movable partitions. This also involves laying wood floor coverings like parquet, as well as carpets and linoleum. The business activity also includes wallpapering and tiling with ceramic or concrete materials. These processes typically involve detailed finishing work to complete the construction of a building.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Building completion and finishing
