Sub-class Name: Interior and exterior painting, glazing, plastering and decorating of buildings or civil engineering structures
Description: The business activity involves the completion and finishing of buildings or civil engineering structures, with a specific focus on interior and exterior painting, glazing, plastering, and decorating. Core operations include preparation and application of paint, installation of glass, application of plaster, and execution of decorative elements on both the interior and exterior of structures. Services may also involve surface preparation, color selection, texture application, and decorative finishes to enhance the aesthetic appeal and functionality of the buildings.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Building completion and finishing
Sub-class Name: Other building completion and finishing
Description: The business activity involves finalizing construction projects and adding finishing touches to buildings. Core operations include the installation of doors, windows, and frames, application of interior and exterior paint, wall papering, and installation of wooden, metal or tiled flooring. Services may also encompass the fitting and sealing of skylights, staircases, and balustrades, as well as other finishing tasks such as plastering, joinery, carpentry, and decorative work. This category also includes any other activities related to building completion and finishing not mentioned elsewhere.

Division Name: Specialized construction activities
Class Name: Other specialized construction activities
Sub-class Name: Other specialized construction activities
Description: Engaging in a variety of specialized construction activities not typically covered by other classifications. This may involve unique or niche construction projects, specialized installations, or bespoke building services. Typical processes could include planning, designing, and executing construction tasks that require specific expertise or unique construction methods. Services may also encompass repair, alteration, maintenance, or demolition of structures using specialized techniques or equipment.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Class Name: Sale of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Wholesale and retail sale of new vehicles (passenger motor vehicles, ambulances, minibuses, jeeps, trucks, trailers and semi-trailers)
Description: The business activity involves the wholesale and retail sale of new vehicles, including passenger motor vehicles, ambulances, minibuses, jeeps, trucks, trailers, and semi-trailers. Core operations include sourcing these vehicles from manufacturers, managing inventory, marketing and selling to customers, and providing after-sales services. The business may also arrange for financing options and insurance for the purchased vehicles.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Class Name: Sale of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Wholesale and retail sale of used motor vehicles
Description: Engaging in the wholesale and retail sale of used motor vehicles, this business activity involves sourcing, inspecting, and purchasing pre-owned cars, motorcycles, and other motor vehicles. Key operations include the refurbishing and maintenance of these vehicles before sale, setting competitive pricing, and managing sales transactions. Services may also extend to offering warranties, financing options, and trade-in programs.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles
Class Name: Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Maintenance and repair of motor vehicles
Description: Business operations in this category involve the upkeep and restoration of motor vehicles. Activities typically include routine maintenance services like oil changes, tire rotation, brake checks, and tune-ups to ensure optimal vehicle performance. It also encompasses more extensive repair services to address issues with engines, transmissions, exhaust systems, and other vehicle components. This can involve diagnosing mechanical problems, replacing damaged parts, and performing tests to ensure the vehicle is functioning properly after repairs.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Sale of motor vehicle parts and accessories
Class Name: Sale of motor vehicle parts and accessories
Sub-class Name: Sale of motor vehicle parts and accessories
Description: Commercial trading of motor vehicle parts and accessories, including both wholesale and retail operations. This business activity encompasses the sale of various components such as engines, transmissions, brake systems, exhaust systems, radiators, and other car parts. It also involves the sale of accessories like car stereos, seat covers, car mats, and other decorative or functional add-ons. Additionally, it may include the provision of services related to the installation or repair of these parts and accessories.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Class Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Sub-class Name: Wholesale or retail sale of new motorcycles, mopeds, scooters and three wheelers
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the wholesale or retail sale of new motorcycles, mopeds, scooters, and three wheelers. Core operations include sourcing and stocking a wide range of these vehicles, selling them to customers, and providing after-sales services. They may also offer maintenance and repair services for these vehicles, including the sale of related parts and accessories.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Class Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Sub-class Name: Wholesale or retail sale of parts and accessories of motorcycles, mopeds, scooters and three wheelers
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the wholesale or retail sale of parts and accessories for motorcycles, mopeds, scooters, and three wheelers. This includes sourcing, stocking, and selling a wide range of components such as engines, brakes, transmissions, exhausts, seats, and lighting. Additionally, these businesses may also offer maintenance and repair services for these vehicles, which could involve diagnosing issues, replacing faulty parts, and performing routine service checks.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Class Name: Sale, maintenance and repair of motorcycles and related parts and accessories
Sub-class Name: Maintenance and repair of motor cycles, mopeds, scooters and three wheelers
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the upkeep and restoration of motorcycles, mopeds, scooters, and three-wheelers. This includes routine servicing, mechanical repairs, and replacement of worn-out parts and accessories. Services may also encompass troubleshooting and resolving issues related to engines, brakes, transmissions, and other integral motorcycle components.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Class Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Sub-class Name: Activities of commission agents, brokers dealing in wholesale trade of agricultural raw material,live animals, food, beverages, intoxicants and textiles
Description: Acting as intermediaries in wholesale trade, commission agents and brokers in this business activity specialize in dealing with agricultural raw materials, live animals, food, beverages, intoxicants, and textiles. Their core operations involve negotiating contracts and transactions on behalf of their clients, typically for a fee or on a contract basis. Services may include market research, price negotiation, quality control, and logistic arrangements for the goods in question. They do not take ownership of the goods but facilitate the buying and selling process between suppliers and buyers.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Class Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Sub-class Name: Activities of commission agents dealing in wholesale trade inwood, paper, skin, leather and fur,fuel, petroleum products, chemicals, perfumery and cosmetics, glass, minerals, ores and metals
Description: Commission agents in this business activity specialize in wholesale trade, operating on a fee or contract basis. They handle a diverse range of products including wood, paper, skin, leather, fur, fuel, petroleum products, chemicals, perfumery and cosmetics, glass, minerals, ores, and metals. Typical processes involve negotiating contracts and deals, facilitating transactions between buyers and sellers, and earning a commission from the successful sale of these products. They may also provide additional services such as market research, product promotion, and logistics support.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Class Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Sub-class Name: Activities of commission agents dealing in wholesale trade in machinery & equipment, other than transport machinery
Description: Acting as intermediaries in wholesale trade, commission agents handle transactions for machinery and equipment, excluding transport machinery. They operate on a contract or fee basis, typically negotiating sales and purchases between businesses. Services provided may include market research, negotiating contracts, and handling logistics related to the delivery of purchased goods.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Class Name: Wholesale on a fee or contract basis
Sub-class Name: Activities of other commission agents n.e.c. (including commission agents working in emerging areas for wholesale trade
Description: Acting as intermediaries in wholesale trade on a contract or fee basis, these businesses typically facilitate transactions between buyers and sellers for a commission. These commission agents operate in various sectors, including emerging areas of wholesale trade. The core business operations involve negotiating contracts, terms and conditions on behalf of their clients, and potentially arranging delivery of goods. The agents do not take ownership of the goods being traded but earn a commission for their brokerage services.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of cereals & pulses
Description: The business activity involves the bulk buying and selling of cereals and pulses. Core operations include sourcing these agricultural raw materials from farms or producers, storing them properly to maintain quality, and selling them in large quantities to retailers or other businesses. Services may also include transportation and delivery of these goods to the buyer's location.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of un-manufactured tobacco, paan (betel leaf), opium, ganja, cinchona etc
Description: Bulk trading of unprocessed tobacco, betel leaves, opium, ganja, cinchona and similar agricultural products. This involves sourcing raw agricultural materials and live animals directly from farms or producers, then selling them in large quantities to retailers or other businesses. Services may include quality control, storage, packaging, and distribution of these raw materials.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of live animals and poultry
Description: The business activity involves the large-scale selling and distribution of live animals and poultry. Core operations include sourcing, purchasing, and handling various types of live animals such as cattle, pigs, sheep, goats, and poultry. This also extends to the wholesale of other live animals like horses or camels. Services provided can involve transportation, storage, and distribution of these live animals to retailers, farms, or other businesses.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of straw, fodder & other animal/poultry feed
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the wholesale distribution of straw, fodder, and other types of feed for animals and poultry. This includes sourcing these agricultural raw materials, purchasing them in large quantities, and then selling them to retailers or directly to customers. The operation may also involve the storage and transportation of these goods. The types of feed can range from general livestock feed to more specialized diets for specific types of animals or poultry.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of flowers and plants
Description: The business activity involves the bulk buying and selling of flowers and plants. Core operations include sourcing a variety of flowers and plants from farms or nurseries, storing them under appropriate conditions to maintain freshness and quality, and selling them in large quantities to retailers or other businesses. Services may also include arranging for the transport or delivery of these products to the buyer's location.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of hides, skins and leather
Description: Engaging in the wholesale trade of hides, skins, and leather, this business activity involves bulk purchasing of these raw materials from agricultural sources and selling them to various industries such as fashion, upholstery, and automotive. Typical processes include sourcing, purchasing, storing, and distributing a variety of hides, skins, and leather goods. The business may also provide related services such as quality inspection, sorting, and packaging.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of oilseed oleaginous fruits
Description: Businesses operating in the wholesale of oilseed oleaginous fruits are primarily involved in buying and selling a variety of oilseed fruits on a large scale. These fruits, such as olives, sunflower seeds, or rapeseeds, are known for their high oil content and are typically used in the production of vegetable oils and biofuels. The core activities of these businesses include sourcing and purchasing oilseed fruits from farmers or growers, storing and preserving the quality of these products, and selling them in bulk to manufacturers or processors. Additional services may include arranging for the transportation of these goods and providing market information to suppliers and customers.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of sugarcane
Description: The business activity involves the bulk buying of sugarcane from farmers or producers and its subsequent selling to retailers or large end users. The operations typically include sourcing and procurement of sugarcane, quality inspection, storage, and distribution to retailers or industrial clients. The wholesaler may also provide related services such as transportation, logistics support, and market price information.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Class Name: Wholesale of agricultural raw materials and live animals
Sub-class Name: Whole sale of other agriculture raw materials n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily engaged in the large-scale distribution of various agricultural raw materials not elsewhere classified, and live animals. Typical activities include sourcing, purchasing, and selling a diverse range of agricultural products such as grains, seeds, fruits, vegetables, and other farm produce. They also deal with the wholesale of live animals for farming or other purposes. The operation involves storing these products in suitable conditions and distributing them to retailers, manufacturers, and other business entities.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of fruits & vegetables
Description: Bulk buying and selling of fruits and vegetables, including sourcing from farms or producers, storing in suitable conditions, and supplying in large quantities to retailers or other businesses. This operation may also involve the import or export of a variety of fruits and vegetables. The business may also provide related services such as packaging, grading, and delivery.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of raw milk & dairy products
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the wholesale distribution of raw milk and other dairy products. This involves purchasing these products from dairy farms or manufacturers, storing them under appropriate conditions to maintain their quality, and selling them in bulk to retailers, food service providers, or other commercial customers. The operations may also include the import or export of dairy products.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of meat, fish & eggs
Description: The business activity involves the bulk buying and selling of meat, fish, and eggs. Core operations include sourcing these products from farms or fisheries, storing them under appropriate conditions to ensure freshness, and selling them in large quantities to retailers or other businesses. This may also involve the import or export of these goods, and potentially their packaging and labeling for resale.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of confectionery, bakery products and beverages other than intoxicants
Description: The business activity involves the wholesale distribution of confectionery items, bakery products, and non-alcoholic beverages. Core operations include sourcing these products from manufacturers, storing them in suitable conditions, and selling them in bulk to retailers or other commercial entities. Services provided may include order fulfillment, delivery, and potentially product marketing support to the purchasing businesses.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of edible oils, fats, sugar and processed/manufactured spices etc.
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are primarily engaged in the wholesale distribution of edible oils, fats, sugar, and processed or manufactured spices. Core operations typically involve purchasing these products from manufacturers or processors, storing them in appropriate conditions, and then selling them in large quantities to retailers, other wholesalers, or institutional clients. They might also offer related services such as packaging, labeling, and transportation.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of tea, coffee & cocoa
Description: Bulk selling of tea, coffee, and cocoa products, often involving importation, storage, packaging, and distribution to retailers or other commercial entities. This business activity may also include quality control, marketing, and sales of these beverages.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Class Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of manufactured tobacco & tobacco products
Description: Engaging in the bulk purchase and subsequent resale of manufactured tobacco and tobacco products, such as cigarettes, cigars, and chewing tobacco. This operation typically involves sourcing these goods from manufacturers or producers, storing them in warehouses, and then distributing them to retailers or other buyers. It may also include services like packaging and labeling.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Wholesale trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Wholesale of food, beverages and tobacco

Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores
Class Name: Other retail sale of new goods in specialized stores
Sub-class Name: Retail sale of household fuel oil, bottled gas, coal and fuel wood
Description: Specialized retail stores involved in the sale of new household fuel products such as fuel oil, bottled gas, coal, and fuel wood. This includes sourcing and stocking these fuel products, managing inventory, and directly selling to consumers. The business may also provide advice on the appropriate usage and safety measures related to these fuel products.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores
Class Name: Other retail sale of new goods in specialized stores
Sub-class Name: Retail sale of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, machinery equipments and hand tools
Description: Selling a variety of new goods including seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, machinery equipment, and hand tools in specialized retail stores. Key business operations involve sourcing and purchasing these products from suppliers, managing inventory, and selling to customers. Services may also include providing expert advice on product usage and offering after-sales support.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores
Class Name: Other retail sale of new goods in specialized stores
Sub-class Name: Activities of commercial art galleries
Description: The business activity involves the operation of commercial art galleries that primarily engage in retail sales of new goods. These entities typically display and sell a variety of art pieces, including paintings, sculptures, photographs, and other visual art forms. The services they provide often include art exhibitions, private viewings, art consultations, and sometimes art auctioning. The core operations primarily revolve around the acquisition, display, promotion, and sale of artwork, often directly from artists or from art dealers.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores
Class Name: Other retail sale of new goods in specialized stores
Sub-class Name: Other retail sale of new goods in specialized stores n.e.c (weapons and ammunition, non food products)
Description: Retail sale of new goods such as weapons and ammunition, and non-food products in specialized stores. This involves sourcing and stocking a variety of new items, managing inventory, and selling these products to customers in a brick-and-mortar store environment. Typical services may also include product demonstrations, customer consultations, and after-sales support.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale of other goods in specialized stores
Class Name: Retail sale of second-hand goods
Sub-class Name: Retail sale of second-hand goods
Description: The business activity involves the retail sale of used or second-hand goods. This includes sourcing, acquiring, and selling a wide range of previously owned items such as clothing, furniture, electronic devices, books, and more. Typical processes may involve inspecting and valuing incoming goods, ensuring items are clean and functional, pricing and displaying items for sale, and facilitating transactions with customers. Services may also include offering expert advice on product history and value, as well as providing warranty or return policies on purchased items.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets
Class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of food, beverages and tobacco products
Sub-class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of food, beverages and tobacco products
Description: Selling food, beverages, and tobacco products directly to consumers through stalls and markets. This retail activity typically involves sourcing and purchasing these products from suppliers, setting up and managing stalls or market spaces, and handling customer transactions. It may also include activities such as displaying products, providing product information, and ensuring the freshness and safety of food and beverage items.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets
Class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of textiles, clothing and footwear
Sub-class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of textiles, clothing and footwear
Description: Operating retail stalls and markets that sell textiles, clothing, and footwear. This involves the sourcing and purchasing of various types of textiles, clothes, and footwear from manufacturers or wholesalers, setting up and managing market stalls or stands, and selling these products directly to consumers. Services may also include providing product information, handling customer inquiries, and managing transactions.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets
Class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of other goods
Sub-class Name: Retail sale via stalls and markets of other goods
Description: Operating retail stalls and markets that sell a variety of goods. The core business operations involve sourcing and purchasing a range of products, setting up and managing market stalls or pop-up shops, and selling directly to the public. Typical processes may include inventory management, pricing, merchandising, customer service, and sales transactions.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail trade not in stores, stalls or markets
Class Name: Retail sale via mail order houses or via Internet
Sub-class Name: Retail sale via mail order houses
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in selling goods to the general public through mail order houses. This involves accepting orders for merchandise through the mail and dispatching these orders via postal or courier services. The goods sold can span a wide range of items, from clothing and electronics to furniture and household appliances. This retail method does not require a physical storefront, and transactions are typically conducted remotely, often involving catalogues or other forms of direct advertising to attract customers.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail trade not in stores, stalls or markets
Class Name: Retail sale via mail order houses or via Internet
Sub-class Name: Retail sale via e-commerce
Description: Selling goods directly to the consumer via mail orders or over the Internet, typically in the form of e-commerce. This includes operations like managing online product listings, processing online orders, packaging goods for shipment, and handling customer inquiries or complaints. Services may also involve coordinating with logistics providers for home delivery and managing returns or exchanges of purchased items.

Section Name: Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Division Name: Retail trade, except of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Group Name: Retail trade not in stores, stalls or markets
Class Name: Other retail sale not in stores, stalls or markets
Sub-class Name: Other retail sale not in stores, stalls or markets
Description: Retail sales activities that occur outside traditional store, stall, or market environments. This may encompass direct selling methods such as door-to-door sales, telemarketing, vending machine sales, or e-commerce. Typical processes involved include the marketing and selling of goods directly to consumers, order processing, delivery of goods, and after-sales services.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Passenger rail transport, interurban
Sub-class Name: Passenger rail transport
Description: Operating interurban passenger rail transport services, which involve transporting passengers between different urban areas using rail systems. Typical processes include scheduling and managing rail services, ensuring passenger safety, maintaining rail infrastructure, and selling tickets for intercity travel.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Freight rail transport
Sub-class Name: Freight rail transport
Description: The business activity of Freight rail transport involves the transportation of goods and cargo by rail. Core operations include scheduling and managing freight shipments, loading and unloading of goods, ensuring safe and timely delivery, and providing related logistical support. Services may also encompass tracking and monitoring of freight, maintenance of rail transport equipment, and coordination with other transportation networks for efficient cargo transfer.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Urban and suburban passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Urban or suburban passenger bus transport (excluding chartered bus)
Description: Operating passenger bus transport services in urban or suburban areas, excluding chartered buses. This involves routine bus services for commuting within cities and suburbs, including regular routes and schedules. Services typically include ticketing, passenger assistance, and maintaining safety standards during transit.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Urban and suburban passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Urban or suburban tramways
Description: Operating urban or suburban tramways for passenger transportation. This involves managing tram networks, scheduling tram services, ensuring safety standards, and maintaining tram infrastructure within city limits or suburban areas. Services typically include ticket sales, customer service, and tram operation.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Urban and suburban passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Urban or suburban underground or elevated rillways
Description: Operating urban or suburban underground or elevated railways, which involves the transportation of passengers within city limits or suburban areas. Typical services include managing, maintaining, and operating railway systems, scheduling train services, ensuring passenger safety, and providing customer service.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Urban and suburban passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Other urban or suburban passenger transport n.e.c.
Description: Providing urban or suburban passenger transport services not classified elsewhere. This involves operating various types of land-based passenger transportation such as trams, cable cars, funiculars, and other similar modes of transport. Services may include regular or scheduled routes, special transports for events, or custom routes based on passenger needs. The core business operations include managing the transport fleet, ensuring passenger safety, route planning, and maintaining punctuality.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Long-distance bus services
Description: Providing long-distance bus services, which involves transporting passengers over extended distances using buses. This includes planning and scheduling of bus routes, managing ticket sales and reservations, and ensuring passenger safety and comfort during the journey. It may also involve operating bus terminals and providing additional services such as onboard amenities and luggage handling.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Charters, excursions and other occasional coach services
Description: Business operations in this category involve providing land transportation services for passengers on an occasional or charter basis. Typical services include arranging and operating coach trips for special events, excursions, sightseeing tours, and other similar activities. These companies may also offer charter bus services, where a group or individual can rent a bus for exclusive use. All services are typically provided on a non-scheduled basis, meaning they do not follow a regular timetable like public transportation services.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Rental of private cars with driver
Description: Offering private car rental services with a driver, this business activity involves leasing vehicles for personal or business use. Typical services provided include chauffeur services for events, corporate transportation, airport transfers, and other travel needs. The core operations include managing a fleet of rental cars, hiring and training professional drivers, maintaining vehicles for safety and comfort, and coordinating bookings and schedules for clients.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Taxi operation
Description: Operating taxis for the transportation of passengers over varying distances. This business activity typically involves providing door-to-door or street-hailing taxi services, managing taxi fleets, maintaining vehicles for safety and comfort, and employing or contracting drivers. Services may also include arranging rides via telephone, website, or mobile app bookings.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Operation of school buses and buses for transport of employees
Description: Running school buses and employee transportation services, which involves managing and operating fleets of buses for the purpose of transporting students to and from school or employees to and from their workplaces. This includes scheduling routes, ensuring safety measures, maintaining the vehicles, and coordinating drivers.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Passenger transport by man- or animal-drawn vehicles
Description: Transportation of passengers via land using vehicles drawn by humans or animals. This includes services like horse-drawn carriage rides, rickshaw services, and sled rides. The core operations involve maintaining the vehicles, caring for the animals if applicable, and providing safe and efficient transport services for passengers.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Other passenger land transport
Sub-class Name: Other non urban passenger land transport n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the provision of non-urban passenger land transport services not classified elsewhere. This includes operations such as managing and operating charter buses, shuttles, or other similar vehicles to transport passengers over long distances, typically outside urban areas. Services may also involve coordinating schedules, routes, and fares, ensuring passenger safety, and maintaining vehicles.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Freight transport by road
Sub-class Name: Motorised road freight transport
Description: Transportation of goods via motorized vehicles on roadways, including services like long-haul trucking, local delivery, and specialized freight transport. Core operations typically involve loading and unloading of goods, ensuring secure and timely delivery, route planning, and vehicle maintenance. This can also encompass the transport of heavy and oversized items requiring specialized equipment.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Freight transport by road
Sub-class Name: Non-motorised road freight transport
Description: Transportation of goods over roads using non-motorised vehicles, such as bicycles, horse-drawn vehicles, or push carts. This business activity involves the collection of freight from a specified pickup point, its transportation via non-motorised means, and the delivery to the designated destination. Services may also include the packing, unpacking, and handling of goods, as well as logistics planning and route management.

Division Name: Land transport and transport via pipelines
Class Name: Transport via pipeline
Sub-class Name: Transport via pipeline
Description: Transportation of goods through pipelines, including the operation and maintenance of pipelines for the distribution of various products such as oil, gas, and chemicals. This business activity also involves the necessary safety checks, monitoring, and control of pipeline functioning.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Sea and coastal passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Sea and coastal ferry service
Description: Operating sea and coastal ferry services, which involves transporting passengers across bodies of water such as seas, oceans, and along coastlines. Typical operations may include scheduling and managing ferry trips, ensuring passenger safety, maintaining vessels, ticketing services, and onboard amenities.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Sea and coastal passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Sea and coastal water cruise, water taxis and other sight seeing boats
Description: Operating sea and coastal water cruises, water taxis, and other sightseeing boats. This involves transporting passengers along the coastline or at sea for leisure, sightseeing, or commuting purposes. Services typically include cruise operations, water taxi services, and boat tours for sightseeing.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Sea and coastal passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Sea and coastal long distance water transport
Description: Operating passenger transportation services over sea and coastal waters for long distances. This involves the management of passenger ships or ferries capable of traveling long distances across oceans, seas, or along coasts. Services typically include ticketing, onboard accommodations, food and entertainment services, and safety measures for passengers during their journey.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Sea and coastal passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Other sea and coastal water transport n.e.c.
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve the provision of passenger water transportation services not otherwise classified, typically along sea and coastal routes. This includes services such as ferrying passengers across bodies of water, operating water taxis, and providing recreational water-based transportation. Activities may also encompass the provision of related services on board, such as catering or entertainment.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Sea and coastal freight water transport
Sub-class Name: Sea and coastal freight water transport
Description: Engaging in the transportation of freight over sea and coastal waters. This involves activities such as loading and unloading of goods, navigation of vessels, and the provision of related services. The freight can be diverse, ranging from raw materials to finished goods. The service may also include the chartering of vessels with crew for sea transport.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Inland passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: River ferry service
Description: The business activity involves the operation of passenger transportation services on rivers, typically via ferries. This includes the provision of regular and scheduled river crossing services, sightseeing tours, or cruises. Duties may include ferry maintenance, ticketing, and ensuring passenger safety during transit.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Inland passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: River cruise, water taxi, boat services
Description: Operating river cruises, water taxis, and boat services primarily in inland waterways, this business activity involves transporting passengers for various purposes such as sightseeing, commuting, or leisure travel. It includes managing and maintaining a fleet of water vessels, scheduling trips, ensuring passenger safety, and providing onboard services.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Inland passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Long distance river water transport
Description: Operating passenger transportation services on rivers for long distances. This involves managing and operating vessels such as ferries, river taxis, or cruise ships that transport passengers from one location to another along rivers. Services typically include ticketing, onboard amenities, safety measures, and potentially tourism-related activities.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Inland passenger water transport
Sub-class Name: Other inland water transport n.e.c.
Description: Business operations under this sub-class involve the provision of inland passenger water transportation services not categorized elsewhere. This may include activities like operating boats, ferries, or other water vessels for the purpose of transporting passengers across inland water bodies such as rivers, canals, and lakes. Services may extend to scenic and sightseeing water transport, as well as offering charter boat services with crew.

Division Name: Water transport
Class Name: Inland freight water transport
Sub-class Name: Inland freight water transport
Description: The activity involves transporting goods via inland waterways, such as rivers, canals, and lakes. Core business operations include loading and unloading of cargo, navigating water vessels, and ensuring safe and timely delivery of freight. Services may also encompass the leasing of vessels with crew for inland water freight transport.

Division Name: Air transport
Class Name: Passenger air transport
Sub-class Name: Passenger airways
Description: Operating passenger airlines, which involves transporting passengers by air over regular routes and on regular schedules or chartered flights. Services may include in-flight amenities, ticketing, baggage handling, and aircraft maintenance.

Division Name: Air transport
Class Name: Passenger air transport
Sub-class Name: Helicopter services
Description: Operating passenger air transport services using helicopters, which may include charter flights, sightseeing tours, medical evacuations, or other specialized helicopter transportation. This involves flight planning, aircraft maintenance, safety operations, and customer service.

Division Name: Air transport
Class Name: Passenger air transport
Sub-class Name: Other passenger air-transport n.e.c
Description: Providing passenger air transport services not elsewhere classified, such as air taxis, charter flights, and scenic and sightseeing flights. This involves the operation of aircraft for the transportation of passengers, including flight planning, in-flight services, and passenger safety and comfort measures. This may also include auxiliary services like ticketing, boarding, and baggage handling.

Division Name: Air transport
Class Name: Freight air transport
Sub-class Name: Freight air transport services
Description: Businesses involved in freight air transport services are primarily engaged in the transportation of goods by air. This includes the use of cargo planes for domestic and international shipping of various items such as documents, parcels, and bulk freight. Typical operations may involve coordinating loading and unloading of goods, ensuring secure and efficient packing for transport, handling customs processes for international shipments, and tracking deliveries to ensure timely and safe arrival at their destinations.

Division Name: Air transport
Class Name: Freight air transport
Sub-class Name: Launching of satellites and space vehicles and space transport
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the air transportation of freight, specifically focusing on the launching of satellites and space vehicles. Core operations include the preparation and execution of satellite launches, the provision of space transportation services, and the management of related logistics. Services may also encompass maintenance and repair of space vehicles, as well as the handling of necessary permits and regulatory compliance for space launches.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Warehousing and storage
Sub-class Name: Warehousing of refrigerated (cold storage)
Description: Storing goods in refrigerated conditions, commonly known as cold storage, which involves maintaining a specific temperature to prevent perishable items from spoiling. The core operations include receiving goods, checking their condition, storing them in temperature-controlled environments, monitoring and maintaining the temperature, and finally dispatching the goods as per requests. Services provided might also encompass inventory management, order picking, packaging, and transportation to the customer's location.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Warehousing and storage
Sub-class Name: Warehousing non-refrigerated
Description: Storing and preserving various goods in non-refrigerated warehouses, including inventory management and order fulfillment. Typical services provided may involve the receipt, storage, and retrieval of goods, as well as the preparation of items for shipment or delivery. This business activity does not include cold storage or refrigerated warehousing.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Warehousing and storage
Sub-class Name: Storage and warehousing n.e.c.[Includes general merchandise warehouses and warehousing of furniture, automobiles, gas and oil, chemicals, textiles etc. Also included is storage of goods in foreign tra
Description: The business activity involves the storage and warehousing of a wide range of items such as general merchandise, furniture, automobiles, gas and oil, chemicals, textiles, and others. This includes receiving goods, storing them in a controlled and secure environment, and maintaining an inventory for easy retrieval when needed. The service also extends to the storage of goods in foreign trade, which involves managing logistics for international shipping and ensuring compliance with customs regulations.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to land transportation
Sub-class Name: Car parking including motorcycle and bicycle parking
Description: Businesses in this sub-class provide parking services for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. These services may include the operation of parking lots or garages, valet parking, and parking meter services. The core operations involve managing and maintaining parking spaces, collecting parking fees, and ensuring the security and safety of parked vehicles.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to land transportation
Sub-class Name: Support service at railway stations, bus stations, bridges etc.
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve providing support services at railway stations, bus stations, bridges, and similar locations. These services may include maintenance and cleaning of facilities, ticket sales, baggage handling, passenger assistance, and other related operations. The goal is to ensure smooth and efficient transportation operations, enhancing the overall travel experience for passengers.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to land transportation
Sub-class Name: Switching and shunting
Description: Organizing and managing the movement of trains within rail yards, including the process of switching and shunting. This involves assembling and disassembling trains, directing and rerouting trains within the yard, and ensuring the correct positioning of railcars for loading and unloading. Services may also include the maintenance and repair of switching and shunting equipment.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to land transportation
Sub-class Name: Other land transport services n.e.c
Description: Business activities in this sub-class primarily involve providing a range of land transport services not classified elsewhere. Typical operations may include transport services related to towing vehicles, operating weigh stations, providing motor vehicle safety inspections, and other miscellaneous services associated with land transportation. This could also encompass services like road maintenance, traffic control activities, and vehicle recovery services. However, it does not include the actual transportation of goods or passengers by road, which falls under different classifications.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to water transportation
Sub-class Name: Service activities incidental to water transportation
Description: Business activities in this category involve providing support services for water transportation. Typical operations include the management and operation of ports and harbors, navigation, berthing, pilotage, lighterage, vessel salvage, and other related services. Additionally, businesses under this classification may also be involved in the maintenance and cleaning of ships. They may also provide loading and unloading services, cargo checking and handling, as well as freight brokerage services. They do not involve the actual transportation of goods or passengers, but rather, they facilitate these processes.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to air transportation
Sub-class Name: Activities related to air transport of passengers, animals or freight
Description: Business activities in this category primarily involve providing auxiliary services related to air transportation. These services may include handling and loading of passengers, animals, or freight onto aircraft, providing ground services at airports, operating airport terminal facilities, and other related tasks. These businesses may also offer services such as aircraft maintenance, cleaning, and refueling, as well as air traffic control and navigation assistance.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Service activities incidental to air transportation
Sub-class Name: Firefighting and fire-prevention services at airports
Description: Providing firefighting and fire-prevention services at airports, which includes maintaining and operating firefighting equipment, conducting regular fire drills and inspections, and implementing fire safety protocols. These services also involve training airport staff on fire safety measures, handling emergency situations, and ensuring compliance with aviation fire safety standards.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Cargo handling
Sub-class Name: Cargo handling incidental to land transport
Description: Handling and managing cargo related to land transport, including loading, unloading, packing and repacking of goods. This business activity also involves the provision of storage and warehousing services, as well as other services incidental to land transportation such as cargo consolidation, break-bulk and freight station operations.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Cargo handling
Sub-class Name: Cargo handling incidental to water transport
Description: Business operations under this sub-class involve the handling of cargo that is incidental to water transport. This includes activities such as loading and unloading of goods from ships, ensuring safe and secure stowage of cargo on board, and managing the transfer of goods between ships and storage facilities. Services may also extend to the coordination of cargo movement, documentation, and tracking. The focus is on facilitating the smooth and efficient transition of goods during their waterborne journey.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Cargo handling
Sub-class Name: Cargo handling incidental to air transport
Description: Handling and managing cargo as part of air transport services, including loading, unloading, packing, and unpacking of goods. This also involves organizing and securing cargo for air transport, ensuring safe and efficient transfer of goods from one location to another via air. Services may also include temporary storage and tracking of cargo during the transportation process.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Other transportation support activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of travel agents and tour operators
Description: Organizing and facilitating travel plans for individuals and groups, including booking transportation, arranging accommodations, and planning itineraries. This involves services provided by travel agents and tour operators such as creating customized travel packages, providing travel advice, and handling travel-related documentation. Other responsibilities may include negotiating with hotels, airlines, and other service providers to secure the best rates for clients.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Other transportation support activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of shipping cargo agents
Description: Shipping cargo agents handle the transportation and storage of goods. The main operations involve organizing and coordinating the shipment of goods, liaising with shipping lines, airlines, and road and rail freight operators. They may also provide services such as customs and import/export documentation, freight consolidation, cargo insurance, and packing.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Other transportation support activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of movers and packers
Description: Business activities in this category primarily involve providing moving and packing services. This includes the packing of goods in boxes or other containers for transportation, the actual moving or transportation of goods from one location to another, and the unpacking of goods at the destination. Services may be offered for both residential and commercial relocations, and can involve local, long-distance, or international moves. The process typically includes assessment of goods, provision of packing materials, loading, transportation, unloading, and unpacking at the new location.

Division Name: Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Class Name: Other transportation support activities
Sub-class Name: Weighing of goods
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are primarily engaged in the weighing of goods in the transportation and storage sector. This involves the use of scales and other weighing equipment to accurately determine the weight of various types of goods, ranging from small packages to large freight items. The service may also include providing weight-related documentation or reports, ensuring regulatory compliance in terms of weight restrictions, and assisting in the calculation of transportation costs based on weight.

Division Name: Postal and courier activities
Class Name: Postal activities
Sub-class Name: Postal activities
Description: Business operations involved in postal activities encompass the collection, sorting, transport, and delivery of mail and parcels. This includes services provided by national post offices, courier companies, and private mail or parcel delivery businesses. Typical processes may involve the receipt and dispatch of letters, postcards, printed papers, parcels, and other postal articles, both domestically and internationally. It may also include related services such as registered mail, express mail, and postal box rentals.

Division Name: Postal and courier activities
Class Name: Courier activities
Sub-class Name: Courier activities
Description: Courier activities involve the provision of delivery services for documents, parcels, and other small consignments, typically utilizing a network of dispatch riders or drivers. This business operation includes the collection of items from businesses or individuals, sorting these items at a central hub, and then delivering them to their respective destinations. Services may also include express or overnight delivery, tracking services, and signature upon delivery.

Division Name: Accommodation
Class Name: Short term accommodation activities
Sub-class Name: Hotels and Motels, inns, resorts providing short term lodging facilities; includes accommodation in house boats
Description: Providing short-term lodging facilities in hotels, motels, inns, resorts, and house boats. Core operations involve managing reservations, offering customer services, maintaining rooms and facilities, and ensuring a comfortable stay for guests. Services may also include food and beverage services, recreational activities, and other hospitality services.

Division Name: Accommodation
Class Name: Short term accommodation activities
Sub-class Name: Provision of short term lodging facilities to members of a particular organisation such as govt.guest houses, company guest houses, circuit houses and similar establishments
Description: Offering short-term accommodation facilities specifically tailored to members of certain organizations such as government guest houses, company guest houses, circuit houses, and similar establishments. The core operations involve providing lodging services on a temporary basis, maintaining the facilities, and ensuring all the needs of the guests are met during their stay. This could also include additional services such as food and beverage provision, housekeeping, and other guest-related services.

Division Name: Accommodation
Class Name: Short term accommodation activities
Sub-class Name: Provision of short stay accommodation n.e.c. (e.g. holiday homes, private guest houses etc.)
Description: The business activity involves offering short-term lodging options such as holiday homes, private guest houses, and similar accommodations not elsewhere classified. Core operations include managing reservations, maintaining the properties, providing housekeeping services, and ensuring guest satisfaction. These businesses typically cater to travelers, vacationers, and other individuals seeking temporary housing solutions.

Division Name: Accommodation
Group Name: Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks
Class Name: Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks
Sub-class Name: Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks
Description: Operating camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks, and trailer parks, which involves providing accommodation and other facilities to campers and vacationers. Services typically include renting spaces for tents, campers, trailers or recreational vehicles, and may also include amenities like public restrooms, laundry facilities, recreational facilities, and convenience stores. Management of these sites includes maintenance of grounds, facilities, and utilities, as well as booking and customer service operations.

Division Name: Accommodation
Class Name: Other accommodation
Sub-class Name: Accommodation provided by student residences, school dormitories
Description: Business activities under this classification primarily involve providing lodging facilities by student residences and school dormitories. These establishments offer accommodation to students and school residents, usually on a long-term basis. The services include maintaining living spaces, ensuring the safety and security of residents, and potentially offering additional amenities like meal services, laundry facilities, and recreational areas.

Division Name: Accommodation
Class Name: Other accommodation
Sub-class Name: Worker hostels and boarding houses
Description: Providing accommodation services specifically for workers in hostels and boarding houses. This involves managing residential facilities that offer affordable, often shared, lodging for workers, typically on a medium to long-term basis. Services may include housing maintenance, meal provision, laundry services, and other basic amenities.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Class Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Sub-class Name: Restaurants without bars
Description: Operation of dining establishments that primarily serve food without alcoholic beverages. This could include a variety of restaurant types, such as fast food outlets, fine dining restaurants, or food trucks. The core business operations involve preparing and serving meals to customers, managing food supplies, maintaining hygiene standards, and providing customer service. The establishments may offer dine-in, take-out, or delivery services.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Class Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Sub-class Name: Cafeterias, fast-food restaurants and other food preparation in market stalls
Description: Operating cafeterias and fast-food restaurants, which involves preparing and serving food and beverages for immediate consumption. This also includes food preparation in market stalls, where meals are typically cooked on-site and sold directly to customers. The core operations may encompass food preparation, cooking, serving, and selling, ensuring food safety and hygiene, managing inventory, and customer service.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Class Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Sub-class Name: Ice cream mobile vendors, mobile food carts
Description: Operating mobile food services such as ice cream trucks and food carts, typically involving the preparation and sale of food items directly to customers from these mobile establishments. The core business operations include sourcing ingredients, food preparation, and direct selling to consumers at various locations. Services may also involve catering to outdoor events, festivals, and other public gatherings.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Class Name: Restaurants and mobile food service activities
Sub-class Name: Restaurant and bar activities connected to transportation, when carried out by separate units
Description: Operating restaurants and bars in connection with transportation, typically found in airports, train stations, or onboard ships and trains. This involves preparing and serving meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption by travelers. It may also include providing mobile food services for various modes of transport. The core operations involve food preparation, customer service, and maintaining health and safety standards in a transport-related setting.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Event catering and other food service activities
Class Name: Event catering
Sub-class Name: Event catering
Description: Event catering involves the provision of food and beverage services for occasions such as weddings, corporate events, parties, and other social gatherings. This includes planning menus, preparing and serving food, providing beverages, and managing all aspects of food service for the event. The business may also handle tasks such as table settings, service staff coordination, and cleanup after the event.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Event catering and other food service activities
Class Name: Other food service activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of food service contractors (e.g. for transportation companies)
Description: Providing food services on a contract basis, typically for transportation companies. This involves preparing and serving meals for airlines, trains, or cruise ships. Services may also include menu planning, food preparation, and catering for special dietary requirements.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Group Name: Event catering and other food service activities
Class Name: Other food service activities
Sub-class Name: Operation of canteens or (e.g. for factories, offices, hospitals or schools) on a concession basis
Description: Managing and operating canteens, typically within factories, offices, hospitals, or schools, on a contract or concession basis. This involves preparing and serving meals, maintaining cleanliness, and ensuring compliance with health and safety standards. The services may also include menu planning, food procurement, and managing staff within these canteen facilities.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Class Name: Beverage serving activities
Sub-class Name: Bars and Restaurants with bars
Description: Operating bars and restaurants with bars, which involves providing alcoholic beverages for immediate consumption on the premises. This can include establishments such as pubs, taverns, and cocktail lounges. Additionally, these businesses may also offer food services alongside their drink offerings, such as full meals, snacks, or appetizers. The typical processes involved in this business activity include preparing and serving drinks, maintaining inventory of beverages, ensuring compliance with relevant licensing and health regulations, and providing customer service.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Class Name: Beverage serving activities
Sub-class Name: Tea/coffee shops
Description: Operation of establishments such as cafes, coffee shops, and tea houses that primarily engage in preparing and serving a variety of tea and coffee drinks. This includes brewing and serving different types of coffee and tea, offering light snacks or pastries, and providing a comfortable environment for customers to consume these beverages on the premises. Some establishments may also sell related products like coffee beans, tea leaves, and brewing equipment.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Class Name: Beverage serving activities
Sub-class Name: Fruit juice bars
Description: Operation of establishments primarily engaged in serving a range of fruit juices and smoothies. This typically involves the sourcing of fresh fruits, preparation of fruit juices and smoothies, and serving these beverages to customers. It may also include the sale of related products such as health drinks, fruit salads, and other fruit-based products.

Division Name: Food and beverage service activities
Class Name: Beverage serving activities
Sub-class Name: Mobile beverage vendors
Description: Mobile beverage vendors involve the operation of vehicles or carts that are specially equipped to sell and serve beverages. This includes the sale of a variety of drinks such as coffee, tea, juice, smoothies, and soft drinks, typically to pedestrians or at events. The core operations consist of preparing and serving beverages, maintaining inventory, and ensuring the cleanliness and hygiene of the mobile serving unit.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Book publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of books, brochures, leaflets and similar publications, including publishing encyclopedias (including on CD-ROM)
Description: The activity involves the publishing of various literary materials such as books, brochures, leaflets, and similar publications. It includes the production and dissemination of encyclopedias, which can also be available in digital formats like CD-ROM. Typical processes involved in this business may encompass content creation, editing, design, printing, marketing, and distribution of these published materials.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Book publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of atlases, maps and charts
Description: The production and distribution of atlases, maps, and charts, encompassing all stages from the initial creation or acquisition of content, to editing, layout, printing, and marketing. This business activity may also involve digital publishing, including the design and release of electronic maps and charts.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Book publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of audio books
Description: The business activity involves the publishing of audio books, which includes the conversion of written content into audio format, the production and distribution of these audio books, and the management of their copyrights. Typical processes may involve the selection and editing of content, hiring voice actors for narration, recording and editing the audio, and marketing and selling the finished audio books. This may also include providing digital access to audio books online or through various platforms.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Publishing of directories and mailing lists
Sub-class Name: Publishing of mailing lists and telephone directories
Description: The business activity involves the production and distribution of directories and mailing lists. This typically includes gathering, compiling, and organizing contact information such as names, addresses, and phone numbers into comprehensive lists. These lists are then published in various formats such as print, online, or electronic databases. The process may also involve updating and maintaining these lists to ensure accuracy and relevance. The publishing of telephone directories is a key part of this activity, which includes both residential and business listings.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Publishing of directories and mailing lists
Sub-class Name: Publishing of other directories and compilations, such as case law, pharmaceutical compendia etc.
Description: Creating and publishing various directories and compilations, such as case law directories, pharmaceutical compendia, and other similar reference materials. This involves gathering, organizing, and updating relevant information, editing for accuracy and clarity, and distributing the finished product in either print or digital formats. Services may also include providing updates or new editions as necessary to keep the information current and relevant.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals
Sub-class Name: Publishing of newspapers
Description: The business activity involves the production and dissemination of newspapers, which may include both print and digital versions. Core operations include gathering news, writing and editing articles, layout and design, and the printing or digital publishing of the final product. Services may also include distribution and delivery of the newspapers to subscribers or retail outlets.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Publishing of newspapers, journals and periodicals
Sub-class Name: Publishing of journals and periodicals
Description: The business activity involves the creation and distribution of journals and periodicals. Core operations include sourcing and editing content, layout design, printing, and distribution to various outlets for sale. Additionally, it may also involve digital publishing, where the content is made available online or through digital platforms. Services provided may include advertising, subscription management, and content syndication.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Other publishing activities
Sub-class Name: On-line publishing of statistics and other information
Description: Publishing statistics and other information online, which involves the collection, analysis, and interpretation of various types of data. This business activity includes the digital distribution of research reports, market studies, financial data, and other specialized information. The core operations typically involve data gathering, statistical analysis, content creation, and online dissemination through various digital platforms.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Group Name: Publishing of books, periodicals and other publishing activities
Class Name: Other publishing activities
Sub-class Name: Other publishing activities (including on-line) n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in diverse publishing activities that are not classified elsewhere, including online publishing. This may involve the creation, preparation, and distribution of specialized content such as books, magazines, newspapers, or other publications in digital or physical formats. Services may include editing, design, production, marketing, and distribution of these publications.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Class Name: Software publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of operating systems and system software
Description: The business activity involves the publication of operating systems and system software. Core operations include the design, development, testing, and distribution of various types of system software such as operating systems, network management systems, database management systems, and middleware.
