Services may also encompass providing updates, patches, or new versions of existing software, as well as offering customer support and technical assistance.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Class Name: Software publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of operating business and other applications
Description: The business activity involves the publishing of software specifically designed for operating business and other applications. This includes the creation, development, and distribution of software applications that aid in the day-to-day operations of businesses. Typical processes involve software design, coding, testing, and debugging. Services provided may include software updates, maintenance, and provision of user support.

Division Name: Publishing activities
Class Name: Software publishing
Sub-class Name: Publishing of computer games for all platforms
Description: The business activity involves the creation and distribution of computer games for various platforms such as consoles, personal computers, and mobile devices. Core operations include game design, programming, art creation, testing, and marketing. The process may also involve obtaining necessary licenses for game distribution on different platforms, providing updates and patches to improve game performance, and offering customer support for game-related issues.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production activities
Sub-class Name: Production of motion picture
Description: Creating and producing films or movies, which involves activities such as scriptwriting, casting, shooting, and editing. This also includes the technical aspects of film production like sound, lighting, and special effects. The final product can be distributed in various formats such as digital media or film stock.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production activities
Sub-class Name: Video production
Description: Creating and producing video content for various platforms such as television, online streaming services, and social media channels. This involves all stages of video production including concept development, scriptwriting, shooting, editing, and post-production processes. Services may also include the creation of video advertisements, corporate videos, educational videos, and other types of visual content.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production activities
Sub-class Name: Production of television programmes or television commercials
Description: Creating television programmes or commercials, which involves the conceptualization, scripting, filming, editing, and post-production processes. This business activity also includes the coordination of technical crews, casting, set design, and other production-related tasks. Services provided may also encompass marketing and distribution of the finished television programmes or commercials.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme post-production activities
Sub-class Name: Post production activities of motion picture
Description: Engaging in the post-production activities of motion pictures, such as editing, titling, subtitling, and credits. This also involves processes like dubbing, mixing, special effects, and color grading. Services may also include the creation of final prints for cinema, television, and digital platforms, as well as the distribution of films and television shows.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme post-production activities
Sub-class Name: Post production activities of television programmes or television commercials
Description: Editing and refining television programmes or commercials following their initial recording or filming. This includes services such as video editing, sound editing, adding special effects or graphics, color correction, and other post-production tasks aimed at enhancing the quality of the final product. This also involves the preparation of the final product for broadcasting or distribution.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme post-production activities
Sub-class Name: Post production activities of video production
Description: Editing and refining video content after the initial filming process, including tasks such as editing raw footage, adding effects or transitions, sound editing, color correction, and other finishing touches. It may also involve converting videos into the correct format for broadcasting or distribution. This sub-class does not include the actual production or filming of the content, but rather the post-production tasks that enhance and finalize the video for viewers.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme distribution activities
Sub-class Name: Motion picture distribution
Description: The business activity involves the distribution of motion pictures or films to various platforms such as cinemas, television networks, and online streaming services. Core operations include acquiring distribution rights from producers, arranging and coordinating film releases, managing the supply of films to different outlets, and handling the logistics of film transportation. Services may also include subtitling, dubbing, or otherwise adapting films for different markets.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme distribution activities
Sub-class Name: Distribution of video tapes, CD and DVDs
Description: The business activity involves the distribution of video tapes, CDs, and DVDs. Core operations include sourcing, acquiring, and distributing a wide range of video and audio content in physical formats such as tapes, CDs, and DVDs. Services typically provided include managing inventory, packaging, shipping, and delivering these items to retailers or directly to consumers. The business may also handle returns and exchanges of these products.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture, video and television programme distribution activities
Sub-class Name: Distribution of television programme
Description: The business activity involves the distribution of television programmes to various broadcasting platforms. This includes negotiating rights, managing licensing agreements, and delivering content to broadcasters, streaming services, and other television platforms. Services may also involve scheduling and programming for television channels, as well as handling syndication for television shows and series.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture projection activities
Sub-class Name: Motion picture or video tape projection in cinemas, in the open air or in other projection facilities
Description: Screening motion pictures or video tapes in cinemas, open-air venues, or other projection facilities. This involves the operation and management of these facilities, the technical aspects of film or video projection, and potentially the organization of special events or screenings.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Motion picture, video and television programme activities
Class Name: Motion picture projection activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of cine-clubs
Description: Organizing and operating cine-clubs, which involve the screening and discussion of films for club members. This includes the selection and acquisition of films, scheduling screenings, and facilitating post-screening discussions or reviews. May also provide additional services such as film education or appreciation workshops, and special events featuring guest speakers from the film industry.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Sound recording and music publishing activities
Class Name: Sound recording and music publishing activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of sound recording in studio or elsewhere
Description: Creating audio recordings in a studio or other locations, this involves capturing and mixing sounds, music, or voices. The process typically includes recording, editing, and mastering audio tracks, which may be used for music albums, radio broadcasts, film scores, or other types of media content.

Division Name: Motion picture, video and television programme production, sound recording and music publishing activities
Group Name: Sound recording and music publishing activities
Class Name: Sound recording and music publishing activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of music publishing
Description: Music publishing activities encompass the acquisition, copyrighting, and distribution of music compositions. This includes negotiating rights and royalties, licensing songs for use in media like films, television, and advertising, and promoting songs to recording artists, producers, and media outlets. It also involves administrative tasks such as tracking royalties and ensuring composers and artists are paid for the usage of their music.

Division Name: Programming and broadcasting activities
Class Name: Radio broadcasting
Sub-class Name: Radio broadcasting
Description: The activity involves the operation of broadcasting studios and facilities for radio transmission. This includes the creation, production, and distribution of radio programs that are aired over radio networks and stations. Typical processes involved are content creation, radio programming, transmission, and syndication. Services may also include news broadcasting, radio talk shows, music programming, and other audio entertainment services.

Division Name: Programming and broadcasting activities
Class Name: Television programming and broadcasting activities
Sub-class Name: Television programming and broadcasting activities
Description: Creating, producing, and delivering television programs and broadcasting content to the public. This involves the development of TV shows, news programs, live events, and other types of television content. It also includes the operation of television broadcasting studios and facilities, the transmission of television programs via broadcasting channels, and the distribution of content through cable or satellite systems.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wired telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of basic telecom services: telephone, telex and telegraph (includes the activities of STD/ISD booths)
Description: Providing basic telecom services such as telephone, telex, and telegraph operations. This includes running STD/ISD booths, which offer long distance and international telephone services. Typical processes involve the maintenance and operation of wired telecommunications infrastructure, customer service, and billing for telecommunications usage.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wired telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Maintenance of telecom network
Description: Business activities in this category involve the upkeep and repair of wired telecommunication networks. This includes the regular servicing and troubleshooting of telecommunication infrastructure such as telephone lines, internet cables, and other wired communication systems. Services may encompass fault detection, repair, routine checks, and preventive maintenance to ensure the smooth and uninterrupted functioning of the network.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wired telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of the cable operators
Description: Operating and managing wired telecommunication networks, primarily focusing on cable-based services. Key activities include the maintenance of cable networks, provision of cable television services, broadband and other high-speed internet services, and wired telephony services. May also involve the sale or lease of access to their networks to other businesses.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wired telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of providing internet access by the operator of the wired infrastructure
Description: The business activity involves the operation of wired infrastructure to provide internet access. This includes the management and maintenance of physical network infrastructure such as cables and other wired connections. The operator may also be responsible for ensuring network security, troubleshooting connectivity issues, and delivering consistent and high-speed internet services to customers. This could also involve offering different internet packages based on speed and data usage to both residential and commercial clients.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wireless telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of Internet access by the operator of the wireless infrastructure
Description: Providing internet access through wireless infrastructure, this business activity involves the operation and maintenance of wireless networks for internet connectivity. The core operations include managing wireless communication systems, offering internet services to customers, and ensuring seamless internet connectivity. Services typically provided encompass network setup, troubleshooting network issues, and upgrading wireless infrastructure to improve internet speed and reliability.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wireless telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of maintaining and operating paging, cellular and other telecommunication networks
Description: Managing and operating wireless telecommunication networks, including cellular, paging, and other related networks. This involves the maintenance and operation of infrastructure to ensure seamless wireless communication, and may include activities such as network setup, troubleshooting, upgrades, and network security measures. Services provided could range from basic cellular services to high-speed data transmission.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Wireless telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of other wireless telecommunications activities
Description: Businesses in this sub-class provide wireless telecommunications services not categorized elsewhere. The core operations involve the transmission of voice, data, text, sound, and video through wireless networks. Services may include satellite communication services, mobile telephony services, paging services, and wireless internet services. These businesses may also be involved in the maintenance of equipment and infrastructure related to wireless telecommunications.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Satellite telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Activity of Internet access by the operator of the satellite infrastructure
Description: Providing internet access via satellite infrastructure, this business activity involves the operation and maintenance of satellite networks to deliver internet connectivity. Typical services include satellite broadband services, satellite internet services, and network management. The operator is responsible for managing the satellite infrastructure, ensuring the quality of the internet connection, and troubleshooting any connectivity issues.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Satellite telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Other satellite telecommunications activities
Description: Engaging in various satellite telecommunications activities not specified elsewhere. This involves the provision of specialized satellite-based communication services, such as satellite tracking, telemetry, and radar station operation. Services may also include satellite uplinking/downlinking, direct-to-home satellite television broadcasting, and satellite-based internet service provision.

Division Name: Telecommunications
Class Name: Other telecommunications activities
Sub-class Name: Other telecommunications activities
Description: Engaging in various telecommunications activities not classified elsewhere. This involves the provision of specialized telecommunications services such as satellite tracking, communications telemetry, and radar station operations. It may also include offering internet services combined with telephony and/or television broadcasting services.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Computer programming activities
Sub-class Name: Writing, modifying, testing of computer program to meet the needs of a particular client excluding web-page designing
Description: Creating, modifying, and testing custom computer programs tailored to specific client needs, except for web-page design. This involves understanding client requirements, developing software solutions, debugging, and performing software testing to ensure the program functions as intended.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Computer programming activities
Sub-class Name: Web-page designing
Description: Designing and creating websites, including the visual aesthetics and usability of a website. This involves creating the layout of a website, the graphics, color schemes, and overall design. It may also include coding and writing markup, ensuring the website is functional across different browsers and devices, and optimizing the website for maximum speed and scalability. Other services might involve regular website maintenance and updates, as well as creating a user-friendly design that meets the client's needs and preferences.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Computer programming activities
Sub-class Name: Providing software support and maintenance to the clients
Description: Engaging in computer programming activities such as offering software support and maintenance to clients. This involves troubleshooting software issues, implementing updates, and ensuring the software's optimal performance. Services may also include regular system checks, preventive maintenance, and providing technical advice to improve the software's functionality and efficiency.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Computer consultancy and computer facilities management activities
Sub-class Name: Computer consultancy and computer facilities management activities
Description: Offering computer consultancy services, which involve advising businesses on the best use of information technology to meet their objectives, and managing computer facilities, which includes overseeing the day-to-day operations of IT networks and systems. Typical services provided may include IT strategic planning, system design and configuration, software selection and installation, network management, and data processing facilities management.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Other information technology and computer service activities
Sub-class Name: Software installation
Description: Installation of software programs on various devices such as computers, servers, or mobile devices. This involves setting up new software, upgrading existing software, and ensuring proper integration with existing systems. Services may also include troubleshooting software installation issues, providing technical support, and configuring software to meet specific user needs or business requirements.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Other information technology and computer service activities
Sub-class Name: Computer disaster recovery
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the provision of services related to computer disaster recovery. This typically includes creating and implementing disaster recovery plans to ensure the continuity of IT services in the event of system failures, data loss, or cyber attacks. Services may also involve regular testing and updating of these plans, data backup and storage solutions, and post-disaster recovery efforts to restore lost data and system functionality.

Division Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Group Name: Computer programming, consultancy and related activities
Class Name: Other information technology and computer service activities
Sub-class Name: Other information technology and computer service activities n.e.c
Description: Business activities in this category primarily involve providing a broad range of information technology and computer services not classified elsewhere. Typical operations include computer disaster recovery services, installation of computer systems and software, computer consultancy and advisory services, and routine maintenance and repair of computers. This category may also encompass activities like computer data storage and retrieval services, software publishing, and other IT-related services.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
Sub-class Name: Data processing activities including report writing
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve processing and managing data for clients. This includes tasks such as data entry, conversion, and analysis. Additionally, these businesses provide report writing services, where they compile, organize, and present data in a structured format for easy understanding and decision-making. Services may also extend to hosting data on servers and maintaining these servers to ensure data accessibility and security.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
Sub-class Name: Web hosting activities
Description: Web hosting activities involve providing storage space and access for websites on the internet. This includes the allocation of server space to clients, ensuring website accessibility via the internet, and performing routine server maintenance. Additional services may include website design and development, server security measures, email hosting, and database support.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
Sub-class Name: Providing general time-share mainframe facilities to clients
Description: Offering shared access to mainframe computers for clients, this business activity involves the provision of robust computing power on a time-sharing basis. Typical services include data processing, server hosting, and other related activities that require substantial computational resources. Clients can rent processing time on these mainframes, enabling them to handle large-scale computing tasks without the need for owning and maintaining their own high-capacity systems.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
Sub-class Name: Providing data entry services
Description: Businesses under this classification perform data entry services, which involve converting physical data into digital format. Typical operations include scanning and digitizing documents, typing information into databases, and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the entered data. These services may be provided to various sectors such as healthcare, finance, or retail, and can include specialized data entry like medical transcription or financial data entry.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
Sub-class Name: Other data processing, hosting and related activities n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this sub-class primarily engage in data processing, hosting, and related activities not explicitly mentioned elsewhere. Core operations typically involve the provision of infrastructure for hosting applications, data mining, data processing services, and web hosting. These companies may also provide specialized hosting activities such as game server hosting, streaming services hosting, or application hosting. Additional services can include data entry, data conversion, and scanning services.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Web portals
Sub-class Name: Operation of web sites that use a search engine to generate and maintain extensive databases of internet addresses and content in an easily searchable format
Description: Running web portals that utilize a search engine to create and manage comprehensive databases of internet addresses and content in a user-friendly, searchable format. This involves processes such as website operation, search engine optimization, database management, and content curation to ensure easy access and retrieval of internet resources for users.

Division Name: Information service activities
Group Name: Data processing, hosting and related activities; web portals
Class Name: Web portals
Sub-class Name: Operation of other websites that act as portals to the Internet, such as media sites providing periodically updated content
Description: Managing and operating websites that serve as gateways to the internet, such as media sites that frequently update their content. This business activity involves maintaining the website's functionality, curating and updating content regularly, and ensuring a user-friendly interface. Services may include news updates, entertainment content, discussion forums, and other online resources that attract and engage users.

Division Name: Information service activities
Class Name: News agency activities
Sub-class Name: News agency activities
Description: Gathering, investigating, and fact-checking news from various sources, then supplying this information to newspapers, magazines, radio and television broadcasters, and other types of media outlets. These news agency activities often include writing news stories, editing content, and providing photographs or videos related to the news. They may also provide features, interviews, and special reports.

Division Name: Information service activities
Class Name: Other information service activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Telephone based information services
Description: Providing information services through telephone-based platforms, which could involve activities such as directory inquiries, weather updates, and other similar services. This business operation typically includes the processes of collecting, processing, and disseminating information to callers, often utilizing automated systems or live operators.

Division Name: Information service activities
Class Name: Other information service activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Activities of cyber cafe
Description: Operating cyber cafes, which involves providing internet access to the public for a fee. This may include related services such as computer rentals, printing, scanning, and photocopying. It also typically involves maintaining computer systems and networks, ensuring internet connectivity, and providing technical support to customers.

Division Name: Information service activities
Class Name: Other information service activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other information service activities n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this classification entail the provision of a variety of information services not classified elsewhere. These services may include the collection, delivery, and dissemination of publicly accessible information, the provision of infrastructure for data hosting, and other related services. This could encompass activities such as news clipping services, telephone-based information services, and web search portals. The core operations involve gathering, processing, and distributing information to clients or users.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Central banking
Sub-class Name: Central banking
Description: Managing and overseeing a country's monetary policy, including the regulation of money supply and interest rates. Activities involve issuing money, setting the nation's official interest rate, controlling the nation's entire money supply, and acting as the lender of last resort to commercial banks during times of financial crisis. Also includes managing foreign exchange reserves and ensuring financial stability in the economy.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Other monetary intermediation
Sub-class Name: Monetary intermediation of commercial banks, saving banks. postal savings bank and discount houses
Description: Commercial banks, savings banks, postal savings banks, and discount houses primarily engage in monetary intermediation. This involves receiving deposits from businesses or individuals and using these funds to extend loans or make investments. Services provided may include savings accounts, checking accounts, mortgage loans, personal loans, credit cards, and other financial products. These institutions also participate in money markets and foreign exchange activities.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Other monetary intermediation
Sub-class Name: Activities of specialized institutions granting credit for house purchases that also take deposits
Description: Granting specialized credit for house purchases and accepting deposits, typically conducted by financial institutions such as banks and mortgage companies. This involves assessing the creditworthiness of clients, providing home loans, managing customer deposits, and offering related banking services.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Other monetary intermediation
Sub-class Name: Other monetary intermediation services n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in financial transactions not classified elsewhere, such as the provision of specialized financial products or services. This may involve the facilitation of money transfers, the issuance of specialized loans, or other unique monetary services. These operations may also include the management and distribution of funds, the provision of investment advice, and the execution of financial transactions on behalf of clients.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Activities of holding companies
Sub-class Name: Activities of holding companie
Description: Holding companies primarily engage in owning the group's outstanding stock. Their main function is to control and manage other companies, which are their subsidiaries. Typical operations include strategic decision-making, financial management, and high-level administrative services. They do not provide any other service to the public or conduct any other business activities. Holding companies may own property, such as real estate, patents, trademarks, stocks, and other assets. However, they do not produce goods or offer services themselves.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Group Name: Trusts, funds and similar financial entities
Class Name: Trusts, funds and similar financial entities
Sub-class Name: Trusts, funds and other financial vehicles
Description: Management and administration of trusts, funds, and other financial vehicles, including investment trusts, pension funds, and insurance funds. This involves the collection, investment, and distribution of capital provided by investors or members. Services typically include asset management, financial planning, risk assessment, and fiduciary responsibilities.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Group Name: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities
Class Name: Financial leasing
Sub-class Name: Financial leasing
Description: Engaging in financial leasing activities, which involves the provision of equipment, vehicles, or other assets to businesses or individuals on a lease basis. This typically includes establishing lease agreements, determining lease terms and conditions, collecting lease payments, and managing leased assets. It may also involve the re-leasing of returned assets or their sale at the end of the lease term.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Group Name: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities
Class Name: Other credit granting
Sub-class Name: Other credit granting
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the provision of credit or loans that are not included under traditional banking services. This could include companies offering payday loans, peer-to-peer lending services, student loans, or vehicle financing. The core operations typically involve assessing the creditworthiness of potential borrowers, determining appropriate loan terms, disbursing funds, and managing repayment schedules. These businesses may also provide related advisory services, assisting clients in understanding their credit options and managing debt.

Division Name: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Group Name: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities
Class Name: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities, n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities, n.e.c.
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in providing financial services that are not specifically related to insurance or pension funding. These activities may include securities brokerage services, investment banking, stock exchange services, and other related financial services. They may also encompass financial consultancy, credit rating services, transaction processing and settlement services, and the provision of financial regulatory services. This classification also includes other financial activities that are not classified elsewhere, hence the term "n.e.c." (not elsewhere classified).

Division Name: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Class Name: Life insurance
Sub-class Name: Life insurance
Description: Offering life insurance policies to individuals, which provide financial benefits to beneficiaries upon the policyholder's death. This involves assessing risks and determining premium rates, processing applications, managing policy renewals, and handling claims. Services may also include providing financial advice related to life insurance policies.

Division Name: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Class Name: Non-life insurance
Sub-class Name: Non-life insurance
Description: Providing non-life insurance services, which cover various risks related to property, liability, vehicle, accident, health, and other types of insurance excluding life insurance. This involves the assessment of risk profiles, underwriting policies, collecting premiums, and settling insurance claims. It may also include reinsurance services and activities related to the policyholder's risk management.

Division Name: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Class Name: Reinsurance
Sub-class Name: Reinsurance
Description: Reinsurance activities involve the practice of insurers transferring portions of risk portfolios to other parties to reduce the likelihood of having to pay a large obligation resulting from an insurance claim. The business operations typically include risk analysis, policy underwriting, and claims management. Reinsurers provide services such as assuming risks from direct insurance companies, spreading risk across alternative institutions, and improving the solvency of primary insurers, thereby enhancing their financial stability.

Division Name: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Class Name: Pension funding
Sub-class Name: Pension funding
Description: Managing and administering funds intended for retirement income provision, which primarily involves the accumulation of assets from employers and employees, or self-employed individuals. The typical processes include collecting contributions, managing and investing the pooled funds, and distributing pension benefits to eligible participants upon retirement or disability. Services may also cover offering advice on pension planning and ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory standards.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Administration of financial markets
Sub-class Name: Administration of financial markets
Description: Overseeing and managing financial markets, including stock exchanges, commodity exchanges, and other securities markets. Typical processes involved are the regulation of securities transactions, enforcement of exchange rules and standards, and facilitation of the buying and selling of stocks, bonds, and other financial instruments. This also includes services like market surveillance, listing of securities, and clearing and settlement of trading transactions.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Security and commodity contracts brokerage
Sub-class Name: Security and commodity contracts brokerage
Description: Acting as intermediaries in buying, selling or trading of securities such as stocks, bonds and other financial instruments, as well as commodities like gold, oil, and agricultural products. This involves the provision of brokerage services, executing buy or sell orders on behalf of clients, and providing advice on investment decisions. It may also include the management of portfolios and the facilitation of transactions between buyers and sellers in the securities and commodities markets.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Other activities auxiliary to financial service activities
Sub-class Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service activities n.e.c.
Description: Supporting financial service activities not elsewhere classified, such as assisting in the planning, facilitating, and coordinating of financial operations. These activities may include providing advice on financial matters, assisting in the development of financial strategies, and offering supportive services for financial transactions and arrangements.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Risk and damage evaluation
Sub-class Name: Risk and damage evaluation
Description: Assessing and evaluating potential risks and damages in financial and insurance contexts. This involves conducting thorough investigations to identify vulnerabilities, calculating possible financial loss, and providing risk management solutions. Services may also include determining the value of damages in insurance claims, analyzing the causes of these damages, and recommending preventive measures to mitigate future risks.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Activities of insurance agents and brokers
Sub-class Name: Activities of insurance agents and brokers
Description: Insurance agents and brokers facilitate the sale of insurance policies to individuals and businesses. They help clients choose the best insurance coverage to suit their needs by comparing various insurance plans offered by different insurance companies. Services provided may include policy recommendations, risk assessment, and claims assistance. They also work on behalf of insurance companies to promote and sell their insurance products.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Group Name: Activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding
Class Name: Other activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding
Sub-class Name: Other activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding
Description: Businesses in this category primarily focus on supporting insurance and pension funding activities that are not classified elsewhere. This includes a variety of auxiliary services such as providing consultancy on insurance and pension plans, performing administrative tasks, and managing claims and policy processing. Other operations may involve risk and damage evaluation, actuarial services, and other insurance-related services. The aim is to facilitate the smooth functioning of insurance and pension funding activities.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Class Name: Fund management activities
Sub-class Name: Management of mutual funds
Description: Overseeing and administering mutual funds, which includes pooling funds from multiple investors to create a larger, diversified portfolio. Typical operations involve selecting suitable investment strategies, executing trades, tracking performance, and managing risk. Services also encompass handling all administrative duties such as preparing financial statements and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Class Name: Fund management activities
Sub-class Name: Management of pension funds
Description: Overseeing and managing pension funds, which includes investing and reallocating assets to ensure fund growth and meet future payout obligations. Typical processes involve setting investment strategies, asset allocation, risk management, and regulatory compliance. Services may also include providing financial advice and planning for pension fund contributors.

Division Name: Activities auxiliary to financial service and insurance activities
Class Name: Fund management activities
Sub-class Name: Management of other investment funds
Description: Overseeing and managing non-traditional investment funds, such as hedge funds, private equity funds, or real estate investment trusts. This involves activities like devising investment strategies, allocating assets, handling transactions, and performing administrative tasks. Services may also include risk management, providing financial advice, and preparing financial reports for investors.

Division Name: Real estate activities
Group Name: Real estate activities with own or leased property
Class Name: Real estate activities with own or leased property
Sub-class Name: Real estate activities with own or leased property
Description: Ownership, management, and rental of real estate properties, either owned or leased. This encompasses activities such as buying, selling, and renting of residential, commercial, or industrial properties. It also includes the operation of residential and non-residential buildings, managing real estate on a fee or contract basis, and providing related services such as property valuation.

Division Name: Real estate activities
Group Name: Real estate activities on a fee or contract basis
Class Name: Real estate activities on a fee or contract basis
Sub-class Name: Real estate activities on a fee or contract basis
Description: Engaging in real estate activities on a fee or contract basis involves providing a variety of services related to property transactions. This includes real estate brokerage services, property management, appraisal services, and real estate consulting. The core business operations may involve facilitating the buying, selling, or renting of property on behalf of clients, providing expert advice on property value and market trends, and managing properties to ensure optimal operation and return on investment. These services are typically provided for a predetermined fee or as part of a contractual agreement.

Division Name: Legal and accounting activities
Class Name: Legal activities
Sub-class Name: Legal activities
Description: Providing professional legal services, this includes activities carried out by lawyers, barristers, solicitors, and other legal practitioners. Services typically involve offering legal advice, representing clients in civil and criminal cases, preparing and reviewing legal documents, and conducting legal research. This class also encompasses activities of notary publics, arbitrators, mediators, and other legal support services.

Division Name: Legal and accounting activities
Group Name: Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing activities; tax consultancy
Class Name: Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing activities; tax consultancy
Sub-class Name: Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing activities
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the provision of a range of financial record-keeping services. These include the preparation, examination, and verification of financial accounts and records, as well as the analysis and interpretation of these records. In addition, businesses may also provide auditing services, where they assess the accuracy and compliance of a company's financial statements. Other services may include the preparation of financial reports and statements, the calculation of taxes owed, and tax consultancy services which involve advising clients on tax compliance and planning.

Division Name: Legal and accounting activities
Group Name: Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing activities; tax consultancy
Class Name: Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing activities; tax consultancy
Sub-class Name: Tax consultancy
Description: Provision of tax consultancy services involves advising clients on tax-related matters, preparing and filing tax returns, and helping businesses understand and comply with local, state, and federal tax regulations. This business activity may also include tax planning services to minimize tax liabilities, offering guidance on tax implications of business decisions, and representing clients in tax disputes or audits.

Division Name: Activities of head offices; management consultancy activities
Class Name: Activities of head offices
Sub-class Name: Activities of head offices
Description: Overseeing and managing overall organizational functions from a central unit, typically referred to as the head office. This involves strategic planning, corporate governance, and decision-making activities. Services provided may include setting company-wide policies, defining business strategies, coordinating different departments, and handling overall administrative tasks.

Division Name: Activities of head offices; management consultancy activities
Class Name: Management consultancy activities
Sub-class Name: Management consultancy activities
Description: Providing expert advice and strategies to businesses to improve their performance and efficiency, management consultancy activities involve analyzing existing organizational problems and developing plans for improvement. Typical services include business strategy advice, operational improvement services, developing coaching skills, technology implementation, strategy development, or operational improvement services. They may also provide organizational change management assistance, process analysis, technology implementation, strategy development, and operational improvement services.

Division Name: Architectural and engineering activities; technical testing and analysis
Group Name: Architectural and engineering activities and related technical consultancy
Class Name: Architectural and engineering activities and related technical consultancy
Sub-class Name: Architectural and engineering activities and related technical consultancy
Description: Business activities in this classification primarily involve providing professional architectural and engineering services. This includes drafting blueprints, designing buildings, structures, and systems, conducting feasibility studies, preparing environmental impact studies, and providing project management services. Additionally, these businesses offer technical consultancy related to architectural and engineering projects, such as advising on best practices, ensuring compliance with safety and building codes, and recommending innovative solutions.

Division Name: Architectural and engineering activities; technical testing and analysis
Class Name: Technical testing and analysis
Sub-class Name: Technical testing and analysis
Description: Business activities in this category involve conducting technical testing and analysis. This typically includes services like product and machinery testing, materials testing, radiographic, magnetic, and ultrasonic testing, and other non-destructive testing methods. It also covers the analysis of physical properties of materials, composition testing, and reliability or performance testing. These services help in ensuring the quality, safety, and performance of products or systems in various industries.

Division Name: Scientific research and development
Group Name: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering
Class Name: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering
Sub-class Name: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering
Description: Conducting research and experimental development in the fields of natural sciences and engineering. This involves the systematic investigation into physical and natural phenomena or specific problems in these fields, with the goal of discovering new knowledge or developing new products, processes, or services. Typical activities may include designing and conducting experiments, analyzing and interpreting data, and reporting findings. This could cover a wide range of scientific disciplines, such as physics, chemistry, biology, and various branches of engineering.

Division Name: Scientific research and development
Group Name: Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities
Class Name: Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities
Sub-class Name: Research and experimental development on social sciences and humanities
Description: Conducting research and experimental development in the fields of social sciences and humanities. This involves creating, enhancing, and applying new knowledge in areas such as sociology, psychology, history, philosophy, and linguistics. Typical processes may include conducting surveys, performing controlled experiments, analyzing historical documents, or carrying out ethnographic research. Services often provided include the publication of research findings, consulting on social science and humanities issues, and providing expert testimony or analysis.

Division Name: Advertising and market research
Class Name: Advertising
Sub-class Name: Advertising
Description: Creating and managing advertising campaigns for clients, which involves the design, production, and dissemination of advertising material. Services may include market research to identify target audiences, creative concept development, media planning and buying, digital advertising, public relations, and event promotion. This also includes online advertising and other digital marketing activities.

Division Name: Advertising and market research
Group Name: Market research and public opinion polling
Class Name: Market research and public opinion polling
Sub-class Name: Market research and public opinion polling
Description: Conducting market research and public opinion polling, which involves gathering, analyzing, and interpreting information about a market, about a product or service to be offered for sale in that market, and about the past, present, and potential customers for the product or service. This also includes gauging public opinion from a particular sample, typically used in politics, marketing, or social science research. Services may include designing and managing surveys, conducting interviews, analyzing data, and presenting findings in a comprehensive report.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Specialized design activities
Sub-class Name: Fashion design related to textiles, wearing apparel, shoes, jewelry, furniture and other fashion goods as well as other personal or household goods
Description: Designing fashion products related to textiles, wearing apparel, shoes, jewelry, furniture, and other fashion goods, as well as other personal or household goods. The core operations involve conceptualizing, sketching, and creating prototypes of fashion items. Services may also include custom design work, trend forecasting, and production consulting.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Specialized design activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of interior decorators
Description: Interior decoration activities involve designing and planning the aesthetic and functional aspects of indoor spaces. This includes selecting and arranging furniture, fixtures, finishes, and color schemes to create visually pleasing and comfortable environments. Services typically provided may also encompass creating design concepts, providing detailed drawings, and overseeing installation or arrangement of elements. These activities are often customized based on clients' preferences and requirements, and can be applied to residential, commercial, or public spaces.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Specialized design activities
Sub-class Name: Services of graphic designers
Description: Creating and providing graphic design services, including designing visual communication materials like logos, brochures, advertisements, packaging, and other printed materials. This also involves consulting with clients to understand their design needs, creating initial concepts, refining designs based on feedback, and preparing final artwork for print or digital use.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Specialized design activities
Sub-class Name: Other specialized design activities n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in specialized design activities that do not fit into other defined categories, this business involves providing unique and tailored design services. These may encompass a wide range of industries and fields, including but not limited to, custom furniture design, fashion design, industrial product design, and graphic design. Typical processes include conceptualizing, drafting, and refining design solutions based on client needs and specifications. This business activity may also involve collaborating with manufacturers or builders to ensure the successful execution of the designs.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Photographic activities
Sub-class Name: Commercial and consumer photograph production
Description: Commercial and consumer photograph production involves the creation and supply of photographic images for both commercial and individual use. Typical processes include taking photographs, editing images, and producing physical or digital copies. Services may also include arranging and conducting photoshoots, providing professional photography for events, advertising, fashion, or product photography, and offering personalized photo services for consumers such as family portraits or wedding photography.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Photographic activities
Sub-class Name: Photographic film processing
Description: Developing and processing photographic film, including services like color correction, enlarging, and reducing. This involves transforming the latent image on exposed film into a visible image using various chemical processes. Other services may include scanning negatives, creating digital copies, and archiving photos.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Photographic activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of photojournalists
Description: Photojournalism activities encompass the capturing and editing of images to narrate a news story or event. This involves taking photographs at news scenes, processing and editing these images, and often working with news agencies or publications to provide visual support for news stories. Photojournalists may also conduct interviews and write accompanying text for their images.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Photographic activities
Sub-class Name: Microfilming of documents
Description: Converting documents into microfilm format for efficient storage and preservation. This involves processes such as document preparation, filming, developing, and quality control checks. Services may also include the digitization of microfilm records and providing access solutions for easy retrieval of microfilmed documents.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Class Name: Photographic activities
Sub-class Name: Other photographic activities
Description: Engaging in a variety of photographic activities not specified elsewhere, such as commercial and consumer photography, photo editing and retouching, and photographic archiving and preservation. This can involve capturing and producing images for various purposes, providing digital alteration services, creating photo books or albums, and maintaining photographic collections.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Group Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Business brokerage activities
Description: Business brokerage activities involve facilitating the buying and selling of businesses for clients. This includes evaluating the business, determining its market value, advertising it for sale without disclosing its identity, handling inquiries from potential buyers, facilitating negotiations, and coordinating the due diligence investigation. Additionally, these activities may also encompass assisting clients in structuring the sale transaction and helping to close the deal.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Group Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Patent brokerage activities
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve facilitating the sale, purchase, and licensing of patents. This includes services such as patent valuation, negotiation of patent rights, and management of patent portfolios. The core operations typically involve providing expert advice on patent value, mediating between patent holders and potential buyers or licensees, and ensuring legal compliance in patent transactions.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Group Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Weather forecasting activities
Description: Conducting weather forecasting activities, which involve the collection and analysis of atmospheric data to predict weather conditions. Typical processes include meteorological research, weather data collection, climate modeling, and the provision of weather forecasts and warnings for public, commercial, and agricultural uses.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Group Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Security consulting
Description: Providing security consulting services, which involve analyzing and advising on an organization's security measures. This includes assessing potential risks, developing and implementing security protocols, and training staff on security measures. It may also involve providing advice on digital security, including network and data protection.

Division Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Group Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other professional, scientific and technical activities n.e.c.
Description: Business activities under this classification encompass a wide range of professional, scientific, and technical services not elsewhere classified. These may include specialized consulting services, scientific research and development, technical testing and analysis, and other knowledge-based services. Typical processes could involve conducting studies and analyses, offering expert advice, developing innovative solutions, and providing other specialized services based on client needs. The aim is to provide professional, scientific, and technical expertise to clients in various sectors.

Division Name: Veterinary activities
Class Name: Veterinary activities
Sub-class Name: Veterinary activities
Description: Veterinary activities encompass the provision of medical care and treatment for animals. This includes diagnosis, prevention and treatment of diseases, injuries or disorders in animals. Services typically involve general animal healthcare, surgical procedures, and preventative treatments such as vaccinations. It may also include animal hospital services, veterinary consultation, and emergency services for pets, livestock, and other animals.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of motor vehicles
Class Name: Renting and leasing of motor vehicles
Sub-class Name: Renting and leasing of motor vehicles
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are primarily involved in the renting and leasing of motor vehicles. This includes providing short-term or long-term rentals of cars, trucks, or vans, often with a variety of options such as different models, sizes, and types of vehicles. It also includes leasing services, where vehicles are rented for a longer duration, typically with a contract. The operations may involve maintaining and servicing the fleet of vehicles, managing rental contracts, and providing customer service related to the rental or lease.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods
Description: The business activity of renting and leasing recreational and sports goods involves the provision of sports equipment, outdoor gear, and other recreational items for temporary use. Core operations include acquiring, maintaining, and renting out a wide range of goods such as camping equipment, water sports gear, winter sports equipment, and other sporting goods. Services typically provided include short-term or long-term leasing options, equipment maintenance and repair, and sometimes delivery and pickup services.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting of video tapes and disks
Sub-class Name: Renting of video tapes and disks
Description: Leasing out video tapes and disks for temporary use, typically involving a physical or online store where customers can browse, select, and rent films or other video content. The business operation may also include services such as home delivery and return pick up of rented items. The store might also offer recommendations and reviews to guide customers in their selection.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of tent, furniture, pottery and glass, kitchen and tableware, utensils, household electrical and electronic equipments etc.
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the rental and leasing of various personal and household goods such as tents, furniture, pottery and glass items, kitchen and tableware, utensils, and household electrical and electronic equipment. Typical operations involve the procurement, maintenance, and leasing of these items to customers for temporary use. Services may also include delivery and pickup of rented goods, as well as providing necessary support and guidance on the usage of certain items.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of books, journals and magazines
Description: Businesses in this sub-class primarily engage in renting out books, journals, and magazines to consumers. This involves acquiring a diverse range of publications, maintaining an inventory, and providing rental services on a short-term or long-term basis. It may also include the operation of online platforms or physical stores for customers to browse, select, and rent these items. Services can also extend to home delivery and return pick-up of rented items.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of jewellery, musical instruments, scenery and costumes
Description: The business activity involves the rental of various personal and household goods, with a specific focus on items such as jewellery, musical instruments, scenery, and costumes. Core operations include sourcing and maintaining a diverse inventory of these items, setting rental terms and conditions, and managing the rental process which includes issuing the items to customers and receiving them back after the rental period. Additional services may include delivery and pick-up of rented items, and providing repair or replacement services for damaged goods.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of textiles, wearing apparel, footwear, sleeping bag, rucksack, household goods
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the rental and leasing of various personal and household goods such as textiles, wearing apparel, footwear, sleeping bags, rucksacks, and other household items. Typical operations include the procurement, maintenance, and leasing out of these items to individuals or households for temporary use. Services may also encompass delivery and collection of rented goods, as well as offering flexible rental terms to meet diverse customer needs.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of personal and household goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of other personal and household goods n.e.c.
Description: This business activity involves the rental or leasing of various personal and household goods that are not explicitly specified elsewhere. Typical operations may include the leasing of items such as furniture, appliances, electronics, sports equipment, books, or clothing. Services provided may encompass the delivery and pickup of rented items, maintenance services, and providing flexible rental terms to accommodate a diverse range of customer needs.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing, without operator, of other machinery and equipment that are generally used as capital goods by industries
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the rental and leasing of various types of machinery and equipment, typically used as capital goods in various industries, without providing an operator. This can include a wide range of equipment such as construction machinery, factory equipment, medical devices, or agricultural machinery. The core operations involve the acquisition, maintenance, and leasing of these assets to clients who require them for a specific period of time. These businesses may also offer related services such as delivery and pick-up, equipment setup and breakdown, and providing advice on equipment use.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of agricultural and forestry machinery and equipment without operator
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in renting or leasing agricultural and forestry machinery and equipment without providing an operator. Typical operations involve providing short or long-term leases on a range of equipment such as tractors, harvesters, plows, and forestry machinery. The equipment is typically used by customers for farming or forestry activities, but the business itself does not participate in these activities. Services may also include maintenance and repair of the leased equipment, but do not involve the operation or supervision of the machinery.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of construction and civil-engineering machinery and equipment without operator
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily engaged in the renting and operational leasing of construction and civil-engineering machinery and equipment without an operator. This includes equipment such as excavators, cranes, bulldozers, and other similar machinery. The core operations involve leasing these types of machinery to clients for a specified period, maintaining the equipment to ensure it is in good working condition, and handling the logistics of delivering and retrieving the equipment from the client's location. However, these businesses do not provide operators or personnel to run the machinery.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of office machinery and equipment without operator
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are primarily engaged in the rental or leasing of office machinery and equipment, such as computers, printers, copiers, and fax machines, without providing an operator. This involves activities like managing rental contracts, maintaining the equipment, and providing customer support for the leased items. They may also offer flexible leasing terms to accommodate the changing needs of clients. This does not include any services related to operating the leased machinery or equipment.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of land-transport equipment (other than motor vehicles) without drivers
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the renting and operational leasing of various types of land-transport equipment, excluding motor vehicles, without providing drivers. The core operations include leasing out equipment such as bicycles, motorcycles, trailers, and semitrailers, along with other non-motorized land transport equipment. Services typically provided include short-term or long-term leasing options, maintenance and repair services, and consultation on equipment selection based on client needs.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of water-transport equipment without operator
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the rental and operational leasing of water-transport equipment without an operator. This includes leasing of vessels like boats, ships, yachts, or any other waterborne crafts for commercial or personal use. The services typically involve short-term or long-term leasing of the equipment, maintenance and repair services for the leased equipment, and may also include insurance coverage for the duration of the lease. The lessee is responsible for operating the equipment.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and operational leasing of air transport equipment without operator
Description: Businesses in this category are primarily involved in renting and operational leasing of air transport equipment without an operator. This includes leasing various types of air transport equipment such as airplanes, helicopters, and drones for a specified period. The lessor retains ownership of the equipment and the lessee pays for the use of the equipment. Services may also involve maintenance of the leased equipment, ensuring they meet safety standards and regulations. This does not include providing personnel to operate the equipment.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting of other tangible goods with out operator (includes renting of containers, pallets, animals etc.)
Description: Businesses in this sub-class are involved in the renting and leasing of various machinery, equipment, and other tangible goods without an operator. Typical operations include offering rental services for items such as containers, pallets, and even animals. This could encompass a wide range of activities, from providing storage solutions through container rentals, to supplying equipment for specific tasks or projects, to leasing animals for various purposes. The main focus is on facilitating temporary access to necessary goods or equipment for clients who do not wish to purchase them outright.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery, equipment and tangible goods
Sub-class Name: Renting and leasing of other machinery and equipment n.e.c. without operator
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in the rental and leasing of various types of machinery, equipment, and other tangible goods without providing an operator. This could include a wide range of items not specified elsewhere, such as industrial machinery, construction equipment, agricultural machinery, or office equipment. Typical services provided by these businesses include short-term or long-term leasing contracts, maintenance and repair services for the leased equipment, and potentially delivery and installation services. The core operation involves managing the rental inventory, ensuring the functionality and safety of the equipment, and providing customer service for the lease agreements.

Division Name: Rental and leasing activities
Group Name: Leasing of intellectual property and similar products, except copyrighted works
Class Name: Leasing of intellectual property and similar products, except copyrighted works
Sub-class Name: Leasing of nonfinancial intangible assets
Description: Businesses in this category primarily engage in leasing nonfinancial intangible assets such as patents, trademarks, and licensing agreements. This does not include copyrighted works. The core operations involve establishing licensing agreements with clients, managing the terms and conditions of these agreements, and ensuring the protection of the leased intellectual property. Services may also include the negotiation of lease terms, renewal of leases, and dispute resolution related to the leased assets.

Division Name: Employment activities
Class Name: Activities of employment placement agencies
Sub-class Name: Activities of employment placement agencies
