Description: Employment placement agencies specialize in connecting job seekers with potential employers. Their core activities include collecting and maintaining a database of job vacancies, screening applicants, conducting initial interviews, and recommending candidates to employers. They may also provide additional services such as career counseling, resume writing assistance, and interview preparation. These agencies work across various sectors, aiming to fill positions on both a temporary and permanent basis.

Division Name: Employment activities
Class Name: Temporary employment agency activities
Sub-class Name: Temporary employment agency activities
Description: The business activity involves the operation of temporary employment agencies that connect job seekers with employers on a temporary basis. Typical processes include sourcing and screening potential candidates, matching them with job vacancies, and facilitating the hiring process. Services provided might also cover payroll and human resource functions for the temporary staff employed.

Division Name: Employment activities
Class Name: Other human resources provision
Sub-class Name: Human resources provision and management of human resources functions
Description: Businesses under this classification are primarily involved in offering various human resources services. These services may include managing and providing human resources functions for other organizations. Typical operations involve recruitment and staffing, employee training and development, performance management, compensation and benefits administration, labor relations, and organizational development. These businesses may also offer strategic planning services to align human resources strategy with the overall business strategy.

Division Name: Travel agency, tour operator, reservation service and related activities
Group Name: Travel agency and tour operator activities
Class Name: Travel agency activities
Sub-class Name: Travel agency activities
Description: Organizing, planning, and arranging travel tours and vacations for individuals and groups. This encompasses booking transportation, accommodations, and other travel services, as well as providing travel advice and information. It may also involve the sale of travel insurance and assistance in securing travel documents such as visas and passports.

Division Name: Travel agency, tour operator, reservation service and related activities
Group Name: Travel agency and tour operator activities
Class Name: Tour operator activities
Sub-class Name: Tour operator activities
Description: Organizing, arranging, and conducting tours that are packaged and sold through travel agencies or directly by agents of tour operators. This involves activities such as creating and marketing travel packages, scheduling flights, securing hotel reservations, arranging for transportation and sightseeing tours, and providing other travel-related services as a part of these packaged tours. The tours can be customized or standardized, domestic or international.

Division Name: Travel agency, tour operator, reservation service and related activities
Group Name: Other reservation service and related activities
Class Name: Other reservation service and related activities
Sub-class Name: Other reservation service and related activities
Description: Business operations under this classification involve providing various reservation services not covered by other categories. This can include reservation services for transportation, hotels, restaurants, car rentals, entertainment activities, and more. It also encompasses related services such as ticketing agencies, travel tour operators, and time-share exchange services. The key processes involve managing bookings, customer service, and coordinating with service providers to ensure smooth delivery of the reserved services.

Division Name: Security and investigation activities
Class Name: Private security activities
Sub-class Name: Private security activities
Description: Private security activities involve providing security services to individuals, businesses, and organizations. Core operations include the deployment of security personnel, installation and monitoring of security systems, and offering consultancy on security matters. Services typically provided include bodyguard services, security guard services, armoured car services, and security system monitoring services. These activities may also involve conducting private investigations and providing polygraph examination services.

Division Name: Security and investigation activities
Class Name: Security systems service activities
Sub-class Name: Security systems service activities
Description: Installation, maintenance, and monitoring of security systems, including alarms, surveillance cameras, and access control systems. This involves assessing client's security needs, recommending suitable security solutions, installing and configuring security systems, regular system checks and updates, and providing immediate response to security alerts. Services may also include consultation and advice on security matters.

Division Name: Security and investigation activities
Class Name: Investigation activities
Sub-class Name: Investigation activities
Description: Conducting investigative services, such as private investigations, corporate investigations, and background checks. This involves gathering information through surveillance, research, and interviews. Services may also include investigating computer crimes, insurance claims, and suspected fraudulent activities.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Class Name: Combined facilities support activities
Sub-class Name: Combined facilities support activities
Description: Businesses under this classification are primarily engaged in providing a combination of support services within a client's facilities. These services typically include general interior cleaning, maintenance, trash disposal, guard and security, mail routing, reception, laundry and related services. These combined services are most often provided to offices, factories, schools, hospitals, commercial complexes, and other businesses and institutions. The main goal of these businesses is to handle the day-to-day operations necessary to run a facility efficiently, allowing the client to focus on their core business activities.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Class Name: General cleaning of buildings
Sub-class Name: General cleaning of buildings
Description: Business activities encompass the general cleaning of buildings, including residential, commercial, and industrial structures. Core operations involve routine and comprehensive cleaning tasks such as sweeping, mopping, dusting, and vacuuming. Services may also include waste removal, window cleaning, and deep-cleaning of specific areas like bathrooms and kitchens. Additionally, this business may offer specialized cleaning services for different types of flooring, upholstery, and equipment within the building.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Class Name: Other building and industrial cleaning activities
Sub-class Name: Cleaning of trains buses, planes etc.
Description: Business activities encompass the cleaning and maintenance of various modes of transportation such as trains, buses, and planes. This includes comprehensive interior and exterior cleaning, disinfection, and upkeep services. Typical operations might involve vacuuming, washing, trash removal, and sanitizing surfaces to ensure a clean and hygienic environment for passengers. The service may also extend to the cleaning of transportation facilities such as train stations, bus depots, and airport terminals.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Class Name: Other building and industrial cleaning activities
Sub-class Name: Cleaning of industrial machinery
Description: Businesses in this category primarily focus on the cleaning of industrial machinery. This involves performing specialized cleaning tasks for large-scale machines used in various industries. Services typically include the removal of dust, grease, and other contaminants, as well as the application of protective coatings, to ensure the optimal performance and longevity of the machinery. This may also encompass the cleaning of factory floors and other industrial spaces where these machines are housed.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Class Name: Other building and industrial cleaning activities
Sub-class Name: Other building and industrial cleaning activities
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the provision of cleaning services for various types of buildings and industrial facilities. These services may include general building cleaning, window cleaning, floor cleaning, and other specialized cleaning tasks. In the industrial setting, it could involve the cleaning of factories, warehouses, and other industrial sites, which may require specialized equipment or procedures due to the nature of the work conducted in these spaces. The operations typically involve the use of cleaning products and equipment, waste disposal, and maintaining cleanliness standards.

Division Name: Services to buildings and landscape activities
Group Name: Landscape care and maintenance service activities
Class Name: Landscape care and maintenance service activities
Sub-class Name: Landscape care and maintenance service activities
Description: Businesses in this category provide landscape care and maintenance services, which include the upkeep and preservation of outdoor spaces such as gardens, lawns, and other green areas. Core operations typically involve mowing, weeding, mulching, and pruning, as well as the installation and maintenance of irrigation systems. Additional services may include seasonal planting, fertilization, pest control, and landscape design and renovation. These businesses may serve residential, commercial, or public properties.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Combined office administrative service activities
Sub-class Name: Combined office administrative service activities
Description: Office administrative service activities encompass a range of operations that support the day-to-day functioning of an office. These include general secretarial services, clerical services, billing and record-keeping, planning and scheduling meetings and events, as well as other administrative activities necessary for efficient office management. This classification also includes businesses that provide a combination of these services to other firms on a contract or fee basis.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Photocopying, document preparation and other specialized office support activities
Sub-class Name: Photocopying, duplicating and blueprinting services
Description: Businesses in this sub-class provide photocopying, duplicating, and blueprinting services. This involves making copies of documents, images, or designs using different technologies such as photocopiers, duplicators, and blueprint machines. These services are often required for office documentation, architectural plans, and technical drawings. The process typically includes receiving original documents from customers, creating copies as per their requirements, and delivering the replicated documents back to the customers.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Photocopying, document preparation and other specialized office support activities
Sub-class Name: Document preparation, typing, word processing and desktop publishing services
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve preparing documents, performing typing services, offering word processing, and providing desktop publishing services. Typical processes include the creation and formatting of written documents, transcription services, and the design and layout of publications using desktop publishing software. Other services may also include proofreading, editing, and other related document preparation services.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Photocopying, document preparation and other specialized office support activities
Sub-class Name: Other specialised office support services activities
Description: Business operations in this sub-class involve providing a range of specialized office support services. These activities may include but are not limited to document preparation, photocopying, and other related services. The processes typically involve preparing, editing, and printing documents, making copies of documents for distribution, and delivering specialized support services tailored to the needs of the office. These services are designed to help other businesses maintain their office functions efficiently.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Activities of call centres
Sub-class Name: Activities of call centres
Description: Managing and operating call centres that handle customer inquiries, complaints, and support requests over the phone, email, or other communication channels. This involves providing inbound services such as customer assistance, technical support, and complaint resolution, as well as outbound services like telemarketing, market research, and customer feedback collection.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Group Name: Organization of conventions and trade shows
Class Name: Organization of conventions and trade shows
Sub-class Name: Organization of conventions and trade shows
Description: Planning, coordinating, and executing conventions and trade shows. This involves activities such as event design, venue selection, hiring vendors, arranging for transportation and accommodation, marketing and promotion, and on-site event management. The service may also include organizing both physical and virtual events, depending on client needs.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Activities of collection agencies and credit bureaus
Sub-class Name: Activities of collection agencies and credit bureaus
Description: Business operations within this category primarily involve the collection of payments for claims and remittance for various entities. This includes agencies that specialize in pursuing payments on delinquent debts owed by individuals or businesses. Additionally, this also covers operations of credit bureaus that collate and distribute credit information on individuals and businesses, typically providing such information to lenders and other creditors to assist in their risk assessment processes.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Packaging activities
Sub-class Name: Packaging activities
Description: Businesses under this classification are involved in packaging activities. These operations typically encompass the process of preparing goods for safe transport, storage, and sale. Services provided can include wrapping, boxing, sealing, and labeling items, as well as designing and producing packaging materials. These activities may be performed for a diverse range of products, from food and beverages to electronics and household goods.

Division Name: Office administrative, office support and other business support activities
Class Name: Other business support service activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other business support service activities n.e.c
Description: Business support service activities not elsewhere classified (n.e.c.) encompass a wide range of services that support the operations of other businesses. These services might include general office administration, clerical services, hiring and placing of personnel, document preparation, and other day-to-day office administrative services. Additionally, it may involve providing specialized services such as planning, organizing, and managing events. The core operations involve assisting businesses in their administrative tasks, enabling them to focus on their primary business functions.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: General public administration activities
Sub-class Name: General public service activities relating to executive
Description: Administration of governmental activities at a high level, typically involving executive decision-making processes. This includes the formulation and implementation of policies, rules, and regulations, as well as the coordination of public programs. Services may encompass the management of public funds, supervision of public services, and ensuring the smooth operation of governmental departments and agencies.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: General public administration activities
Sub-class Name: General public service activities relating to legislation
Description: Activities involved in this business classification pertain to the administration of public services related to legislation. This typically includes drafting, enacting, and interpreting laws and regulations at various levels of government. It also involves the implementation and enforcement of these laws and regulations. Services such as legislative oversight, statutory interpretation, legal advice, and administrative rulemaking are commonly provided in this sector.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: General public administration activities
Sub-class Name: General public service activities n.e.c.
Description: Administration activities encompassing a broad range of public services not otherwise classified. These may involve the formulation and implementation of policies, planning and administration of government programs, and regulation of different sectors. Services provided could include disaster management, emergency response coordination, public safety administration, and other general government services.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: Regulation of the activities of providing health care, education, cultural services and other social services, excluding social security
Sub-class Name: Regulatory agencies relating to health
Description: Overseeing and regulating the provision of health care services is the primary activity in this sub-class. This involves monitoring and setting standards for healthcare providers to ensure quality, safety, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Typical processes include conducting inspections, issuing licenses and permits, handling complaints, and enforcing rules and regulations related to healthcare services. This sub-class does not include the regulation of social security services.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: Regulation of the activities of providing health care, education, cultural services and other social services, excluding social security
Sub-class Name: Regulatory agencies relating to education
Description: Overseeing and regulating educational institutions and services forms the central business activity in this category. This involves setting standards, implementing regulations, and ensuring compliance by educational institutions and services. Typical processes may include conducting evaluations, granting accreditations, and handling complaints or issues related to the education sector. However, this does not encompass social security services.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: Regulation of the activities of providing health care, education, cultural services and other social services, excluding social security
Sub-class Name: Regulatory agencies relating to other social services n.e.c. excluding social security
Description: Overseeing and regulating the provision of health care, education, cultural services, and various other social services, apart from social security. This involves monitoring the operations of these sectors, setting standards and guidelines, and ensuring compliance with regulations. The sub-class specifically pertains to regulatory agencies focused on miscellaneous social services not elsewhere classified, excluding social security. Typical activities may include policy development, enforcement of regulations, licensing, and evaluation of service quality.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Administration of the State and the economic and social policy of the community
Class Name: Regulation of and contribution to more efficient operation of businesses
Sub-class Name: Regulation of and contribution to more efficient operation of businesses
Description: Overseeing and contributing to the improved efficiency of businesses through regulatory activities. This involves creating and implementing policies and guidelines to streamline business operations, ensure compliance with industry standards, and promote productivity. Services may include conducting audits, providing recommendations for improvement, and offering training or resources to facilitate better business practices. This classification also encompasses the enforcement of these regulations and guidelines to ensure businesses operate within legal and ethical boundaries.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Provision of services to the community as a whole
Class Name: Foreign affairs
Sub-class Name: Foreign affairs
Description: Management and operation of governmental foreign affairs activities. This involves the formulation and implementation of foreign policies, diplomatic and consular services, representation of the home government abroad, and handling of international diplomatic affairs. It also includes the operation of embassies, consulates, or other types of foreign government establishments.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Provision of services to the community as a whole
Class Name: Defence activities
Sub-class Name: Defence activities
Description: Activities involved in this classification include the operation and management of national defence affairs. This encompasses strategic planning, logistics, training, intelligence gathering, and the maintenance of defence forces. It also includes the procurement and production of weapons, ammunition, and other military equipment. Additionally, this classification covers the administration and operation of military bases and facilities. Services provided may also involve peacekeeping operations, military missions and operations, and other related defence services.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Group Name: Provision of services to the community as a whole
Class Name: Public order and safety activities
Sub-class Name: Public order and safety activities
Description: Management and enforcement of public order and safety measures, including the operation of police forces, firefighting services, and court systems. This involves maintaining law and order, providing emergency services, ensuring public safety during events, conducting safety inspections, and implementing crime prevention initiatives. It also includes activities related to the administration of justice such as court operations, prosecution services, and prison administration.

Section Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Division Name: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
Class Name: Compulsory social security activities
Sub-class Name: Compulsory social security activities
Description: Administration and execution of government-mandated social security programs, including the collection, management, and distribution of funds. These activities typically involve ensuring the provision of benefits to retirees, the unemployed, and persons with disabilities. It also includes the administration of insurance programs, such as health, maternity, and work-related accident insurance.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Pre-primary and primary education
Sub-class Name: Pre-primary education (education preceding the first level)
Description: Provision of pre-primary education, which is the level of education before primary school. This typically includes activities such as teaching basic literacy and numeracy skills, social interaction, and physical development to children, usually between the ages of 3 and 5. Services may also involve providing care, supervision, and recreational activities for children during the day.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Pre-primary and primary education
Sub-class Name: Primary education (education at the first level)
Description: Providing education at the first level, which includes teaching basic skills such as reading, writing, and mathematics. This business activity involves the operation of primary schools and other institutions that offer a curriculum designed for younger students in the early stages of their academic journey. Services typically include classroom instruction led by certified teachers, development of social skills through group activities, and monitoring of student progress through regular assessments.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Pre-primary and primary education
Sub-class Name: Provision of literacy programmes for adults at primary level
Description: Offering literacy programmes for adults at the primary level, which involve teaching basic reading, writing, and arithmetic skills. Typical services include designing and implementing educational curricula, conducting classes, and assessing student progress. This may also involve providing additional support and resources to aid adult learners in their educational journey.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Pre-primary and primary education
Sub-class Name: Special education for handicapped students at primary level
Description: Providing special education services to handicapped students at the pre-primary and primary level. This involves designing and implementing individualized educational programs, offering therapeutic interventions, and adapting teaching strategies to meet the unique needs of these students. Services may also include speech and language therapy, physical therapy, and occupational therapy, all aimed at enhancing the learning experience and personal development of handicapped students.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Pre-primary and primary education
Sub-class Name: Other primary education activities n.e.c.
Description: Conducting educational activities at the primary level that do not fall under traditional categories. This can include alternative or experimental learning programs, special education initiatives, or home-schooling support services. The core operations involve the development and implementation of unique or specialized curriculums, teaching methods, and educational resources to enhance primary education.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: General secondary education
Sub-class Name: General school education in the first stage of the secondary level (up to X th standard) without any special subject pre-requisite
Description: Providing general school education at the first stage of the secondary level, typically up to the tenth standard. This involves delivering a broad curriculum without any specific subject prerequisites. Core operations include developing lesson plans, teaching a wide range of subjects, administering tests and assessments, and monitoring student progress. Services may also encompass guidance counseling, extracurricular activity coordination, and parent-teacher communication.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: General secondary education
Sub-class Name: General school education in the second stage of the secondary level (Senior/Higher secondary) giving, in principle, access to higher education
Description: Providing general school education at the senior or higher secondary level, which typically prepares students for higher education. This includes teaching a broad curriculum, conducting examinations, and offering guidance services. The core operations involve creating and implementing lesson plans, grading student performance, and facilitating a conducive learning environment.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: General secondary education
Sub-class Name: Special education for handicapped students at first stage or second stage of secondary level
Description: Providing special education services to handicapped students at the first or second stage of secondary level. This involves designing and implementing individualized education plans tailored to each student's needs, offering specialized instruction and support, and monitoring student progress. Services may also include therapies, counseling, and other resources to help students overcome their disabilities and succeed in their education.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Technical and vocational secondary education
Sub-class Name: Technical and vocational education below the level of higher education except for handicapped
Description: Providing technical and vocational education at secondary level, excluding higher education, specifically designed for non-handicapped individuals. This involves delivering courses and programs that impart practical skills, knowledge, and understanding necessary for employment in a specific trade, occupation or profession. Typical services include classroom teaching, practical demonstrations, and supervised hands-on training. This education is not intended to lead to an advanced degree or qualification.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Technical and vocational secondary education
Sub-class Name: Technical and vocational education for handicapped students below the level of higher education
Description: Providing technical and vocational education specifically tailored for students with disabilities who are not yet at the higher education level. This involves designing and implementing educational programs that cater to different types of disabilities, providing specialized training, and facilitating skill development in various technical and vocational fields. Services may also include career guidance, counselling, and support services to help these students transition into the workforce.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Technical and vocational secondary education
Sub-class Name: Professional motor driving school
Description: Offering technical and vocational education specifically in the field of professional motor driving. This involves conducting driving lessons, providing practical and theoretical training in vehicle operation, traffic rules, and safety procedures. Services may also include preparation for driving tests, vehicle maintenance education, and defensive driving instruction.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in science, commerce, humanity and fine arts leading to a university degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education in the fields of science, commerce, humanity, and fine arts with the aim of awarding university degrees or equivalents. This involves conducting lectures, seminars, and practical sessions, implementing educational programs, assessing student performance through examinations and assignments, and issuing academic qualifications upon successful completion of courses. These institutions may also engage in research activities related to their respective fields.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in engineering / other technical courses leading to a university degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education in engineering or other technical courses that lead to a university degree or equivalent. This involves designing and delivering academic curriculum, conducting lectures, seminars, and practical sessions, evaluating student performance, and awarding degrees or certifications. Services may also include research activities, student counseling, and career guidance.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in medical/bio-technology and related courses leading to a university degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education services in medical/bio-technology and related courses that lead to a university degree or equivalent. This involves the delivery of lectures, practical sessions, and workshops in medical and biotechnological fields. It also includes conducting examinations, assessments, and research activities, as well as offering academic guidance and counseling to students. The services provided may also extend to training in laboratory techniques, clinical practices, and the latest advancements in medical and bio-technology.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in management courses leading to a degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education services in management courses that lead to a degree or equivalent. This involves developing and delivering curriculum, conducting lectures, seminars, and workshops, administering exams, and granting recognized degrees or equivalent qualifications in management studies. It also includes student support services such as academic advising, career counseling, and facilitating internships or practical training in the field of management.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in law leading to a degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education in law that leads to a degree or equivalent. This involves conducting law lectures, seminars, and tutorials, administering law examinations, and awarding law degrees or equivalent qualifications. Other activities may include offering legal research programs, providing academic counseling, and facilitating law internships.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education in other professional/ vocational courses leading to a degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education in various professional or vocational courses that lead to a degree or equivalent. This involves the development and delivery of curriculum, conducting lectures, seminars, and practical sessions, evaluating student performance, and awarding degrees or equivalent qualifications. It also includes advising and guiding students, conducting research, and engaging in community service activities related to the field of study.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Higher education
Sub-class Name: Higher education not leading to a degree or equivalent
Description: Providing higher education courses that do not culminate in a degree or equivalent qualification. This involves designing and delivering various educational programs, such as diploma courses, certificate programs, vocational training, or continuing education units. Typical processes include curriculum development, instruction, student assessment, and issuing non-degree certifications.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Sports and recreation education
Sub-class Name: Sports and recreation education
Description: Providing education and training in sports and recreational activities. This entails conducting classes, workshops, and training sessions for various sports such as football, basketball, swimming, and others. It also includes recreational activities like dance, yoga, and aerobics. Services may also encompass professional coaching, athletic training, and skill enhancement programs. The business activity might also involve organizing sports events and tournaments for educational purposes.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Cultural education
Sub-class Name: Cultural education
Description: Cultural education involves teaching and learning about different cultures, traditions, and societal norms. This can include activities such as language courses, history classes, art and music lessons, and other educational programs focused on cultural understanding and appreciation. Services typically provided may range from conducting workshops and seminars, organizing cultural exchange programs, to offering specialized courses on cultural studies. The core operations involve curriculum planning, teaching, facilitating discussions and cultural experiences, and assessing student progress.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Other education n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Academic tutoring services
Description: Academic tutoring services encompass providing personalized, one-on-one or small group instruction to students outside the traditional classroom setting. This often involves identifying students' academic strengths and weaknesses, designing customized learning plans, and guiding students through challenging subjects or topics. Services may also include test preparation help, study skills enhancement, and homework assistance across various academic disciplines. The aim is to supplement formal education and improve students' overall academic performance.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Other education n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Professional examination review courses
Description: Providing professional examination review courses, which involve designing and delivering specialized training programs to prepare students for various professional exams. This includes creating course materials, conducting lectures, and offering practice tests to help students understand the exam format and improve their performance. It may also involve providing personalized feedback and study strategies.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Other education n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Flying school
Description: Providing flight training and aviation lessons, including theoretical knowledge and practical flying skills. Typical services include private pilot training, commercial pilot training, instrument rating, and flight instructor courses. These schools may also offer advanced training for existing pilots, such as multi-engine rating, aerobatics training, and type rating courses. Training is typically provided by certified flight instructors and includes both ground school classes and in-flight training.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Other education n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Motor driving school (non-professional)
Description: Operating a motor driving school for non-professional drivers, this business activity involves providing practical and theoretical driving lessons to individuals. Typical services include teaching basic vehicle operations, traffic rules, safe driving practices, and preparing students for driving tests. The business may also offer defensive driving courses and refresher lessons for existing drivers.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Other education n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other educational services n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category involve providing educational services not classified elsewhere. This may include a range of unconventional or specialized educational programs, tutoring services, educational consulting, and vocational counseling. Typical processes might involve developing and delivering unique educational content, providing one-on-one instruction, offering educational advice, and assisting individuals with career planning and decision-making.

Division Name: Education
Class Name: Educational support activities
Sub-class Name: Educational support services
Description: Providing auxiliary services to education, such as educational consulting, guidance counseling, student exchange programs, and curriculum development. This involves creating and implementing educational policies, conducting educational research and assessments, and providing other support services that enhance the learning environment. It may also include offering special services for students with specific needs, such as tutoring or disability support.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Hospital activities
Sub-class Name: Hospital activities
Description: Provision of health services through hospitals, including general, specialized, psychiatric and substance abuse hospitals. This involves medical consultations, surgical procedures, emergency room services, laboratory testing, medical imaging, patient admissions, and other related healthcare services. It also includes the management and maintenance of hospital facilities and equipment.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Medical and dental practice activities
Sub-class Name: Medical practice activities
Description: Provision of health care by general practitioners, specialists, and medical professionals. This includes routine health examinations, diagnosis and treatment of illnesses or injuries, pre and post-operative care, and referral to specialist services if necessary. The provision of dental care, such as regular check-ups, cleaning, fillings, and other dental treatments, is also included. Services may be provided in private practices, clinics, hospitals, or other health care facilities.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Medical and dental practice activities
Sub-class Name: Dental practice activities
Description: Provision of oral health care services primarily focusing on the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases and disorders of the mouth. These dental practice activities include routine dental examinations, teeth cleaning, fillings, extractions, orthodontics, endodontics, periodontics, and prosthodontics. Services may be provided in private practices, clinics, hospitals, or mobile health units.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of Ayurveda practitioners
Description: Practicing Ayurveda, which includes diagnosing, treating, and preventing diseases using traditional Ayurvedic techniques and medicinal herbs. Services typically provided by these practitioners involve patient consultation, creating personalized treatment plans, providing Ayurvedic therapies, and offering wellness advice based on Ayurvedic principles.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of Unani practitioners
Description: Practicing Unani medicine, a traditional system of healing and health maintenance recognized in South Asia. The activities typically involve diagnosing patients based on the principles of Unani medicine, prescribing natural remedies, and providing holistic treatments to balance the body's elements. This can include dietary advice, physical therapies, and the use of herbal medicines.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of homeopaths
Description: Practicing homeopathy, which involves diagnosing and treating patients using homeopathic methods. This includes creating individualized treatment plans based on patient symptoms and health history, prescribing homeopathic remedies, and monitoring patient progress. Services may also encompass health consultations, patient education, and follow-up appointments.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of nurses, masseures, physiotherapists or other para-medical practitioners
Description: Provision of health-related services by registered nurses, masseurs, physiotherapists, and other para-medical practitioners. This involves conducting patient assessments, providing therapeutic treatments and rehabilitation, administering massages for relaxation or therapeutic purposes, and offering other para-medical services. These professionals may operate in hospitals, clinics, private practices, or patients' homes, and are often involved in designing and implementing individualized care plans.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of independent diagnostic/pathological laboratories
Description: Independent diagnostic or pathological laboratories conduct various health tests and examinations. These activities typically involve analyzing samples such as blood, urine, and tissue to diagnose diseases or health conditions. They may also provide services such as medical imaging, genetic testing, and other diagnostic procedures. These laboratories operate independently from hospitals or clinics and often collaborate with healthcare providers to deliver accurate and timely results.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of independent blood banks
Description: Independent blood banks collect, store, and distribute blood and blood products. This includes the process of blood donation, testing for blood-borne diseases, separating blood components, and providing safe and compatible blood for transfusions to hospitals and clinics. They also typically offer therapeutic services such as plasma exchange and perform research to improve blood safety and efficacy.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Human health activities
Class Name: Other human health activities
Sub-class Name: Other human health activities n.e.c. (including independent ambulance activities)
Description: The business activity involves providing various health services not classified elsewhere, such as independent ambulance services. Core operations may include responding to emergency medical calls, transporting patients to medical facilities, providing first aid treatment, and other health-related services that don't fall under the standard healthcare categories.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Residential care activities
Class Name: Residential nursing care facilities
Sub-class Name: Nursing care facilities
Description: Operating residential facilities that provide nursing care services. This includes long-term, short-term, rehabilitative, and palliative care to individuals who require continuous nursing care. Typical services include 24-hour supervision, room and board, monitoring of medication, personal care (like dressing and bathing), and social and recreational activities. These facilities may also provide physical, occupational, and speech therapy.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Residential care activities
Group Name: Residential care activities for mental retardation, mental health and substance abuse
Class Name: Residential care activities for mental retardation, mental health and substance abuse
Sub-class Name: Residential care activities for mental retardation, mental health and substance abuse
Description: Providing residential care services for individuals with mental retardation, mental health issues, and substance abuse problems. This involves offering a safe and supportive living environment, therapeutic interventions, and daily life skills training. Services may also include medication management, counseling, and other therapeutic activities designed to improve the residents' health and well-being.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Residential care activities
Group Name: Residential care activities for the elderly and disabled
Class Name: Residential care activities for the elderly and disabled
Sub-class Name: Residential care activities for the elderly and disabled
Description: Providing residential care services for the elderly and disabled, which involves offering accommodation, meals, personal care, and social activities in a supervised setting. These services may include assistance with daily living activities such as bathing, dressing, and medication management. It also often involves offering rehabilitative services, therapeutic treatments, and social interaction programs tailored to the specific needs of the elderly and disabled residents.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Residential care activities
Class Name: Other residential care activities
Sub-class Name: Other residential care activities n.e.c.
Description: Providing residential care services not elsewhere classified, such as long-term assisted living facilities for the elderly or individuals with disabilities. These operations may also include residential rehabilitation services for individuals recovering from physical or mental health issues, or for those dealing with substance abuse. Services typically involve daily living assistance, medical care, therapeutic activities, and social interaction in a residential setting.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Social work activities without accommodation
Group Name: Social work activities without accommodation for the elderly and disabled
Class Name: Social work activities without accommodation for the elderly and disabled
Sub-class Name: Social work activities without accommodation for the elderly and disabled
Description: Providing social work services without accommodation for the elderly and disabled, this business activity involves a range of services designed to support the well-being of these individuals. Core operations include conducting needs assessments, planning and implementing support strategies, offering counseling and advocacy services, and coordinating with other health and social services. These services are provided in clients' own homes or in community settings, not in residential establishments.

Section Name: Human health and social work activities
Division Name: Social work activities without accommodation
Group Name: Other social work activities without accommodation
Class Name: Other social work activities without accommodation
Sub-class Name: Other social work activities without accommodation n.e.c.
Description: Engaging in various social work activities without providing accommodation, often not elsewhere classified. This involves offering community and social services such as counseling, welfare, child protection services, community housing services, vocational rehabilitation, and charitable services. These activities are typically conducted in non-residential settings such as community centers, offices, or clients' homes.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Stage production and related activities
Description: Stage production and related activities involve the creation, production, and performance of theatrical presentations, concerts, and other stage performances. This includes the development and rehearsal of performances, the construction of sets and stage scenery, as well as the management of technical aspects like lighting and sound. It also encompasses the organization and management of live shows, events, and festivals.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Operation of concert and theatre halls and other arts facilities
Description: Managing and operating concert halls, theatre halls, and other arts facilities. This involves the planning and hosting of various artistic and entertainment events such as concerts, plays, exhibitions, and performances. Services may also include ticket sales, event promotion, facility maintenance, security, and customer service.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of sculptors, painters, cartoonists, engravers, etchers etc.
Description: Creating and selling fine arts such as sculptures, paintings, cartoons, engravings, and etchings. This involves the conception and creation of original artwork, as well as the exhibition and sale of these pieces. Artists may also offer services such as custom commissions, art restoration, and teaching art classes.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of individual writers, for all subjects including fictional writing, technical writing etc.
Description: Individual writers engaging in the creation of various forms of written content. This can range from fictional narratives, poetry, and scripts to technical manuals, reports, and articles. The business operations typically involve conceptualizing, drafting, revising, and proofreading written works for different audiences and purposes.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of independent journalists
Description: Independent journalists engage in creating and presenting original news stories, articles, features, and other journalistic content. This typically involves researching, interviewing, writing, editing, and publishing content across various media platforms such as newspapers, magazines, digital media, television, and radio. They may also provide freelance journalism services to multiple clients.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Activities of restoring of works of art such as paintings etc.
Description: Restoration of artistic works, particularly paintings, encompassing processes such as cleaning, repairing, and preserving pieces to their original or near-original state. Services typically include damage assessment, treatment planning, structural work, surface cleaning, and applying protective coatings to prolong the artwork's lifespan. The aim is to maintain the artistic integrity of the works and extend their life for future generations to appreciate.

Division Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Class Name: Creative, arts and entertainment activities
Sub-class Name: Other creative arts and entertainment activities
Description: Engagement in various creative arts and entertainment activities not classified elsewhere. This involves the creation, production, and performance of works of art and entertainment that are original and creative in nature. Services may include but are not limited to visual arts like painting and sculpture, performing arts such as dance, music, and theater performances, and other artistic endeavors like poetry readings, storytelling events, and magic shows. This also covers the organization and management of events and performances related to these activities.

Division Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Group Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Class Name: Library and archives activities
Sub-class Name: Library and archives activities
Description: Management and operation of libraries and archives, encompassing the collection, cataloging, preservation, and distribution of books, manuscripts, and other materials. This also includes providing access to these resources, facilitating research activities, and organizing educational programs or events related to the library or archive's collection.

Division Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Group Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Class Name: Museums activities and operation of historical sites and buildings
Sub-class Name: Museums activities and operation of historical sites and buildings
Description: Operating museums, including the curation, preservation, and exhibition of collections for public viewing. This also involves the maintenance and operation of historical sites and buildings, which may include conducting guided tours, providing educational programs, and organizing special events. Services may also encompass the conservation and restoration of historical artifacts and buildings.

Division Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Group Name: Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
Class Name: Botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves activities
Sub-class Name: Botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves activities
Description: Management and operation of botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves. This involves the care, conservation, and display of a wide variety of plant and animal species. Services provided typically include guided tours, educational programs, and conservation efforts. The maintenance of the natural habitats, conducting research, and preserving biodiversity are also key activities.

Division Name: Gambling and betting activities
Class Name: Gambling and betting activities
Sub-class Name: Wholesale of lottery tickets
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the bulk sale of lottery tickets, typically to retailers or other intermediaries. Core operations include procuring a large number of lottery tickets from the lottery organizer, maintaining an inventory, and distributing these tickets to various retail outlets or other sales points. Services may also include managing the logistics and supply chain for the distribution of these lottery tickets.

Division Name: Gambling and betting activities
Class Name: Gambling and betting activities
Sub-class Name: Retail sale of lottery tickets
Description: The business activity involves the retail sale of lottery tickets as part of gambling and betting activities within the arts, entertainment, and recreation sector. Core operations include the procurement, distribution, and sale of various types of lottery tickets to customers. Services may also include providing information regarding lottery rules, winning numbers, and prize claims.

Division Name: Gambling and betting activities
Class Name: Gambling and betting activities
Sub-class Name: Other gambling and betting activities
Description: Operating various forms of gambling and betting activities not specified elsewhere. This encompasses managing and providing services such as online gambling platforms, lottery ticket sales, bingo halls, and other similar betting activities. It also includes the organization of gambling events and the operation of gambling machines outside of casinos.

Division Name: Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities
Class Name: Operation of sports facilities
Sub-class Name: Operation of sports facilities
Description: Managing and maintaining sports facilities such as stadiums, arenas, and sports complexes. This involves the organization of sports events, renting out facilities for training or competitions, providing necessary amenities, and ensuring the upkeep and safety of the facility. Services may also include the sale of tickets for events, concessions, and merchandise.

Division Name: Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities
Class Name: Activities of sports clubs
Sub-class Name: Activities of sports clubs
Description: Organizing and operating sports clubs, including managing teams, training athletes, and organizing sports events. This involves the provision of facilities for various sports activities, membership services, and other related activities such as promotion of sports events. It also includes the management and operation of sports professionals and teams.

Division Name: Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities
Class Name: Other sports activities
Sub-class Name: Other sports activities
Description: Engagement in various sports activities not classified elsewhere, such as independent athletes participating in professional or semi-professional competitions, sports trainers providing specialized training, and operators of sports facilities. This may also include businesses that organize and manage outdoor sports events, sports clubs, and leagues. Services typically involve training, coaching, organizing sports events, and maintaining sports facilities.

Division Name: Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities
Class Name: Activities of amusement parks and theme parks
Sub-class Name: Activities of amusement parks and theme parks
Description: Operating amusement parks and theme parks, which includes the management and provision of rides, games, and other attractions for entertainment. This also encompasses the maintenance and safety checks of these facilities, as well as food and beverage services, souvenir shops, and special events hosting within the park premises.

Division Name: Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities
Class Name: Other amusement and recreation activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Other amusement and recreation activities n.e.c.
Description: Engagement in a variety of amusement and recreational activities not classified elsewhere. These may encompass a wide range of services such as organization of fun fairs, carnivals, riddle activities, and recreational fishing. It also includes the provision of recreational activities in amusement parks and arcades, as well as the operation of mechanical rides, water rides, games, shows, themed exhibits and picnic facilities.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Group Name: Activities of business, employers and professional membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of business and employers membership organizations
Sub-class Name: Activities of business and employers membership organisations
Description: Organizing and managing membership for business and employers organizations, including the provision of services such as networking events, advocacy, lobbying, and business information dissemination. These organizations typically work to promote the interests of their members, provide industry-specific resources, and facilitate collaboration and communication among businesses.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Group Name: Activities of business, employers and professional membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of professional membership organizations
Sub-class Name: Activities of professional membership organizations
Description: Professional membership organizations carry out activities that support the interests of their members. These activities typically include maintaining membership records, organizing meetings and conferences for members to connect and share knowledge, providing resources and training opportunities to enhance members' professional skills, and advocating for members' interests at the policy level. These organizations may also publish industry-specific journals or newsletters, offer accreditation or certification programs, and conduct research relevant to their members' professions.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of trade unions
Sub-class Name: Activities of trade unions
Description: Trade union activities encompass the representation and protection of workers' interests and rights. Typical operations involve negotiating with employers for better pay and working conditions, providing legal advice and representation to members, organizing strikes or industrial action, and campaigning on issues affecting workers. These organizations also often provide education and training programs for their members.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of religious organizations
Sub-class Name: Activities of religious organizations
Description: Religious organizations conduct a wide range of activities, including organizing religious services, educational programs, and community outreach initiatives. They may also provide spiritual counseling, distribute religious literature, and manage places of worship. Additionally, they might engage in fundraising activities to support their operations and mission. These organizations may operate on a local, national, or international scale and can encompass a variety of faiths and religious denominations.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of political organizations
Sub-class Name: Activities of political organizations
Description: Political organizations engage in activities that promote political causes, ideologies, or the interests of specific groups. These activities might include policy development, lobbying efforts to influence public opinion or legislative decisions, organizing political campaigns, and fundraising for political purposes. Other operations might involve conducting political research, providing political education and information to the public, and managing membership of the organization.

Division Name: Activities of membership organizations
Class Name: Activities of other membership organizations n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Activities of other membership organizations n.e.c.
Description: Business operations under this classification engage in activities of various membership organizations not classified elsewhere. This can encompass a wide range of organizations that provide services to their members. Typical processes involved may include member registration, event organization, fundraising, advocacy work, or other member-focused initiatives. Services provided may be diverse and tailored to the specific needs or interests of the organization's members, such as professional development, networking opportunities, community service, or social activities.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of computers and communication equipment
Class Name: Repair of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of computer and peripheral equipment
Description: Business activities in this classification primarily involve the repair and maintenance of computers and peripheral equipment. This includes diagnosing and fixing hardware or software faults, replacing damaged parts, and performing regular updates and check-ups to ensure optimal performance. Services may also encompass the repair of devices such as printers, scanners, and other computer accessories.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of computers and communication equipment
Class Name: Repair of computers and peripheral equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and maintenance of automated terminals like automatic teller machines, point-of-sale (POS) terminals, not mechanically operated
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the repair and maintenance of automated terminals such as automatic teller machines (ATMs) and point-of-sale (POS) terminals that are not mechanically operated. This includes diagnosing and fixing hardware or software faults, replacing parts as needed, and performing routine maintenance checks to ensure optimal performance of these machines. Services may also cover the installation and setup of these terminals, as well as providing technical support and advice to clients.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of computers and communication equipment
Class Name: Repair of communication equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair of communication equipment
Description: Business activities in this category involve the maintenance and repair of communication equipment. This includes services such as fixing faults in telecommunication devices, restoring damaged radio and television broadcasting equipment, and repairing other related communication infrastructure. Typical processes might involve diagnosing issues, replacing faulty components, and testing equipment to ensure proper functionality.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of consumer electronics
Sub-class Name: Repair of consumer electronics
Description: Businesses under this classification are primarily engaged in repairing and maintaining consumer electronics. This includes a wide range of devices such as televisions, radios, digital cameras, video game consoles, home theater systems, and other similar electronic products. Typical services provided involve diagnosing issues, replacing faulty parts, and performing general maintenance tasks to ensure the proper functioning of these devices. These businesses may also offer advice and consultation on the use and care of consumer electronics.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of household appliances and home and garden equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and servicing of household appliances ( refrigerators, stoves, washing machines, clothes dryers, room air conditioners, etc. )
Description: Businesses in this sub-class primarily engage in the repair and maintenance of various household appliances such as refrigerators, stoves, washing machines, clothes dryers, and room air conditioners. Typical services include diagnosing issues, replacing or repairing faulty parts, regular servicing to ensure optimal functioning, and providing maintenance advice to customers.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of household appliances and home and garden equipment
Sub-class Name: Repair and servicing of home and garden equipment such lawn mowers, edgers, trimmers etc.
Description: Business activity involves the repair and maintenance of home and garden equipment such as lawn mowers, edgers, and trimmers. Core operations include diagnosing issues, replacing faulty parts, performing regular servicing to ensure optimal functioning, and providing preventive maintenance advice to customers. Services can be carried out in a dedicated workshop or on-site at the customer's location.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of footwear and leather goods
Sub-class Name: Repair of footwear and leather goods
Description: Business activities in this category involve the repair and restoration of footwear and leather goods. Core operations include mending shoes, boots, and other types of footwear, as well as fixing damage to leather items such as handbags, belts, and jackets. Services can range from simple tasks like replacing soles and heels, stitching tears, and patching holes, to more complex processes like dyeing and reshaping leather goods to restore their original appearance.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of furniture and home furnishings
Sub-class Name: Repair of furniture and home furnishings
Description: Business activities under this classification involve the restoration and fixing of furniture and home furnishings. Typical operations might include repairing broken furniture parts, reupholstering worn out or damaged fabrics, restoring antique furniture, and refinishing surfaces. Services may also extend to the repair of various home furnishings such as curtains, blinds, rugs, and other decorative items. This could involve mending tears, replacing components, or restoring items to their original condition.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair of bicycles
Description: Business activities in this category primarily revolve around the repair and maintenance of bicycles. This includes services such as fixing punctured tires, adjusting brakes and gears, replacing worn-out parts, and performing general tune-ups to ensure the bicycle's optimal performance. Additionally, it may involve cleaning and lubricating parts, wheel truing, and installing accessories. The aim is to restore the bicycle to a safe and functional condition.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair and alteration of clothing
Description: Business operations in this category involve the repair and alteration of various types of clothing. Services typically include mending tears, replacing zippers, adjusting the fit of garments, or restyling old clothes. This can also involve specialized tailoring services for high-end fashion or bespoke clothing items. These businesses may also offer additional services such as dry cleaning or clothing restoration.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair and alteration of jewellery
Description: Business activity involves the repair and alteration of jewellery items. This includes services such as resizing rings, repairing broken chains, replacing lost gemstones, and other modifications to restore or change the appearance of jewellery. It may also involve cleaning and polishing services to maintain the aesthetic value of the jewellery. This business typically requires skilled craftsmen with expertise in handling various types of precious and semi-precious stones and metals.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair of watches, clocks and their parts
Description: The business activity involves the repair and maintenance of watches, clocks and their related parts. Typical operations include diagnosing issues, replacing defective parts, cleaning and oiling mechanisms, and performing general maintenance to ensure accurate timekeeping. Services may also extend to the restoration of antique or high-value timepieces.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair of musical instruments
Description: Business activities in this sub-class involve the repair and maintenance of musical instruments. This includes services such as tuning, cleaning, replacing parts, and restoring vintage or damaged instruments to their original condition. The operations may cover a wide range of instruments, from stringed and wind to percussion and electronic instruments.

Division Name: Repair of computers and personal and household goods
Group Name: Repair of personal and household goods
Class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods
Sub-class Name: Repair of other personal and household goods n.e.c.
Description: Business activities in this category encompass the repair and maintenance of a wide range of personal and household goods not specified elsewhere. This includes the restoration of items such as watches, jewelry, musical instruments, sports equipment, toys, and other non-classified personal and household products. Typical services provided involve diagnosing issues, replacing faulty parts, and restoring the functionality and appearance of these goods.

Division Name: Other personal service activities
Class Name: Washing and (dry-) cleaning of textile and fur products
Sub-class Name: Washing and (dry-) cleaning of textile and fur products
Description: Business activities in this classification involve the cleaning of textile and fur products. This includes services like laundering and dry cleaning of items such as clothing, bed linens, curtains, and rugs. It can also involve specialized cleaning processes for fur products. The core operations typically involve receiving items from customers, performing the necessary cleaning services using appropriate methods and chemicals, and then returning the cleaned items to the customers. This classification also covers businesses that provide cleaning services on a commercial scale to other businesses, such as hotels or hospitals.

Division Name: Other personal service activities
Class Name: Hairdressing and other beauty treatment
Sub-class Name: Hairdressing and other beauty treatment
Description: Business activities under this classification primarily involve providing hairdressing and beauty treatment services. Typical operations include cutting, styling, and coloring hair, as well as providing other beauty treatments such as facials, manicures, pedicures, and waxing. These services can be offered in a salon, at the client's home, or other locations. The business may also sell beauty products and offer advice on hair and skin care.

Division Name: Other personal service activities
Class Name: Funeral and related activities
Sub-class Name: Funeral and related activities
Description: Business activities in this category primarily involve providing services related to the planning, management, and conducting of funerals. This encompasses a range of operations such as preparing the deceased for burial or cremation, organizing and overseeing funeral ceremonies, maintaining funeral homes, and offering grief counselling. Additional services may include the sale of funeral-related merchandise like caskets, urns, or memorial products, and the provision of hearse services for transportation of the deceased.

Division Name: Other personal service activities
Class Name: Other personal service activities n.e.c.
Sub-class Name: Social activities such as escort services, marriage bureaus
